description: This 2004 Maybach 62 is finished in Nayarit Silver and Middle Gray Himalayas Metallics over gray Exclusive leather upholstery, and it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V12 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes 21″ alloy wheels, bi-xenon headlights, an adjustable air suspension with adaptive damping, an electro-transparent panoramic glass roof, heated and ventilated power-adjustable seats, two-place reclining and massaging rear seating, four-zone automatic climate control, a rear seat entertainment system, rear tray tables, a refrigerator compartment, Distronic adaptive cruise control, Keyless Go, COMAND infotainment with navigation, and a Bose surround-sound system. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this V240 has 58k miles and is now offered in California with infotainment accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title that lists the car as a 2004 Mercedes.

The Maybach 62 measures 242.7″ in length, approximately 17″ longer than the contemporary 57 model. Nayarit Silver Metallic and Middle Gray Himalayas Metallic paint finish the exterior, and details consist of a Maybach hood ornament, pneumatic soft close doors, a power-operated tailgate, parking sensors, and an electro-transparent panoramic glass roof with electrically adjustable transparency and a solar module.

Polished 21″ alloy wheels are mounted with 275/40 Yokohama Advan Sport tires that show 2018 production codes. The car is equipped with an electronically controlled air suspension with variable ride height and adaptive damping.

Gray Exclusive leather covers the seating surfaces, and it is complemented by color-coordinated leather dashboard upholstery, an Alcantara headliner, and burl wood veneer trim on the dashboard, center console, steering wheel, gear selector, sills, and door panels. Equipment includes heated and power-adjustable front seats, quad-zone automatic climate control, Keyless Go, Distronic adaptive cruise control, Parktronic, COMAND infotainment with navigation, and a 21-speaker Bose surround-sound system. The selling dealer states that the automatic phone cradle is inoperative.

Amenities for the rear passengers include two heated, power-adjustable, and reclining and extending rear with massage functions as well as headliner-mounted instrumentation, a refrigerator compartment, cup holders, fold-out tables, power-operated privacy curtains, and an entertainment system with an Alpine DVD player, a remote control, headphones, and 9.5″ LCD screens mounted in the front seatbacks.
The heated multifunction steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and supplementary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 58k miles.
The twin-turbocharged M285 V12 was factory rated at 543 horsepower and 664 lb-ft of torque. The car passed a California emissions test in April 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a five-speed automatic transmission.
Two rear infotainment headsets and a remote are included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Nayarit Silver & Middle Gray Himalayas Metallic

description: This 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 Clubsport is a Competition example equipped with a Manthey-Racing (MR) package, and it was imported from Asia to the US under prior ownership. Power comes from a 3.8-liter flat-six mated to a six-speed PDK dual-clutch gearbox with a mechanical differential lock, and the car rides on three-way-adjustable coilovers and forged 18″ BBS alloy wheels. Finished in Pure White under a multicolor vinyl wrap, the car features aluminum-steel and carbon-fiber bodywork as well as a rear wing, a rear diffuser, and a polycarbonate windshield. The race-prepped cabin is outfitted with an integrated roll cage, Recaro fixed-back racing seats, Schroth harnesses, a carbon-fiber 911 GT3 R steering wheel, a VBOX video system, and a Chillout cooling system. Work performed since the current owner’s acquisition in 2023 has involved replacing the left front wheel and part of the radiator assembly along with repairing portions of the bodywork. This 718 GT4 is now offered on dealer consignment with manufacturer’s documentation, spare wheels and tires, and a bill of sale.

The GT4 Clubsport was offered as a track-focused version of the 982 GT4 and available in either Trackday or Competition trims. This Competition example features an aluminum-steel composite body shell, natural-fiber composite door materials, a fixed rear wing, and intake scoops built into the quarter panels. The MR package added a polycarbonate windshield and rear window, a natural-fiber lip spoiler and diffuser, and a carbon-fiber hood, fenders, and bumper fascias.

A multicolor vinyl wrap has been applied to the bodywork, which left the factory finished in Pure White. The left-side fender, headlight assembly, and rocker panel were repaired under current ownership following a collision during track use.

Staggered-width 18″ BBS GT4 MR forged alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The MacPherson-strut suspension features three-way-adjustable coilovers and adjustable sway bars. The brakes are equipped with adjustable-bias dual master cylinders as well as six-piston front and four-piston rear monobloc aluminum calipers over multi-piece slotted rotors. The car is also equipped with an air jack system.

The cabin is protected by a roll cage with door bars and houses two Recaro P1300 GT racing seats equipped with Schroth harnesses. A Chillout cooling system has been added along with a Racelogic data logger, a Motorola radio, and a VBOX video system with front- and rear-facing cameras.

The GT4 Clubsport Competition package specified a 911 GT3 R carbon-fiber steering wheel that is mounted to a quick-release hub and fronts a Cosworth color LCD screen with an integrated data logger. The digital odometer indicates 3,900 miles.
The mid-mounted 3.8L flat-six was factory rated at 425 horsepower and features VarioCam Plus. Part of the radiator assembly was replaced under current ownership.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a rigidly mounted six-speed PDK dual-clutch gearbox with a mechanical differential lock.
Spare wheels and tires are included in the sale.
The car is not legal for road use, has not been registered for the street, and carries no title or registration. It is being sold on a bill of sale.

This 1996 Porsche 911 Carrera cabriolet was purchased by the current owner in June 1996 in Pennsylvania, and it spent time between Hawaii, California, and Nevada. The 3.6-liter flat-six was removed from the car in June 2018 to be decarbonized and resealed, while the six-speed manual transaxle received a replacement clutch, flywheel, pressure plate, and rear main seal. The car is finished in Arena Red Metallic over Marble Grey partial leather, and additional features include a black dashboard with light rootwood trim, a black soft top, 17″ Cup II wheels, power-adjustable front seats, air conditioning, and cruise control. This 993 Carrera cabriolet is now offered in Nevada by the seller on behalf of the current owner at no reserve with the owner’s manual, service records, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Arena Red Metallic (L84S) and features a power-retractable black soft top as well as headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets. Paint blemishes are shown up close in the gallery.

Silver-finished 17″ Cup II wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires that show date codes from 2016 and 2017. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in Marble Grey leather and a black dashboard accented with light rootwood trim. Amenities include power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, air conditioning, and a Becker-Porsche CDR-220 stereo. The headliner is sagging in areas, and the seller notes that the radio needs a code to operate.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The trip odometer gears are broken, and while the six-digit odometer shows 72k miles, true mileage is unknown.

The air-cooled 3.6L M64 flat-six features a VarioRam intake system and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 250 lb-ft of torque. A June 2018 service involved decarbonizing and resealing the engine. In May 2022 the engine mounts, drive belts, the alternator, a fuel line, the engine lid struts, and the AC evaporator, receiver/drier, and expansion valve were replaced, and an oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. The clutch, flywheel, pressure plate, release bearing, and the rear main seal were replaced in June 2018.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The California title is listed as a duplicate.

This 1998 Mercedes-Benz SL500 remained under the care of a long term owner prior to the selling dealer’s acquisition, and it has 39k miles. It is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Black over black leather. Equipment includes a removable hardtop, a black soft top, 18″ aftermarket wheels, xenon headlights, fog lights, power-adjustable seats, a Bose sound system, and automatic climate control. This R129 is now offered with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Black (040) and features a matching removable hardtop as well as a black soft top. Additional exterior equipment includes xenon headlights, clear turn indicators, fog lights, and fender air vents. The seller states that the soft-top hydraulic cylinders have been replaced. There are tears in the rear quarter windows of the soft top.
Aftermarket 18″ wheels wear a polished finish and are mounted with Nitto Motivo tires that show date codes from 2023. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes.

The power-adjustable seats are upholstered in black leather, and burl wood accents the doors and center stack. Amenities include a deployable roll bar, seat position memory, a Bose sound system, a CD stereo, a heated rear hardtop window, cruise control, and automatic climate control.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, a clock, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel economy, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 39k miles.

The 5.0-liter M119 V8 was factory rated at 315 horsepower and 347 lb-ft of torque, which is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed automatic transmission. The valve cover gaskets were replaced and an oil change performed in April 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 2005 Chevrolet SSR has 3,700 miles and is powered by a 6.0-liter V8 linked to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The truck is finished in Smokin’ Asphalt over Ebony leather upholstery and was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024. Additional equipment includes a power-folding hardtop, the 1SB Preferred Equipment Package, wood cargo floor rub strips, a body-color engine cover, a sport suspension, heated power-adjustable twin bucket seats, remote keyless entry, cruise control, and air conditioning. This SSR is now offered with a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Oregon title.

The SSR was built on a modified version of the GMT360 platform shared with the contemporary TrailBlazer SUV, and its styling was inspired by the Chevrolet Advance Design family of trucks. This example is finished in Smokin’ Asphalt with a color-matched hardshell tonneau cover and a power-retractable hardtop. Additional equipment includes flush-mounted halogen headlights bisected by a satin-finished chevron bar as well as flush-mounted taillights, power-operated heated side mirrors, and dual polished exhaust tips. The carpeted cargo bed is accented with wood strips.

The 20″ and 24″ Billett Specialties wheels are mounted with 245/40 Pirelli P Zero front and 315/30 Pirelli Scorpion Zero rear tires. The SSR was equipped from the factory with a ZQ8 sport suspension featuring an independent front and five-link solid-axle rear setup with front and rear stabilizer bars. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated disc brakes. Bilstein shocks and Ground Force springs are installed.

The twin heated and power-adjustable high-back bucket seats are upholstered in Ebony leather. Body-color wraparound trim accents the cabin, while satin chrome trim adorns the dash, center console, and door panels. Equipment includes a color-keyed waterfall console as well as an AM/FM/CD stereo, air conditioning, and cruise control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames SSR-branded instrumentation including a 140-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 3,700 miles.
The 6.0-liter LS2 V8 wears a body-color engine cover with SSR-branding and was factory rated at 390 horsepower and 405 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T56 six-speed manual transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential. An aftermarket exhaust system is installed.
Manufaacturer’s literature and a period sales brochure are included with the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2022 GMC Hummer EV is an Edition 1 pickup that was acquired by the current owner on BaT in December 2022, and a matte metallic gray vinyl wrap was subsequently applied over the truck’s Interstellar White paintwork. The Ultium Drive e4WD system sends power to all four wheels via a single-motor front unit with an electronic locking differential as well as a dual-motor rear axle with virtual locking capability. Additional features include the Illumination Package, 18″ wheels, CrabWalk four-wheel steering, Super Cruise driver assistance, Watts to Freedom launch control, a 24-module 200-kWh Ultium battery pack, air-ride adaptive suspension, UltraVision underbody cameras, a power-retractable tonneau cover, a 5’ pickup bed, Bose audio, Jet Black and light gray leather upholstery, touchscreen infotainment with navigation, and a MultiPro tailgate with an integrated Kicker audio system. This Hummer EV Edition 1 has 625 miles and is now offered at no reserve in Pennsylvania by the seller on behalf of the owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean Montana title in the name of the owner’s LLC.

Production of Edition 1 examples began in late 2021 at GM’s “Factory Zero” Detroit/Hamtramck Assembly Center in Michigan, with each truck finished in Interstellar White with a black roof, bumpers, running boards, and wheel-arch flares. This example was wrapped in matte metallic vinyl following the owner’s acquisition, and it features an Infinity Roof with four removable tinted glass Sky Panels as well as LED headlights and cargo-area lighting, roof clearance lights, front and rear recovery hooks, heated and power-folding mirrors, and a 5’ bed with a Kicker audio system integrated into the MultiPro tailgate. A power-retractable tonneau cover was also optioned from the factory. The optional Illumination Package added front off-road auxiliary lights, tailgate step lighting, and side mirror projection lights with Hummer EV logos.

Edition 1 equipment includes the Extreme Off-Road Package, which added black 18” aluminum wheels with machine-finished accents, 305/70 Goodyear Wrangler Territory M/T tires, rocker-panel rock sliders, underbody skid plates, ball spline half shafts, and underbody cameras. The CrabWalk four-wheel steering system allows the rear wheels to turn up to 10°, enabling the truck to travel diagonally at low speeds. Additional features include regenerative braking, a four-corner air-ride suspension with adaptive dampers, and a Watts to Freedom launch control system.

The cabin features Jet Black and light gray leather upholstery covering the seats, while bronze trim accents the dashboard which is also fitted with an “Edition 1” badge. Appointments include heated and ventilated front seats with 12-way power adjustment, four-way lumbar-support control, driver-seat position memory, and Hummer EV insignias. Additional amenities consist of an infotainment system with a 13.4” color touchscreen as well as Bose surround-sound audio, the Super Cruise system, the Illumination Package, tri-zone automatic climate control, heated rear seats with storage compartments, and an UltraVision system providing 18 exterior camera views including front and rear underbody cameras. The front “eTrunk” features a power-operated hood that opens to reveal 11.3 cubic feet of space along with an under-floor storage bin.
The heated steering wheel fronts a configurable digital display panel. The digital odometer indicates 625 miles, approximately 70 of which were added under current ownership.
The front “eTrunk” features a power-operated hood that opens to reveal 11.3 cubic feet of space along with an under-floor storage bin.

A single-motor front-drive unit with a 13.3:1 fixed gear ratio is housed with an electronic locking differential, while a rear-axle unit with a fixed 10.5:1 ratio incorporates two motors that can be synchronized to simulate a locking differential. The Ultium battery pack is composed of 24 pouch-style vertical cell modules in two layers and is compatible with 800-volt/350-kW fast-charging stations. A battery was replaced in December 2022.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Jet Black & Light Gray Leather Upholstery

description: This 1996 Rover Mini Cooper was imported to Canada from Japan under previous ownership before being acquired by the seller in 2022. It was subsequently repainted in grey with a white roof and fitted with a Mk I-style grille, taillights, faux door hinges, and dashboard as well as a Superlite wood-rimmed steering wheel, Smiths instrumentation, and replacement seats trimmed in brown upholstery. The car wears quad WIPAC driving lights as well as black wheel arch extensions and rides on a Hi-Lo suspension kit along with 10″ Revolution four-spoke wheels. Power is from a fuel-injected 1.3L inline-four linked to a four-speed manual transaxle, and further equipment includes a custom exhaust system in addition to 7.9″ front disc brakes. This modified Mk VI Cooper is now offered in Ontario, Canada, with a clean Carfax report and Ontario registration.

The car left the factory finished in British Racing Green with a Diamond White roof and was repainted in Dove Grey with a Snowberry White roof under current ownership, according to the seller. A Mk I-style grille and taillights as well as faux-external door hinges have been added. A leather hood strap, Austin Cooper S badging, quad WIPAC driving lights, bullet-style mirrors, and black wheel arch extensions with bright trim are further details.

Black-finished 10″ Revolution four-spoke wheels feature polished rims and are mounted with 165/70 Falken FK-07E tires. The car is equipped with 7.9″ front disc brakes as well as a Hi-Lo suspension kit.

The bolstered front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in brown upholstery with white piping and complemented by a color-coordinated shift boot and door and side panels. Billet hardware accents the cabin, and black carpets line the floors. Additional details include a heater, three-point seatbelts, and tinted sun visors. The air conditioning system is inoperative.

A Superlite wood-rimmed steering wheel fronts a backdated dashboard housing a Smiths tachometer as well as a centrally mounted 220-km/h speedometer and auxiliary gauges. The speedometer is inaccurate and the oil pressure gauge is inoperative. The five-digit odometer shows 23k kilometers (~14k miles), approximately 10k of which have been added under current ownership. True mileage is unknown.

The 1.3L A-series inline-four features single-point injection (SPi) and was factory-rated at 62 horsepower and 70 lb-ft of torque. According to the seller, work under current ownership has involved changing the timing chain, rebuilding the alternator, and changing the oil along with replacing the thermostat, engine air filter, cooling lines, and vacuum hoses.

Power is sent to the front wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle. A sump guard and a custom exhaust system have been installed. The seller notes that rust was repaired on the floor and battery pans.
Decoding the VIN tag provides the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage from a single April 2022 entry.
The vehicle is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 1970 Husqvarna 360 Cross is equipped with a 354cc two-stroke single paired with a four-speed transmission and is finished in red over a silver frame. Features include polished aluminum fenders, 21″ front and 18″ rear alloy rims, Girling shocks, an expansion-chamber exhaust system, a side stand, Magura hand controls, and a cross-braced handlebar. This 360 Cross is now offered on dealer consignment in Oregon for off-road use only with a bill of sale.

The fuel tank is finished in red with polished knee panels and white accents, and is noted to show wear. Features include a silver-painted single-downtube frame, polished alloy fenders, a black seat, white plastic number plates, and a side stand.

Wire-spoke wheels with shouldered alloy rims measuring 21″ up front and 18″ at the rear are mounted with knobby Cheng Shin tires. Suspension consists of a Husqvarna telescopic fork as well as a pair of chrome-shrouded Girling shocks mounted to the swingarm.
The cross-braced handlebar is secured in four-bolt risers and is equipped with a kill switch as well as a Magura throttle and grips. No instrumentation is present, therefore total mileage is unknown.

The 354cc two-stroke single was factory rated at 37 horsepower, and it features a Bing carburetor, a left-side kick starter, and a black-finished high-mounted expansion chamber with a perforated heat shield. The bike has not been started or ridden under current ownership.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a wet clutch, a right-side-shifted four-speed transmission, and a drive chain.

This AM General M1123 HMMWV was originally designated for use by the US Military before being acquired by the seller in 2020. Subsequent work involved performing a four-door conversion, refinishing the body in gray bedliner material, and installing steel front and rear bumpers as well as a hood scoop, a winch, LED headlights, side steps, and 17″ KMC alloy wheels. The interior has been fitted with bucket seats trimmed in black leather in addition to four-point harnesses, custom storage boxes, and a Pyle Bluetooth-capable sound system. Power comes from a 6.5-liter diesel V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case, and additional equipment includes a roll cage, a custom-fabricated underbody guard, and aftermarket suspension components. This M1123 “Humvee” is now offered at no reserve with a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name that lists the truck as a 2010 model year.

The High-Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV) went into production for military use in 1984, and the later M1123 variant was used primarily by the United States Marine Corps. This example is said to have received a four-door conversion before being finished with gray bedliner material under current ownership. Modifications include custom-fabricated front and rear bumpers, a partial roof covering, LED headlights, NAOEVO LED auxiliary lights, a ZESUPER winch, a hood scoop, a hood-mounted shovel and pick axe, side steps, and a custom-fabricated HUMMER tailgate logo. The windshields and washer fluid reservoir were replaced, and a locking fuel filler door was fitted.

The 17″ KMC alloy wheels are mounted with 38×13.5″ Nitto Trail Grappler M/T tires. The suspension has been modified with aftermarket coil springs and rear A-arms, and the rubber CV boots were replaced, according to the seller. Braking is handled by inboard-mounted discs.

The front and rear bucket seats are trimmed in black leather with diamond-pattern inserts, while the exposed metal surfaces are finished in gray bedliner material. Diamond plate flooring lines the footwell, and details include Kyostar four-point harnesses for each occupant, a custom-fabricated roll cage, ammo box-style storage boxes, and a Pyle Bluetooth-capable audio receiver and speakers.

A MOMO Competition steering wheel sits ahead of LED-backlit instrumentation consisting of a 60-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, fuel level, coolant temperature, and voltage. The five-digit odometer shows 434 miles, and approximately 4k miles have been added under current ownership. Total chassis mileage is unknown.

The reverse-hinged hood opens to reveal the 6.5-liter diesel V8. Work performed since 2020 is said to have involved refurbishing the alternator and replacing the starter, voltage regulator, and radiator fluid overflow tank.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The seller states the flywheel and a driveshaft were replaced. A custom-fabricated underbody guard was fitted, and a diesel fluid leak is noted.
The data plate shown above lists serial number 211057 as well as a rebuild date of February 2010.

This 2008 Lexus GX470 remained registered in Florida until 2024 and now has 180k miles. It is finished in Titanium Metallic over Ivory leather and is powered by a 4.7-liter V8 mated to a five-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a Torsen locking center differential. Aftermarket suspension components have been installed, and the truck is equipped with a power sunroof, a roof rack, a receiver hitch, 17″ alloy wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, navigation, and a Mark Levinson sound system. Service in 2024 is said to have included replacing the timing belt, front brake pads, and a rear wheel bearing. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this J120 GX470 is now offered at no reserve with a clean Maryland title.

The vehicle is finished in Titanium Metallic (1D4) with body-color wheel arch extensions. Exterior equipment includes fog lights, a power sunroof, illuminated running boards, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, a roof rack, a receiver hitch, and a rear spoiler. The fog light bulbs were replaced in June 2024. The Carfax report notes the truck was involved in accidents with other vehicles in September 2017 and November 2018 and lists damage to the left front in October 2018.

The 17″ double five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with mixed Bridgestone and Cooper tires. The rear air suspension components were replaced with coil springs, and stopping power is provided by ventilated disc brakes at each corner. Service in June 2024 included replacing a rear wheel bearing and an outer tie rod end along with the front brake pads.

The heated power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Ivory leather, and wood trim accents the cabin. Amenities include third-row seating, rear-cabin air conditioning, a rearview camera, dual-zone automatic climate control, a six-disc CD stereo, navigation, a Mark Levinson sound system, and cruise control.

The leather- and wood-rimmed multifunction steering wheel is mounted on a power-adjustable column and fronts a 130-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and supplementary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 180k miles. The Carfax report lists an odometer reading of 183k miles in June 2024, and the tire pressure monitoring system warning light is illuminated.

The 4.7-liter 2UZ-FE V8 features VVT-i variable valve timing and was rated at 263 horsepower and 323 lb-ft of torque when new. A sticker on the left door jamb notes the timing belt was replaced in April 2024, and the air filter was replaced in June 2024.
Power is routed to all four wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a Torsen locking center differential.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident and damage entries.

This 1940 Cadillac Fleetwood Series 60 Special sedan is a non-running project that is said to have been used as a police car under previous ownership before it was purchased by the current owner’s late husband in 1983. The car is finished in black over gray cloth upholstery and retains a 346ci Monobloc V8, a three-speed manual transmission, chrome bumpers with overriders, dual spotlights, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and an under-dash cassette player. It is unknown when the car was last run, and maintenance will be required prior to use. This 60 Special is now offered on dealer consignment at no reserve with a clean California title in the owner’s name.

The Fleetwood-built bodywork was delivered from the factory in Chicory Green Metallic (13) and was repainted black under previous ownership. Features include chrome bumpers and overriders, a hood ornament, an antenna, and dual spotlights. Wear in the paint and other imperfections in the finish can be seen in the gallery.

Body-color wheels wear chrome hubcaps, and they are mounted with Columbia Deluxe bias-ply whitewall tires. A spare wheel is stowed beneath the trunk floor. The 60 Special rode on a 127″ wheelbase and featured an X-frame chassis with a coil-sprung independent front suspension and rear semi-elliptical leaf springs. The car retains hydraulically assisted drums at all four corners.

The cabin features bench seats trimmed in gray cloth with color-matching door panel centers and carpets. Dark gray vinyl accents the upper and lower door panels and the front bench, and additional features include an AM radio, a locking glovebox, an under-dash Optimus cassette player, kick panel-mounted speakers, a rear footrest, and a rear folding armrest.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel fronts a painted steel dashboard housing a 100-mph sweep speedometer and auxiliary gauges. A three-gauge pod is mounted beneath the dash. The five-digit odometer shows under 58k miles, and a Hobbs hour meter has been added in the engine bay and shows 174 hours. Total mileage is unknown.
The 346ci Monobloc V8 features three main bearings and was factory rated at 135 horsepower. It is unknown when the car was last run, and maintenance will be required prior to use.
The car retains a column-shifted three-speed manual transmission. Corrosion on the undersides can be seen in the gallery.
The Fleetwood body tag decodes as follows:

This 1989 Porsche 911 Carrera 4 coupe has remained registered in Pennsylvania since new and now has 79k miles. It is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Slate Gray Metallic over Silk Grey leather upholstery. Equipment includes 17″ Cup wheels, a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, a cassette stereo, cruise control, and R134a-based air conditioning. Acquired by the selling dealer in December 2023, this 964 C4 coupe is offered with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The car is finished in Slate Gray Metallic and features a speed-activated rear spoiler, an electric sunroof, integrated fog lights, a rear window wiper, and heated and power-adjustable side mirrors. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 17″ Cup wheels are wrapped in Continental ExtremeContract tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. The brake fluid was changed in 2023, and the power steering reservoir, power steering lines, and steering rack boots were replaced in March 2024.

The heated power-adjustable front bucket seats are upholstered in Silk Grey leather with darker piping and are complemented by a color-coordinated dash, center console, and door panels. Amenities include a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, a cassette tape holder, power windows, cruise control, and R134a-based air conditioning.

The three-spoke MOMO steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as a 180-mph speedometer, a Quarz analog clock, and gauges for oil level, oil pressure, oil temperature, and fuel level. A VDO voltage meter is housed in the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 79k miles, approximately 120 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The air-cooled 3.6L M64 flat-six was factory-rated at 247 horsepower and 228 lb-ft of torque. The distributor was rebuilt and the drive belts, fuel tank hoses, and oil hoses were replaced in 2020. The oil was changed in 2024.
Power is sent to all four wheels via a five-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential. The shifter shaft seal was replaced and the transaxle fluid was changed in 2020.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1987 Honda Elite CH150 is finished in red and is powered by a liquid-cooled 153cc four-stroke single mated to a V-matic variable-ratio transmission with an automatic clutch. The scooter is equipped with an electric starter, full suspension, drum brakes, 10″ steel wheels, street lighting, a two-up seat, and a lockable glovebox and trunk. Acquired by the seller in 2024, this CH150 is now offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, a tool kit, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The scooter is finished in red and features black lower moldings and trim, dual mirrors, a locking glovebox, a stepped two-up seat, a body-color trunk, rear grab handles, and both center and side stands. A crack is visible on the tinted windscreen.
The silver-finished 10″ wheels are mounted with Dunlop tires. Suspension consists of a leading-link fork up front and dual shocks at the rear. Braking is handled by a drum at each end.

The handlebar is mounted beneath a shroud that houses a 65-mph speedometer along with supplementary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 1,600 miles, approximately 100 of which were ridden under current ownership.

The liquid-cooled 153cc SOHC four-stroke single is integrated within the rear swingarm and features an electric starter and a low-mount exhaust system finished in black. The oil was changed and the battery was replaced in 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through an automatic centrifugal clutch, a V-matic variable-ratio transmission, and an enclosed drive belt.

This 2011 Audi S5 Prestige coupe remained with its initial owner until 2024 and now has 24k miles. The car is finished in Ibis White over Tuscan Brown Nappa leather and is powered by a 4.2-liter V8 mated to a six-speed manual transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes a glass sunroof, adaptive xenon headlights, rear parking sensors, 19″ alloy wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, Audi Side Assist blind-spot monitoring, automatic climate control, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and Audi MMI infotainment with Navigation Plus. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this S5 is now offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Ibis White (LY9C) and features a glass sunroof, adaptive xenon headlights, LED taillights, rear parking sensors, a rearview camera, Audi Side Assist blind-spot monitoring, and quad exhaust outlets. Photos of paint meter readings are shown in the gallery below.
The 19″ double-five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Toyo tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with S5-branded front calipers.

The heated power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Tuscan Brown Nappa leather that extends to the door panels, while wood inlays accent the cabin. Amenities include driver’s seat memory settings, Audi Advanced Key, three-zone automatic climate control, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, Audi Music Interface (AMI), and Audi MMI infotainment with Navigation Plus.
The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 24k miles.

The 4.2-liter FSI V8 was factory rated at 354 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque, which is routed to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. An oil change was performed in April 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1980 Mercedes-Benz 230C is a European-market coupe that was reportedly first delivered in Germany and was imported to Canada in the 1990s, and it was acquired by the seller on BaT in July 2021. The 2.3-liter inline-four was overhauled by Metric Motors of Los Angeles, California, in 2022, and additional work under current ownership included adjusting the carburetor, overhauling the ignition and cooling systems, and installing a Becker Europa AM/FM/cassette stereo with replacement speakers. Finished in green over beige vinyl and cloth, the car also features a four-speed automatic transmission, dual side mirrors, 14″ Bundt wheels, European-specification bumpers and headlights, and a cabin heater. This C123 shows 120k kilometers (~74k miles) and is offered with factory literature, service records from current ownership totaling approximately $35k, and Connecticut registration in the seller’s name.

The body left the factory finished in Cactus Green (880) and was repainted in May 2007. Features include European-specification bumpers and single-piece glass headlights, chrome trim, and a single polished exhaust outlet. Various replacement window and body seals were installed in 2022. An insurance claim in the amount of CA$3,215.75 was made in May 2006 according to an ICBC Vehicle Claims History Report provided in the previous listing.

Silver-finished 14″ Bundt wheels were mounted with 195/70 Vredestein Quatrac 5 tires under current ownership. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs. The rear anti-roll bar links were replaced in 2022 along with various power steering hoses.

The seating surfaces are trimmed in beige vinyl with cloth inserts, while Zebrano woodgrain trim accents the contrasting dashboard, center stack, and center console. A Becker Europa AM/FM/cassette stereo was installed under current ownership along with replacement speakers.

The four-spoke steering wheel fronts a 200-km/h speedometer, a clock, and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 120k kilometers (~74k miles), approximately 3k of which were added by the seller. Replacement dashboard backlight bulbs were installed in 2022.

The 2.3-liter M115 inline-four drives the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission. Maintenance under previous ownership involved replacing the distributor cap and rotor in 2019 and servicing the alternator in 2020. The engine was rebuilt by Metric Motors of Los Angeles, California, in 2022, and additional service at that time included replacing the following components:
The carburetor was adjusted in February 2023.
Additional underside images are provided in the gallery.
Factory literature is included in the sale. Service records from current ownership totaling approximately $35k can be viewed in the gallery below.

The car does not have a title, as it is located in a state that does not issue titles to vehicles of its age. It is being offered on its Connecticut registration, which displays “Antique” under the Registered Usage heading.

This 1991 Nissan 300ZX coupe was acquired by the current owner on BaT in November 2021, and it now has 24k miles. Power is provided by a 3.0-liter V6 paired with a five-speed manual transmission, and the car is finished in Glacier White Pearl Glow over tan leather upholstery. Further details include 16″ alloy wheels, four-wheel antilock disc brakes, removable roof panels, integrated fog lights, and quad exhaust outlets, while the cabin is outfitted with automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose cassette stereo and audio system. Leather repairs on the seats and steering wheel were performed since the prior auction. This Z32 is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner at no reserve with the owner’s manuals, a clean Carfax report, and a clean South Carolina title in the current owner’s name.

The car is finished in Glacier White Pearl Glow and features removable glass T-top roof panels along with a rear window wiper, integrated fog lights, painted mirror caps, a power-telescoping antenna, and polished quad exhaust outlets. Close-up photos of the paint, trim, and imperfections are provided in the gallery.

Five-spoke 16″ alloy wheels are mounted with 225/50 BFGoodrich g-Force T/A KDW tires. The car is equipped with independent multi-link suspension. Stopping power is provided by antilock four-wheel vented disc brakes.

The two-place cabin features bolstered seats trimmed in tan leather, and repairs to the upholstery on the seats and steering wheel were performed in 2021. Interior appointments include automatic climate control, a Bose cassette stereo and sound system, a rear cargo cover, and cruise control. The in-dash CD changer does not work.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 24k miles, a few hundred of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.0-liter VG30DE V6 was factory rated at 222 horsepower and 198 lb-ft of torque. A timing belt service is said to have been performed in 2017.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission, and clutch components were replaced in 2017, according to the seller. Additional underbody photos are provided in the gallery.
T-top storage bags are included in the sale along with the owner’s manuals and two keys.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1970 Velosolex Solex 3800 is said to have been originally sold in Highland Park, Illinois, and it was acquired near there by the seller in 2024. It is finished in black and powered by a 49cc two-str0ke single that directly drives the front wheel. Features include lights, a center stand, a cargo rack, a sprung solos eat, and whitewall tires. This Solex 3800 is now offered at no reserve in Illinois with a bill of sale.

The 49cc two-stroke single is mounted up front and drives the front wheel via a direct-drive system. The seller states that the engine and carburetor were overhauled under previous ownership and that the control cables were replaced at that time.
Engine number 5227472 shown above matches the sequence stamped into the frame.

This 1972 Chevrolet Chevelle sport coupe was refurbished in 2024 and fitted with a 383ci stroker V8 linked with a Tremec six-speed manual transmission and a Detroit TrueTrac limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes a COMP camshaft, Dart heads, long-tube headers, and a billet serpentine drive system. The car is finished in black with a red and gray stripe, and an earlier-model Chevelle front clip was installed along with an adjustable rear spoiler, a modified rear valance and quarter panels, a cowl-induction hood, and LED lighting. The car rides on a lowered suspension and 20″ Forgiato wheels over four-wheel disc brakes. The cabin was reupholstered in gray vinyl and microsuede, and appointments include air conditioning, a full-length center console, Dakota Digital gauges, and a Bluetooth head unit linked to high-performance speakers. Acquired by the seller in 2016, this modified Chevelle is offered with a clean Nevada title in the seller’s name.

A 1970 Chevelle-style front clip was installed and features a split black grille, LED headlights, and a front air dam, while an adjustable rear spoiler, a cowl-induction hood, and black window trim were fitted during the build. The car was refinished in black with a dark gray and red stripe on the hood and trunk. A custom lower valance is fitted and the rear quarter panels were modified to accommodate the quad exhaust outlets.

Black-finished Forgiato 20″ wheels are shod with Toyo Extensa HP tires. The car rides on a lowered suspension with an aftermarket front sway bar and coilovers. Braking is provided by four-wheel discs with a Wilwood master cylinder and brake booster. The emergency brake is not functional.

The cabin was re-trimmed in gray vinyl and microsuede over the bucket seats, full-length center console, dash pad, and door panels. Red ambient lighting and an Old Air climate control system were installed during the build, and further details include push-button start, a B&M shifter, cupholders, and a JVC Bluetooth touchscreen head unit linked with an aftermarket subwoofer and speakers.

The Grant Challenger steering wheel sits on a tilting column and frames Dakota Digital instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer and supplementary readouts. The tachometer does not work. The five-digit odometer shows 1,300 miles. Total mileage is unknown.

The 383ci stroker V8 was installed in 2024, and the seller states it was assembled with Dart cylinder heads, ARP fasteners, Scorpion rockers, and a COMP Xtreme roller camshaft, valve springs, and lifters. Additional equipment includes a CVR serpentine drive setup, a Holley carburetor, an Optima battery, an MSD Pro billet distributor and ignition, and dual electric fans.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a Tremec T56 six-speed manual transmission and a Detroit TrueTrac limited-slip differential with 4.11:1 gears. Long-tube headers flow to an H-pipe midsection.
The current Nevada title lists an “exempt” odometer brand.

This 1974 BMW 3.0CS is finished in Nachtblau Metallic over blue leather and is powered by a 3.0-liter M30 inline-six linked with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a front air dam, a sliding steel sunroof, tri-color side stripe graphics, 17″ BBS wheels, a Becker AM/FM radio, a hidden Bluetooth stereo, and a heater. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2018, and work since 2023 has included reupholstering the seats, reconditioning the dashboard, and replacing the battery, belts, fuel lines, hood shocks, differential mount, and center support bearing. This E9 is now offered by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, service records, two spare sets of wheels, and a clean California title.

The car came finished from the factory in Nachtblau Metallic (40), and exterior features include tri-color side stripes, a front air dam, a sliding steel sunroof, front fender-mounted vertical air guides, dual side mirrors, bright window trim, and a chrome-finished rear bumper with rubber impact strips. The front air dam, roof, and hood were repainted while a fender was repaired in 2023.

The 17″ BBS wheels were mounted with 235/40 Toyo Proxes Sport tires in 2022. Stopping power is provided by discs at all four corners. A set of 14″ turbine-style wheels wearing Michelin tires and a set of 14″ basketweave wheels with BFGoodrich tires accompany the vehicle.

The cabin houses front bucket seats and contoured rear seats that were re-trimmed in blue leather in 2023. The front seat foam padding was also replaced at that time and the dash was reconditioned. Interior appointments include front seat head restraints, a heated rear window, a Becker AM/FM radio, a heater, and a hidden Bluetooth stereo.

The aftermarket three-spoke steering wheel fronts a 150-mph speedometer, a tachometer, an analog clock, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 98k miles, approximately 6k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.0-liter M30 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission. Work in 2024 included installing a spin-on oil filter and replacing the battery, belts, fuel lines, hood shocks, differential mount, and center support bearing. A receipt from the work indicates smoke from the engine.
Additional underbody photos are provided in the gallery.

This 2011 BMW 335i xDrive sedan has 26k miles and is powered by a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission. The car is finished in Le Mans Blue Metallic over black Dakota leather and is equipped with the M Sport Package, adaptive xenon headlights, a sunroof, Park Distance Control, an M Sport suspension, 18″ Style 193M wheels, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, Active Cruise Control, and dual-zone automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2024. This E90 335i is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean New York title.

The car is finished in Le Mans Blue Metallic (381) and is equipped with the optional M Sport Package, which added an aerodynamic body kit and Shadowline trim. Additional exterior features include adaptive xenon headlights, a sunroof, Park Distance Control, LED taillights, and fog lights. Paint protection film was applied to the body under previous ownership. The rear bumper cover is scratched.

The 18″ Style 193M alloy wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport tires. Stopping power is provided by ventilated discs at each corner. The optional M Sport Package added an M Sport suspension.

The cabin features power-adjustable front sport seats and a rear bench upholstered in black Dakota leather. Interior appointments include a Harman Kardon sound system, driver-seat position memory, a BMW CD stereo, Active Cruise Control, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction M Sport steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles.
The turbocharged 3.0-liter N55B30M0 inline-six was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 300 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission. Additional underside photos are presented in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1971 Fiat 128 is finished in Arctic Gray over black vinyl upholstery and is powered by a 1.1-liter inline-four paired with a four-speed manual transaxle. It is equipped with 13” steel wheels wearing chrome-finished hubcaps along with front disc brakes, three-point front seatbelts, and a heater and defroster. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2016, this Fiat 128 is offered at no reserve in Rome, Italy, with Italian registration.

The car is finished in Arctic Gray and is said to have received paintwork under previous ownership. Exterior features include a driver-side mirror, round headlights, and a chrome grille surround, trim, door handles, and bumpers with overriders.

The 13″ wheels wear chrome-finished hubcaps and are wrapped in 145/80 Imperial Ecodriver 2 Radial 109 tires. A spare wheel and tire assembly is stowed in the engine compartment. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums. Close-up photos of the wheel condition are provided in the gallery below.

The low-back front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in black vinyl upholstery that extends to the door panels. Additional interior features include a tan headliner and sun visors as well as a heater, crank windows, three-point front seatbelts, black carpets, and red floor liners.

The two-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-km/h Veglia Borletti speedometer and a combination gauge. The five-digit odometer shows 56k kilometers (~35k miles,) approximately 12k of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.

The 1.1-liter inline-four drives the front wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle. Work in April 2024 is said to have included performing an oil change and replacing the battery and spark plugs.
Additional underside photos are presented in the gallery.
The car does not have a title, as it is being sold in a country that does not issue titles for road vehicles. It is being offered with its Italian registration.

This 2023 Porsche 911 Targa 4S is a GT Silver Metallic-finished example that has 8k miles and was optioned with a seven-speed manual transaxle, which is paired with a twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six. The car has black leather upholstery, all-wheel drive, a retractable Targa top, LED headlights, a front-axle lift system, 20″ and 21″ Carrera S wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, a Bose sound system, the Chrono Package, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 992.1 Targa is now offered with the owner’s manual, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

The car is finished in GT Silver Metallic and has a retractable Targa roof panel, LED headlights, fog lights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, and front and rear parking sensors. Paint meter readings are provided in the gallery.

Black-finished 20″ and 21″ Carrera S alloy wheels are mounted with Goodyear Eagle F1 tires measuring 245/35 up front and 305/30 at the rear. The car was factory optioned with a front-axle lift system, and braking is handled by red-finished Porsche-script calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors.

The heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in black leather with Porsche crests on the headrests, while rubberized Porsche-branded floor mats line the footwells. Cabin amenities include a Bose sound system, front and rear cameras, cruise control, automatic climate control, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel fronts a central 8k-rpm tachometer with an inset speed readout and LCD screens with configurable displays. A stopwatch is mounted atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 8k miles.

The twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six was factory rated at 443 horsepower and 390 lb-ft of torque. Power is routed to all four wheels through a seven-speed manual transaxle. An oil change was performed in March 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
The New York title is listed as a duplicate.
listing_details: Heated and Ventilated Power-Adjustable Front Seats

description: This 1970 Buick Estate Wagon was refurbished around 2006 and was later featured in the 2013 Steve Carell film The Way, Way Back. The seller acquired the vehicle in late 2013. Powered by a 455ci V8 linked to a three-speed automatic transmission, the car is finished in green with woodgrain paneling and a black vinyl roof over green vinyl upholstery. Other equipment includes three rows of bench seating, styled wheels, power steering, a dual exhaust system, a luggage rack, power windows, air conditioning, and an eight-track player. This LeSabre-based Estate Wagon is now offered with movie memorabilia, manufacturer’s literature, a 2010 article from The Buick Bugle that documents the refurbishment, service records from current ownership, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

Finished from the factory in Seamist Green (45), the car was repainted under prior ownership in the late 2000s. The body sides and the tailgate are accented by faux-woodgrain paneling. A black vinyl roof covering was fitted during the aforementioned refurbishment. Features include a wind deflector above the rear window as well as a luggage rack, chrome bumpers and trim, dual side mirrors, and fender ventiports. Massachusetts inspection labels from 1970 and 2013 are applied to the windshield, and an assortment of travel-themed stickers decorate the rear side windows. Blemishes in the paint, cuts in the woodgrain appliqué, and other imperfections are pictured in the gallery below, and rust is noted in the lower corners of the doors.

Chrome-plated five-spoke 15″ wheels with black accents are mounted with 235/75 Maxxis MA-1 whitewall tires. The car has power steering, and braking is provided by power-assisted drums at all four corners.

The cabin features three rows of bench seats trimmed in green vinyl. Interior appointments include power windows, air conditioning, an eight-track player, cruise control, lap belts, green carpeting, and green floor mats. The top of the dashboard is faded, the driver’s door power-window switch is not functional, and the seller notes low volume output from the AM/FM radio.

The two-spoke steering wheel has woodgrain trim and fronts a 120-mph speedometer. The five-digit odometer shows 22k miles, approximately 500 of which were added under current ownership. The gear selection indicator is not functional. The odometer rolled over in the early 2000s, and true mileage is unknown.
The rear-facing third-row bench seat can be folded flat, and so can the second row. The two-way tailgate drops down or swings open.
The 455ci V8 is topped by a four-barrel carburetor. A dual exhaust system was installed in 2014 under current ownership. An oil change and a tune-up were performed most recently in 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission.

Script pages, a rental/release agreement, a hat, and call sheets from The Way, Way Back are included in the sale and shown in the gallery along with screen grabs of articles about the movie from 2013 and 2014.

This 2000 Mercury Grand Marquis LS was ordered with the Handling and LS Ultimate packages, and it remained registered with its first owner in Tennessee from new until it was acquired by the selling dealer in February 2024. Now indicating 26k miles, the car is finished in Silver Frost Clearcoat Metallic over Light Graphite leather, the car is powered by a 4.6-liter SOHC V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission. It is also equipped with a dual exhaust system, a numeric keyless entry keypad, rear air suspension, anti-lock disc brakes, 16″ aluminum wheels, a digital instrument cluster, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a factory cassette stereo. This Grand Marquis is offered at no reserve with a clean Tennessee title.

The car is finished in Silver Frost Clearcoat Metallic (TS). Exterior details include a numeric keyless entry keypad, cornering lamps, and power-adjustable mirrors with body-color caps. The Carfax report notes that the front of the car sustained “functional” damage in a May 2011 accident, and the seller states that cracks in the rear bumper cover were repaired before the rear bumper cover was refinished in preparation for the sale. Blemishes around the body are identified by the selling dealer in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 16″ lacy-spoke aluminum wheels are wrapped in P225/60R16 Michelin Harmony tires with production date codes from 2008. The optional Handling Package specified revised tuning for the rear stabilizer bar, spring rates, and shock absorbers as well as rear air springs. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel anti-lock discs, the front of which feature dual-piston calipers.

The seating surfaces are trimmed in Light Graphite leather, while woodgrain trim accents the color-coordinated dashboard and door panels. Appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, automatic headlights, power-adjustable front seats, and a factory AM/FM/cassette stereo as well as power windows and door locks. Stains in the carpeting are noted by the selling dealer.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel frames the digital instrument cluster, which contains a speedometer, gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level, and an integrated vehicle status display. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles.

The 4.6-liter SOHC V8 is equipped with a dual exhaust system, and it produced 215 horsepower and 285 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission.
The selling dealer notes corrosion on the steering box, steering linkage, rear axle, front frame rails, and front lower control arms.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned May 2011 accident report and lists history in Tennessee.

This 1991 Mazda RX-7 convertible is said to have remained registered with the prior owner’s family since 2001 in Washington and Texas until it was acquired by the current owner on BaT in August 2023, and it now shows 46k miles. The car is powered by a 1.3-liter Wankel rotary paired with a five-speed manual transmission and is finished in Crystal White over black leather. Equipment includes a power-operated black convertible top, pop-up headlights, fog lights, 15″ BBS alloy wheels, power steering, air conditioning, and cruise control. This RX-7 convertible is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with magazines, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Crystal White and features a power-retractable black convertible top with a removable targa-style roof panel. Additional equipment includes pop-up headlights, fog lights, a power antenna, and dual exhaust outlets. Blemishes around the exterior and areas of worn upholstery around the top-boot latches are noted. The trunk lid struts need to be replaced.
The 15″ BBS alloy wheels are mounted with 205/60 Bridgestone Turanza EL400 tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs, and the car is equipped with power steering.

The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather along with a color-coordinated dash, doors, and carpets. Amenities include air conditioning, cruise control, and power windows, door locks, and side mirrors. The seller reports the CD player functions intermittently.

The airbag steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 46k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.
The 1.3-liter 13B Wankel rotary was factory rated at 160 horsepower and 140 lb-ft of torque. Fluid changes were performed in May 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission. Service in June 2021 included replacing the transmission output shaft seal and the upper shifter boots.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage from the first entry in 1993.

This 2004 Bentley Arnage T was listed on BaT in October 2019 before it was acquired by the seller in 2021, and it now has 42k miles. Subsequent work is said to have included replacing the steering rack, serpentine belt, transmission mount, sway bar links, lower control arm bushings, and tires. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 6.75-liter V8 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission and is finished in black over Linen Connolly leather. It has 19″ two-piece five-spoke wheels, multi-zone automatic climate control, a sunroof, rear-passenger picnic tables, cruise control, heated and power-adjustable front seats, navigation, and a CD stereo with a six-disc CD changer. This Arnage T is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

Black paint finishes the body, and exterior details consist of a sunroof, front fender vents, a body-color grille shell, parking sensors, and round quad headlights. The front bumper cover was repainted under previous ownership.

The 19″ two-piece five-spoke wheels are mounted with 255/45 Vredestein Quatrac Pro tires that were reportedly replaced at 32k miles. The sport-tuned suspension features a double-wishbone independent design that is supplemented by a computer-controlled adaptive electro-hydraulic damping system, and traction control, stability control, and ride height control came standard. The lower control arm bushings were replaced in 2021, the brake fluid and power steering fluid were changed in December 2022, and the seller states that a replacement steering rack and sway bar links were installed in 2024.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Linen Connolly leather with diamond-stitched inserts. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable front seats, multi-zone automatic climate control, rear-passenger picnic tables, a leather headliner, aftermarket all-weather floor mats, burl oak trim, cruise control, navigation, and a CD stereo with six-disc CD changer. The cabin air filters were replaced in December 2022. The right-rear window regulator is inoperative.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a digital display flanked by a 170-mph speedometer and a tachometer. A clock and gauges for coolant temperature, voltage, oil pressure, and fuel level are centrally mounted in the wooden dash fascia. The digital odometer indicates 42k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The twin-turbocharged 6.75-liter V8 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 645 lb-ft of torque. The serpentine belt is said to have been replaced in 2021. The oil was most recently changed in December 2022, and the seller notes that the air filters were replaced at that time.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels via a GM-sourced 4L80-E four-speed automatic transmission. The transmission was most recently serviced in December 2022.
Manufacturer’s literature is included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1975 Oldsmobile Delta 88 Royale convertible was initially sold at Steele-Hopf Oldsmobile in Blue Island, Illinois, and is said to have remained in a collection for 20 years before the selling dealer’s 2024 acquisition. Now showing 8k miles, the car is finished in Crimson Red over white leather and powered by 455ci V8 linked with a three-speed automatic transmission and limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a power-operated white convertible soft top, power steering, power-assisted front disc brakes, and 15″ steel wheels with wire-style covers in addition to a power-adjustable driver seat, air conditioning, cruise control, a push-button AM/FM radio, an Alpine CD stereo, and power windows, locks, and mirrors. This 88 convertible is offered in Oregon with a build sheet, a manufacturer’s certificate of origin, manufacturer’s literature, and a Washington title.

The body is finished in Crimson Red (72) and features a power-operated white convertible soft top, chrome bumpers, sport side mirrors, a power antenna, and an outside thermometer affixed to the left door.

The 15″ steel wheels wear wire-style covers are mounted with 225/75 Michelin XA4 All Seasons narrow-whitewall tires. The car is equipped with power steering and power-assisted front disc and rear drum brakes.

The split front bench seat and rear bench are upholstered in white leather and joined by color-coordinated door panels. Woodgrain trim accents the cabin and appointments include a six-way power-adjustable driver seat, air conditioning, cruise control, a push-button AM/FM radio, an Alpine CD stereo, a digital clock, and power windows, locks, and mirrors.
The wood-trimmed steering wheel is mounted to a tilting column and fronts a horizontal-sweep 100-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel economy and level. The five-digit odometer shows 8k miles.
The 455ci V8 is equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and was factory rated at 190 horsepower and 350 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The current Washington title carries a “Classic” brand.

This 1967 Mercedes-Benz 230S is powered by a 2.3-liter inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission and is finished in Maroon over tan MB-Tex. Equipment includes 13″ steel wheels, power steering, a fender-mounted antenna, chrome bumpers, air conditioning, and bench seating. The selling dealer recently acquired the car from the second owner, who had owned the car since 1968. This Fintail is now offered at no reserve with a data card, factory books, handwritten service notes, a tool kit, and a clean Kansas title.

Heckflosse, or Fintail, versions of the W111 chassis were built between 1959 and 1968. This example is finished in Maroon and features a fender-mounted antenna, chrome bumpers, chrome trim, vent windows, and a driver-side mirror. Photos of bubbling paint can be found in the gallery.
The 13″ steel wheels wear covers with body-color accents and are mounted with 185/75 Yokohama AVID tires. The car is equipped with power steering and power-assisted four-wheel drum brakes.

The front and rear bench seats are trimmed in tan MB-Tex, while wood veneers accent the dashboard and door panels. Interior appointments include a padded upper dashboard, an electric clock, and air conditioning.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a chrome horn ring and frames vertically oriented instrumentation including a 120-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer shows 74k miles, and has rolled over at least three times. Total mileage is unknown.
The 2.3-liter inline-six features dual Zenith carburetors and was factory rated at 131 horsepower and 132 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.
The previous owner applied for and was awarded a 500,000-kilometer certificate in 1986.
Handwritten service records dating back to 1968 will accompany the car. They include an entry for collision repair parts and labor on August 1, 1973.

This 1968 Datsun 510 race car was first listed on BaT in 2019 and then bought by the selling dealer in 2021. It was subsequently rebuilt to compete in the B-Sedan class, and work included repainting the body, overhauling the suspension, reworking the cockpit, installing a Rebello-built L18 engine, a 280ZX five-speed manual transmission, a Cusco limited-slip differential, and Koni/QA1 adjustable shocks, and replacing the gauges, fuel cell, driveshaft, U-joints, brake hoses, wheel bearings, and tie rod ends. This 510 race car is now offered in Colorado with a bill of sale.
The car was repainted in dark blue with a white engine bay and interior following the selling dealer’s purchase in 2021.
Over 150 photos of the build process are provided in the gallery.

The suspension and brakes were overhauled following the 2021 auction. Work included returning the rear cross member to factory specification, repairing and reinforcing the front subframe, repairing the front control arms, sandblasting and powdercoating the suspension components, converting the rear brakes back to drums, installing adjustable Koni front shocks, adjustable QA1 rear shocks, and upgraded sway bars, and replacing the brake lines, wheels bearings, and tie rod ends.
The wheels are 13×7″ Rotas and they are mounted with 205/60 Toyo R888R tires.

Cockpit changes under current ownership have included modifying the roll cage to ease entry and exit, repairing rust, repainting the sheet metal in white, fabricating a new dashboard, door panels, and interior panels, and replacing the gauges and switchgear.
Instrumentation includes an AutoMeter Pro-Comp II Tachometer and Steward-Warner gauges for fuel pressure, oil pressure, voltage, water temperature, and oil temperature.

The 1.8L L18 inline-four was installed during current ownership and the selling dealer notes that it was built by Rebello Racing. The engine is equipped with twin Mikuni sidedraft carburetors, Ermish Racing headers, and an Ermish Racing exhaust system.
The selling dealer also installed a close-ratio 280ZX five-speed manual transmission, a Cusco 4.11:1 limited-slip differential, a replacement driveshaft and U-joints, and an ATL fuel cell.

This 1985 BMW M635CSi is a German-market example that was imported to the US and federalized in 1985 by its original owner, with whom the car remained until the selling dealer acquired it in 2024. Power comes from a 3.5-liter M88/3 inline-six mated to a five-speed manual transmission, and the car left the factory finished in Diamond Black Metallic over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 17″ Racing Dynamics five-spoke wheels, headlight wipers, fog lights, a power sunroof, and a decklid spoiler as well as manually adjustable front sport seats, air conditioning, and an Alpine CD stereo. This E24 M635CSi is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, documents relating to the 1985 import, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Diamond Black Metallic and features a power sunroof, headlight wipers, and a front air dam with fog lights as well as a power antenna, a decklid spoiler, and twin off-center exhaust outlets. Photos showing chipped paint on the mirror caps and around the front of the car are provided in the gallery.

Racing Dynamics 17″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 235/45 BFGoodrich Advantage Control all-season tires. The car is equipped with MacPherson struts up front and a semi-trailing arm suspension setup out back as well as Bilstein shocks and front and rear anti-roll bars. Braking is handled by power-assisted four-wheel discs with ABS and ventilated front rotors.

The manually adjustable front sport seats and the rear bench are upholstered in black leather, while the door panels are accented with gray leather. Amenities include air conditioning, an onboard computer, and an Alpine head unit connected to a trunk-mounted CD changer and aftermarket amplifiers as well as BMW-branded carpeted floor mats, and power-operated windows, mirrors, and locks. Scuffs are visible on the front seat upholstery.

The M Tech I steering wheel fronts a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as a 160-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The six-digit mechanical odometer shows 285k miles, approximately 100 miles were added by the selling dealer. The factory speedometer has been replaced with a US version, therefore true mileage is unknown. Areas of wear are visible on the steering wheel.
The 3.5-liter M88/3 inline-six features Bosch Motronic fuel injection and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 251 lb-ft of torque.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transmission
The Carfax report begins with a January 1991 entry and is free of accidents or other damage.
The car was designated a Gross Polluter by the state of California in December 2000 and has since passed a California emissions test, most recently in February 2023.

This 1940 Ford pickup was purchased by the current owner in 2020 and refurbished and modified with the installation of a 4.3-liter Vortec V6, a 700R4 four-speed automatic transmission, a 9″ rear end, and a Mustang II-style independent suspension. The truck was repainted in the metallic gray and the cab was fitted with a bench seat trimmed in gray upholstery along with a VintageAir climate control system, a tilt steering column, and VDO gauges. Additional equipment includes an Edelbrock four-barrel carburetor and intake manifold, power front disc brakes, power-assisted steering, 15″ Speedway Motors steel wheels, LED turn signals, and fiberglass rear fenders. This modified Ford pickup is now offered on dealer consignment with spare parts, refurbishment photos and records, and a clean Wyoming title in the name of the owner’s trust.

The cab was chopped 3″ and fiberglass rear fenders were installed before the truck was painted metallic gray during the refurbishment. Equipment includes a black front bumper, a rear roll pan, LED lighting, dual side-view mirrors, black and white pinstripes, and running boards.

Black 15″ Speedway Motors steel wheels wear chrome baby moon hubcaps, and they are mounted with 195/60 Goodyear Viva 3 front tires and 225/70 Cooper Cobra Radial G/T rubber out back. The truck rides on a Heidt’s Mustang II-style independent front suspension with power steering as well as a live rear axle with leaf springs. Braking is provided by power front disc brakes and rear drums.

The cab was fitted with a Tea’s Design bench seat trimmed in gray upholstery during the build, and it is joined by a color-coordinated headliner, door panels, and carpets. A VintageAir climate control system is mounted in a custom lower dash panel, and the hood release has been relocated to the passenger-side of the firewall.

The leather-wrapped LeCarra steering wheel is mounted on a chrome tilting column ahead of VDO instrumentation that includes a 120-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, voltage, fuel level, and water temperature. The digital odometer shows 600 miles, all of which were added after completion of the build. Total mileage is unknown.
The 4.3-liter Vortec V6 features an Edelbrock four-barrel carburetor and intake manifold. An electric cooling fan is also fitted. An oil change was reportedly performed 400 miles ago.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 700R4 four-speed automatic transmission and a 9″ rear end.
Photos taken during the build are provided in the gallery.

This 2004 Mercedes-Benz SL600 is a Brilliant Silver Metallic-finished example that has spent time in Georgia and Ohio through 2024 and now has 46k miles. Powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V12 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission, it has the AMG Styling Package, gray Exclusive leather upholstery, a power-folding hardtop, a panoramic glass roof, bi-xenon headlights with washers, 18″ Alphard alloy wheels, Parktronic, Keyless-Go, heated and ventilated power-adjustable seats with position memory and massaging elements, a Bose sound system, Active Body Control (ABC) suspension, and COMAND with navigation. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this R230 is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, two keys, a Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title.

The car is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic and has a power-folding convertible hardtop, a panoramic glass roof, bi-xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, fender air vents, and the AMG Styling Package, which added a revised front fascia and side skirts. Damage to the left side is listed in a May 2008 entry of the Carfax report.

The 18″ Alphard alloy wheels are mounted with staggered-width Michelin tires. The car features Active Body Control (ABC) suspension as well as an Electronic Stability Program (ESP) and Automatic Slip Control (ASR). Replacement brake pads, rotors, and wear sensors were installed in February 2024, according to the seller.

The heated, ventilated, and massaging multi-contour seats feature position memory settings and are upholstered in gray Exclusive leather, while wood trim accents the cabin. Carpeted floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include dual-zone automatic climate control, Parktronic, cruise control, Keyless Go, a Bose sound system, and COMAND with navigation.
The wood- and leather-trimmed steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 46k miles.

The twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter M275 V12 was factory rated at 493 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. Per the seller, the power steering and ABC suspension pump was replaced in 2020, and a replacement battery was fitted in February 2024 at which time the oil was changed.
