Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the R230 SL600 when it was new? Click here to check out their March 2004 Road Test.
listing_details: Heated, Ventilated, and Massaging Multi-Contour Seats

description: This 1963 Chevrolet C10 Fleetside pickup was acquired out of Arizona by the seller in 2018 and underwent a refurbishment that was completed in 2021. Work involved refinishing the truck in orange and white, refreshing the coordinated interior, and lowering the ride height. Power is provided by a 230ci inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission, and equipment includes Hedman headers, 15″ steel wheels, polished hubcaps, lowering springs and shocks, a wood-plank bed floor, a push-button AM radio, and aftermarket instrumentation. This C10 is now offered with a clean Florida title in the seller’s name listing the truck as a 1964 model.

The truck is equipped with a Fleetside bed and is refinished in orange with a white cab. Wood planks and body-color runners line the bed floor, and replacement components include the windshield, weatherstripping, rear window, rear bumper, front grille, mirrors, trim, and vent windows.

White 15″ steel wheels wear polished hubcaps and are mounted with 235/75 Nexen tires. Revised suspension includes 5″ front and 4″ rear lowering springs, an adjustable panhard bar, and replacement ball joints and tie rods. The seller notes that the wheel cylinders and shoes for the four-wheel drum brakes were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The cabin houses a bench seat trimmed in white and orange, and the color scheme extends to the door panels and dashboard. A push-button Delco AM radio and replacement carpets are fitted, and the shifter is topped with a beer tap handle.

The two-spoke white steering wheel frames an aftermarket 160-mph speedometer and readouts for fuel level, voltage, water temperature, and oil pressure. The odometer shows 2,800 miles, and total mileage is unknown.

The 230ci inline-six sends power to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transmission. An aluminum radiator with an electric fan is fitted, and Hedman headers feed twin exhaust outlets that exit in front of the left rear wheel. The spark plugs and wires, ignition coil, and carburetor were replaced under current ownership.

This 2001 BMW M5 is powered by a 4.9-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Jet Black over Imola Red and Black Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes 18″ Style 65 wheels, a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, parking sensors, heated power-adjustable front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, and navigation. The car was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023, and it now has 98k miles following registration history in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and North Carolina. This E39 M5 is offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean North Carolina title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) with Shadowline trim and features xenon headlights with washers, parking sensors, fog lamps, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, rain-sensing wipers, and quad exhaust outlets. There is a scratch on the front and rear bumper covers, and Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim as well as paint meter readings are shown in the gallery below.

Chrome Shadow 18″ Style 65 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The car features Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) with All Season Traction, and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs measuring 13.6″ and 12.9″ front and rear, respectively.

The cabin features Imola Red and Black Nappa leather covering the heated power-adjustable front sport seats, door panel inserts, center console, and lower dashboard, while brushed aluminum accents the upper dashboard, center console, and upper doors. Amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, and navigation.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts an M-branded 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 98k miles, approximately 600 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 4.9-liter S62 V8 is equipped with individual throttle bodies and double-VANOS continuously variable valve timing. It was factory rated at 394 horsepower at 6,600 rpm and 369 lb-ft of torque at 3,800 rpm. The oil was changed in November 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Getrag six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.  The driveshaft flex disc was replaced in November 2023, per the selling dealer.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Imola Red & Black Nappa Leather Upholstery

description: This 2002 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am convertible is one of approximately 2,400 Collector Edition models that were produced for the 2002 model year, all of which were finished in Collector Yellow over Ebony leather. It is powered by a 5.7-liter LS1 V8 linked to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes an aftermarket exhaust system, a black convertible soft top, 19″ Curva Concepts multi-spoke wheels, a decklid spoiler, pop-up headlights, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, remote keyless entry, air conditioning, cruise control, and the WS6 Ram Air Performance and Handling Package, which added Ram-Air induction, functional hood scoops, a tuned suspension, and a power-steering cooler. The seller purchased the car in July 2018, and it now has 39k miles. This Firebird Trans Am convertible is offered with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Kansas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Collector Yellow with silver and gray stripes on the hood, doors, and quarter panels. Features include a power-operated black convertible soft top Ram-Air induction, functional hood scoops, pop-up headlights, fog lights, and a decklid spoiler.

Aftermarket 19″ Curva Concepts multi-spoke wheels are mounted with 275/30 Pirelli Cinturato P1 tires. Braking is handled by power-assisted four-wheel disc brakes with ABS. The WS6 Ram Air Performance and Handling Package included revised suspension tuning and a power steering cooler.

The 2+2 cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Ebony leather with embroidered Firebird logos and Collector Edition lettering on the headrests. Equipment includes a six-way power-adjustable driver’s seat, remote keyless entry, power mirrors, air conditioning, cruise control, a Monsoon audio system, and a remote CD changer.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,000-rpm redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 39k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.7-liter LS1 V8 features Ram-Air induction and was factory rated at 345 horsepower. A BMR strut tower brace and an aftermarket exhaust system have been fitted, and additional modifications are said to include a mild camshaft. An oil change was performed in October 2023.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
listing_details: WS6 Ram Air Performance and Handling

attributes.value: Firebird Trans Am WS6 Collector Edition Convertible WS6 6-Speed

description: This 2016 Alfa Romeo 4C Spider is finished in black over black leather with red stitching, and it is powered by a turbocharged 1.7-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. The current owner purchased the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 1,200 of the under 1,500 indicated miles. Equipment includes the Spider Track Package 3 and Carbon Fiber Interior Trim Group as well as a sport-tuned dual exhaust, forged 18″ and 19″ five-hole wheels, bi-xenon headlights, manually adjustable sport seats, air conditioning, and an Alpine stereo with Bluetooth connectivity. This 4C is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the name of the owner’s company.

The car’s composite bodywork is finished in black and surrounds a carbon-fiber tub with aluminum front and rear subframes. Features include a carbon-fiber side intake scoop and mirror caps as well as bi-xenon headlights, a removable fabric soft top, a rear diffuser, and LED taillights.

Dark-finished 18″ front and 19″ rear five-hole forged alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires measuring 205/40 up front and 235/35 out back. The car is equipped with a race-tuned suspension, and braking is handled by fixed red-finished four-piston Brembo calipers mounted over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors at each corner.

The cabin features twin manually adjustable sport seats upholstered in black leather with red stitching and headrest embroidery. The carbon-fiber monocoque chassis is visible on the center tunnel, floor, and around the door sills. Amenities include additional optional carbon-fiber trim, keyless entry, power windows and locks, air conditioning, and an Alpine AM/FM stereo with Bluetooth connectivity.

The leather- and microfiber-wrapped flat-bottomed steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a TFT LCD digital gauge cluster with a 6,500-rpm redline tachometer, a speed readout, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates under 1,500 miles, approximately 1,200 of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted and turbocharged 1.7-liter DOHC inline-four features direct fuel injection and was rated at 237 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. The car was ordered with a sport-tuned dual exhaust system.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to Dennis Dillon Alfa Romeo and Fiat in Boise, Idaho, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total price of $75,795. A car cover and manufacturer’s literature are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2009 Triumph Bonneville T100 50th Anniversary is #284 of 650 examples that were produced to commemorate the 1959 introduction of the Bonneville model. It now shows 9k miles and is powered by an 856cc parallel twin with Keihin fuel injection that drives the rear wheel via a five-speed transmission. Finished in light blue and orange with commemorative badges, the bike is equipped with a quarter fairing, a tinted flyscreen, a two-up seat, and a side stand as well as wire-spoke wheels, front and rear cross-drilled brake rotors, preload-adjustable shocks, an oil cooler, and a chrome two-into-two exhaust system. Acquired by the seller on BaT in April 2024, this 50th Anniversary Bonneville is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, a Certificate of Authenticity, a Hepco & Becker luggage set, an additional stepped two-up seat, two chrome mufflers, spare parts, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in the Meriden Blue and Exotic Orange 50th Anniversary livery and features commemorative badges on the side covers. The front quarter fairing is fitted with a tinted flyscreen, and additional equipment includes chrome-housed turn signals, a 4.4-gallon fuel tank, Triumph-branded rubber knee bolsters, a skid plate, a side stand, four folding foot pegs, and a two-up seat with white piping and a grab strap.

Wire-spoke wheels measuring 19″ up front and 17″ out back are mounted with Continental ContiGo! tires. Suspension consists of a 41mm telescopic fork with black accordion gaiters as well as a pair of preload-adjustable shocks attached to the swingarm. Stopping power is provided by front and rear disc brakes with cross-drilled rotors.

The chrome handlebar carries a pair of round mirrors as well as a smartphone holder and an auxilliary power outlet. Chrome-rimmed instrumentation consists of a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline, and an array of indicator lights. The five-digit odometer shows 9k miles, approximately 30 miles were ridden by the seller.
A plaque on the upper triple clamp identifies the bike as #284 of 650 examples produced.

The air-cooled 865cc DOHC parallel-twin features an oil cooler, an electric starter, digital ignition, Keihin fuel injection, four valves per cylinder, and a chrome-finished two-into-two exhaust system with aftermarket mufflers.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a multi-plate wet clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a drive chain turning under a black-finished guard.

A three-piece hard-sided luggage set by Hepco & Becker will accompany the bike along with an additional stepped two-up seat, two chrome mufflers, manufacturer’s literature, a Certificate of Authenticity, and spare parts.

This 2024 Land Rover Range Rover Sport SV is an Edition One example that is finished in Carbon Bronze Matte over Ebony Windsor leather, and it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V8 driving all four wheels via an eight-speed automatic transmission and an electronic active differential. Equipment consists of a sliding panoramic sunroof, carbon-fiber exterior trim, soft-close doors, 23″ carbon-fiber wheels, air suspension, selectable driving modes, and an active exhaust system. Other details include heated and ventilated seats, Meridian audio, a Pivi Pro touchscreen infotainment system, a heated steering wheel, adaptive cruise control, and a surround-view camera system. This Range Rover Sport SV has 29 miles and is now offered with a window sticker, a first aid kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Mexico title.

The Edition One was offered exclusively with three paint options that included Obsidian Black Gloss, Flux Silver Gloss, or–as seen here–Carbon Bronze Matte. Exterior equipment includes LED lighting, a sliding panoramic sunroof, a power gesture tailgate, soft-close doors, and carbon fiber elements including a body-color hood, trim accents, and exhaust outlet finishers.

Carbon-fiber 23″ Style 5132 wheels are wrapped in 285/40 front and 305/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport All-Season tires. The vehicle rides on a 6D Dynamics air suspension system with hydraulic dampers and is equipped with all-wheel steering, Terrain Response 2, and selectable driving modes including an SV mode with a dedicated button on the steering wheel. Braking is handled by four-wheel slotted discs.

Ebony Windsor leather upholstery covers the seating surfaces, center console, and dashboard, which are complemented by a Suedecloth headliner and satin carbon-fiber trim on the door panels and front seatbacks. The power-adjustable front seats feature heating, cooling, and massaging settings, and additional interior amenities include heated and ventilated rear seats, a Meridian sound system, and a 13.1″ Pivi Pro touchscreen infotainment system that incorporates navigation, climate controls, and other vehicle functions. Additional details include keyless entry, a Clear Sight rearview mirror, wireless device charging, and Edition One door sill plates.

The heated steering wheel is equipped with illuminated paddle shifters and fronts a digital instrument cluster with an odometer indicating 29 miles. Driver aids include adaptive cruise control, blind spot assist, lane keep assist, emergency braking, and a surround-view camera system.

The twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V8 was factory rated at 626 horsepower and 553 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission, a single-speed transfer case, and an electronic active differential. An active exhaust system was equipped as standard.
The window sticker lists factory colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $192,790. A first aid kit and manufacturer’s literature are included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

attributes.value: Rover Range Rover Sport SV Edition One

description: This 1991 Land Rover Defender 90 is a right-hand-drive hardtop that was imported to the US under previous ownership and then refurbished and modified. Work involved fitting a Project Kahn wide-body kit, a repaint in matte silver, and installing a supercharged 6.2-liter LS3 V8 mated to a 6L80 six-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is also equipped with 20” Black Rhino wheels, Old Man Emu shocks, auxiliary lighting, a NAS-style rear bumper, tan leather-trimmed aftermarket seats, custom interior wood paneling, air conditioning, a microfiber headliner, a rearview camera, and an Alpine sound system. It was previously sold on BaT in February 2023, and subsequent work included overhauling brake and suspension components, repairing a leak from the fuel tank, and replacing the rear differential before it was sold again on BaT in December 2023. Recently re-acquired by the selling dealer, this modified Defender 90 is offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a Califonia title listing the truck as a 1990 model.

Along with the Project Kahn wide-body kit, the truck has a modified Puma hood, an X-Lander grille, LED headlights and auxiliary lighting, fender vents, alpine windows, a NAS-style rear bumper, and Masai rock sliders.

Gray 20″ Black Rhino Armory wheels are mounted with 33″ Gladiator QR900-M/T tires, and a smaller spare is affixed to the rear cargo door. Old Man Emu shocks and sway bars are noted, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes. Work in August 2023 included rebuilding the power steering and brake booster pump along with repairing the brake master cylinder, flushing the brake fluid, replacing the rear brake pads, and realigning the rear brake calipers. Suspension bump stops were also fitted at that time.

Beneath a color-keyed microfiber headliner, the aftermarket bucket seats are trimmed in tan leather, while black leather, microfiber, and custom wood trim accent the two-passenger cabin, which has been lined with sound-deadening insulation. Air conditioning, power windows and locks, a push-button gear selector, an Alpine touchscreen, and a rearview camera are additional elements.

A MOMO steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer flanked by gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, fuel level, and boost pressure. The odometer shows 1,400 miles. The Carfax report states that a Not Actual Mileage title was issued for the vehicle in February 2024, and total mileage is unknown.
A custom enclosure located behind the rear seats houses two subwoofers and amplifiers.
The 6.2-liter LS3 V8 was installed under previous ownership and is equipped with a 4.0-liter Whipple supercharger, Trick Flow cylinder heads, and MagnaFuel and Holley fuel system components.

Power is routed to all four wheels through a 6L80E six-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and custom drive shafts. The truck also has long-tube headers, a Flowmaster Flow FX muffler, a front skid plate, and a fuel tank guard. The transmission mount, driveshaft hardware, rear differential, rear axles, and rear wheel hub spacers were replaced in August 2023, at which time the front axle drive flanges were overhauled, a fuel leak was repaired, and a custom overflow canister was added.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned Not Actual Mileage entry.
The vehicle has not been inspected by the California Bureau of Automotive Repair.

This roadster was built in the style of a Lotus Seven prior to the seller’s 2022 acquisition, and its 1.8-liter inline-four and five-speed manual transmission were sourced from a Mazda Miata. Bodywork consists of polished metal panels and a yellow-finished nose and fenders, and the car is equipped with a roll bar, headlights, safety harnesses, and a MOMO steering wheel. Suspension includes Miata-sourced components, QA1 coilovers, and tubular control arms, and the car is also equipped with a Torsen limited-slip differential, four-wheel disc brakes, and Advanti 15″ wheels. This Seven-style roadster is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with spare parts and a clean South Carolina title listing the car as a 1963 Lotus Seven.
The polished metal bodywork is complemented by a yellow-finished nose and fenders. Equipment includes a roll bar, a side-exit exhaust pipe, headlights, and turn signals.

Advanti Storm S1 15″ wheels are wrapped in 205/50 front and 225/45 Falken Azenis RT660 tires. Suspension consists of Miata-sourced knuckles, fabricated control arms, and QA1 coilovers. Cross-drilled and slotted discs are fitted at all four corners.
The seats are trimmed in black vinyl and equipped with safety harnesses. Switchgear for vehicle functions is located on the fabricated black dashboard.
The MOMO steering wheel is mounted on a quick-release hub and fronts a Koso digital display. The odometer shows 5k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.
The 1.8-liter inline-four was sourced from a Mazda Miata and installed under previous ownership. A lightweight battery and a revised radiator and fan were installed following the owner’s acquisition.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential that were sourced from a Mazda Miata.
The car is titled using the identification sequence shown above.

This Ventura was assembled under prior ownership using a Volkswagen chassis along with interior components and a fiberglass body supplied by L’Automobile Distribuidora de Veículos Ltda. of Brazil. Acquired by the current owner approximately eight years ago, it is described a running project that has recently been driven a short distance following a period of long-term storage. The car is finished in yellow with black stripes and features quad rectangular headlights and a rear hatch along with Western 13″ and 14″ alloy wheels. Inside, bolstered bucket seats trimmed in patterned black and gray upholstery are accompanied by an AM/FM cassette stereo as well as VDO and  Cronomac instrumentation. Power is from a 1.6L flat-four fitted with dual downdraft carburetors, while shifting is through a four-speed manual transaxle. This Ventura project is now offered at no reserve in California by the seller on behalf of the owner with a clean Arizona title that lists the car as a 1989 Puma.

L’Automobile Distribuidora de Veículos Ltda. was founded in São Paulo, Brazil, by Claudio Campuzzano and Guillermo Pardo. From 1975 to 1983, the company produced kit car components as well as complete vehicles based on Volkswagen chassis and running gear. The fiberglass body of this Ventura is finished in yellow with black stripes and is said to have been repainted under previous ownership. Details include quad rectangular headlights, dual side-view mirrors, a rear hatch, and Ventura badging. Cracks in the paint and other blemishes are visible around the car.

Western 13″ front and 14″ rear alloy wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza tires measuring 185/70 and 205/70, respectively. Stopping power is from four-wheel drums, and the brake fluid was flushed in preparation for the sale. The seller recommends adjusting the brakes and notes a clanking sound from the suspension.

The bosltered bucket seats are upholstered in patterned black cloth with contrasting gray accents. Black vinyl covers the dash and door panels, while black carpets line the floors. An AM/FM cassette stereo with a built-in equalizer is located in the center stack, and further details include a glovebox, three-point seatbelts, and door-mounted controls for adjusting the side-view mirrors.

A three-spoke steering wheel is paired with a floor-mounted shifter fitted with a golf ball knob. Instrumentation includes a VDO 7k-rpm tachometer along with a Cronomac 200-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges indicating voltage, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 1 mile, and total mileage is unknown.
The air-cooled 1.6L flat-four is fitted with dual Weber downdraft carburetors. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale. The car has not passed a California emissions test.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle. Rust is present on the underside.

This 2012 Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4 coupe is a Nero Nemesis-finished example that was initially delivered to Prestige Imports of North Miami, Florida and has been fitted with an aftermarket exhaust system and a radar detector. Powered by a 6.5-liter V12 linked with a seven-speed ISR automated manual transmission and a Haldex all-wheel-drive system, the car has Nero Ade leather upholstery, a limited-slip rear differential, carbon-ceramic brakes, a front-axle lift system, 20” and 21” Dione wheels, bi-xenon headlights, a carbon-fiber engine cover, a rear-view camera, parking sensors, power-adjustable seats, navigation, cruise control, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this Aventador coupe has 27k miles and is now offered in Illinois with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The Aventador was designed by Filippo Perini, and this coupe example is finished in Nero Nemesis. Exterior details include a carbon-fiber composite monocoque shell, scissor doors, bi-xenon headlights, a rear-view camera, parking sensors, and a center-exit exhaust.

Forged 20″ and 21″ Dione wheels are mounted with staggered-width Pirelli tires. The car is equipped with a magnetic push-rod suspension and a front-axle suspension lift system. Stopping power is provided by yellow-painted multi-piston calipers over carbon-ceramic rotors at all four corners.

The cockpit features power-adjustable bucket seats trimmed in Nero Ade leather with Lamborghini logos on the headrests. Equipment includes cruise control, a radar detector, automatic climate control, navigation, and an infotainment system with a 7″ TFT display. Wear is visible on the driver’s seat and near the right door release lever.

The leather-trimmed multi-function steering wheel frames a digital gauge cluster with a central tachometer, a speed readout, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 27k miles.
The mid-mounted 6.5-liter V12 was factory rated at 691 horsepower and 509 lb-ft of torque. A carbon-fiber engine cover was optioned from the factory.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a seven-speed single-clutch ISR automated manual transmission and a Haldex all-wheel-drive system with a limited-slip rear differential. An aftermarket exhaust system has been fitted.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2021 Mercedes-Benz S580 4MATIC has 6k miles and is equipped with over $16k in optional equipment including the AMG Line Package, Warmth and Comfort Package, 21″ AMG multi-spoke wheels, and gloss-black “Flowing Lines” interior trim. The car is finished in Manufaktur Diamond White over gray and black Exclusive Nappa leather and is further equipped with a panoramic sunroof, Airmatic air suspension, soft-close doors, and heated and ventilated active multi-contour front seats. Other features include a Burmester sound system, an MBUX infotainment system, Distronic adaptive cruise control, and a 360º camera system. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 with a 48-volt EQ Boost hybrid-assist system linked to a 9G-Tronic nine-speed automatic transmission and 4MATIC all-wheel drive. Acquired new by the current owner, this S580 4MATIC is offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a build sheet, a clean Carfax report, and a Florida title.

The car is finished in Manufaktur Diamond White (799) and features revised bodywork as part of the AMG Line Package. Exterior equipment includes a panoramic sunroof, a body-color rear spoiler, adaptive LED headlights, soft-close doors, parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets.
Optional 21″ AMG multi-spoke wheels are wrapped in 255/35 front and 285/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. The car is equipped with Airmatic air suspension and Dynamic Select driving modes.

The cabin is upholstered in gray and black Exclusive Nappa leather complemented by gloss-black “Flowing Lines” trim. The car is equipped with heated and ventilated active multi-contour front seats, a Burmester 3D surround-sound system, and an MBUX infotainment system with a 12.8″ touchscreen display. Other features include 64-color ambient lighting, wireless smartphone integration, and the Warmth and Comfort Package, which added a heated steering wheel, armrests, and rear seats.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a configurable 12.3″ digital instrument cluster with a 160-mph speedometer and an 8k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer indicates 6k miles. Driver aids include Distronic adaptive cruise control, a 360º camera system, Steering Assist, Active Blind Spot Assist, and Active Lane Keeping Assist.

The twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 was factory rated at 496 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque and is coupled with a 48v mild-hybrid EQ Boost Boost Integrated Starter Generator (ISG) that can start the car, recover energy during braking, and provide a temporary power increase of 21 horsepower and 184 lb-ft of torque. Power is delivered to all four wheels through a 9G-Tronic nine-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. A 30k-mile service was performed in May 2024.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
There is currently a lien on the car, and the owner’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.

This 2003 Porsche 911 Carrera cabriolet is finished in Guards Red over black leather and was ordered with a sport exhaust system, M030 sport suspension, heated front sport seats, xenon headlights, body-color interior trim, and more as detailed below. It remained with its original owner in Florida until 2024 and now has 86k miles. Power is provided by a 3.6-liter M96 flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. Other equipment includes a black soft top, a fixed rear spoiler, and aftermarket 18″ wheels. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this 996.2 cabriolet is now offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Guards Red and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, integrated fog lights, a fixed rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers. The Carfax report notes that the fuel filler door actuator was replaced in August 2021, and the seller states that paint correction was performed before a ceramic coating was applied in preparation for the sale.

Aftermarket 18″ wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 tires. The car was ordered with M030 sport suspension, and braking is handled by red four-piston Porsche-branded calipers fitted over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. ABS repairs are noted on the Carfax report in August 2023.

The cabin features heated hardback front sport seats upholstered in black leather with body-color seatbacks. Interior features include body-color trim, cruise control, and automatic climate control. The Carfax report notes that the air-conditioning system compressor, receiver drier, and expansion valve were replaced in August 2021 before the shifter assembly was replaced in May 2024. The shift knob trim is worn.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features silver trim inserts and fronts aluminum-look instrument dials consisting of a 200-mph speedometer, a central tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The steering wheel Porsche crest is worn. The digital odometer indicates 86k miles.

The 3.6-liter M96 flat-six was factory rated at 320 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. The car was ordered with a sport exhaust system from the factory. The Carfax report notes that the water pump was replaced in August 2020, the rear main seal was replaced in February 2021, and the fuel pump seal was replaced in September 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1995 Mercedes-Benz E300 is finished in Smoke Silver Metallic over Creme Beige MB-Tex and powered by a 3.0-liter OM606 diesel inline-six linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes 15″ Alamak alloy wheels, a power sunroof, heated and power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, and a cassette stereo. The car spent time in Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and Nevada before it was acquired by the selling dealer on BaT in February 2022. This W124 E300 shows 109k miles and is offered at no reserve in California with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Nevada title.

Finished from the factory in Smoke Silver Metallic (702), the car is believed to have been repainted under previous ownership. Exterior details include red and gold pinstriping, a power sunroof, fog lights, headlight wipers and washers, a power antenna, and a mono-blade windshield wiper. Paint chips are noted on the left rear quarter panel and rear bumper cover.

The 15″ Alamak alloy wheels are mounted with 195/65 Michelin Premier A/S tires that were manufactured in 2018. The car is equipped with Automatic Slip Control (ASR) and braking is handled by ventilated front and solid rear disc brakes with ABS.

The heated and power-adjustable front bucket seats and rear bench are upholstered in Creme Beige MB-Tex (175) and accompanied by a color-coordinated lower dashboard, door panels, and carpets. Zebrano wood trim accents the cabin and interior appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, a passenger airbag, and a cassette stereo that is said to occasionally cut in and out. The selling dealer notes that the air conditioning system was serviced in August 2023. The headliner is sagging in the rear.

The leather-wheel steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a 140-mph speedometer and a 6k-rpm tachometer with an inset analog clock as well as gauges for coolant temperature, fuel level, and oil pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 109k miles, approximately 18k of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.0-liter OM606 diesel inline-six was factory rated at 134 horsepower and 155 lb-ft of torque. Service in 2022 is said to have involved replacing the EGR valve, idle air control valve, coolant temperature sensor, and fuel filter, and the engine air filter was changed along with the oil April 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1981 Porsche 928 is finished in Mocha Brown over Beige leather upholstery, and its odometer currently shows 22k miles. Powered by a 4.5-liter V8 paired with a five-speed manual transaxle, it is further equipped with a limited-slip differential, 16″ phone dial wheels, a sunroof, pop-up headlights, front fog lights, automatic climate control, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. The car was previously registered in Pennsylvania, Kansas, North Carolina, and Illinois, and it was listed on BaT in July 2022 and purchased by its current owner later that year. This 928 is now offered at no reserve on dealer consignment with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Mocha Brown (451) with body-color housings for the power-adjustable mirrors. Exterior details include pop-up headlights with washers as well as integrated fog lights, a sunroof, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets.

Replacement 16″ phone-dial alloy wheels with color-crest center caps are wrapped in 225/50 Vredestein Ultrac Satin tires that have 2016 production-date codes. The rear wheels are mounted over 25mm spacers, and the car is equipped with power-assisted rack-and-pinion steering and four-wheel ventilated-disc brakes. The front-lower ball joints were replaced in June 2022 with steel units.

The front bucket seats and the folding individual rear seats are upholstered in Beige leather, and the upper door panels are trimmed to match. Additional appointments include automatic climate control, power windows, cruise control, a Blaupunkt Bamberg QTS AM/FM/cassette stereo, and a Hi-Fi sound system as well as 928-script carpeted floor and cargo mats.

The leather-wrapped four-spoke steering wheel frames an 85-mph speedometer, a 7,600-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, fuel level, oil pressure, and voltage. The six-digit odometer shows 22k miles.

The 4.5-liter V8 was equipped with L-Jetronic fuel injection and factory rated at 231 horsepower and 265 lb-ft of torque. The timing belt, water pump, and crankcase seal were replaced in June 2022, and a PK tensioner was installed at that time.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a rear-mounted five-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The clutch slave cylinder was replaced in February 2022, and a reverse lock-out was installed four months later.

The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries. An August 2023 entry indicates the car was designated a gross polluter by the state of California, and an entry six days later shows the car passed a California emissions inspection.

This 1975 Toyota Land Cruiser FJ40 was acquired by the current owner in 2020 and is said to have received subsequent refurbishment work by Mudrak Custom Cruisers and Fine Line Imports in Sonoma and Santa Rosa, California, respectively. It is powered by a 4.2-liter 2F inline-six that has been fitted with a Holley Sniper electronic fuel injection system, an FiTech Fuel Injection fuel pump, a Davis Unified Ignition distributor, and a Tri-Mil exhaust header. Finished in green with a removable hardtop and a white roof over black vinyl, the truck is equipped with a four-speed manual transmission, a dual-range transfer case, Old Man Emu shock absorbers, and 15″ steel wheels with polished hubcaps as well as a Gobi Stealth roof basket and ladder, a Warn winch, a high-lift jack, Bestop Trailmax front bucket seats, inward-facing rear bench seats, a Specter Off-Road roll bar, three-point front seatbelts, Vintage Air climate control, and a Tuffy locking center console. This FJ40 is offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a repair manual, parts receipts, spare parts, and a clean California title.

Finished from the factory in Rustic Green (621), the truck was repainted under previous ownership and a rubberized 3M coating was applied to the wheel wells in preparation for the sale. Exterior details include a removeable hardtop with a white roof as well as a Gobi Stealth roof basket and ladder, a Warn winch, headlight grilles, a high-lift jack, a PIAA reverse light, an auxiliary fuel caddy, rear ambulance-style doors, rear bumperettes, a rear step, and a 2″ receiver hitch. Recent work is said to have involved installing front driving lights and dual telescoping hinged side mirrors as well as replacing the windshield, weather stripping, door handles, and various exterior lights. Chips are noted on the right rear window and other exterior blemishes are pictured in the gallery below.

The 15″ steel wheels with polished hubcaps are mounted with 30×9.5″ Falken Wildpeak AT3W tires, and a matching spare is affixed to the swing-out rear tire carrier. The truck is equipped with Warn manually locking front hubs, Old Man Emu shock absorbers, and four-wheel drum brakes. The seller reports that the brake master cylinder, booster, and lines were recently replaced along with the wheel bearings, tie rod ends, and leaf spring shackles.

The Bestop Trailmax front bucket seats and inward-facing rear bench seats are trimmed in black vinyl. The seller states that sound deadening material has been added to the door panels. Appointments include an off-white felt headliner, a Specter Off-Road rear roll bar, three-point front seatbelts, Vintage Air climate control, a passenger grab bar, a radio block-off plate, a fire extinguisher, a black vinyl floor liner and rubber mats, and a Tuffy locking center console with cupholders and USB power outlets. The right window does not roll all the way down, a dent is noted on the inside of the right rear door, and paint runs are noted in the left door jamb and window ledge. An area of black textured coating on the transmission tunnel has peeled off.

The replacement three-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and readouts for oil pressure, fuel level, coolant temperature, and amperage while Stewart Warner oil pressure and vacuum gauges are housed in the dash. The high-beam indicator is not functional. The five-digit odometer shows 90k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership. The seller notes that the total mileage is unknown.

The 4.2-liter 2F inline-six is equipped with a Holley Sniper electronic fuel injection system, an FiTech Fuel Injection in-line fuel pump, braided stainless-steel fuel lines, a Davis Unified Ignition (DUI) distributor, and a gear reduction starter. Dyno tuning is said to have been carried out at Fine Line Imports in Santa Rosa, California, in August 2023. Recent service reportedly involved changing the fluids and replacing the intake manifold, engine mounts, spark plugs, alternator, voltage regulator, battery, thermostat, belts, and hoses. Some emissions equipment has been removed or disconnected. Oil seepage is noted from the rear main seal.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The seller states that the front axle was rebuilt, the clutch cable was changed, and a Tri-Mil exhaust header was installed in 2022 along with a replacement exhaust system.

This 1991 Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce remained registered in Illinois until 2024, and now shows 77k miles. It is powered by a 2.0-liter inline-four paired with a five-speed manual transmission and is finished in red over beige leather upholstery. Equipment includes a tan soft top, 15″ 12-hole alloy wheels, an aftermarket stereo, air conditioning, and power windows. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this Series 4 Spider is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The Series 4 Spider received an exterior refresh with color-matched bumpers and a revised tail with integrated wrap-around taillights. The Pininfarina-designed bodywork of this example has been refinished in red, and exterior details include a tan soft top, a power antenna, and painted mirror caps. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.
Silver-finished 15″ 12-hole alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P6 tires. Power steering and four-wheel disc brakes were fitted as standard equipment on the Series 4 Spider.

The bucket seats are upholstered in beige leather and suede as well as a color-coordinated lower dashboard, center console, and door panel inserts. Interior equipment includes an aftermarket stereo, air conditioning, a rear parcel shelf, a driver-side airbag, and power windows.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer and an 8k-rpm tachometer as well as gauges for oil pressure, voltage, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 77k miles. The airbag light is flashing.

The 2.0-liter inline-four features Bosch Motronic electronic fuel injection and was factory rated at 120 horsepower and 117 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission. The cylinder was serviced in May 2016 and the clutch was replaced in 2021. and the selling dealer notes oil leaks. A recent inspection noted that the car has some leaks around the valve cover gasket, the steering link ends have play, and the brake master cylinder was seeping.
There is corrosion on the underside components.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2008 Land Rover Range Rover HSE remained registered in California until 2018 and now has 38k miles. It is powered by a 4.4-liter AJ V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and an electronic center differential. The truck is finished in Java Black over Jet leather and features 19″ alloy wheels, a sunroof, heated front and rear seats, a rearview camera, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Service in preparation for the sale included replacing the radiator, air filters, and PCV valve. Acquired by the current owner in 2018, this Range Rover HSE is offered by the seller on behalf of the owner at no reserve with a window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the owner’s name.

The truck is finished in Java Black and features xenon headlights with washers as well as fog lights, a sunroof, a rear window wiper, a receiver hitch, and parking sensors. The seller reports the right portion of the front bumper cover was repainted and blended with the fender. Noted blemishes include chips on the windshield, rear bumper cover, and door edges.

The 19″ seven-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/55 Accelera tires. The truck is equipped with an adjustable air suspension, a Terrain Response system, and Hill Descent Control. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs, and the brake fluid was flushed in June 2024.

The front seats are upholstered in Jet leather and feature heating, power adjustment, and lumbar support. Amenities include heated outboard rear seats, keyless entry, a rearview camera, navigation, a 14-speaker Harman Kardon sound system, and three-zone automatic climate control.

The heated steering wheel frames a 156-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 38k miles, approximately 18k of which were added under current ownership.
The 4.4-liter AJ-V8 was factory rated at 301 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque. Service in June 2024 included changing the oil and replacing the radiator, PCV valve, and air filters.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed ZF automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and an electronic center differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Penegon Mission Viejo in California and shows factory colors, equipment, and a total amount of $78,550.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1973.5 Porsche 911T Targa  is a running project that was acquired by the late owner in 1983, and it has been repainted metallic burgundy and fitted with black cloth Recaro front seats. The car is powered by a 2.4-liter flat-six equipped with Bosch K-Jetronic fuel injection and linked with a 915 five-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes a removable roof panel, a stainless-steel Targa bar, 15″ Fuchs alloy wheels, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. This 911T Targa is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner’s estate with the owner’s manual, shop manuals, a car cover, and a Pennsylvania title.

Originally finished in Green Metallic (230), the car was repainted black under prior ownership and was refinished in its current shade of metallic burgundy in the 1980s. Equipment includes a removable roof panel, a stainless-steel Targa bar, US-specification rear bumperettes, “sugar scoop” headlight trim rings, and a driver-side mirror. Imperfections are shown up close in the gallery.

The 15″ Fuchs alloy wheels feature body-color recessed areas and are mounted with 205/80 Bridgestone Potenza RE71 tires. The four-wheel disc brakes were overhauled in 2016. Koni gas  shocks are fitted and a front strut tower brace has been added.

The Recaro front seats are upholstered in black cloth while the fold-down rear seats are trimmed in black vinyl. Red carpets have been added along with wood trim, an aftermarket shift knob, a Blaupunkt cassette radio and graphic equalizer, and Optimus rear speakers. The air conditioning compressor has been removed.

The aftermarket three-spoke steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation consisting of a 150-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, an analog clock, and gauges for fuel level, oil level, oil temperature, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer has rolled over and shows 18k miles. Total mileage is unknown.

The 2.4-liter flat-six was factory equipped with Bosch K-Jetronic fuel injection and was rated at 147 (SAE) horsepower. The fuel accumulator was replaced in preparation for the sale.  The seller states there is smoke coming from the engine.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a 915 five-speed manual transaxle. The seller notes various oil leaks and states that the shift linkage has play.

This 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Guards Red over black partial leather. Equipment includes 17″ Cup II-style wheels, drilled rotors, power-adjustable front seats, a Pionner CD stereo, power windows, cruise control, and air conditioning. The car was previously sold on BaT in April 2020 and acquired in 2022 by the seller, who added 5k of its 81k shown miles. This 993 Carrera coupe is now offered in Canada with the owner’s manual, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and British Columbia registration.

The car is finished in Guards Red (L80K) and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a power-operated sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, dual exhaust outlets, and a “basket handle” upper rear spoiler with an integrated brake light. The seller reports a chip in the windshield has been repaired.

Cup II-style 17″ wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires measuring 205/50 up front and 255/40 out back. The car rides on Bilstein coilovers, and braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over drilled rotors at all four corners.

The interior is trimmed in black partial leather along with a color-coordinated dashboard and carpeting. interior elements include eight-way power-adjustable seats, cruise control, air conditioning, power windows and locks, a Rennline pedal set, Coco Mats, and a Pioneer head unit and speakers.

A MOMO Mod. 07 steering wheel fronts VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer, a 180-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 81k miles, approximately 5k of which have been added under current ownership.

The air-cooled 3.6L flat-six was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 243 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. The clutch, pressure plate, and release bearing were replaced under previous ownership. The seller reports that the flywheel was replaced in 2022 and the car has been fitted with a Motorsound airbox cover and a Fister Stage 3 exhaust.
The option sticker decodes as follows:
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other reported damage.
This vehicle does not have a title and is being sold on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada.

This 1997 Ford F-350 XLT is a Crew Cab 4×4 pickup that is finished in two-tone Oxford White and Medium Grey Metallic over Opal Gray cloth upholstery and is powered by a 7.3-liter turbodiesel V8 mated to a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Additional equipment includes a limited-slip rear differential, 16″ eight-hole alloy wheels, front disc brakes, Bilstein shocks, a sliding rear window, a receiver hitch, a fifth-wheel hitch, power-adjustable front seats, air conditioning, cruise control, and an AM/FM/CD stereo. The selling dealer acquired the truck in 2024 and it now has 115k miles. This F-350 is now offered at no reserve with a Deluxe Marti report, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Kansas title.

The truck is finished in two-tone Oxford White and Medium Grey Metallic, and features include a bug shield, a sliding rear window, a rear step bumper, a receiver hitch, a fifth-wheel hitch, bedside 4×4 decals, and a spray-in bedliner that was applied in June 2024.
The 16″ eight-hole alloy wheels are mounted with 285/75 BFGoodrich All-Terrain K02 tires. The truck is equipped with Bilstein shocks and Motorcraft front brake calipers.

The cabin features power-adjustable front seats and a rear bench seat trimmed in Opal Gray cloth along with a color-coordinated dashboard and door panels. Amenities include air conditioning, cruise control, power windows, and an AM/FM/CD stereo.
The steering wheel frames an 85-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 115k miles.
The 7.3-liter Power Stroke turbodiesel V8 was factory rated at 215 horsepower and 425 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in the past 100 miles.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a limited-slip rear differential.
The Deluxe Marti report indicates initial delivery to Crater Lake Motors of Medford, Oregon, along with factory colors and equipment.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Oxford White & Medium Grey Metallic Paint

attributes.value: F-350 XLT Crew Cab Power Stroke 4×4

description: This 1972 Chevrolet K10 Custom Deluxe 4×4 pickup was fitted with a 6.0-liter LQ4 V8 and repainted black under previous ownership and was acquired by the current owner in 2022. The truck is equipped with a three-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, a 4″ suspension lift, and Fox dual steering stabilizers and shock absorbers with remote reservoirs in addition to power steering, power-assisted four-wheel disc brakes, polished 15″ US Mags Indy wheels, an aFe Power cold air intake, and a 3″ dual exhaust system with MagnaFlow mufflers. The interior was also refreshed and features air conditioning, a black cloth bench seat, a Bluetooth stereo, a subwoofer, and aftermarket speakers. This K10 is offered on dealer consignment in Arizona with a clean South Carolina title.

The body has been repainted black, the grille surround has been re-chromed, and the brightwork has been refinished or replaced. Exterior details include a Fleetside bed, dual side mirrors, LED side marker lights and taillights, and a Line-X textured bedliner.

Polished 15″ US Mags Indy wheels are mounted with 32×10″ BFGoodrich Mud-Terrarin T/A KM3 tires. The truck is equipped with power steering, power-assisted four-wheel disc brakes, a 4″ suspension lift, and dual Fox steering stabilizers and Performance Series 2.0 IFP shock absorbers with remote reservoirs.

The interior has been refreshed and was reportedly fitted with sound deadening material. The bench seat is trimmed in black cloth and appointments include air conditioning, three-point front seatbelts, power door locks, a Bluetooth stereo, aftermarket kick panel speakers, and a subwoofer beneath the seat.

An aftermarket steering wheel is mounted to a tilting column and frames a 100-mph speedometer, a 5k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, amperage, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer shows 65 miles, which is said to reflect the miles driven since the completion of the build. Total chassis mileage is unknown.
A 6.0-liter LQ4 V8 was installed in approximately 2015 and features an aFe Power cold air intake.
Power is routed to all four wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The 3″ dual exhaust system incorporates an X-pipe and MagnaFlow mufflers.

This 1983 Land Rover 110, nicknamed “Grey Goose”, was modified and mechanically refurbished by The Landrovers of Amsterdam prior to being imported to the US under prior ownership. The build included repainting the body and fitting it with a roof rack, a Puma-style hood, LED auxiliary lights, 18″ Sawtooth wheels, and a 2″ suspension lift as well as refreshing the interior with brown leather upholstery, an Alpine touchscreen stereo, and an aftermarket air conditioning system. Power is from a 3.5-liter V8 linked to a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. This Land Rover 110 is offered by the seller in Rhode Island on behalf of the current owner with a Florida title listing the truck as a 1985 model.

The truck was repainted gray during the build, and it has been modified with the installation of a roof rack, a Puma-style hood, a KBX grille, LED auxiliary lights, Fire & Ice-style side steps, and a Mantec spare tire carrier.
The 18″ Sawtooth wheels are mounted with Cooper Discoverer STT Pro tires. The truck is equipped with a 2″ suspension lift and front disc brakes.

The front bucket seats, inward-facing rear bench seats, door panels, dash pad and center console lid were reupholstered in brown leather during the refurbishment, which also included replacing the headliner, carpets and seat belts. Appointments include an Alpine touchscreen head unit, Alpine speakers, an aftermarket air conditioning system, and Land Rover-branded rubber floor mats.

The replacement steering wheel fronts a 110-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges. The six-digit odometer shows 2,200 miles, which is said to represent the total mileage added since the refurbishment. Total mileage is unknown.
The 3.5-liter V8 was overhauled during the refurbishment.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through an LT95 four-speed manual transmission and an LT230 dual-range transfer case, both of which are said to have been overhauled during the build.

This 1979 Mercedes-Benz 450SL was sold on BaT in December 2021 before it was acquired in 2024 by the selling dealer, who proceeded to overhaul the air conditioning system and replace the fan clutch and fuel accumulator. The car now shows 56k miles and is finished in English Red over Creme Beige leather upholstery. Power comes from a 4.5-liter V8 mated to a three-speed automatic transmission, and equipment includes a dark brown convertible soft top, a removable hardtop, 14″ Bundt alloy wheels, fog lights, a Pioneer CD stereo, power windows, and automatic climate control. This R107 is now offered with manufacturer’s literature and a clean Ohio title.

The car is finished in English Red (504) and features a color-matched removable hardtop and a dark brown convertible soft top. Additional exterior equipment includes fog lights, a power antenna, and chrome-accented bumpers, mirrors, and trim. A paint correction process is said to have been performed in preparation for the sale and paint meter readings can be viewed in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 14″ Bundt alloy wheels are mounted with 205/70 Hankook Kinergy ST tires. The car was factory-equipped with power steering and power-assisted four-wheel disc brakes. The brake fluid was flushed in preparation for the sale.

The bucket seats are upholstered in Creme Beige leather that extends to the center console and door panels, while woodgrain trim accents the cabin. A Pioneer CD head unit has been installed and other amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, central locking, and power-operated windows. The wood trim behind the shifter is cracked.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, an analog clock, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The six-digit mechanical odometer shows 56k miles, approximately 300 miles were added by the selling dealer.

The 4.5-liter M117 V8 features Bosch K-Jetronic fuel injection and was factory rated at 180 horsepower and 220 lb-ft of torque. The air conditioning system was overhauled by the selling dealer in June 2024 with a replacement compressor, dryer, and expansion valve and recharged with R134a refrigerant. Additional work included changing the oil and replacing the fan clutch along with the fuel filter and accumulator.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a three-speed automatic transmission.
Decoding the data plate reveals the following:

This 1970 Ford Mustang Mach 1 is powered by a 351ci Cleveland V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Candyapple Red over black leather. Equipment includes the Instrumentation Group, a Traction-Lok differential, a rear spoiler, power steering, 15″ Magnum 500-style wheels, an AM/FM radio, and air conditioning. The seller purchased the car in 2000 a 2023 refurbishment included repainting the bodywork, reupholstering the interior, overhauling the brakes and suspension, and rebuilding the engine, transmission, and rear end. This Mach 1 is now offered in California with a clean Utah title in the seller’s name.
The car has been refinished in Candyapple Red and features a front spoiler, a Mach 1 grille, Mach 1 graphics, dual side mirrors, a rear spoiler, rear window louvers, and dual exhaust outlets.

The 15″ Magnum 500-style wheels are mounted with 225/60 BFGoodrich Radial T/A tires. The seller notes that the car was fitted with power steering during the build and that the brakes and suspension were also overhauled.
The high-back bucket seats were reupholstered in black leather during the build. Interior appointments include an AM/FM radio, a floor-mounted center console, and air conditioning.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 120-mph speedometer and a fuel-level gauge. The car was optioned with auxiliary gauges for oil temperature and voltage. The five-digit odometer shows 76k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.
The 351ci Cleveland V8 was factory rated at 300 horsepower and was reportedly rebuilt in 2023.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a three-speed automatic transmission and a Traction-Lok differential. The seller notes that both were rebuilt in 2023.

This 2004 Porsche 911 Turbo cabriolet is finished in Speed Yellow over black leather upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six that drives all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. It is equipped with a limited-slip differential, a black soft top, 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, and yellow-finished brake calipers along with optional lowered and heated seats, a Sport shifter, a Bose sound system, and a stainless-steel exhaust system. The car was first delivered to Manhattan Motorcars of New York, New York, and was sold on BaT in August 2021 before it was acquired by the current owner on BaT in June 2023. This 996 Turbo cabriolet has 5k miles and is offered in California on dealer consignment with a wind deflector, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in Speed Yellow (12H) with a black convertible soft top. Additional features include xenon headlights, fog lights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and polished exhaust outlets as well as wider rear bodywork, rear air intakes, and revised bumper covers in comparison to the contemporary Carrera. XPEL paint protection film was applied to parts of the hood, front fenders, and mirror caps under previous ownership. Blemishes are evident on the leading edge of the front spoiler.

The 18″ Turbo Twist wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza S-02A tires measuring 225/40 up front and 295/30 at the rear. The car is equipped with Porsche Stability Management (PSM) and an automatic brake differential. Braking is from yellow-finished four-piston calipers over vented and cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. Brake and power steering fluid changes were performed in 2021.

The cabin houses optional 10mm-lowered, power-adjustable, and heated front seats trimmed in black leather with yellow stitching, and matching upholstery extends to the dashboard, center console, shifter boot, handbrake lever, and door panel inserts. Amenities include lumbar support for the driver, Speed Yellow seat belts, a Sport shifter, dual-zone automatic climate control, navigation, and a Bose sound system with a six-CD changer mounted in the front trunk. The climate control display is missing some pixels.

A three-spoke steering wheel with yellow stitching frames yellow instrumentation including an 8k-rpm tachometer, a 200-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 5k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.
The twin-turbocharged 3.6L Mezger flat-six had a factory rating of 415 horsepower and 415 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in 2022.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. The clutch was reportedly replaced under previous ownership. The car is equipped with an optional stainless-steel exhaust system.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2011 BMW M3 coupe was acquired from the initial owner by the current owner on BaT in April 2023 and now has 14k miles. It is powered by a 4.0-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over Silver Novillo extended leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Cold Weather, Premium, Technology, and Competition packages as well as 19″ Style 359 wheels, a limited-slip differential, adaptive xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front seats, iDrive infotainment, navigation, a Dinan exhaust system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. This E92 M3 is offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean Colorado title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic and features Shadowline trim and adaptive xenon headlights in addition to rain-sensing wipers, a carbon-fiber roof panel, a trunk lid spoiler, and quadruple exhaust outlets. The seller notes scuffs under the front valance.

The 19″ Style 359 wheels wear 245/35 front and 265/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4 S tires that were reportedly mounted in May 2024. Competition Package equipment includes a lowered ride height compared to the standard M3 as well as retuned Electronic Damping Control (EDC) and Dynamic Stability Control (DSC). Braking is handled by four-wheel vented and cross-drilled discs measuring 14.2″ and 13.8″ front and rear, respectively.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Silver Novillo extended leather, and Carbon Structure Leather trim accents the dashboard and doors. Interior amenities include iDrive with navigation, Comfort Access keyless entry, driver-seat position memory settings, a CD stereo, dual-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features tri-color stitching and frames an M-branded tachometer, a 200-mph speedometer, a central information display, and gauges for oil temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 14k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

The 4.0-liter S65 V8 features double-VANOS variable valve timing and was factory rated at 414 horsepower and 295 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a Variable M Differential Lock. A Dinan exhaust system has been fitted, and an oil change was performed in May 2024. The removed factory exhaust system is included in the sale.
Additional photos of the underside are presented in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Cold Weather, Premium, Technology, & Competition Packages

description: This 1951 MG TD is finished in burgundy over tan leather and is powered by a 1,250cc XPAG inline-four paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Features include a tan soft top, 15″ knock-off wire wheels, a louvered hood, chrome bumpers, driving lights, Brooklands-style windscreens, and fender-mounted side mirrors. The car was refurbished some time ago and acquired the current owner in 2017. This TD is now offered in Maryland on dealer consignment with a top boot, side curtains, and a clean West Virginia title.

The car has been repainted burgundy, and features include a tan folding soft top, a louvered hood, Lucas tripod headlights, Moss Motors driving lights, fender-mounted side mirrors, running boards, wind wings, a badge bar, a folding windshield, Brooklands-style windscreens, and chrome bumpers with overriders. Removable side curtains accompany the vehicle. Blemishes on the body can be seen in the gallery.
The 15″ knock-off wire wheels are mounted with Bridgestone SF-402 tires measuring 165/80. A spare wheel and tire are affixed to the rear. Braking is handled by drums at each corner.

The cabin was refurbished some time ago and houses a split bench seat trimmed in tan leather. Amenities include a passenger-side grab handle, map pockets, lap belts, and a dash-mounted rearview mirror.

The wood-rimmed Moto-Lita steering wheel is mounted on an adjustable column and frames Jaeger instrumentation consisting of a 100-mph speedometer and a tachometer with an inset clock as well as gauges for amperage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 3,500 miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The 1,250cc XPAG inline-four is equipped with dual SU carburetors and was factory rated at 54 horsepower.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.

This 1965 Chevrolet Impala SS was acquired by the seller’s late father in the early 2010s and was subsequently refurbished. Powered by a 396ci V8 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission, the car is finished in red over black vinyl upholstery. Equipment includes air conditioning, front bucket seats, a retro-style radio, dual antennas, dual exhaust, styled wheel covers, power brakes, power steering, electronic ignition, an aluminum radiator, and an electric cooling fan. This Impala is now offered by the seller on behalf of the late owner’s estate with a clean Arizona title in the name of the owner’s trust.

Finished from the factory in Regal Red (RR), the car was repainted during the aforementioned refurbishment, which reportedly involved removing the body from the frame. Features include chrome bumpers and trim, SS and Super Sport badging, six taillights, quad headlamps, dual side mirrors, dual antennas, and dual exhaust outlets. The seller notes that the paint is defective and exhibits areas of cracking.
Steel wheels wear styled SS covers and are mounted with American Classic whitewall tires. The car is equipped with power-assisted brakes and power steering.

The low-back front bucket seats and the rear bench are trimmed in black vinyl. Appointments include a center console, air conditioning, a retro-style radio, lap belts, dome lights, black carpeting, and rubber floor mats.

The two-spoke steering wheel has a partial horn ring and fronts a horizontal 120-mph speedometer flanked by a combination gauge and a readout for manifold vacuum. A Stewart-Warner gauge for water temperature is mounted beneath the dashboard to the left of the steering wheel, and a clock is located ahead of the shifter. The five-digit odometer shows less than 700 miles, and true mileage is unknown. The car has not been driven regularly since late 2021.

The 396ci V8 was reportedly rebuilt under prior ownership around 2010, and the air-cleaner cover has Turbo-Jet 325HP markings. Modifications include electronic ignition, an aluminum radiator, and an electric cooling fan.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 700R4 four-speed automatic transmission.

The chassis number is appropriate for a 1965 Chevrolet Impala SS two-door hardtop that was built in Southgate, California, and equipped with a V8 engine. Decoding the Fisher body tag shown above reveals the following production information:

This 2014 Morgan 3-Wheeler was acquired by the current owner in 2014 for display in the MOMO booth at the SEMA show in Las Vegas, Nevada. It is powered by a 1,979cc V-twin paired with a five-speed manual transmission and is finished in metallic blue with chrome vinyl livery over Orange leather. Equipment includes the Urban Cooling Kit, 19″ wire-spoke front wheels, dual side exhaust pipes, Brooklands-style windscreens, bright dual roll hoops, a MOMO steering wheel and shift knob, and VDO instrumentation. This 3-Wheeler is offered on dealer consignment with a blue Mohair tonneau cover, factory books and tools, and a clean Florida title.

The aluminum body was delivered from the factory in primer and was disassembled and initially painted for presentation in MOMO’s SEMA booth in chrome with a translucent blue topcoat and MOMO livery. The car has since been refinished in metallic blue with chrome-style vinyl MOMO livery. The #30 honors MOMO’s historic sponsorships of the Porsche 935 IMSA GTP and Ferrari 333SP LMP race cars. Equipment includes outboard-mounted headlights, a leather bonnet strap, Brooklands-style windscreens, dual mirrors, dual roll hoops and headrests, a Le Mans-style fuel filler cap, and a dual exhaust system with perforated black heat shields.

Black 19″ wire-spoke front wheels are mounted with Excelsior Comp H tires, while a single 15″ wheel with a Yokohama Avid tire is positioned under the rear bodywork. Stopping power is provided by disc brakes up front and a drum out back.

The two-person cockpit features seating trimmed in diamond-stitched Orange leather joined by matching armrests. Appointments include a MOMO shift knob, three-point seatbelts, storage pockets, aircraft-style toggle switches, and a power outlet under the dashboard.
The leather-wrapped MOMO Prototipo steering wheel is mounted on a quick-release hub and fronts a VDO 130-mph speedometer and a 7k-rpm tachometer. The digital odometer indicates 1,600 miles.

The fuel-injected 1,979cc S&S Cycle X-Wedge V-twin is equipped with an Urban Cooling Kit and chrome covers. Power to the rear wheel through a Centa drive, a five-speed manual transmission, a driveshaft, a bevel box, and a final-drive belt.
A blue Mohair tonneau cover, a leather-bound build book, a mallet, and a can of fix-a-flat accompany the car.

This 1973 MG Midget is powered by a 1,275cc inline-four paired with a four-speed manual transmission and is finished in Harvest Gold over Navy vinyl. Features include a black soft top, front disc brakes, 13″ Rostyle wheels, dual side mirrors, and a cabin heater. The seller purchased the car in 2020 recent work consisted of machining the cylinder head, replacing the head gasket, and overhauling the cooling system and the clutch and brake hydraulics. This Midget is offered at no reserve with a driver’s handbook, a workshop manual, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The car was refinished in Harvest Gold circa 2012 and features a replacement black soft top, dual side mirrors, and chrome bumpers. The reverse lights do not work, a snap on the top is ripped, and rust is visible on the hood, wheel arches, and rocker panels.
The 13″ Rostyle wheels are mounted with Kumho Power Star 758 tires with cracks in the sidewalls. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums.

The bucket seats are trimmed in Navy vinyl that extends to the door panels. Black carpets line the floors and appointments include a cabin heater, a wood shift knob, and crank windows. The aftermarket CD head unit is missing a face plate.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames Smiths instrumentation consisting of a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 63k miles.

The 1,275cc inline-four features dual SU carburetors. Work under current ownership included machining the cylinder head and replacing the head gasket, radiator, heater core, thermostat, and coolant expansion tank. The seller states that the starter is weak and requires replacement.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission. The clutch master cylinder was replaced under current ownership. Corrosion is visible on various underside components.

This 1968 Ford F-250 was purchased by the current owner in August 2018, and work under current ownership included installing the replacement 352ci V8 and repainting the exterior orange and white. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission, and additional equipment includes 16.5″ white-finished wheels, a receiver hitch, a spray-on bedliner, and an aftermarket stereo. This bumpside F-250 is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean California title in the owner’s name.
The truck was repainted orange and white in 2021 and features black-finished bumpers, a spray-on bedliner, and a receiver hitch.

The 16.5″ white-finished wheels are mounted with Uniroyal Laredo tires. Stopping power is provided by power-assisted discs at the front and drums at the rear. The truck is said to be fitted with the suspension from a 1974 F-Series.
The bench seat is trimmed in tan vinyl. Appointments include a skull-style shift knob, an aftermarket stereo, and a heater.

The three-spoke steering wheel wears an aftermarket wrap and frames a horizontal-sweep 100-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 31k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.
The replacement 352ci V8 was reportedly installed in 2021.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.

This 1971 Jaguar XKE Series III roadster is finished in red over black leather and powered by a 5.3-Liter V12 paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a black soft top, knock-off wire wheels, an AM/FM radio, and quadruple carburetors. The car remained registered to its prior owner from 1972 until 2024. This XKE is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner, a licensed retail dealer in Washington, with manufacturer’s literature and a clean Washington title.

The car is finished in red and was repainted some time ago and fitted with a replacement black convertible top. Features include a black top boot, uncovered headlights, a louvered hood, US-spec bumpers, and quadruple exhaust outlets.

The 15″ wire-spoke wheels are secured with knock-off spinners and are mounted with older 215/70 Dunlop Elite Seventy whitewall tires. The Series III E-Type was factory equipped with power steering, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with inboard-mounted rear rotors. The seller notes the shocks should be replaced.
The bucket seats are upholstered in black leather, and the cabin features color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include an AM/FM radio, a locking glovebox, and a heater.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames Smiths instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline. An analog clock along with auxiliary gauges for voltage, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level are mounted in the center stack. The five-digit odometer shows 37k miles.
