The 5.3-liter V12 was factory equipped with quadruple Zenith-Stromberg carburetors and was rated at 241 horsepower and 285 lb-ft of torque when new. The spark plugs and distributor cap and rotor were replaced within the last few months. The seller notes rust around the battery.
Power is delivered to rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.
Manufacturer’s literature and an original purchase agreement are included in the sale.

This 1996 BMW 318ti is a right-hand-drive example that was imported from Japan to the US in 2023, and it was ordered in Individual Daytona Violet Metallic over black cloth upholstery with patterned M-Tech inserts. Indicating 45k kilometers (~28k miles), the car is powered by a 1.9-liter inline-four paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and equipment includes 17″ Style 42 wheels, Sachs lowering springs, a cloth sunroof, a cassette stereo, a trunk-mounted CD changer, power windows, and air conditioning. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this E36/5 is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a Pennsylvania title.

The car is finished in Individual Daytona Violet Metallic (283) and features a “California” power-retractable cloth sunroof, black trim, fog lights, pop-out rear quarter windows, and a rear window wiper. The selling dealer notes a leak in the cloth sunroof, and close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 17″ multi-piece Style 42 wheels are mounted with a mixed set of Achilles ATR Sport and Falken tires. Sachs dampers and lowering springs have been added, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs.

The front seats and rear bench are upholstered in black cloth with patterned M-Tech inserts, and matching trim accents the door panels. Interior appointments include power windows, a cassette stereo, a trunk-mounted CD changer, and air conditioning. There is a hole in the rear bench and the selling dealer states that the headliner was replaced in 2024.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 250-km/h speedometer and a 7k-rpm tachometer as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 45k kilometers (~28k miles), approximately 200 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 1.9-liter M44B19 inline-four was factory-rated at 138 horsepower and 133 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage from its first entry in December 2023.
The Pennsylvania title carries an “Out Of Country” brand and is listed as a duplicate.

This 1968 Ford Mustang was acquired by its current owner in 2005 as a shell, and it was subsequently built over the next 11 years. A Gone in 60 Seconds-style body kit was fitted along with fender flares before the car was repainted Pepper Grey Metallic with black stripes, the 351ci V8 Dart block was bored and stroked to displace 427ci and equipped with fuel injection and a nitrous oxide system, and a Tremec five-speed manual transmission was installed. The car also has Chris Alston suspension components, QA1 coilovers, rack-and-pinion steering, custom-made 17″ Halibrand-style wheels, SSBC brakes, a side-exit exhaust system, a custom sound system with a back-up camera, and seats sourced from a 2008 GT500. This modified Mustang convertible is now offered on dealer consignment with a clean Oregon title.

The car was acquired as a rolling chassis, and it was modified in the style of the Mustang used in Gone in 60 Seconds. A Maier Racing Enterprises E-body kit was installed in 2006 along with flared steel fenders and custom rockers with side-exit exhaust outlets, and approximately $79k worth of bodywork and painting were performed in 2012. The Pepper Grey Metallic paintwork is complemented by black stripes and a black soft top, and the hood has a scoop and is mounted on billet hinges and secured by pins.

Custom-made Halibrand-style 17″ wheels are mounted with 245/45 front and 315/35 rear Kumho Ecsta XS tires. The rear fenders have been tubbed. SSBC four-wheel disc brakes have been installed along with rack-and-pinion steering and Chris Alston suspension components with QA1 coilover shocks.

The front seats were sourced from a 2008 GT500, and the rear seats were reupholstered to match. Dynamat insulation has been installed under the carpeting, and a push-button starter and hard-wired radar detector have been installed. The Kenwood stereo is linked to a custom sound system with Focal speakers and JL Audio subwoofers, and it has a back-up camera system mounted in the fuel filler cap.
The center console is accented by a Shelby-logo armrest, and controls for the lights, windows, locks, top, and nitrous oxide system are mounted behind the shifter.
The shifter is topped by a “Go Baby Go”-logo shift knob. The Holley Sniper control screen and auxiliary gauges can been seen behind the shifter in the image above.

The wood-rimmed Moto-Lita steering wheel is mounted on a tilting column. The five-digit odometer shows 10k miles, which is said to represent the mileage on the build. The AutoMeter speedometer and fuel gauge were repaired in April 2024.
The nitrous oxide bottle is mounted in the trunk along with the aluminum fuel filler and Optima battery.

The 351ci V8 has a Dart Iron Eagle block that was bored to displace 427ci, and the car also has Air Flow Research aluminum heads, a SCAT crankshaft, Mahle pistons, and a Competition Cams camshaft. It is topped by the Holly Sniper fuel injection system that was installed in 2024. The tubular headers are linked to a JBA exhaust system, and the aluminum radiator has dual electric cooling fans.
Power is sent to 9″ rear end with 31-spline axles through a five-speed Tremec TKO 600 manual transmission.
Build records and a summary are included in the sale.
Images showing various stages of the build are presented in the gallery below.

This 2012 Jeep Wrangler Rubicon rides on 17″ AEV wheels and a lifted suspension with Bilstein shocks, and it is equipped with LoD bumpers, a Warn winch with built-in air compressor, a bull bar, a high-lift jack, MetalCloak fenders, and rear jerrycan holders. It is finished in Flame Red over black cloth and is powered by a 3.6-liter V6 mated to a five-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Further equipment includes Tru-Lok front and rear differentials, a removable hardtop, a receiver hitch, LED lighting, removable doors, rock rails, heated front bucket seats, cruise control, and air conditioning. The truck has 23k miles and was registered in Texas before being acquired by the selling dealer in 2023. This JK Wrangler is offered by the selling dealer in Florida with the owner’s manual, a CB radio, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The truck is finished in Flame Red and features a black three-piece removable hardtop. The truck is fitted with LoD bumpers, and a Warn winch with built-in air compressor and bull bar are mounted up front, while a heavy-duty swing-away carrier with jerrycan carriers is equipped at the rear. Further equipment includes a high-lift jack, a receiver hitch, aftermarket fenders, rock rails, and LED lighting.

The truck rides on a long-arm lift kit with Bilstein shocks along with a Rock Krawler steering system. Gray AEV 17″ wheels are mounted with 315/70 BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2 tires, and a matching spare is located at the rear. Imperfections on the wheels are displayed in the gallery. Braking is handled by discs at each corner.

The heated front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in black cloth. Amenities include cruise control, power windows, and air conditioning along with a Cobra CB radio, auxiliary switchgear, a fire extinguisher, and a factory CD stereo with an Infinity subwoofer.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel houses controls for the cruise, voice, and audio systems, and it frames a 100-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,400-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 24k miles.
The 3.6-liter Pentastar V6 is equipped with an aFe Power air intake with a conical filter.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck came equipped from the factory with Tru-Lok locking front and rear differentials.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1997 BMW 840Ci is powered by a 4.4-liter V8 linked to a five-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over Silver Gray Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes 18″ Style 37 M Parallel wheels, a power-operated sunroof, fog lights, dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, heated power-adjustable front seats, a cassette stereo, and a trunk-mounted CD changer. The car was first registered in Florida and relocated to California where it was purchased by the current owner in 2023, and it now has 141k miles. Work performed in preparation for the sale included replacing the control arms, sway bar links, drive belts, and spark plugs. This E31 is offered on dealer consignment with a clean California title.

The pillarless coupe’s exterior is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic (309) and features pop-up headlights, fog lights, a power-operated sunroof, and black bodyside trim. A February 1999 entry on the Carfax report lists damage after an accident or other incident. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Staggered-width 18″ Style 37 M Parallel wheels have curb marks and are mounted with Michelin tires. The car is equipped with Automatic Stability Control (ASC), and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. The control arms and sway bar links were replaced in 2024.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats trimmed in Silver Gray Nappa leather along with matching door panels and carpets. Equipment includes an onboard computer, dual-zone automatic climate control, a cassette stereo, a trunk-mounted CD changer, and a power-adjustable steering column. The air conditioning system was recharged in preparation for the sale.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 190-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 141k miles, approximately 400 of which were added under current ownership.

The 4.4-liter M62B44 V8 was factory-rated at 282 horsepower and 310 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission. The selling dealer states that the oil was changed and the drive belts, air filter, and spark plugs were replaced in 2024.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned February 1999 damage.

This 2008 Jaguar XKR convertible is finished in Liquid Silver over Charcoal leather and features the Luxury, Premium Sound, and Advanced Technology packages as well as an active differential, a power-operated black soft top, bi-xenon headlights, 20″ Senta wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, an Alpine sound system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. The car has spent time in Virginia and Indiana and now has 10k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this XKR convertible is now offered in Pennsylvania with a photocopy of the window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Indiana title.

XKR-specific styling cues include hood vents, mesh front grilles, and revised front and rear spoilers. This example is finished in Liquid Silver, and exterior equipment includes a power-operated black soft top, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, and polished quadruple exhaust outlets.

The 20″ Senta alloy wheels are mounted with Dunlop SP Sport Maxx tires measuring 255/35 up front and 285/30 out back. The car is equipped with an enhanced Computer Active Technology Suspension (eCATS) with adaptive damping. Stopping power is provided by an optional Alcon braking system featuring red-finished six-piston front calipers as well as four-wheel slotted rotors.

The heated power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Charcoal leather complemented by burl walnut wood trim. Interior amenities include an Alpine sound system, navigation, push-button ignition, cruise control, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The heated three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with paddle shifters and frames a 180-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as a central digital display. The digital odometer indicates 10k miles.
The supercharged and intercooled 4.2-liter AJ V8 features variable valve timing and was rated at 420 horsepower and 413 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed automatic transmission and an active differential.
A photocopy of the window sticker notes initial delivery to Checkered Flag Jaguar in Virginia Beach and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $107,525.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1993 Mazda ɛ̃fini RX-7 Type R is a right-hand-drive example that was imported to the US under prior ownership before being acquired by the seller in 2021. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 1.3-liter Wankel rotary engine mated to a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in silver over black upholstery. Equipment includes 17″ Enkei alloy wheels, aftermarket coilover suspension, a front lip spoiler, an R1-style rear wing, and a Sony head unit linked to a trunk-mounted subwoofer as well as a Mishimoto aluminum radiator and an aftermarket exhaust system. Work performed in 2022 involved fluid changes in addition to replacing the coilovers, door latches, and spark plugs. This FD RX-7 has 84k kilometers (52k miles) and is offered with receipts for work performed under current ownership and an Oregon title in the seller’s name that lists the car as a 1995 model year.

The FD generation of the RX-7 was first sold under the ɛ̃fini brand in Japan, with the Type R marketed as its lightweight, sport version. This example was finished from the factory in Silver Stone Metallic (4G) and was repainted under prior ownership. Features include pop-up headlights, fog lights, a front spoiler, front fender vents, an R1-style rear wing, and ɛ̃fini badging. Paint imperfections on the front bumper cover and spoiler are noted.

Silver-finished 17″ Enkei alloy wheels are mounted with 255/40 front and 275/40 rear Falken Azenis RT615K+ tires. The suspension is said to have been fitted with Tein coilovers in January 2022, and braking is provided by four-wheel rotors with Mazda-branded calipers up front.

The 2+2 cabin features front bucket seats upholstered in black cloth, while bolstered rear seats are trimmed in black vinyl. A Sony head unit linked to a trunk-mounted Kicker subwoofer has been retrofitted, and additional appointments include aluminum pedals, woven floor mats, and power windows and door locks. The door latches were replaced in July 2022. The seller notes the air conditioning system does not work, the center console armrest is missing, the driver’s door storage box lid is cracked, and the front seat upholstery is worn.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central tachometer, a 180-km/h speedometer, and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. An aftermarket Blitz boost pressure gauge is affixed to the steering column. The digital odometer indicates 84k kilometers (~52k miles), approximately 1k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 1.3-liter 13B Wankel rotary features sequential twin-turbochargers. The fuel filter and spark plugs were replaced in January 2022, and a Mishimoto aluminum radiator is said to have been installed in April 2022. Compression test results can be viewed in the gallery below, and the plastic engine tray is missing.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential. The catalytic converters have been removed and an aftermarket exhaust system has been fitted. The transmission and rear differential fluids were changed in January 2022.

This 2007 Mercedes-Benz S600 is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V12, and it has 59k miles. The car was ordered with the Designo Espresso Edition package that featured Mocha Black Metallic paint, Armagnac Brown Nappa leather, and Natural Maple wood trim. It also has hydropneumatic suspension, adaptive cruise control, a rearview camera, a Harman/Kardon surround sound system, and power-adjustable heated and ventilated front and rear seats. This W221 S600 is now offered by the selling dealer with owner’s manuals and a clean New Jersey title.

Equipment includes soft-close doors, a power-operated trunk lid, dual exhaust outlets, auto-dimming mirrors, and bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination. Unspecified damage is listed in an August 2023 entry on the Carfax report.

Polished 18″ five-spoke wheels are mounted with 255/45 front and 275/45 rear Michelin Primacy HP tires. The car has Active Body Control continuously variable damping, and four-piston brake calipers are fitted over 360mm rotors up front.

The heated and ventilated Drive-Dynamic massaging front seats are trimmed in Designo Armagnac Brown Nappa leather, and Natural Maple wood trim accents the cabin, which has a panoramic roof, an Alcantara headliner, four-zone climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, COMAND infotainment with DVD navigation, and power-adjustable heated and ventilated rear seats.

The heated steering wheel is mounted on a power-adjustable column, and the driver is aided by Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, Night View Assist, Keyless Go, Park Assist, and a rearview camera. The odometer indicates 59k miles.
Factory rated at 510 horsepower and 612 lb-ft of torque, the twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter M275 V12 sends power to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage entry.

This 1954 Oldsmobile Super 88 Holiday two-door hardtop was purchased new in Florida and remained with the family of its original owner until it was sold from California to Washington in 2011. The vehicle was subsequently returned to California and modified for competition in the 2014 running of the Mille Miglia Storica in Italy, after which it was offered as a BaT Exclusive in July 2014 and relocated to Virginia. The FantomWorks television show on the Velocity Channel featured the car in a 2015 episode that focused on preparing it for additional racing events, and the vehicle returned to the Mille Miglia field in both 2018 and 2019 and also has competed in two Colorado Grand tours. Powered by a 324ci Rocket V8 paired with a three-speed Turbo Hydramatic automatic transmission, the car is finished in turquoise and white over a blue and white interior. The suspension, braking, and cooling systems have been updated for competition use, and other equipment includes a transmission cooler, an electric fuel pump, power steering, power brakes, wheel covers, lap belts, and aftermarket air conditioning. The selling dealer acquired the car in June 2024. This modified Super 88 is now offered with historical photos of a 1954 Oldsmobile that raced at the contemporaneous Mille Miglia as well as a FIVA identification card, correspondence from previous owners, service records, manufacturer’s literature, a collection of spare parts, a car cover, and a Pennsylvania title.

Finished from the factory in Capri Blue with a Polar White roof (40-60), the vehicle is said to have been repainted decades ago while under the care of the original owner’s family. Decals from races in which the car has been campaigned adorn multiple body panels. The bumpers have been rechromed, and additional paintwork has been performed on the lower areas of the right-front fender, according to the seller, who also notes that some of the chrome is pitted.

White-painted 15″ steel wheels wear styled covers and are wrapped in 205/65 Michelin Premier A/S tires. The suspension reportedly has been updated with larger sway bars as well as stiffer springs and firmer bushings. The steering is power assisted, as are the four-wheel drum brakes.

The cabin features split-front and rear bench seats upholstered in white vinyl with patterned blue cloth inserts. Aftermarket air conditioning has been installed along with added switchgear for the electric fuel pump and an auxiliary cooling fan. Other appointments include blue carpeting, white and blue door panels, front and rear lap belts, a Deluxe AM radio, and dome lights.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a full horn ring and fronts a 120-mph speedometer with subdials for amperage, coolant temperature, fuel level, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer shows 12k miles, approximately 50 of which were added by the selling dealer; true mileage is unknown.
The 324ci Rocket V8 features a “bat wing” air cleaner placed above a Rochester four-barrel carburetor. An electric fuel pump has been added, and the oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed Turbo Hydramatic automatic transmission that has been modified with an oil cooler and a TCI Automotive pan.

The Identity Card issued by the Fédération Internationale des Véhicules Anciens (FIVA) is shown above. The included service records, manufacturer’s literature, and spare parts are pictured in the gallery below.
Historical photos of a different 1954 Oldsmobile that raced at the Mille Miglia in the 1950s will accompany the vehicle.
The Pennsylvania title carries a Classic brand and lists the body type as sedan.
listing_details: White Vinyl & Patterned Blue Cloth Upholstery

description: This 2019 Aston Martin Vantage coupe has remained registered in Florida from new and was acquired by the seller in 2022. It is finished in Scorpus Red over black leather and has been fitted with 21″ Vossen EVO-2R wheels and Velocity Automotive Performance lowering springs. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 linked with an eight-speed automatic transaxle and an electronic rear differential. Other features include Skyhook adaptive damping, LED lighting, keyless entry, and a 360-degree camera system. This Vantage has 10k miles and is offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Scorpus Red (P6021ABC) and features gloss-black accents added as a part of the Exterior Black Collection. Additional exterior details include an aluminum hood, LED headlights and taillights, fender vents, and quad exhaust tips. Paint protection film is said to have been applied to the front valance.

Ten-spoke 21″ Vossen EVO-2R wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 305/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. The car has three selectable Skyhook adaptive damping modes, and stopping power is provided by Aston-Martin branded multi-piston calipers over slotted rotors.

The cabin is upholstered in Obsidian Black leather with contrasting red stitching complemented by an Alcantara headliner and gloss-black accents. Additional appointments include power-adjustable seats, a 360-degree camera system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and an infotainment system with an 8″ display and Bluetooth connectivity. The leather on the dash is loose.

The multifunction steering wheel is equipped with paddle shifters and frames a 12″ color LCD instrument cluster with a central tachometer, a speedometer, and a pair of configurable displays. The odometer indicates 10k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership. The vehicle speed sensor was replaced in 2022 according to the Carfax report.

The twin-turbocharged Mercedes-AMG M177 4.0-liter V8 was factory rated at 503 horsepower and 505 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a carbon-fiber propeller shaft, an eight-speed automatic gearbox, and an electronic rear differential with Dynamic Torque Vectoring.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
There is currently a lien on the vehicle, and the owner’s lender will need to be paid off before the title is transferred to the next owner.

This 2005 Ford GT is one of 2,022 built for the model year, and its 5.4-liter V8 was modified with a Whipple supercharged during prior ownership. Now said to produce 720 horsepower at the wheels, the car has also been fitted with double-staggered CCW forged wheels, AP Racing brakes, AFCO Racing coilover suspension with remote-reservoir shocks, and a Borla exhaust system. Finished in Mark II Black over Ebony leather, it is also equipped with HID headlights, a front splitter, a rear diffuser, a McIntosh stereo, and air conditioning. This Ford GT has 5k miles and is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean New Jersey title.

The Camilo Pardo-designed GT was styled as an homage to the Le Mans-winning GT40 racing cars of the 1960s and features aluminum body panels over an extruded-aluminum space frame and roll-bonded floors. This example is one of 238 finished in Mark II Black for the model year, and it is not equipped with racing stripes. Features include side tape stripes, Ford GT graphics, HID headlights, fog lights, side air intakes, a vented hood, a front splitter, a rear diffuser, and a dual center-exit Borla exhaust system.

Forged CCW monoblock wheels measure 19″ up front and 20″ out back, and theyare wrapped in 245/35 and 315/35 Continental ExtremeContact tires, respectively. AP Racing calipers, two-piece rotors, and AFCO Racing coilover suspension with remote-reservoir shocks have been installed.

The cockpit is trimmed in Ebony leather, with manually adjusted seats designed by Sparco that feature carbon-fiber shells with GT40-style ventilation grommets and harness slots. The console on the center tunnel houses rotary climate controls, and amenities include air conditioning, remote keyless entry, and push-button ignition. The car also has a McIntosh stereo.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is affixed to a tilting and telescoping column ahead of the GT40-inspired instrument array consisting of a central tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline and an offset 220-mph speedometer. Toggle-switch controls are positioned under additional gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, boost, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 5,600 miles, approximately 40 of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted 5.4-liter DOHC V8 has been modified with a Whipple supercharger, an Accufab Racing throttle body, and Ford Racing-logo valve covers. The selling dealer states that the car now generates 720 horsepower at the wheels. An oil change was performed in April 2024.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

This 1987 Buick GNX is #450 of 547 produced for a single model year, and it now shows 26 miles. The car spent time in long-term storage during prior ownership and since the current owner’s 2013 acquisition. The car is powered by a turbocharged 3.8-liter V6 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and is finished in black over two-tone black and Sand Gray upholstery. Details include a limited-slip differential, 16″ cross-lace wheels, composite wheel arch flares, fender vents, a rear spoiler, air conditioning, and cruise control. This GNX is now offered on dealer consignment with a clean California title.

The Grand National Experimental was created in partnership with McLaren Performance Technologies/ASC to celebrate the end of the vehicle’s production run, and all 547 examples were finished in black. Cosmetic details specific to the GNX include heat-extracting fender vents, composite wheel arch flares, a three-piece rear spoiler, and GNX badging. Additional exterior details include a rear window defogger, sport mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in July 2024 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner’s participation on BaT has been restricted and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.

The GNX features front suspension components from the contemporary Grand National, and upgraded rear components include a Panhard rod, torque arm, and an additional frame crossmember. Braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.
Black-finished factory 16″ cross-lace wheels wear GNX-branded center caps along Goodyear Eagle VR50 tires.

The front bucket seats and rear bench are upholstered in black and Sand Gray cloth, and Turbo 6 embroidery adorns the front seat headrests. Amenities include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, air conditioning, cruise control, power windows, and a Delco cassette stereo with a graphic equalizer.
A plaque mounted to the passenger side of the dashboard identifies this as GNX #450.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts GNX-specific Stewart-Warner instrumentation consisting of a 160-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for boost, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 26 miles, a few of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.8-liter V6 was modified by ASC/McLaren with a Garrett T3 turbocharger under a heat shield with GNX lettering along with a larger air-to-air intercooler and a low-restriction exhaust system. Factory-rated output was 276 horsepower and 360 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 200R4 four-speed automatic transmission with a factory-upgraded oil cooler, and the limited-slip differential features a GNX-branded aluminum cover.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage from the first entry in 2001 through the final entry in 2021.

This 1952 Mercedes-Benz 300 S is one of 203 examples built with Cabriolet A coachwork during three years of production and was invoiced to its first owner in Coahuila, Mexico, on December 5, 1952. Beginning in 1961, the car passed through a series of Mexico City owners, including a 16-year span under the stewardship of architect Francisco Artigas during which it was returned to Mercedes-Benz in Germany in 1969 for a mechanical refurbishment and also received a color change to black over tan leather. It was purchased in 2007 for its current owner’s museum collection in Mexico City and subsequently underwent a multiyear refurbishment that was completed in 2017 before the car was imported to the US in 2024. Power is provided by a 3.0-liter M188 inline-six that breathes through triple Solex carburetors and is paired with a column-shifted four-speed manual transmission. Additional features include four-wheel independent suspension, finned hydraulic drum brakes, a black convertible top, and a Becker Grand Prix radio. The W188 is now offered on dealer consignment in San Diego, California, with a copy of its original sales invoice, factory data cards, ownership documentation dating back to new, a 2008 inspection report, refurbishment photos, a brochure, an owner’s manual, a matching luggage set, and a clean Montana title.

The 300 S was introduced at the Paris Motor Show in October 1951 as a hand-built sporting version of the four-door 300 series and rode on a wheelbase 150mm shorter than the sedan variant. It entered production the following summer in three configurations including a coupe, a roadster, and a cabriolet, the latter of which was distinguished from the roadster by a more substantial convertible top flanked by landau bars. The 300 S models were succeeded in 1955 by the fuel-injected 300 Sc range.

Originally finished in green, this example’s bodywork received a color change to black circa the 1970s and was again repainted in black after being stripped to bare metal during the refurbishment performed under current ownership. Various stone chips are noted in the finish. Features include front and rear bumper guards, front fog lights, a driver-side mirror, a fender-mounted antenna, and a black convertible top with bright landau bars.

Chrome 15” wheels wear covers with body-color accents and are mounted with 215/75 BFGoodrich Silvertown whitewall tires, while dual trunk-mounted spares wear Firestone whitewall rubber. Braking is handled by finned drums all around, and the brake system is said to have been rebuilt in preparation for the sale.

The cabin is trimmed in tan leather over the reclinable front seats, fold-down rear bench seat, door panels, and side panels. Features include color-keyed carpeting, wood dash and door-cap accents, roll-up windows, a lockable glovebox, a rectangular VDO clock, and a Becker Grand Prix radio. Imperfections are noted in areas of the wood finish.

The black two-spoke steering wheel hosts a bright horn ring and sits ahead of VDO instrumentation including a 200-km/h speedometer and gauges monitoring oil pressure, coolant temperature, fuel level, and amperage. The five-digit odometer shows 10k kilometers (~6k miles), approximately 44 of which have been added since the car’s arrival in the US.

The 3.0-liter SOHC M188 inline-six features an aluminum cylinder head that mates to the block at a 30° diagonal to allow increased valve sizes, with induction handled by triple Solex carburetors. Output was factory rated at 150 horsepower. The engine is said to have been overhauled during the refurbishment performed under current ownership, while an oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.

Engine number 18892000059/52 is stamped on the block as well as on a tag affixed to the engine, which also carries a “tauschaggregat,” or exchange unit, tag. The transmission and rear end are also said to be marked as factory-repaired or -replaced units.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transmission with synchromesh on all forward gears. The four-wheel independent suspension features coil springs and telescopic shock absorbers at each corner.

Copies of two versions of the factory data cards accompany the car, including the above document that describes the car as a Sonderschau Mexiko, or Mexican Special Exhibition car. A sales invoice dated December 5, 1952, is viewable in the photo gallery below and lists the original colors, options, and component numbers as well as delivery to its original owner in Mexico. Invoices from Mercedes-Benz from 1970 for DM 2,306.22 and $6,038 can be viewed in the gallery along with various ownership documents from throughout the car’s life.

This 1977 Lamborghini Countach LP400 is one of approximately 150 Periscopio examples manufactured during the first four years of the Countach model’s production. Chassis 1120262 left the factory in right-hand-drive configuration and was purchased new by best-selling British pop musician Sir Rod Stewart while on tour in Australia. The car later moved with Stewart to Los Angeles, where it was modified with a wide-body kit and a targa-style roof panel before being relocated to the UK and remaining in Stewart’s private collection until 2002. It was converted to left-hand drive under the stewardship of its second owner before being purchased in 2013 by an owner who commissioned a refurbishment returning its bodywork to factory configuration while retaining the left-hand-drive configuration. Further refurbishment work reportedly carried out in 2022 by Lamborghini Polo Storico is said to have included servicing of the powertrain, brakes, and steering system as well as a return of the interior to LP400 specifications before the car was purchased by the selling dealer in 2023. Finished in Rosso over Tobacco leather, the car is powered by a 3.9-liter quad-cam V12 that is equipped with six Weber carburetors and twin-distributor ignition. Additional features include a five-speed manual transmission, a limited-slip differential, four-wheel coil-sprung independent suspension, four-wheel ventilated disc brakes, Campagnolo 14” alloy wheels, Stewart-Warner gauges, and air conditioning. This LP400 Periscopio is now offered by the selling dealer in Los Angeles with a binder of registration documents and service records dating back to 1990, invoices from the work performed in 2022 and 2024, and a clean Montana title.

Using the project code LP112, Lamborghini began the development of a successor to the Miura in 1970 before unveiling a prototype bearing the Countach name at the 1971 Geneva Motor Show. The Countach platform underwent three years of refinement before entering production as the LP400 with aluminum bodywork styled by Bertone’s Marcello Gandini wrapped over a steel spaceframe built by Marchesi. Design elements include a wedge-shaped profile with trapezoidal panel lines, pop-up headlights, air boxes protruding from the sail panels, NACA ducts on each flank, scissor doors, and a periscope-style angular roof depression carried over from the prototype.

This example’s bodywork was reportedly modified in the 1980s by Costa Mesa-based Albert Madikian Engineering with front and rear spoilers, wheel arches, and removal of the roof to create a targa configuration. A refurbishment initiated in Europe in 2013 included the installation of a replacement factory-look periscope roof panel and removal of the body extensions as well as a repaint in the original shade of Rosso. The door seals, trunk seal, and engine compartment seal were replaced during a service completed in June 2024. Closeups of the finish, trim, and lenses are shown in the photo gallery below. The seller notes that the photos were taken prior to the replacement of the seals.

Replacement Campagnolo five-bolt alloy wheels are said to have been sourced from France and are wrapped in Michelin XWX tires measuring 205/70VR14 up front and 215/70VR14 at the rear. Dual-circuit Girling ventilated disc brakes are said to have been refreshed during the 2022 refurbishment.

The cabin was re-trimmed in 2022 and features Tobacco leather over the fixed-back bucket seats, console, sills, and rear bulkhead with color-matched upholstery over the door panels. Additional features include beige carpeting, brown brushed suede over the dash and boxed instrument binnacle, a gated shifter, black shoulder belts, a passenger-side footrest, a lockable glovebox, roll-up side-window vents, and air conditioning.

The three-spoke steering wheel is wrapped in black leather and sits ahead of an aluminum bezel hosting Stewart-Warner instrumentation including a 320-km/h speedometer, a 9k-rpm tachometer, and gauges monitoring voltage, amperage, oil pressure, coolant temperature, fuel level, and oil temperature. The vertically aligned five-digit odometer shows 562 kilometers (~350 miles), and true mileage is unknown.

The mid-mounted 3,929cc V12 features an aluminum block with a 60° angle between cylinder banks, dual-overhead camshafts, six sidedraft Weber 45 DCOE carburetors, twin Marelli distributors, and twin coils. Factory-rated output was 370 horsepower at 8k rpm and 269 lb-ft of torque at 5k rpm. The engine was reportedly overhauled in the 2000s, while further mechanical and electrical freshening is said to have been performed in 2022. Service completed in June 2024 by Fast Cars of Redondo Beach, California, included fluid changes, replacement of the spark plugs, installation of stainless-steel fuel pickup screens, and the installation of a replacement ANSA muffler. Invoices from the work totaling close to $30k can be viewed in the gallery.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transmission located in the middle of the car along with a limited-slip differential mounted behind the engine. Suspension comprises double wishbones up front, reverse lower wishbones and parallel trailing links at the rear, and anti-roll bars at each end. Coilover shock absorbers are utilized all around, with dual units at each rear wheel.

This 1997 Ferrari F355 Spider is finished in black over beige leather and is powered by a 3.5-liter DOHC V8 linked with a gated six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a black soft top, 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels, pop-up headlights, and a Kenwood stereo hooked to a modified sound system. The car has been owned in Pennsylvania since 2002 and now shows 36k miles. Acquired by the selling dealer in August 2022, this F355 Spider is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a car cover, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title

The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Nero, and styling elements include a power-operated black convertible top as well as pop-up headlights, integrated front fog lights, an integrated rear decklid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, a vented engine cover, and air intakes on the doors and rocker panels. Work in 2022 included replacing the convertible top microswitch, main switch, and elastic strips.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in June 2024 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner’s participation on BaT has been restricted and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.
The 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels are mounted with Continental tires with date codes from 2011-2012. Ferrari-branded brake calipers are mounted over ventilated discs at each corner.

The sport seats are trimmed in beige leather that extends to the center console, door panel inserts, and lower half of the dashboard. Amenities include a gated shifter, automatic climate control, drilled aluminum pedals, a front trunk-mounted Sony CD changer, and a Bluetooth-capable Kenwood CD stereo hooked to a custom sound system. The passenger-side dashboard upholstery is warped.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer, a 10k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure and coolant temperature. Ancillary instruments in the center stack include an analog clock and gauges for fuel level and oil temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 36k miles, approximately 500 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The mid-mounted 3.5-liter DOHC V8 features five valves per cylinder and dry-sump lubrication for a factory-rated output of 375 horsepower and 268 lb-ft of torque. An engine-out belt service was last completed in May 2021, and the alternator belt, spark plug wires, and belt tensioners were also replaced at that time.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Records indicate that the clutch components were replaced in October 2020 at 36k miles.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1982 Toyota Land Cruiser FJ40 is said to spent time in Saudi Arabia before being imported to the US from the United Arab Emirates in 2012. It was later refurbished as part of a project completed by Mideast Classics of Topeka, Kansas, in 2015 and was acquired by the current owner in 2020. The truck is finished in red over patterned vinyl upholstery and is powered by a 4.2-liter 2F inline-six linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes driving lights, ambulance-style rear doors, manually locking front hubs, and 15″ steel wheels with polished hubcaps along with front disc brakes sourced from a later model Land Cruiser. The cabin features a split front bench seat, inward-facing jump seats, and a Vintage Air climate control system. This FJ40 is offered at no reserve on dealer consignment with a clean New York title.

The truck was removed from the frame and refinished during the refurbishment, reportedly in Freeborn Red with a Cygnus White hardtop. Exterior features include driving lights, a pintle hitch, and ambulance-style rear doors.

The 15″ steel wheels feature polished hubcaps and are mounted with 33×10.50″ BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2 tires. Power steering is said to have been added, and the selling dealer notes that a brake master cylinder and front disc brakes from a later model Land Cruiser are installed.

The cabin was fitted with replacement patterned vinyl seat upholstery during the refurbishment along with a replacement headliner, dash pad, seat foam, door cards, and carpeting. A Vintage Air climate control system and floor insulation are said to have been installed.

Instrumentation includes a 160-km/h speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, amperage, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 2,600 kilometers, (~1,600 miles), and total mileage is unknown.
The 4.2-liter 2F inline-six is said to have been rebuilt during the refurbishment and is equipped with a single carburetor.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The differentials are fitted with 3.70:1 gearing according to the selling dealer.

This 1987 Porsche 944 Turbo shows 86k miles along with registration history in Tennessee beginning in June 1995. It is finished in Guards Red over black partial leather and is powered by a turbocharged 2.5-liter inline-four paired with a five-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes 16″ phone dial alloy wheels, pop-up headlights, fog lights, a sunroof, an Alpine stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 944 Turbo is offered in New Jersey by the selling dealer with a clean Tennessee title.

The car is finished in Guards Red (LM3A) and features a tilting sunroof with a removable panel as well as pop-up headlights, fog lights, a rear window wiper, and a rear spoiler. The Carfax report notes damage in an April 2024 entry. Paint blemishes including rock chips and dents are shown up close in the gallery.

The 16″ phone dial alloy wheels show signs of wear, and they are mounted with Sumitomo HTR A/S P02 tires that show date codes from 2016. The anti-lock braking system features four-piston calipers matched with ventilated discs at each corner. The power steering pump is said to have been replaced in April 2024.

The cabin features front seats and rear seats trimmed in black partial leather. The driver’s seat has been reupholstered in preparation for the sale. Amenities include an Alpine stereo, cruise control, power windows, dual front airbags, and air conditioning. The shifter bushings are worn, there are cracks on the dash and in the leather on the passenger seat, and additional interior blemishes can be viewed in the gallery.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 180-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,400-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, turbo boost pressure, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 86k miles.
The turbocharged 2.5-liter inline-four was factory rated at 217 horsepower and 243 lb-ft of torque. The thermostat and its housing were replaced and an oil change performed in April 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.

This 1973 Ford Bronco wagon was acquired by the current owner in 2015 following a multi-year refurbishment that included refinishing the body in green and silver and installing a 302ci V8 that is fitted with GT40 aluminum cylinder heads, an Edelbrock intake manifold and Pro-Flo electronic fuel injection, and MSD ignition components. The truck is further equipped with an NV4500 five-speed manual transmission, an Atlas dual-range transfer case, limited-slip front and rear differentials, power-assisted front disc brakes, a lifted suspension, and a Wild Horses 4×4 1″ body lift and quick-ratio power steering. Additional modifications consist of 17″ Fuel wheels, aftermarket front and rear steel bumpers, LED exterior lighting, Corbeau front bucket seats, Vintage Air climate control, Dakota Digital VHX instrumentation, and a custom exhaust system. This U15 Bronco is offered on dealer consignment with service records, a Warn VR8000-S winch, and a clean Nevada title.

The rear fenders were cut, wheel arch flares were fitted, and the truck was refinished in green and silver during the refurbishment. Additional details include a Wild Horses 4×4 1″ body lift, electric windshield wiper kit, and raised fiberglass hood with pins as well as a removable hardtop, an LED lightbar, headlights, and reverse lights, and aftermarket front and rear steel bumpers with receiver hitches.

The 17″ Fuel wheels are mounted with 285/70 Toyo Open Country A/T tires, and a matching spare is affixed to the swing-away rear tire carrier. The truck is equipped with a lifted suspension, manually locking front hubs, Wild Horses 4×4 quick-ratio power steering, and hydraulic power-assisted front disc and rear drum brakes.

The interior metal surfaces have been coated in a black textured material and the cabin has been fitted with a six-point roll cage, gray cloth Corbeau front bucket seats and a rear bench, Vintage Air climate control, polished diamond plate door panels, aluminum pedal covers, and Wild Horses 4×4 transmission and transfer case shift knobs.

A leather-wrapped Lecarra steering wheel is mounted to a polished Flaming River tilting column and fronts Dakota Digital VHX instrumentation consisting of a 120-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for voltage, fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The replacement digital odometer shows 729 miles and the total mileage is unknown.

A 302ci V8 has been installed and is fitted with GT40 aluminum cylinder heads, an Edelbrock intake manifold and Pro-Flo electronic fuel injection system, and an aluminum radiator with dual electric fans along with a March Performance serpentine system, an electronic fuel injection system, and MSD ignition components.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through an NV4500 five-speed manual transmission with overdrive as well as an Atlas dual-range transfer case and limited-slip front and rear differentials. The truck is equipped with a 22-gallon primary fuel tank, an auxiliary tank, and a custom exhaust system.
DDecoding the warranty plate on the glovebox door provides the following information:

This 2001 Ford Mustang SVT Cobra convertible is finished in Ebony Clearcoat over Dark Charcoal leather, and it has 43k miles. The car is powered by a replacement 4.6-liter DOHC V8 linked with a five-speed manual transmission, and features include a limited-slip differential, a black convertible soft top, 18″ OE Racing wheels, an independent rear suspension, a vented hood, a rear spoiler, fog lights, articulated front sport seats, a Mach 460 AM/FM/cassette stereo, a CD changer, remote keyless entry, cruise control, air conditioning, and power windows, mirrors, and locks. This SVT Cobra convertible is now offered by the selling dealer with a Deluxe Marti report, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.

The Cobra was distinguished from the contemporary SN95 Mustang by circular front fog lights, tri-color tail lights, and a revised front fascia and vented hood. This example is finished in Ebony Clearcoat, and additional equipment includes a power-retractable black soft top, a rear spoiler, black-surround headlights, dual polished exhaust outlets, and SVT and Cobra badging. A satin-finish film has been applied behind the hood vent.

Aftermarket 18″ OE Racing wheels wear a chrome finish and are mounted with BF Goodrich G-force Sport Comp-2 tires measuring 245/40 up front and 275/35 out back. SVT-specific suspension components consist of linear-rate springs, gas-pressurized front struts and rear shocks, and an independent rear suspension. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with Cobra-branded calipers up front.

The cabin features articulated front sport seats trimmed in Dark Charcoal Nudo leather with Medium Graphite microsuede inserts and Cobra emblems embroidered into the backrests. Equipment includes a Mach 460 AM/FM/cassette stereo with an in-dash six-disc CD changer as well as a leather-wrapped shift knob, remote keyless entry, cruise control, air conditioning, and power windows, mirrors, and locks.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is mounted to a tilting column and frames white instrument dials including a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, voltage, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 43k miles.
A replacement 4.6-liter DOHC V8 was installed in January 2002. An oxygen sensor was replaced in January 2024.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a Tremec T-45 five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Deluxe Marti Report lists factory colors, options, and production statistics.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 2010 Ford Mustang Shelby GT500 convertible was first registered in Ontario and now has 18k kilometers (~11k miles). It has been modified with a Whipple supercharger, a JLT Performance carbon-fiber air intake, long-tube headers, Borla Atak mufflers, aftermarket suspension components, and a short-throw shifter. The car is powered by a 5.4-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic with Satin Black stripes over Charcoal Black leather. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ alloy wheels, a black soft top, HID headlights, a Shaker sound system, and air conditioning. Acquired by the seller in 2024, this Shelby GT500 convertible is now offered in Canada with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and Alberta registration.

The car is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic with Satin Black stripes and features a power-retractable black soft top, HID headlights, fog lights, hood vents, a rear spoiler, Shelby badging, and polished exhaust outlets. The seller reports the front splitter was replaced under current ownership, and streaky stripes and a paint chip near the rear license plate are noted.

The 18″ twin-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Nitto NT555 G2 tires measuring 275/40, and a blemish is noted on the front left wheel. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with Brembo front calipers. The suspension is said to have been modified with an Eibach Panhard bar and lowering springs along with UPR rear lower control arms.

The cabin features front sport bucket seats upholstered in Charcoal Black leather with fabric accents and Shelby Cobra logos on the backrests. Equipment includes a power-adjustable driver’s seat, a roll bar, a Shaker sound system, a CD stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. A short-shifter kit has been added.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 260-km/h speedometer, a tachometer, supplementary gauges, and an MSD shift light. The digital odometer indicates 19k kilometers (~12k miles), approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.
The supercharged 5.4-liter DOHC V8 was modified under previous ownership with a Whipple supercharger, a JLT Performance carbon-fiber air intake, and a JMS PowerMax fuel pump voltage booster.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and a Centerforce clutch kit has reportedly been installed. The seller states the exhaust system has been modified with Kooks long-tube headers and H-pipe as well as a MagnaFlow X-pipe and Borla Atak mufflers.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
The vehicle is being sold on its registration, which serves as the ownership document in Alberta, Canada. The sale does not include a title.
listing_details: Brilliant Silver Metallic Paint w/Black Stripes

description: This 2003 Mercedes-Benz E500 sedan has remained registered in California since new and now has 37k miles. The car is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Platinum Blue Metallic over beige Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes a sunroof, 17″ multi-spoke alloy wheels, power-adjustable front seats, Keyless-Go, a Harman Kardon sound system, a CD stereo, and four-zone automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this E500 sedan is offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Platinum Blue Metallic (353) and features a power-retractable sunroof, black window trim, and fog lights. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 17″ multi-spoke alloy wheels are fitted with Pirelli Cinturato P7 tires that were mounted in preparation for the sale. Stopping power is provided by ventilated discs at each corner, and the car is equipped with Airmatic air suspension and an Adaptive Damping System (ADS II).

The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in beige Nappa leather, and interior features include Keyless-Go, a Harman Kardon sound system, a CD stereo, four-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, and COMAND infotainment.

The wood- and leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as an analog clock and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 37k miles, approximately 100 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 5.0-liter M113 V8 was factory-rated at 302 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a seven-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.

This 2002 Ford F-350 Super Duty Lariat is a Crew Cab long-bed 4×4 example powered by a 7.3-liter Power Stroke turbodiesel V8 that drives the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is finished in Oxford White Clearcoat over Medium Flint leather upholstery, and features include tubular side steps, fog lights, a sliding rear window, a receiver hitch, an AM/FM stereo, an in-dash CD changer cruise control, air conditioning, heated power-adjustable front seats, and a rear step bumper. The selling dealer acquired the truck in 2024 and it now has 98k miles. This F-350 is offered in North Carolina with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.

The truck is finished in Oxford White Clearcoat and features four forward-opening doors, a rear cargo light, fog lights, tubular side steps, a sliding rear window, a receiver hitch, a bedliner, bedrail mounting hooks, a rear step bumper, and halogen headlights. The tailgate is dented and there is chipped paint on the front right door.
The 16″ five-hole alloy wheels are mounted with 265/75 Michelin Radial LT tires. The truck is equipped with automatic locking front hubs and stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Medium Flint leather. Interior amenities include heated power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, air conditioning, Lariat-branded floormats, and an AM/FM stereo with an in-dash CD changer.

The steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 3,400-rpm redline, and auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, fuel level, transmission temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 98k miles.
Power is provided by a 7.3-liter Power Stroke turbodiesel V8 that was factory rated at 250 horsepower and 505 lb-ft of torque when new. An oil change was performed at 95k miles.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission and a shift-on-the-fly dual-range transfer case.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

attributes.value: F-350 Super Duty Lariat Crew Cab Power Stroke 4×4

description: This 1929 Model A Fordor sedan was purchased by the owner in 1996, and it has not been driven in several years. The car is finished in green and black over tan cloth upholstery, and it is equipped with a non-running 201ci L-head inline-four as well as a three-speed manual transmission, a black vinyl roof, 21″ wire-spoke wheels, a tilt-out windshield, an aftermarket turn signal switch, and a rear-window shade. This Model A Fordor sedan is now offered as a non-running project on dealer consignment at no reserve with a California title.

The bodywork is finished in green with a black vinyl roof and black-finished fenders and running boards. The car features a tilt-out windshield, auxiliary lights, and dual taillights. Spots of faded and worn-through paint are visible along with scratches and chips. Corrosion on the radiator shell is visible in the gallery below.
The 21″ wire-spoke wheels are mounted with older thin-whitewall tires. Braking is provided by four-wheel drums.

The cabin features front and rear bench seats upholstered in tan cloth along with coordinated door panels and black-painted wood floor boards. A roll-up window shade is mounted above the rear window. Wear, holes, and stains in the upholstery are pictured in the gallery.

The four-spoke steering wheel sits ahead of an aftermarket turn-signal switch and an aftermarket temperature gauge. A speedometer and gauges for fuel-level and amperage are mounted in the central instrument panel. The five-digit odometer shows 55k miles, approximately 3-5k of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The 201ci L-head inline-four was factory rated at 40 horsepower and 128 lb-ft of torque. The engine does not run, and details of the current condition are not known.
The car is equipped with a sliding-gear three-speed manual transmission linked to a banjo-style rear axle. Spots of rust on underside components are pictured in the gallery below.

This 2010 Audi A4 Avant Premium was first registered in New Jersey and remained with the original owner in the state until it was recently acquired by the selling dealer. Now with 75k miles, it is finished in gray over black leather upholstery and is powered by a turbocharged 2.0-liter inline-four that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes 17″ seven-spoke alloy wheels, a sunroof, fog lights, heated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, and an Audi Concert CD stereo. Recent work has included refinishing the bumpers and replacing the sunroof mechanism. This B8 A4 Avant is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual, two key fobs, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the selling dealer’s name.

The car is finished in gray and features a panoramic sunroof, roof rails, fog lights, and dual exhaust outlets. The front and rear bumpers have been refinished and the sunroof mechanism was replaced in preparation for the sale. Scratches, dings, and various other paint blemishes are highlighted in photos provided in the gallery below.

The 17″ seven-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ProContact tires measuring 225/50, and braking is handled by ventilated discs at each corner. The tires are showing date codes ranging from 2019 to 2023.

The seating surfaces are trimmed in black leather, and amenities include heated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, aluminum trim, cruise control, and an Audi Concert CD stereo. The driver’s seat bottom is worn and the headliner is stained.
Instrumentation consists of a 180-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 75k miles.
The turbocharged 2.0-liter EA888 inline-four was factory rated at 211 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed Tiptronic automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Corrosion on underside components is shown in photos below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2007 Ferrari F430 Spider was first delivered to Ferrari of Newport Beach in California, and it has 20k miles following registration history in the state. Finished in Nero Daytona over tan leather with black accents and piping, the car is powered by a 4.3-liter DOHC V8 paired with a six-speed F1 automated transaxle. Equipment includes a black convertible soft top, 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels, an electronically controlled limited-slip differential, Brembo carbon-ceramic brake rotors, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, power-adjustable Daytona-style bucket seats, and automatic climate control. This F430 Spider is now offered in New Hampshire by the selling dealer with a Ferrari Vehicle Identification Passport, a copy of the window sticker, owner’s manuals, a car cover, and a clean California title.

The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Nero Daytona and features a power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a carbon-fiber rear panel, and quad exhaust tips exiting on either side of the rear diffuser. Clear paint-protection film has reportedly been applied to the lower portions of the doors along with the front bumper cover, hood, fenders, headlight lenses, A-pillars, and side skirts.

The 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport 02 tires. Braking is handled by yellow-finished brake calipers fitted over Brembo carbon-ceramic rotors. The brake fluid was flushed in preparation for the sale.

The power-adjustable Daytona-style bucket seats are upholstered in tan leather with black piping and accents, and the cabin features a matching center console and door panel inserts. Equipment includes a CD stereo, air conditioning, drilled aluminum pedals, and power windows and locks.

The leather- and carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel is equipped with an engine-start button as well as a manettino dial for control of dynamic settings. Instrumentation includes a central tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline as well as a 220-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 20k miles.

The mid-mounted 4.3-liter F136 V8 features Bosch Motronic engine management and a dry-sump lubrication system. Factory-rated output was 483 horsepower and 343 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed F1 automated transaxle and an electronically controlled limited-slip differential. Carbon-fiber trim adorns the engine bay. The oil and transaxle fluids were changed and the battery and spark plugs were replaced in June 2024.
A photocopy of the window sticker lists initial delivery to Ferrari of Newport Beach in California along with factory equipment and a total suggested retail price of $294,215.
The Ferrari Vehicle Identification Passport contains photos of the car during various phases of its construction. The sale also includes owner’s manuals and a car cover.
The Carfax report shows at least one open recall.
listing_details: Tan Leather Upholstery w/Black Accents & Piping

description: This 2008 Mini Cooper S is a Sidewalk Edition convertible that is finished in Sparkling Silver Metallic over Malt Brown leather upholstery and is powered by a supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four linked to a six-speed manual transaxle. The car is equipped with the Cockpit Chrono Package, a black soft top, 17″ alloy wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, automatic climate control, and a JVC stereo linked to a Harman Kardon sound system. The seller acquired the car in April 2023 and an oil change was completed in preparation for the sale. This R52 Cooper S is offered with service records, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and an Ontario registration.

The car is finished in Sparkling Silver Metallic with black bonnet stripes and features a power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, fog lights, Park Distance Control, a hood scoop, Sidewalk badging, and twin center-exit exhaust outlets. The seller states a ceramic coating was applied under previous ownership.

Night Spoke 17″ alloy wheels are mounted with 205/45 Continental ContiProContct tires. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control and a 21mm rear sway bar. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs.

The front bucket seats and split-folding rear bench are upholstered in Malt Brown English leather with white piping. Details include contrasting brown leather trim on the lower portion of the steering wheel and the shift knob as well as Mini-branded floor mats, Sidewalk-branded door sill plates, automatic climate control, and a Bluetooth-capable JVC stereo linked to a Harman Kardon sound system.

The car was optioned with the Cockpit Chrono Package, which included a column-mounted gauge pod with a 150-mph speedometer and an 8k-rpm tachometer as well as central gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 52k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.
The supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four was factory rated at 168 horsepower and 162 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in May 2024.
Power is sent to the front wheels through a Getrag six-speed manual transaxle
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other reported damage and lists history in Florida, Ohio, Kentucky, and Ontario, Canada.
The car does not have a title, as it is registered in a province that does not issue titles for vehicles. It is being sold on its Ontario registration.

This 2016 Ford Mustang Saleen 302 White Label convertible was acquired new by the current owner in California and now has 21k miles. It is finished in Oxford White over Ebony leather and is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 mated to a six-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Saleen equipment includes PowerFlash engine calibration software, a high-performance exhaust system, 20″ staggered-width wheels, revised suspension components, front and rear valances, and graphics. The car is also equipped with a black soft top, rear parking sensors, heated and cooled front seats, adaptive cruise control, Shaker audio, and SYNC 3 infotainment with navigation. This 302 White Label is now offered on dealer consignment with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Oxford White and has a Saleen grille, badges, graphics, and rear fascia. Additional details include a black soft top as well as a vented hood, HID headlights, a rear diffuser, rear parking sensors, a rearview camera, a decklid spoiler, and LED taillights with sequential turn signals. A ding is noted on the left quarter panel.
Staggered-width 20″ five-spoke wheels are mounted with Cooper Zeon RS3-S tires. The suspension features revised springs, and braking is handled by vented four-wheel discs.

The heated and cooled power-adjustable front bucket seats are upholstered in Ebony leather that extends to the door panels. Branded mats line the front footwells, and equipment includes driver’s seat memory settings, adaptive cruise control, ambient lighting, dual-zone automatic climate control, push-button ignition, a 12-speaker Shaker sound system, and an 8″ SYNC 3 touchscreen infotainment system with navigation.
A dashboard plaque identifies this 302 White Label as #16-0014.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel wears a Saleen horn button and frames a white-dial instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer. The digital odometer indicates 21k miles, all of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.0-liter Coyote V8 was modified by Saleen with PowerFlash engine calibration software and a high-performance exhaust system. Output was rated by Saleen at 450 horsepower and 410 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.

This 1974 Ford Ranchero GT was refinished in metallic red under prior ownership and was exported from the US to Canada following the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024. Power comes from a 351ci V8 equipped with a Holley four-barrel carburetor, and shifting is through a three-speed automatic transmission. On the inside, the bucket seats are upholstered in black leather with tan inserts and accompanied by a wood-rimmed steering wheel, a center console, air conditioning, and a JVC CD stereo. Further equipment includes 17″ alloy wheels, power-assisted front disc brakes, a hood scoop, a sliding rear window, and a spray-on bedliner. This Ranchero GT is now offered by the selling dealer in Canada with Ontario registration.

Finished from the factory in Dark Green Metallic (4Q), the truck was repainted metallic red under prior ownership. Details include a hood scoop, dual side mirrors, chrome-finished bumpers, a sliding rear window, a spray-on bedliner, and dual polished exhaust outlets.

Split-spoke 17″ alloy wheels are mounted with 215/45 Bridgestone Ecopia EP4 tires up front and BFGoodrich tires out back. The truck is equipped with power steering, and braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The bucket seats are upholstered in black leather with tan inserts and are joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, and door panels. Air conditioning, a JCV head unit, and a locking glove compartment are further details.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel sits ahead of a 120-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and readouts for fuel level and coolant temperature. Additional Equus gauges monitoring oil pressure, coolant temperature, and voltage are mounted in the center console. The five-digit odometer shows 60k miles.
The 351ci V8 is equipped with a Holley four-barrel carburetor, an MSD ignition coil, and a polished air cleaner housing and valve covers.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission. A dual exhaust system is fitted and features Thrush mufflers.
The vehicle does not have a title and is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada

This 1967 Cadillac Eldorado was purchased by the current owner in 1981 and underwent modifications that were completed in 2014. A 500ci V8 and a replacement three-speed automatic transmission were installed, the roof was removed and chopped, a removable hardtop was fitted, the bodywork was repainted black, and the seats were re-trimmed in black leather. Additional equipment includes a removable tonneau cover, 15″ wheels, front disc brakes, a power-operated front bench, power front windows, aut0-dimming headlights, and a heater. This modified Eldorado is now offered in Canada by the seller on behalf of the owner with British Columbia registration.

The roof was chopped and shortened, the frame was reinforced, and a removable fabric hardtop and custom tonneau cover were fitted. The seller reports that the car has undergone three color changes and was most recently refinished in black circa 2014, and red “Helldorado” script and stripes adorn the sides. Additional modifications have involved adding a rear LED light strip and removing the gas door, rear back-up light, and wheel arch trim. Paint chips and a crack on the right rear fender are noted.

Steel 15″ wheels wear covers with black centers and red accent stripes. The wheels are mounted with 235/75 Hankook Radial H714 tires measuring 235/75/R15. The car is equipped with power steering, stopping power is provided by front disc and rear drum brakes, and the seller states that rear air bags are fitted.

The cabin houses a power-operated front bench and a rear bench seat that have been reupholstered in black leather, and the seller reports that the carpets have also been replaced. Appointments include a fold-down center armrest, power front windows, auto-dimming headlights, and a heater. The radio does not work, and a tear in the upholstery of the driver’s seat is depicted in the gallery.

The three-spoke steering wheel wears a Cadillac wreath and crest and fronts a horizontal-sweep 120-mph speedometer, gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level, and an analog clock. A trio of aftermarket readouts is mounted in the center of the dashboard. The five-digit odometer shows 6k miles, and the seller reports having added approximately 30k miles under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The seller notes that the 500ci V8 was sourced from a 1970 model and installed in 2010.
Power is routed to the front wheels through a replacement three-speed Turbo Hydra-Matic automatic transmission.
The vehicle does not have a title and is being sold on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada.

This 1954 Packard convertible was acquired by the seller in the mid-1990s out of Michigan. Powered by a replacement 327ci straight-eight linked to a replacement three-speed manual transmission with overdrive, the car is finished in red with a power-operated black soft top over red and white vinyl upholstery. The electrical system has been converted to 12 volts and PerTronix ignition, and other features include wheel covers, whitewall tires, fender skirts, power windows, and a power-adjustable front seat. This Packard 5479 is now offered in Canada with service records, manufacturer’s literature, a service manual, a jack, and Ontario registration in the seller’s name.

The Cavalier-based convertible was stripped of that nameplate for the 1954 season, when it was referred to simply as the Packard convertible and 863 copies were produced. This example has been refinished in red urethane paint following rust repair, according to the seller, who notes that the power-operated black convertible top was replaced in 2000. Equipment includes fender skirts, a turned-down exhaust finisher, dual sideview mirrors, a pelican-style hood ornament, and chrome bumpers and trim.
Body-color steel wheels feature Packard-branded chrome covers and are mounted with Uniroyal Tiger Paw whitewall tires.

The front and rear bench seats have been retrimmed in red and white vinyl upholstery. Appointments include a power-adjustable front seat, power windows, a heater, and front lap belts. The AM radio and the clock are inoperable.

A red steering wheel with a partial horn ring sits ahead of a 110-mph speedometer and a combination gauge. The five-digit odometer shows 88k miles, approximately 30k of which were added under current ownership.

The 327ci inline-eight is a replacement unit that was installed under current ownership. The electrical system has been converted to 12 volts, and PerTronix ignition has been fitted. The oil was changed most recently in late 2023. The car was originally powered by a 359ci inline-eight.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a replacement three-speed manual transmission with overdrive.
The vehicle is being offered on its Ontario registration, a form that serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada.

This 1963 Buick Skylark is a two-door hardtop finished in Rose Mist and Regal Black over black vinyl and powered by an aluminum 215ci V8 paired with a two-speed Jetaway transmission. Equipment includes 13″ wheels, power steering, chrome bumpers, front bucket seats, and an AM radio. This Skylark is offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a service manual, literature, service records, fender skirts, and New York registration.
The car was factory-finished in Rose Mist and Regal Black and was refinished under previous ownership. Details include polished bodyside trim, chrome bumpers, and dual side mirrors.
