The 13″ steel wheels with factory hubcaps are wrapped in 175/70 Kumho Sense tires showing 2015 date codes. Braking is handled by four-wheel drums and the car is equipped with power steering. The brake lines, hubs, and shoes were replaced in November 2022.

The front bucket seats and rear bench are upholstered in black vinyl, and a center console with an armrest sits between the front seats. Equipment includes carpeted floor mats, an AM radio, and front lap belts.

Instrumentation consists of a 120-mph horizontal speedometer, an analog clock, and a fuel gauge. A Sunpro coolant temperature gauge is mounted underneath the dashboard. The five-digit odometer shows 30k miles.
The 215ci V8 is fed via a Rochester 4-Jet four-barrel carburetor and delivers power to the rear wheels via a two-speed Jetaway automatic transmission.
The engine stamping is shown above.
Additional underside photos are viewable in the gallery below.
Decoding the cowl tag reveals the following details:
The above literature, service records, and a pair of fender skirts are included in the sale.
listing_details: Repainted Rose Mist and Regal Black

description: This 1997 BMW M3 sedan was modified for track use under previous ownership in 2005, reportedly for use in the BMWCCA Club Racing C-Mod class. Highlighting the modifications is a European-specification 3.2-liter S50B32 inline six, a Jim Blanton-built 3.64 differential, coilover suspension with remote-reservoir Motion Control shocks, upgraded brakes, APEX ARC-8 wheels, and front and rear spoilers. The Alpine White paintwork is accented by Motorsport-motif flags, and inside the car has a cage, an OMP seat for the driver, and an AIM dashboard. This race-prepared M3/4/5 is now offered on a bill of sale in Illinois with records.

The car is finished in Alpine White III (300). A raised rear spoiler and a front splitter have been added along with fender lip extensions. The rear windows are fixed, and the left-front headlight has been removed and replaced with an intake. Sponsor and racing-style decals have been added along with Motorsport-motif flag accents, and the carbon-fiber hood is secured by pins. Several trim items are missing.

The APEX ARC-8 wheels wear 275/35 Falken tires all around and are secured on studs. Motion Control two-way dampers with remote reservoirs have been installed along with height-adjustable coilover springs, aftermarket sway bars, a lower front chassis reinforcement, and a front upper stress bar. A Turner Motorsport four-piston Brembo brake kit has been installed up front, while out back Porsche 996-specification tw0-piston calipers have been installed.

The interior has been stripped, and a TC Design cage was installed and finished to match the car. The doors have been gutted and the lower dashboard and center console were removed, and diamond-plate panels were installed on the floor. The driver is secured in the OMP seat by Simpson harnesses, and a transponder, a window net, fire extinguishers, a racing rearview mirror, and Sparco pedals.
An AIM dashboard has been installed ahead of the factory instrumentation, and a MOMO Competition steering wheel has been installed along with an IRP shifter. The odometer indicates 66k miles.

The European-specification 3.2-liter S50B32 inline-six was reportedly installed by Patrick BMW in Schaumburg, Illinois in 2001. The engine is believed to have had ~15k miles at the time of installation, and it was modified with a Autothority intake and a lightweight flywheel.

The five-speed manual transmission is linked to a Jim Blanton-built differential with 3.64 gears and an Alpina cover. The stainless-steel headers are linked to a custom exhaust system with Borla mufflers.
A binder of records and historical photos are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

This 1956 Mercury Montclair convertible has been modified with a 5.0-liter Coyote V8 mated to a 4R70W four-speed automatic transmission and a Currie 9” rear differential. Finished in orange and white with a power-operated black convertible top over an orange and white interior, the car also features front coilovers and tubular control arms, front disc brakes, power-assisted rack-and-pinion steering, a dual exhaust system, 15″ wire wheels, whitewall tires, a Continental kit, air conditioning, a power-adjustable front seat, and power windows. This modified Montclair was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023 and is now offered in Florida with a Pennsylvania title.

Mercury manufactured 7,762 Montclair convertibles for 1956, and this example was finished from the factory in two-tone Persimmon and Classic White (83). The car is said to have undergone a rotisserie refurbishment under prior ownership, during which it was repainted in orange and white. Equipment includes a power-operated black convertible top, fender skirts, dual fender-mounted sideview mirrors, fog lights, a hood ornament, and chrome bumpers and trim. The dual exhaust system terminates in horizontal tailpipes that are styled around the lower surface of the rear bumper.

Chrome-finished 15″ wire wheels with spinner-style centers are mounted with 205/75 BFGoodrich Silvertown Radial whitewall tires; two of the wheel centers bear Ford branding, and the other two have Chevrolet logos. A Continental kit with a body-color cover houses a spare wheel and tire, and another spare is situated inside the trunk compartment. The front underpinnings feature tubular control arms, coilovers, power-assisted rack-and-pinion steering, and power-assisted disc brakes. The rear of the car rides on leaf springs connected to a live axle capped by drum brakes. The power steering reportedly was repaired in May 2024.

The bench seating surfaces have been retrimmed in orange and white upholstery. Appointments include a power-adjustable front seat, power windows, air conditioning, a clock, a push-button AM radio, bright trim, black carpeting, and orange carpeted floor mats.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 120-mph speedometer positioned below auxiliary gauges. Aftermarket gauges monitoring voltage, oil pressure, and water temperature are located below the dashboard, alongside aftermarket climate controls. The five-digit odometer shows 93k miles, less than 50 of which were added by the selling dealer; true mileage is unknown.

The 5.0-liter Coyote V8 was installed under prior ownership and features quad camshafts as well as twin independent variable camshaft timing. The engine is augmented by an aluminum radiator with electric cooling fans plus a cold-air intake, exhaust headers, and MagnaFlow mufflers.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 4R70W four-speed automatic transmission and a Currie 9” differential.
The Pennsylvania title carries an “Antique” brand.

This 1991 Buick Roadmaster Estate wagon was modified under prior ownership, which included removing the exterior trim and door handles, fitting a rear roll pan, installing an aftermarket grille and headlights, and repainting the car in pearl white with light blue upper sections. The car rides on adjustable air springs and 20″ American Racing wheels, and it is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission. The cabin is trimmed in Camel leather and outfitted with power-adjustable front seats, woodgrain trim, electric door poppers, air conditioning, cruise control, a rear-facing third-row bench, and a Sony head unit. This modified Roadmaster Estate is offered by the selling dealer in Texas at no reserve with the owner’s manual and a clean California title.

The exterior was repainted in pearl white with light blue upper sections, and the exterior trim and door handles were removed, electric door poppers were installed, and a rear roll pan, taillight trim, aftermarket headlights, and a revised front grille were fitted during the build. Further details consist of a Vista Roof over the second-row seats and dual exhaust outlets. The Carfax report notes an entry in April 2006 in which the vehicle was involved in a rear-end collision, and the trim is separating from the roof.

American Racing 20″ wheels are mounted with Falken Azenis tires. The car rides on adjustable air springs that are controlled in the cabin. It was factory equipped with power steering, and braking is provided by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The power-adjustable front seats are separated by a center console and are trimmed in Camel leather and vinyl. Appointments include cruise control, a microsuede headliner, air conditioning, and a Sony head unit mounted in the glove compartment as well as a power-operated rear window, side windows, locks, and mirrors.

The cargo area is accessed via a dual-hinged tailgate and features a fold-down rear-facing bench seat. The fuel filler has been relocated to inside the tailgate jamb, and a compressed air tank is mounted in the footwell. The rear cargo cover is sagging.

The tilting custom steering wheel is worn and frames a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, fuel level, oil pressure, and battery voltage. An analog clock and readouts for the air springs are mounted in the center console. The six-digit odometer shows 2,400 miles and is believed to have rolled over. The Carfax report notes a mileage inconsistency in an October 2020 entry. Total mileage is unknown.
The 5.0-liter V8 has been fitted with polished and chrome dress-up accessories along with a Powermaster alternator, an open-element air cleaner, and a custom pinstriped radiator shroud.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed 4L60 automatic transmission. Tubular headers are installed, and the catalytic converters have been removed.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident and mileage inconsistency.

This 2004 Chevrolet Express is outfitted with a Midwest Vans conversion package and is finished in white with blue and gray graphics over gray cloth upholstery. Power is provided by a 5.3-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and equipment includes front and rear captain’s chairs, a folding third-row bench seat, privacy shades, tinted windows, 16″ alloy wheels, woodgrain trim, a TV, a VHS player, an Audiovox CD player, and air conditioning. The selling dealer acquired the van in 2024 and subsequent work consisted of replacing the spark plugs and ignition coils. This Chevy conversion van has 7k miles and is now offered with a clean New Jersey title in the name of the selling dealer.
The van is finished in white with blue and gray graphics and details include tinted rear windows, chrome bumpers, fender flares, and body-color running boards.
The 16″ alloy wheels are wrapped in Cooper Discovery HTP tires. The factory four-wheel antilock braking system features discs at each corner.

The forward cabin houses captain’s chairs trimmed in gray cloth. Appointments include air conditioning, rear fan control, cruise control, a CD stereo, GM-branded rubber floor mats, and power door locks, mirrors, and windows.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles, a handful of which were added under current ownership.
The rear cabin is outfitted with dual captain’s chairs and woodgrain trim, a TV, a VHS player, an Audiovox CD player,  climate controls, and third-row bench that folds into a sleeping surface.
The 5.3-liter Vortec V8 was factory rated at 285 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque. Work in preparation for the sale is said to consist of replacing the spark plugs and ignition coils.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission.
The owner’s manual, headphones, and remotes are included in the sale.

This 1960 Porsche-Diesel Junior 108 tractor is said to have been refurbished in southern Europe in 2023 before being acquired by the selling dealer. The tractor is powered by an air-cooled 822cc diesel single paired with a dual-range three-speed manual transmission, and it is finished in red with a beige steel seat and beige wheels. Equipment includes dual power take-offs, front and rear pin hitches, a drawbar, a fender-mounted jump seat, headlights, and taillights. This Porsche-Diesel Junior tractor is offered by the selling dealer at no reserve in Florida with a bill of sale.

Porsche-Diesel Junior tractors were produced in short- and long-wheelbase variants between 1957 and 1961. This short-wheelbase (K) example was reportedly refurbished in 2023, and it features a rear-hinged hood, a fender-mounted jump seat, aluminum front grilles, headlights, taillights, and Porsche-Diesel badges.
Beige-painted wheels wear 4.00-16 agricultural tires up front and 8.3-24 Galaxy Earth Pro 45 tires out back. Stopping power is from independent rear drum brakes.

The spring-suspended operator’s seat is finished in beige and has the Porsche Diesel script across the back. Controls include a hand throttle as well as a centrally-mounted shifter and transmission range selector. The clutch pedal is located on the left, and dual pedals for the individual rear brakes are on the right.
The black three-spoke steering wheel sits ahead of an instrument panel housing ignition and starter controls, a headlight switch, and warning lights. The tractor is not equipped with an hour meter.

The air-cooled 822cc diesel single features Bosch diesel injection and was factory rated at 14 horsepower. The three-speed dual-range manual transmission delivers six forward speeds and two in reverse. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a portal axle.

This 2023 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS cabriolet is one of a reported 115 America Editions built to commemorate the 70th anniversary of the Porsche 356 America. Acquired by the selling dealer from the White Collection in 2023, it is finished in paint-to-sample Grand Prix White over black leather with red and white stitching and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six that drives the rear wheels through a seven-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes the Premium Package, a black soft top, Porsche Active Suspension Management, 20″ and 21″ RS Spyder Design wheels, LED lighting, heated and ventilated front seats, a surround-view camera, Porsche Communication Management, navigation, and a Bose surround sound system. This 992.1 GTS has 91 miles and is offered by the selling dealer in Texas with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in paint-to-sample Grand Prix White with America-script side graphics and “911 Carrera GTS” badging and is said to be the only America Edition example painted in this color. Exterior details include a black soft top and LED headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Lighting System as well as SportDesign aero, front and rear parking sensors, power-folding side mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets with black finishers.

White-finished 20″ and 21″ RS Spyder Design alloy wheels with red pinstripes on the rim are mounted with 245/35 front and 305/20 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires. Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) was standard on America Edition cars, and braking is handled by black-finished Porsche-script calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors.

The heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats and individual rear seats are upholstered in black leather with red and white contrast stitching on the front backrests, and 911 embroidery on the front headrests. Appointments include dual-zone automatic climate control, a surround-view camera, lane change assist, guards red seatbelts, America Edition-specific sill plates, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation linked to a Bose surround sound system.

The heated leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features a red centering stripe and frames a central 8k-rpm tachometer with an inset speed readout and LCD screens with configurable settings. A white-dial Sport Chrono stopwatch is mounted atop the center of the dash. The digital odometer indicates 91 miles.
The twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six was rated at 473 horsepower and 420 lb-ft of torque when new and features a factory sport exhaust system.
America Edition cars were only offered in a rear-wheel-drive configuration with a seven-speed manual transaxle.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Porsche North Houston in Texas along with factory colors, standard and optional equipment, and a total price of $198,540.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Texas and Montana. An open voluntary service action is noted.

This 2017 Mini Cooper is a John Cooper Works model that has 26k miles and is finished in Thunder Gray with a Chili Red roof and mirror caps. Power comes from a turbocharged and intercooled 2.0-liter inline-four mated to a six-speed manual transaxle, and the car rides on 17″ double-spoke alloy wheels finished in gloss black. Additional equipment includes a JCW sport-tuned suspension, Brembo brake calipers, LED headlights, a rear hatch spoiler, and manually adjustable front bucket seats upholstered in black cloth with gray stitching as well as dual-zone automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and MINI Connected infotainment with navigation. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this F56 JCW is now offered in Florida with a clean Carfax report and a clean New York title.

The car is finished in a JCW-specific paint scheme comprised of a Thunder Gray body color with the roof and mirror caps finished in Chili Red. Exterior details include a hood air inlet, LED headlights, black wheel arch moldings, bright trim, twin center-exit exhaust outlets, and a rear hatch with a spoiler, heated glass, and a wiper.

Gloss black 17″ double-spoke alloy wheels were mounted with 205/45 Hankook Ventus S1 Evo3 tires in preparation for the sale. The car rides on a JCW sport-tuned suspension with two driver-selectable modes, and braking is handled by red-finished Brembo calipers mounted over cross-drilled discs up front and solid discs out back.

The manually adjustable front bucket seats and the two-place rear bench are trimmed in black cloth with gray contrast stitching. Red upholstery and gloss black trim accent the dashboard and door panels, and amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, keyless entry, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a MINI Connected infotainment system with navigation.

The JCW three-spoke multifunction steering wheel is trimmed in perforated leather with orange stitching and fronts a column-mounted tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as a bar-style gauge for fuel level and a 160-mph speedometer with an inset multifunction digital display. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles.

The turbocharged and intercooled B48 2.0-liter inline-four features aluminum construction, a twin-scroll turbocharger, and double-VANOS variable valve timing. Factory-rated output was 228 horsepower and 236 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the front wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1951 Willys-Overland Jeep Station Wagon is a 4×4 model that was refurbished and retrofitted with a 225ci Buick V6 under previous ownership. It has a three-speed manual transmission, power steering, front disc brakes, and 15″ steel wheels with 31″ BFGoodrich tires. Acquired by the seller in 2023, this Willys station wagon is now offered with a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The station wagon featured a steel body designed by Brooks Stevens. This one was refinished in its current three-color scheme under previous ownership, and it has high-mount mirrors as well as a rear receiver hitch.

Black-finished 15″ Cragar wheels are mounted with 31×10.50″ BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO tires. Power steering, manually locking front hubs, and front disc brakes are additional elements. The seller reports that the steering was serviced in June 2024.
Beneath a white headliner, the front and rear benches are trimmed in patterned cloth that extends to the sunvisors, and the cabin has dual USB ports in addition to a heater.

A column-mounted tachometer is installed, and the central 80-mph speedometer has a five-digit odometer showing 65k miles, approximately 300 of which were added by the seller, who reports that total mileage is unknown.

The 225ci Buick V6 has an aluminum radiator, finned Offenhauser valve covers, and a dual exhaust system, and it sends power to the rear or all four wheels through a three-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
Additional photographs of the underside are shown at the end of the gallery below.

This 2020 Rezvani Hercules is a custom pickup based on a Jeep Gladiator chassis that was converted to a 6×6 by Rezvani of Santa Ana, California. The truck is outfitted with fabricated body panels finished in matte black over black leather upholstery, and power is from a 6.4-liter SRT V8 mated to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes body-color bumpers, a gold-finished roll bar, LED lighting, 20″ alloy wheels, power-operated side steps, Fox remote-reservoir shocks, a reverse-view camera, and an Alpine touchscreen infotainment system. First registered in California, the truck spent time in Montana, Florida, and Puerto Rico before it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023. Previously listed on BaT in March 2024, this Rezvani Hercules has 8k miles and is now offered at no reserve with a clean Florida title listing it as a 2020 Jeep Gladiator.

Assembled in Santa Ana, California, the Hercules was introduced in 2020 and is based on a Jeep Gladiator platform. This example is finished in matte black with body-color bumpers and gold chase-style bed bars. Details include an LED light bar, a bull bar, dual mirrors, a tailgate, and Rezvani badging.

Gold-finished 20″ XD Rockstar II alloy wheels wear Rezvani-logo center caps and are mounted with 37×10.5″ Falken Wildpeak MT tires. Stopping power is from disc brakes, and the truck is equipped with a front and rear multi-link suspension setup, a rear anti-sway bar, and Fox DSC remote-reservoir adjustable shock absorbers.

The front bucket seats and rear bench are upholstered in black leather with sueded inserts that extends to the door panels, center console, and dashboard. Additional features include Hercules script debossed on the headrests, a black sueded headliner, black carpets, a roll bar, a reverse-view camera, automatic climate control, an Alpine touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, and a custom audio system with supplementary overhead speakers.

A multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel sits ahead of a 120-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, a configurable digital display, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 8k miles.
The 6.4-liter V8 sends power to the rear or all six wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
Additional underside photos can be viewed in the gallery below.
The Carfax report lists no accidents or other damage, notes one manufacturer recall, and indicates that the truck was exported to Puerto Rico in 2022.

This 1984 Porsche 944 was purchased new by the current owner from HBL Inc. in Vienna, Virginia, and it now shows 87k miles following registration history in that state since new. It is powered by a 2.5-liter inline-four paired with a five-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Guards Red over black leatherette upholstery with cloth pinstripe inserts. Equipment includes 15″ cookie-cutter alloy wheels, a sunroof, pop-up headlights, fog lights, cruise control, an Alpine cassette stereo, and R134a-based air conditioning. Work performed in 2024 has included replacing the timing belt, timing belt tensioner, DME relay, speed sensor, and crankshaft position sensor. This 944 is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Guards Red and features a removable sunroof, pop-up headlights, fog lights, and a rear spoiler. There is a ding in the right quarter panel and scratches around the body. A C.A.R. Score report is provided by the seller, and close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 15″ cookie-cutter alloy wheels have black centers and are mounted with 215/60 Kumho Ecsta LX tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel power-assisted ventilated discs. The brake fluid was changed in 2024.

The cabin features seats upholstered in black leatherette with cloth pinstripe inserts along with a color-coordinated center console and door panels. Amenities include cruise control, an Alpine cassette stereo, and air conditioning, the latter of which has been converted to utilize R134a refrigerant.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 170-mph speedometer and a tachometer as well as gauges fuel economy, fuel level, and coolant temperate. An oil pressure gauge and analog clock are housed in the center stack. The five-digit odometer shows 87k miles.

The 2.5-liter M44 inline-four features Bosch engine management and was factory rated at 143 horsepower and 142 lb-ft of torque. Work performed in March 2024 included changing the oil and replacing the timing belt, timing belt tensioner, DME relay, speed sensor, and crankshaft position sensor.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle. The clutch fluid was changed in March 2024.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to HBL Inc. in Vienna, Virginia, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $22,935.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Black Leatherette Upholstery w/Cloth Pinstripe Inserts

description: This go-kart was produced by Action Industries of Tempe, Arizona, to replicate an Indy Car and was reportedly won as an unassembled kit during a promotion held during the Cleveland Grand Prix in the mid-1980s. The selling dealer acquired the kart in 2023 and partially completed assembly. The fiberglass body is finished in red with a Coca-Cola livery over a black tubular steel frame, and the sale includes a Tecumseh single and a centrifugal clutch. Additional equipment includes chain drive, a rear-mounted drum brake, a pull-starter, front and rear wings, a black seat, and a steering yoke. This Indy car-style go-kart is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature in Washington, Pennsylvania, on a bill of sale.

The fiberglass body is finished in red with matching front and rear wings that are accented by a silver faux windscreen, dual white stripes, and “Enjoy Coca-Cola” logos. The kart is said to have remained unassembled under prior ownership, and photos of the removed bodywork are shown in the gallery.
Silver-painted 6″ wheels are mounted with bias-ply tires. Stopping power is provided by a rear drum brake.

The frame is finished in black, and the single seat sits aft of a three-spoke steering wheel. An engine cut-off switch is mounted on the steering column, and a manufacturer’s label affixed to the floor pan shows the number 713603.

The 3.5-horsepower Tecumseh single is fitted with a pull starter. Once installed, it links to the rear axle via a centrifugal clutch and a drive chain. According to the selling dealer, the engine has not been started, and the fuel and oil tanks are dry.
An owner’s manual and model brochure are included in the sale.

This 1949 Dodge Power Wagon is a running and driving project that is said to have spent time on a ranch near Steamboat Springs, Colorado, before it was acquired by the current owner in October 2023. The truck is powered by a 230ci Flathead inline-six linked to a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case, and it is finished in orange over tan vinyl upholstery. Equipment includes a 12-volt electrical system, 16″ black-finished steel wheels, a Klaxon horn, a wood tailgate and bed floor, a tow ball, a heater, and a replacement bench seat. This Power Wagon is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean Colorado title in the owner’s name.

The truck has been refinished in orange, and equipment includes a Klaxon horn, cowl-mounted running lights, a driver-side mirror, a split windshield, a tow ball, and a wood tailgate and bed floor. A PTO-driven winch is mounted to the front bumper, and the seller states the clutch lever needs to be repaired. Cracks are visible in the windshield, right side window, and running lights.
The 16″ steel wheels are mounted with 9.00-16″ Specialty Tires of America tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel drums, and the brake cylinders were reportedly rebuilt under prior ownership.

The cab features a heater, green-finished metal surfaces, wind-up windows, and a replacement bench seat trimmed in tan vinyl. The seller states the wiring system needs attention as various lights and gauges do not work.
The three-spoke steering wheel fronts an 80-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 53k miles. Total mileage is unknown.

The 230ci inline-six is said to have been overhauled approximately 20 years ago, and it features a 12-volt electrical system and a single carburetor. The seller states the battery and fuel pump were recently replaced.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.

This 1956 Ford F-100 pickup is a running project that is powered by a 272ci Power King Y-block V8 linked with a three-speed automatic transmission. The truck is finished in red over gray vinyl, and features include a floor shifter, wrap-around front window, running boards, slotted mag-style wheels, front disc brakes, a bench seat, a cabin heater, and vent windows. This F-100 was acquired by the seller in 2021 and is now offered in Tennessee at no reserve with a spare steering wheel and a clean Utah title in the seller’s name.

The truck is finished in red, and equipment includes a wrap-around front windshield, a dual-bar grille, running boards, and dual towing mirrors. The paint is dull and areas of fading, corrosion, paint loss, and other blemishes are shown in the gallery along with holes in the wood bed floor. The seller notes prior rust repair on the cab and touchup around the body. The taillights are broken and inoperative, the vent windows should be replaced, and the door window regulators require lube.
The 15″ slotted mag-style wheels are mounted with Goodyear Wrangler Radial tires 235/75. Stopping power is provided by Wilwood front disc brakes and rear drums.

The cabin was refreshed in 2021 and features a bench seat upholstered in gray vinyl along with black carpets. Interior appointments include body-color metal surfaces, lap belts, a cabin heater, and quarter vent windows.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 90-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. An aftermarket gauge is mounted to the steering column. The five-digit odometer shows 19k miles, and total mileage is unknown.

The 272ci Power King Y-block V8 features an Edelbrock carburetor and was factory rated at 167 horsepower and 260 lb-ft of torque. The truck was brought back to running condition under current ownership, though further service is required.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a floor-shifted three-speed automatic transmission, which was installed in place of the factory manual gearbox under prior ownership.
Decoding the serial number tag reveals the following:

This 2020 BMW M2 CS is a Misano Blue Metallic-finished example that has 1,400 miles and was optioned with a six-speed manual transmission, which is paired with a twin-turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six. The car has black Merino leather and Alcantara upholstery, an Active M limited-slip differential, Park Distance Control, a rearview camera, a carbon-fiber roof, gold-finished 19″ Style 763M alloy wheels, carbon-fiber exterior and interior accents, adaptive LED headlights, heated power-adjustable front seats, Comfort Access, an iDrive infotainment system, navigation, Apple CarPlay, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2021, this F87 is now offered with a scale model, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.

The M2 CS features a carbon-fiber hood, roof, front splitter, decklid spoiler, rear diffuser, and mirror caps. This example is finished in Misano Blue Metallic and has adaptive LED headlights, side gills, a rearview camera, Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to the exterior, per the seller.

Gold-finished 19″ Style 763M alloy wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 265/35 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car is equipped with a standard M suspension that includes variable damper settings, and braking is handled by red M-logo six-piston front and four-piston rear calipers mounted over cross-drilled rotors.

The heated power-adjustable front seats are trimmed in black Merino leather and Alcantara with illuminated M2 badges on the backrests. Carbon-fiber trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include Comfort Access, an iDrive infotainment system, navigation, Apple CarPlay, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The Alcantara-wrapped multifunction M sport steering wheel frames a 180-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and a fuel-level gauge. The digital odometer indicates 1,400 miles, approximately 800 of which were added under current ownership.

The twin-turbocharged S55B30 3.0-liter TwinPower inline-six is mounted behind a carbon fiber U-brace. Factory-rated output was 444 horsepower and 406 lb-ft of torque in CS specification. The car is equipped with a CS-specific dual-branch exhaust system with electronically-controlled exhaust valves. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an Active M limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Black Merino Leather and Alcantara Upholstery

description: This 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Widebody is finished in Smoke Show over Demonic Red Laguna leather and was ordered with the Driver Convenience Group as well as the SRT Black, Plus, Carbon/Suede Interior, Laguna Leather, and Painted Satin Black Graphics packages. Power is provided by a supercharged 6.2-liter V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include Brembo brake calipers, a competition suspension, 20″ split-spoke lightweight wheels, a power sunroof, HID Air-Catcher headlamps, widebody fenders, and heated and ventilated front seats. The seller purchased the car new, and it now has 24 miles. This Hellcat Widebody is now offered in Arizona with black and red keys, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Oregon title in the name of the seller’s company.

The car is finished in Smoke Show (PAE) with Satin Black accents on the hood, roof, and trunk lid. Additional features include HID Air-Catcher headlamps, a power sunroof, black hood pins, widebody fenders, an aluminum hood with dual air scoops, Hellcat fender badges, chin spoiler guards, a rearview camera, rear parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets finished in Black Vapor chrome.

Black 20″ split-spoke lightweight wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero All Season tires measuring 305/35 all around. The car is equipped with a Widebody competition suspension system with adaptive Bilstein dampers. Braking is handled by red-finished six-piston front and four-piston rear Brembo calipers.

The heated and ventilated front seats are upholstered in Demonic Red Laguna leather with embossed Hellcat logos on the front backrests, and carbon-fiber trim accents the instrument panel and center console. Amenities include driver-seat power adjustability, a folding rear seat, keyless entry, push-button start, dual-zone automatic climate control, and Uconnect infotainment with navigation.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is mounted to a tilting and telescoping steering column and frames a red 200-mph speedometer and 7k-rpm tachometer along with a configurable digital display. The digital odometer indicates 24 miles.

The supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 produced 717 horsepower and 656 lb-ft of torque when new and is equipped with aluminum cylinder heads and a forged-steel crankshaft, connecting rods, and pistons. Power is sent to the rear wheels through an eight-speed TorqueFlite automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report notes at least one recall.

This 1993 Chevrolet Corvette ZR-1 is powered by an LT5-based V8 that was modified by Lingenfelter Performance Engineering in 2016 to displace 415ci, and the powerplant is linked with a six-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Ruby Red Metallic over matching leather upholstery, the car is equipped with 17″ sawblade alloy wheels, Van Steel front coilovers, a Stainless Works exhaust system, and two removable roof panels as well as pop-up headlights, power-adjustable sport seats, air conditioning, and a Delco Bose Gold Series sound system with CD and cassette players. Following registration history in Kentucky, New York, Nevada, and Colorado, the vehicle was acquired by the selling dealer in May 2024. With 24k miles, this modified Corvette ZR-1 is now offered in Pennsylvania with a window sticker, owner’s manuals, two keys, a Lingenfelter Certificate of Authenticity, spare parts, a roof-panel stand, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title.

The C4 ZR-1 was sold between 1990 and 1995, and it featured a wider tail compared to the standard C4 Corvette and introduced a convex rear fascia with squared-off taillights. This example is finished in Ruby Red Metallic and features pop-up headlights, integrated fog lights, a removable transparent roof panel, front-fender vents, and power-adjustable and heated side mirrors. A body-color roof panel and a rolling stand are included in the sale.

Staggered-width 17″ sawblade alloy wheels are mounted with 275/40 front and 315/35 rear Nitto NT555 RII tires that have 2020 and 2021 production-date codes. Braking is handled by an anti-lock disc at each corner. Van Steel adjustable coilovers have been fitted up front, and the matching uninstalled rears are included in the sale along with the removed Bilstein front shocks.

The power-adjustable sport bucket seats are upholstered in Ruby Red leather with 40th Anniversary headrest embroidery. The door panels are trimmed to match, and additional appointments include air conditioning, an onboard computer, cruise control, a tire-pressure warning system, power windows and locks, and a Delco Bose Gold Series sound system with CD and cassette players.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central digital speedometer and fuel-level readout flanked by an analog tachometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and voltage. The digital odometer indicates 24k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.

The LT5-based 32-valve V8 was modified by Lingenfelter Performance Engineering (LPE) in 2016 with steel four-inch-bore cylinder liners, a larger throttle body, a stroker crankshaft, and custom pistons and connecting rods as well as ported and polished cylinder heads. The resultant displacement is 415c, and LPE rated the output at 610 horsepower.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential. A Stainless Works exhaust system is in place.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Bob Smith Chevrolet in Louisville, Kentucky, factory colors and equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $67,478. A Lingenfelter Certificate of Authenticity notes their delivery date of October 26, 2016.
The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries.

This 2002 Ford Excursion Limited is powered by a 7.3-liter Power Stroke turbodiesel V8 with ECU tuning software, an aFe cold air intake, a 4″ exhaust system, and upgraded fuel injectors while shifting is through a modified four-speed automatic transmission mated to a dual-range transfer case and a limited-slip rear differential. A Rough Country 4″ suspension lift kit and dual-shock steering stabilizer have also been installed along with a revised power steering box, upgraded brakes, aftermarket front and rear bumpers, and more as detailed below. Finished in black over two-tone Medium Parchment leather, the truck is further equipped with 16″ polished alloy wheels, Warn manually locking front hubs, tow mirrors, and running boards as well as heated and power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, and a Boss touchscreen head unit. Acquired by the current owner in 2019, this modified turbodiesel Excursion has 275k miles and is now offered at no reserve on dealer consignment with manufacturer’s literature, a Haynes repair manual, a Deluxe Marti report, a Carfax report, and a clean Oregon title.

The truck left the factory finished in Black Clearcoat and is believed to have been repainted during time with a previous owner. Aftermarket front and rear bumpers with LED lights, recovery hooks, and receiver hitches have been installed, and additional exterior details include an aftermarket vented hood, a brush guard, tinted glass, power-adjustable tow mirrors, running boards, rear parking sensors, and a split tailgate with a rear window wiper. The Carfax report contains a September 2010 entry that describes “minor damage” to the front of the truck, while “minor damage” to the left-rear area of the truck is recorded in a November 2019 entry. Blemishes noted by the selling dealer include imperfections in the window tinting film as well as dents on the hood, roof, and left side of the truck.

Polished 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 285/75 Dean Back Country Mud Terrain tires. A Rough Country 4″ suspension lift kit comprised of front leaf springs, rear blocks, and six shocks has been installed along with a dual-shock steering stabilizer kit, an aftermarket power steering box, and upgraded sway bars. Braking is handled by upgraded red-finished calipers mounted over cross-drilled and slotted rotors at each wheel, and the truck is equipped with Warn manually locking front hubs. The tie rods and ball joints are said to have been replaced under current ownership.

The heated and power-adjustable front captain’s chairs feature Limited embroidery on the backrests and are trimmed in two-tone Medium Parchment leather that extends to second- and third-row bench seats. Faux woodgrain trim accents the center console and door panels, and amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, seat-position memory settings, power-adjustable pedals, and an overhead console with a trip computer, rear climate control knobs, and fold-down storage compartments. A Boss touchscreen head unit, a Uniden CB radio, and an electronic trailer brake controller have been installed. The overhead rear-seat DVD entertainment system is inoperative. Photos provided in the gallery show cracks and tears in the upholstery on the driver’s armrest, second-row bench, and both front seats.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 3,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil pressure, transmission temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 275k miles, approximately 90k of which were added by the current owner. The ABS warning light comes on intermittently.

The 7.3-liter Power Stroke turbodiesel V8 has been fitted with 15-mode ECU tuning software as well as an in-cab touchscreen display that provides readouts and configurable settings for various engine-performance parameters. Additional modifications installed under current ownership include the following parts:
The water pump has reportedly been replaced under current ownership.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission, an electronically shifted dual-range transfer case, and a limited-slip rear differential with 3.73:1 gearing. Modifications to the transmission include a triple-disc torque converter, an aftermarket pan, an upgraded oil cooler, and steel valve bodies.

The Deluxe Marti report shows a build date of April 25, 2002, as well as initial delivery to Walnut Creek Ford of Walnut Creek, California and lists factory colors, equipment, and options alongside production statistics. Manufacturer’s literature and a Haynes repair manual are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report contains the aforementioned damage reports and lists history in California and Oregon since new.
listing_details: Rough Country Lift Kit & Steering Stabilizer

description: This 2006 Porsche 911 Carrera cabriolet is a Canadian-market example that has 94k kilometers (~58k miles) following registration history in British Columbia. Finished in Seal Grey Metallic over black leather, the car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono Package Plus, a black soft top, 19″ Carrera Classic wheels, bi-xenon headlights, heated front seats, automatic climate control, and a Sony touchscreen head unit. The car runs and drives, though the selling dealer notes that there are metal particles in the oil filter. This 997.1 cabriolet is now offered in Canada by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual, service records, and a clean British Columbia registration.

The car is finished in Seal Grey Metallic (6B4) and features include a black convertible soft top, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers, and a speed-activated rear spoiler. The Canadian Carfax report is viewable in the gallery, and it lists collisions involving the left side in September 2008, the right rear corner in May 2012, the left rear corner in November 2015, and the right rear corner in August 2019. Wear is noted on the soft top.

The 19″ Carrera Classic wheels show curb marks and are mounted with Michelin Pilot 4S tires. Braking is handled by four-piston monoblock calipers over vented and cross-drilled discs. The car is equipped with Porsche Stability Management (PSM), an automatic brake differential (ABD), and Anti Slip Regulation (ASR). The rear control arm bushings were replaced in November 2020.

The replacement heated front seats were fitted some time ago, and they are upholstered in black leather. Their power-adjustment functions do not work. Amenities include the Sport Chrono Package Plus, a Sony touchscreen head unit, a Bose sound system, a wind deflector, and cruise control. The climate control knobs are worn.

The steering wheel frames a central tachometer and a 330-km/h speedometer along with gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The airbag light is illuminated. The digital odometer indicates 94k kilometers (~58k miles).

The 3.6-liter M96 flat-six was factory rated at 325 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque. The crankshaft position sensor and spark plugs were replaced in September 2022, and work in April 2023 included replacing the water pump, thermostat, drive belt, ignition coils, and pulleys. The oil was changed in May 2024, and the selling dealer notes that metal particles were present in the removed oil filter.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage. The Canadian Carfax report is viewable in the gallery, and it lists the aforementioned collisions.
The vehicle is being sold on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 2003 Honda S2000 has been registered in California from new. It is finished in Grand Prix White over tan leather and is powered by a 2.0-liter VTEC inline-four linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, Zeal coilovers, a K&N air-intake system, a black convertible soft top, xenon headlights, a Skunk2 Racing shift knob, a Kenwood CD stereo, air conditioning, and cruise control. This AP1 S2000 has 81k miles and is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a spare wheel and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Grand Prix White (NH-565) and features a power-operated black soft top with a glass rear window. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, roll hoops, and dual exhaust outlets. The Carfax report indicates that a headlamp assembly and the front-left fender were replaced in June 2007, while “minor damage” to the front is noted in a September 2022 entry. Separation and a repaired tear are present on the soft top, and a dent is present on the right rocker panel.

Factory 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels show curb marks and are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza RE970AS Pole Position tires. The car features double-wishbone suspension and four-wheel disc brakes. Zeal coilovers have been fitted, and the brake fluid was changed in June 2024. A spare wheel is included in the sale.

The seats are upholstered in tan leather, and the cabin features color-coordinated door panel inserts and carpeting. Amenities include push-button ignition, air conditioning, cruise control, a Kenwood CD stereo, a wind deflector, and a Skunk2 Racing shift knob.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a digital speedometer and a bar-style tachometer with an 8,900-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 81k miles.

The 2.0-liter VTEC F20C inline-four was factory rated at 240 horsepower and 153 lb-ft of torque, which is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It has been outfitted with a K&N air-intake system, and work in June 2024 included an oil change and replacing the battery, air filter, and cabin filter.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the S2000 when it was new? Click here to check out their August 1999 Road Test.

This 1964 International Harvester Scout 80 has been refinished in green over black vinyl and is powered by a 152ci inline-four linked to a three-speed manual transmission and a twin-stick dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes a Softopper black soft top, black 15″ wagon-style wheels, a roll bar, a center console, and a rear bench seat. Acquired by the current owner in 2023, this Scout 80 is offered at no reserve on dealer consignment in Georgia with an Oklahoma title.

The truck was refinished in green under previous ownership and features a Softopper black soft top with roll-up sides as well as a mesh grille, a folding windshield, removable doors, a drop-down tailgate, and a tow ball. The selling dealer notes that the indicators illuminate but do not flash. Open mounting holes are pictured along with other blemishes in the gallery below.
Black 15″ wagon-style wheels are mounted with 235/75 Goodyear Wrangler tires. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs and braking is handled by four-wheel drums.

The low-back front bucket seats are trimmed in black vinyl while the rear bench is upholstered in beige vinyl. Appointments include manual crank windows, a roll bar, a center console, a lockable glovebox, and a heater and defroster. Rust is present in the passenger footwell.

The four-spoke steering wheel fronts inoperative instrumentation including an 80-mph speedometer and a combination gauge with readouts for coolant temperature and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 62k miles, though the total mileage is unknown.
The 152ci inline-four is equipped with a single-barrel carburetor and was factory rated at 93 horsepower and 143 lb-ft of torque.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a three-speed manual transmission and a twin-stick dual-range transfer case. Corrosion is visible on the underside, additional photos of which are provided in the gallery.
The current Oklahoma title carries a “Classic” brand.

This 1978 Chevrolet Corvette is one of approximately 6,502 Pace Car Edition examples produced to commemorate the model’s use as the pace car for the 1978 running of the Indianapolis 500. It is powered by a 350ci L82 V8 paired with a four-speed manual transmission and is finished in Black and Silver over Silver leather upholstery. The car is equipped with a Positraction differential, 15″ eight-slot alloy wheels, removable glass roof panels, a Delco push-button AM/FM radio, a CB radio, power windows, and air conditioning. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2017, and it was awarded by the National Corvette Restorers Society two years later. Now showing 30k miles, this special-edition C3 Corvette is offered in Texas with owner’s manuals, NCRS documents, spare keys, and a Pennsylvania title.

The 1978 Corvette featured a revised fastback roofline with wraparound rear glass, and all Pace Car examples were finished in two-tone Black (19) and Silver (47) with a red stripe below the blend line. Exterior equipment includes removable glass T-top roof panels, Pace Car graphics, pop-up headlights, front and rear spoilers, side marker lights, fender air vents, and quad taillights. Close-up photos showing blemishes in the finish are provided in the gallery below.

The 15″ eight-slot alloy wheels are wrapped in 225/60 Goodyear GT Radial white-outline tires that have 2017 production-date codes. Braking is handled by four-wheel power-assisted discs, and the calipers were reportedly replaced in 2019.

The bucket seats are trimmed in Silver leather (152) and are accompanied by a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, door panels, and carpeting. Additional appointments include Delco AM/FM and CB radios, power windows, a rear window defogger, and air conditioning.

The tilt-adjustable, leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer and a 7k-rpm tachometer. A clock and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level are located in the center stack. The five-digit odometer shows 30k miles, approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership.

The 350ci L82 V8 is equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and an aluminum intake manifold and was factory rated at 220 horsepower and 260 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a Positraction differential.
The car earned a National Corvette Restorers Society Top Flight Award in 2019. The scoring summary can be viewed in the gallery.
The car’s Pennsylvania title carries a “Classic” brand.

This 2002 BMW 325i sedan remained registered in California with the original owner until the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024 and now has 71k miles. The car is powered by a 2.5-liter inline-six paired with a five-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over gray leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes 16″ Style 45 alloy wheels, fog lights, a sunroof, dual exhaust outlets, Myrtle wood trim, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This E46 325i sedan is now offered in Pennsylvania at no reserve with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a California title.
The car is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic and features fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a sunroof, and dual exhaust outlets. The front bumper cover has dings and paint chips.

The 16″ Style 45 alloy wheels are mounted with 205/55 Bridgestone Ecopia tires. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) with all-season traction control. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features front seats upholstered in gray leather as well as a color-matching lower dashboard, center console, door panels, and carpets. Interior amenities include Myrtle wood trim, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer and a tachometer as well as gauges for coolant temperature, fuel level, and instant fuel economy. The digital odometer indicates 71k miles.
The 2.5-liter M54B25 inline-six was factory rated at 184 horsepower and 175 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The window sticker notes initial delivery to Crevier BMW of Santa Ana, California, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $33,645.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1975 Honda GL1000 Gold Wing was reportedly refurbished circa 2015, and it was acquired by the seller in 2023. Refinished in blue with gold accents, the motorcycle is powered by a liquid-cooled 999cc SOHC flat-four mated to a five-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft. It is also equipped with an electric starter, a removable kick starter, four Keihin carburetors, a four-into-two exhaust system, an under-seat fuel tank, wire-spoke wheels, triple disc brakes, chrome-finished fenders, locking storage compartments, and both center and side stands. The battery and the fuel filter were changed in March 2024. This GL1000 is offered at no reserve with a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The faux fuel tank, radiator shrouds, and side covers were reportedly refinished in blue with tri-color pinstripes and gold-tone badging as part of the refurbishment. The bike is equipped with a five-gallon fuel tank located beneath the two-up seat, and additional features include a rear grab bar, chrome-finished fenders, and both center and side stands.

Wire-spoke wheels measuring 19″ up front and 17″ out back are mounted with Shinko and Dunlop tires, respectively. Suspension consists of an air-adjustable 37mm fork in addition to preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm on the left and the final drive enclosure on the right. Braking is from dual-piston calipers mounted over twin discs up front along with a single-piston caliper and a single disc out back.

The chrome handlebar carries a pair of chrome-finished round mirrors, and it is mounted aft of a green-dial Nippon Seiki 150-mph speedometer, a matching tachometer with a faded 8,500-rpm redline and an inset coolant temperature gauge, and an indicator light panel containing the keyed ignition switch. The five-digit odometer shows 16k miles, approximately 500 of which were added by the seller.

The liquid-cooled 999cc SOHC flat-four features an electric starter and a removable kick starter in addition to belt-driven camshafts, a counter-rotating alternator to offset crankshaft torque, and a black-finished four-into-two exhaust system with chrome shields and muffler tips. According to the seller, the carburetors were serviced, the timing belts were replaced, the valves were adjusted, and the fluids were changed as part of the refurbishment under previous ownership. Work in March 2024 is said to have included changing the battery, oil, and fuel filter.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and a driveshaft enclosed within the right leg of the swingarm.

This 1982 Mercedes-Benz 300SD was registered with one owner in Wisconsin through 2021, and it was refurbished by Woods & Barclay of Roswell, Georgia, before it was acquired by its current owner in 2022. Now showing 95k miles, the car is finished in Champagne Metallic over Brazil Brown leather, and it has a sunroof, an automatic antenna, 14″ alloy wheels, power windows, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Becker cassette stereo. This W126 300SD is now offered at no reserve on dealer consignment in New Jersey with a clean Carfax report and a clean New Hampshire title in the owner’s name.

The metallic finish is contrasted by pinstripes, dark lower cladding, and anodized aluminum trim. The selling dealer notes that the right-rear quarter panel has been refinished, and paint-meter readings around the vehicle are shown in the gallery below.
The 14″ Bundt alloy wheels are mounted with 205/70 Firestone All Season tires. Bilstein shock absorbers are noted, and braking is handled by four-wheel discs.

The seats are upholstered in Brazil Brown leather over color-keyed carpets, and wood trim accents the cabin, which has an electric sunroof, power windows, automatic climate control, cruise control, sisal floor mats, and a Becker Grand Prix cassette stereo.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 125-mph speedometer, a 6k-rpm tachometer, an analog clock, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 95k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.0-liter OM617A turbodiesel inline-five was factory rated at 123 horsepower and 184 lb-ft of torque.
Ziebart undercoating is noted by the selling dealer, and additional photographs of the underside are shown at the end of the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2011 Jaguar XJ is finished in Polaris White over London Tan leather and now has 30k miles. Power is supplied by a 5.0-liter V8 linked with a six-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes the Luxury Package, a panoramic sunroof, xenon headlights, parking sensors, a rear-view camera, 19″ Aleutian alloy wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated and ventilated rear seats, navigation, and a Bowers & Wilkins sound system. This X351 XJ was listed on BaT in May 2024 and is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a Pennsylvania title.

The car is finished in Polaris White and features a power-operated dual-pane sunroof, xenon headlights, parking sensors, heated power-folding side mirrors, LED taillights, and a power-operated trunk lid. Imperfections are visible on the front bumper.

The 19″ Aleutian alloy wheels wear 245/45 front and 275/40 rear Continental ProContact tires with 2019 date codes. The car rides on an Adaptive Dynamics suspension system with electronically controlled dampers, and braking is provided by four-wheel discs.

The heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats and heated and ventilated rear seats are upholstered in London Tan leather, which extends to the center console and door panels. Amenities include a rear-view camera, front seat massage functionality, navigation, a CD stereo, a Bowers & Wilkins sound system, a power-operated rear sunshade, and four-zone climate control. The seller states that sticky dash buttons have been repaired.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a TFT Virtual Instrument Panel that displays a 170-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 30k miles.
The 5.0-liter AJ Gen III V8 was factory rated at 385 horsepower and 380 lb-ft of torque. An oil change and coolant flush were performed in February 2024.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a ZF six-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1994 Ford Mustang SVT Cobra convertible is #105 of 1,000 examples built to commemorate the Mustang’s selection as the pace car for the 1994 Indianapolis 500, and it shows 5k miles. The car is powered by a 302ci V8 paired with a five-speed manual transmission and is finished in Rio Red Tinted Clearcoat with a Saddle convertible soft top over Saddle leather upholstery. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, a rear spoiler, fog lights, a cassette stereo, and air conditioning. This Mustang SVT Cobra convertible Pace Car Edition was listed on BaT in May 2024 and is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a clean Carfax report and a clean Pennsylvania title.

All Indy 500 Cobra Pace Car replicas were finished in Rio Red Tinted Clearcoat (E8) and equipped with a power-operated Saddle soft top as well as the Indy 500 Pace Car Replica Package. Exterior features include a rear wing, Cobra badging, fog lights, fender vents, and dual exhaust outlets. Paint meter readings from around the car are presented in the gallery below.
The 17″ cast aluminum five-spoke wheels are mounted with 255/45 Goodyear Eagle GS-C tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel anti-lock disc brakes with Cobra-branded front calipers.

The cabin features articulated front seats upholstered in Saddle leather, with embroidered Indy-500 winged-tire logos accenting the backrests. Interior amenities include dual front airbags, a cassette stereo, Cobra-branded floor mats, and air conditioning that was serviced in 2023.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5,800-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, voltage, oil pressure, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 5k miles.
The 302ci V8 features electronic fuel injection and GT40 cylinder heads for a factory rating of 240 horsepower and 285 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in May 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a T5OD five-speed manual transmission and a Traction-Lok limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

attributes.value: Mustang SVT Cobra Convertible Pace Car 5-Speed

description: This 2010 Ford Mustang GT coupe is powered by a Roush-supercharged 4.6-liter V8 paired with a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and finished in Torch Red over Charcoal Black leather upholstery. Features include polished 18″ alloy wheels, heated front seats, Ford SYNC infotainment, a Shaker audio system, a power driver’s seat, air conditioning, cruise control, and all-season rubber floor mats. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2024, and it was subsequently listed on BaT in May 2024. This S197 Mustang has 16k miles and is now offered at no reserve in Pennsylvania with a clean Carfax report and a clean Idaho title.

The car is finished in Torch Red and equipped with a rear spoiler, GT badging, gray lower body cladding, fog lights, sequential LED taillights, polished exhaust outlets, and power-adjustable side mirrors. Paint meter readings from around the body are presented in the gallery below.
Polished 18″ alloy wheels are mounted with 235/50 Pirelli P Zero Nero tires. The car is equipped with electronic stability control and stopping power is provided by vented four-wheel discs.

The heated front bucket seats and split-folding rear bench are trimmed in Charcoal Black leather upholstery and amenities include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, Ford SYNC infotainment, a Shaker audio system, keyless entry, air conditioning, cruise control, a striped shifter knob, and all-season rubber floor mats.
The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 16k miles.
The 4.6-liter V8 was fitted with a Roush M90 supercharger, intake manifold, air-to-water intercooler system, and high-flow induction system and fuel injectors under prior ownership.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1965 Ford F-100 is a Flareside 4×4 pickup that was sold new in December 1964 from Clayt and Don Hill Limited in Canada. It underwent a cosmetic refurbishment in the 1990s under prior ownership that involved performing bodywork, installing fiberglass fenders, and repainting it in blue-green. The truck was later acquired by the seller in 2018 and is powered by a 300ci inline-six mated to a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Further equipment includes 15″ steel wheels, Warn manually locking front hubs, drum brakes, chrome bumpers, and a wood bed floor with metal runners as well as a bench seat upholstered in white and green vinyl, vent windows, and a heater. This F-100 Flareside is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, shop manuals, spare parts, partial service records, and Ontario registration in the seller’s name.

Finished from the factory in Twilight Turquoise (M), the truck was repainted as part of the aforementioned refurbishment under prior ownership. Fiberglass fenders have been fitted, and further details include a Flareside bed, dual side mirrors, chrome-finished bumpers, front tow hooks, and a wood bed floor with metal runners. Split boards in the bed along with paint chips on various body panels are noted.

White-finished 15″ steel wheels are mounted with 31×10.5″ Kelly Safari MSR tires. The front axle is equipped with Warn manually locking hubs, and braking is handled by unassisted drums at all four corners.

The bench seat was upholstered in white and green vinyl under prior ownership. A heater, vent windows, sun visors, and a rubberized floor covering are further details. The left vent window lock is not installed but is included in the sale.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 75k miles, approximately 4k of which have been added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The 300ci inline-six is equipped with a single carburetor and was factory rated at 170 horsepower and 283 lb-ft of torque. An oil leak is noted.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
Partially decoding the chassis tag shown above reveals the following information:
The truck’s full chassis number is “6831020L4214481A”. The Ontario registration lists the VIN as “FL0214481”, and a redacted copy of the document is viewable in the gallery below.
The truck does not have a title and is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada.

This 2003 Honda XR650R is powered by a liquid-cooled 649cc SOHC four-stroke single mated to a five-speed transmission and features red plastic bodywork mounted over an aluminum frame. Additional equipment includes a red and black vinyl solo seat, a skid plate, trail lighting, white number plates, hand guards, and wire-spoke wheels with 21″ and 18″ D.I.D alloy rims as well as front and rear disc brakes, adjustable Kayaba suspension, a kick starter, a Keihin carburetor, dual exhaust ports, and a side stand. The bike remained with its second California owner for approximately 19 years before the seller acquired it in 2024. This XR650R is now offered at no reserve in California for off-road use only with a bill of sale.

The red plastic bodywork wears black and yellow decals and is mounted over an aluminum frame. The bike is equipped with white front and side number plates as well as a 2.6-gallon fuel tank, a red and black vinyl solo seat, a skid plate, a headlight and taillight, spring-loaded serrated foot pegs, and a side stand. The seller notes scratches on the skid plate and plastics.

Wire-spoke wheels with D.I.D alloy rims measuring 21″ up front and 18″ out back are mounted with Michelin knobby tires. Braking is handled by silver-finished calipers mounted over cross-drilled discs at both ends, while Kayaba adjustable suspension components consist of a 46mm leading-axle cartridge-type fork with black accordion gaiters as well as a remote-reservoir monoshock fitted to the box-section swingarm via a Pro-Link linkage. Blemishes are noted on the fork lowers.

The silver-finished cross-braced handlebar is fitted with red plastic hand guards as well as clutch and compression-release levers on the left and a twist-grip throttle and brake lever on the right. A two-digit mechanical trip meter comprises the bike’s instrumentation, therefore true mileage is unknown.

The liquid-cooled 649cc SOHC four-stroke single features a kick starter, a 42mm Keihin carburetor, CD ignition, and dual exhaust ports that feed into a black-finished high-mount exhaust system. The fluids were changed and the carburetor was cleaned in January 2024. Worn finish is visible on the engine covers.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a multi-plate wet clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a drive chain. The drive chain and sprockets have been replaced, per the seller.
The motorcycle does not have a title or registration. It being sold on a bill of sale for off-road use only.

This 1986 Honda Z50RD Christmas Special is a limited-edition model that was produced for one year only and was distributed in pairs to top Honda US dealerships. The RD is based on the Z50R, and all Christmas Special examples feature a chrome-plated finish with red, white, and blue graphics. Powered by a 49cc single paired with a three-speed transmission with an automatic clutch, the bike is equipped with chrome-finished 8″ steel wheels, a cross-braced handlebar, and a side stand. The seller purchased the bike in 2024 recent work reportedly included changing the oil, replacing the spark plug, carburetor, chain guard, hand grips, and tires, and retrimming the motocross-style seat in red vinyl. This Z50RD is offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with spare parts and a clean Indiana title.

The steel backbone frame, fenders, chassis components, and fork legs feature a chrome-plated finish, as does the 1.3-gallon fuel tank that wears red, white, and blue Honda graphics and a red “Special” decal on top. Additional details include a motocross-style solo seat with a replacement seat cover along with a front number plate, side number plates, and a side stand. Oxidation is visible on surfaces around the bike.

Multi-piece 8″ steel wheels are finished in chrome and were mounted with Bridgestone Trail Wing tires in April 2024. Braking is handled by front and rear drums, and the suspension consists of an inverted fork as well as dual shocks mounted to the swingarm.

The cross-braced chrome handlebar carries replacement red grips as well as a twist-grip throttle, ignition switch, and brake lever on the right. The bike is not equipped with instrumentation, therefore total mileage is unknown.

The horizontal 49cc four-stroke single is equipped with a replacement Keihin carburetor, a kick starter, and a high-mounted exhaust system. Service in preparation for the sale consisted of changing the oil and replacing the air filter and spark plug. The upper heatshield is missing from the exhaust.
Power is routed to the rear wheel through a three-speed transmission with an automatic clutch as well as a drive chain with a replacement black guard.

This Citroen 2CV6 was sold new in France in 1970 and subsequently brought to Canada later that year. It was acquired by the seller in 2023, and work has since involved the installation of a replacement four-speed manual transaxle, a rebuild of the carburetor, an overhaul of the brake system, a refresh of the fuel system, and replacement of the exhaust system and front floors. The car is powered by a replacement 602cc twin and is finished in Rouge Massena over red cloth. Equipment includes a black canvas top, 15″ steel wheels, and a cabin heater. This 2CV6 is now offered in Canada with the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, and British Columbia registration.

The car came finished in Rouge Massena (AC423) and was repainted in the late 1980s. Features include a black replacement canvas top, flip-up side windows, mudflaps, and round headlights. Safari-style bumper assemblies and fender extensions accompany the vehicle. Blemishes are pointed out by the seller in the gallery.
The 15″ steel wheels are mounted with 135/15 Michelin tires. The drum brakes were overhauled in 2023, including replacement of the master cylinder, shoes, wheel cylinders, hoses, and lines.
The front seats and rear bench are upholstered in red cloth, and interior appointments include front and rear seatbelts and a cabin heater.

Instrumentation includes a speedometer and readouts for fuel level and amperage. The five-digit odometer shows 63k kilometers (~39k miles), approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The 602cc twin is equipped with a single carburetor that was rebuilt in 2023. Additional work at that time involved installing a replacement exhaust system, heater hoses, fuel tank, and fuel level sending unit.

Power is sent to the front wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle, which was replaced in 2023. Replacement front floors were also installed at that time, and photos from the work are provided below.
The vehicle is being sold on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 2001 Harley-Davidson Road King was purchased by the seller in 2022, and it wears a custom finish in black with red and orange graphics that was applied under prior ownership. Powered by a fuel-injected 88ci Twin Cam V-twin paired with a five-speed transmission, the bike was further modified with LED lighting, Fat Katz and West Coast Choppers fenders, a Wild1 handlebar, Hawg Halters front brake calipers, Progressive Suspension shocks, and Andrews camshafts. Additional equipment consists of chrome 16″ alloy wheels, triple disc brakes, a chrome dual exhaust system, electronic ignition, a black solo saddle, and a side stand as well as color-matched removable travel cases. This FLHRI has 13k miles and is now offered with spare parts and accessories and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The bodywork and detachable hard-sided cases are finished in black with red and orange graphics that were painted by Joe Martin of Martin Bros. Customs in Johnson City, Texas. Bike details include a tubular chrome guard with highway pegs as well as floorboards, LED lighting, a contoured black solo saddle, a side stand, a Fat Katz front fender, and a West Coast Choppers rear fender with a recessed plate mount.

Chrome-plated 16″ cast-alloy wheels are wrapped in Avon Cobra Chrome tires. Suspension consists of a shrouded telescopic fork as well as dual Progressive Suspension adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm. The triple-disc braking system has been fitted with Edelbrock rotors and chrome Hawg Halters calipers up front.

A Wild1 Chubby handlebar is secured ahead of the tank-top console, which houses a 120-mph speedometer and a row of indicator lights and is flanked by dual fuel-filler caps. The digital odometer shows 13k miles, approximately 250 of which were ridden under current ownership.

The air-cooled 88ci Twin Cam OHV V-twin features electronic ignition, electronic sequential-port fuel injection, and a chrome dual exhaust system. Andrews TW26-series camshafts were reportedly installed under prior ownership.
Power is routed to the rear wheel through a hydraulically actuated clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a drive belt.
Two spare Saddlemen seats and a detachable windshield are included in the sale, along with a Harley-Davidson-branded motorcycle cover and a battery charger.

This 1966 Volkswagen Type 2 bus was acquired by the current owner in 2009 and was the subject of a multi-year refurbishment, which was completed in 2020.
