It is finished in green and white over gray vinyl and yellow Naugahyde upholstery and is equipped with a pop-up roof, jalousie windows, safari-style windshields,  and a Motorola AM radio, a shore power connection, and a 12-volt electrical system as well as a hand-pump windshield washer, a flat-folding rear bench seat, an insulated cooler, storage cabinets, fold-out tables, and privacy curtains. Power comes from an air-cooled 1,776cc flat-four equipped with dual carburetors and paired with a four-speed manual transaxle with gear reduction boxes. This Type 2 camper is now offered on dealer consignment with a first aid kit, a tool kit, a jack, a tent, camping equipment, manufacturer’s literature, and an Idaho title.

The 11-window body was refinished in green and white under current ownership approximately 15 years ago. Exterior details include a pop-up roof, dual side-view mirrors, a shore power connection, side steps, five jalousie windows, one pop-out window, and safari-style windshields.

Chr0me 15″ steel wheels wear matching hubcaps and are mounted with 195-series Nexen Radial SV-820 tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel drum brakes. An alignment was performed in preparation for the sale.

The forward cabin features a split bench seat trimmed in Mesh Grey vinyl upholstery joined by black carpeting and birch wood door panels. Interior elements include a parcel shelf, sliding side windows, lap belts, a hand-pump windshield washer system, and a wire basket with integrated cupholders. The Motorola push-button AM radio is disconnected.

The black two-spoke steering wheel wears an aftermarket wrap and sits ahead of an 80-mph VDO speedometer and a fuel level gauge. The tachometer and auxiliary gauges mounted in the overhead ventilation unit are not connected. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 56k miles.

Dual swing-out side doors on the right provide access to a rear cabin equipped with a flat-folding rear bench as well as a rear-facing seat, both of which are trimmed in yellow Naugahyde upholstery. Additional details include birch paneling, an insulated cooler, a faucet, storage cabinets, fold-out tables, and privacy curtains. A Coleman stove, heater, and lantern are included in the sale.

The replacement air-cooled 1,776cc flat-four was reportedly refurbished in 2013 utilizes a 12-volt electrical system and is equipped with dual Kadron-style carburetors topped with polished air cleaner bonnets as well as a degree pulley and a merged header exhaust system with a quiet pack muffler and heater boxes. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle that has reportedly been modified with a “Freeway Flyer” gearset and is equipped with gear reduction boxes.
Decoding the M plate reveals the following information:

This 1967 Pontiac Firebird convertible is finished in burgundy over a black interior and is powered by a 400ci V8 linked with a three-speed automatic transmission. The car is said to have remained with one family for more than three decades prior to the selling dealer’s 2024 acquisition. Equipment includes an Edelbrock Performer intake manifold, a black soft top, dual hood scoops, 14″ Cragar wheels, a Pioneer CD stereo, and trunk-mounted amplifiers. This Firebird is now offered with a clean Tennessee title.

The car was refinished in burgundy at some point under prior ownership and is equipped with quad round headlights, dual hood scoops, a door-mounted driver-side mirror, and a polished front grille, rear bumper, and trim. The black soft top operates slowly and requires service.
Cragar 14″ wheels are mounted with Dunlop GT Qualifier tires, and stopping is provided by drum brakes.

The cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench upholstered in black along with a color-coordinated dashboard, door panels, and carpets. A Pioneer CD stereo is linked to amplifiers housed in the trunk.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 120-mph speedometer and a fuel-level gauge. An aftermarket tachometer is mounted on the steering column, and a trio of readouts are located ahead of the shifter. The five-digit odometer shows 96k miles, approximately 50 of which were added under current ownership.

The selling dealer notes that the 400ci V8 is equipped with a revised camshaft, a Weber carburetor, an Edelbrock Performer intake manifold, and exhaust headers. Three Sunpro readouts are mounted in the engine bay.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission.
Decoding the trim tag provides the following information:

This 2015 Aston Martin V12 Vantage S coupe is powered by a 5.9-liter V12 mated to a seven-speed automated transaxle and is finished in Snow White over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes trim, tinted windows, 19″ alloy wheels, carbon-ceramic disc brakes, parking sensors, a rearview camera, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, a pop-up infotainment screen, and navigation. The car was registered in Ohio and California and was acquired by the seller in August 2021, and it was listed on BaT in December 2022. This V12 Vantage S is offered by the seller in California with a clean Carfax report and an Ohio title.

The car is finished in Snow White (AST5117H) and features a carbon-fiber front splitter, grille surround, hood and fender vents, and mirror caps. A carbon-fiber rear spoiler and front bumper cover canards were removed under current ownership. Additional equipment includes parking sensors, tinted windows, and dual exhaust outlets. Paint chips are noted on the front end.

Staggered-width 19″ split-spoke wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires that were reportedly rotated in 2023. Stopping power is provided by yellow-finished calipers over carbon-ceramic rotors at all four corners. The car is equipped with an adaptive damping system with three selectable drive modes. A close-up photo of wheel blemishes is presented in the gallery below.

The power-adjustable sport seats are trimmed in Obsidian Black leather with yellow center stripes, and carbon-fiber trim accents the center stack and door panels. Equipment includes seat memory settings, automatic climate control, a rearview camera, a pop-up infotainment screen, navigation, and a CD stereo.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames yellow-accented paddle shifters as well as a 220-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 14k miles, approximately 1k of which were added during current ownership.

The 5.9-liter V12 features quadruple overhead camshafts and was factory rated at 565 horsepower and 457 lb-ft of torque. A carbon-fiber engine cover is fitted. An oil change was performed and the wipers were replaced in January 2023. The car most recently passed a California emissions test in October 2018.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed automated transaxle and a limited-slip differential.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage, and it indicates that a duplicate Ohio title was issued in February 2022. There is currently a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid before the title can be transferred to the next owner.
The vehicle is fitted with a temporary Ohio tag that expired in October 2021.

This 1995 Ferrari F355 Berlinetta shows 26k miles, and it has been registered in Florida since October 2001. The car is finished in Rosso Corsa over Tan Connolly leather, and it is powered by a 3.5-liter DOHC V8 linked with a gated six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Features include 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels, pop-up headlights, an integrated rear decklid spoiler, a vented engine cover, a gated shifter, automatic climate control, and a CD stereo. Purchased by its current owner in April 2017, this F355 Berlinetta is now offered on dealer consignment with a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a Florida title

The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Rosso Corsa, and styling elements include pop-up headlights, integrated front fog lights, an integrated rear decklid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, a vented engine cover, and air intakes on the doors and rocker panels. According to the selling dealer, cracks on the buttresses have been repaired, and the front bumper cover has been repainted. Clear paint-protection film has reportedly been applied to the body.
The 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. Ferrari-branded brake calipers are mounted over ventilated discs at each corner.

The cabin features sport seats trimmed in Tan Connolly leather, and matching leather extends to the center console, door panel inserts, and lower half of the dashboard. Amenities include a gated shifter, automatic climate control, an AM/FM/CD stereo, carbon-fiber sill guards, and a drilled aluminum kick plate and pedals. The selling dealer notes that sticky buttons have been refinished.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer, a 10k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure and coolant temperature. Ancillary instruments in the center stack include an analog clock and gauges for fuel level and oil temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 26k miles, approximately 6k of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted 3.5-liter DOHC V8 features five valves per cylinder and dry-sump lubrication for a factory-rated output of 375 horsepower and 268 lb-ft of torque. Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. An engine-out belt service was reportedly completed in 2022, and the selling dealer indicates that the clutch was replaced and fluids exchanges were performed under current ownership.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

This 1995 Land Rover Defender 110 is a three-door left-hand-drive station wagon that was registered in France before it was cosmetically and mechanically refurbished in 2022 by Invicta Automotive Design of Manchester, England. The project involved repairing and refinishing the body and chassis, converting the roof to an Exmoor Trim soft top, and refreshing the interior in addition to overhauling the 2.5-liter 300Tdi turbodiesel inline-four, R380 5-speed manual transmission, four-wheel disc brakes, and suspension. The truck features a locking center differential, 18″ alloy wheels, inward-facing rear jump seats, Focal speakers, a Bluetooth-capable Alpine stereo, and a MOMO steering wheel. Imported to the US in December 2022, this 110 was acquired by its current owner in October 2023, and it is now offered on their behalf by the seller in Colorado with a BMIHT certificate, a commemorative book, and a clean Illinois title in the owner’s name.

The aluminum body was disassembled, repaired, and equipped with a heavy-duty soft top frame, a Puma-style hood and doors, and replacement glass, weatherstripping, hardware, and galvanized trim before the truck was refinished in Keswick Green. The frame was also media blasted, repaired, and powder-coated during the refurbishment. An Exmoor Trim PVC soft top, LED exterior lighting, an Invicta-branded sump guard, and backlit aluminum door handles are additional elements.

Finished in satin black, Lucari Solutions 18″ XTR-1 alloy wheels are wrapped in 265/60 BFGoodrich Mud-Terrain T/A KM3 tires, and a matching spare is mounted on an ORE swing-away carrier. The four-wheel disc brakes have ventilated front rotors and silver-finished calipers at each corner.

High-back bucket seats with adjustable headrests are trimmed in Ivory Nappa leather. A locking Exmoor Trim center console is fitted, and molded all-weather mats line the floors. Focal speakers are linked with a Bluetooth-capable Alpine stereo with a USB port.

A MOMO Indy steering wheel fronts a recovered dashboard and replacement instruments, and the shifters have polished aluminum knobs. The six-digit odometer shows 1,600 miles traveled since completion of the project. Total mileage is unknown.
Inward-facing rear benches are installed over synthetic teak-style flooring in the cargo area, and the seller reports that seatbelts for eight passengers are fitted.

The overhauled 2.5-liter 300Tdi turbodiesel inline-four is mated to an R380 five-speed manual transmission that was reconditioned by Hallbeck Engineering of Wrexham, Wales. A dual-range transfer case and a locking center differential complete the powertrain. A replacement fuel tank and wiring are also noted.
Underbody condition is shown further in the gallery below.
A British Motor Industry Heritage Trust certificate lists factory colors, equipment, identification numbers, and delivery from the factory to Land Rover France SAS.
Additional photos from the refurbishment process are shown at the end of the gallery.
The Carfax report has a pair of entries that list history in Florida beginning in December 2022.
The photos in the gallery were taken in 2023 before the truck was relocated to Colorado.

This 1943 Ford GPW was refurbished in the mid-2010s under prior ownership by Hammon’s Garage of Fort Worth, Texas, not long before being acquired by the current owner in May 2019. The vehicle is finished in gray with a gray soft top over gray upholstery, and U.S. Navy lettering adorns various body panels. Power is supplied by a 134ci L-head inline-four paired with a three-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Features include 16″ steel wheels, a nine-slot grille, a fold-down windshield, manual windshield wipers, a side-exit exhaust system, a rear-mounted jerrycan, a side-mounted shovel and ax, occupant-retention straps, and a keyed ignition. This GPW is now offered on dealer consignment with refurbishment and service records as well as a Pennsylvania title in the owner’s name.

Commissioned by the United States government in October 1941, the Ford GPW was built to help meet demand for the newly introduced Willys MB military vehicle. Approximately 280,000 examples were manufactured at several Ford plants during World War II. This GPW has been repainted in gray and bears black stencil graphics referencing the U.S. Navy. A canvas top with two bows has been fitted along with a shovel, an ax, a jerrycan, and grab handles.
Military-style steel wheels wear 6.00-16 Ford Motor Company–branded tires, and a matching spare is attached at the rear. Braking is handled by four-wheel drums.

The open interior houses individual front seats and a rear bench trimmed in gray cloth, while the floors are covered in matching paint. Appointments include occupant-retention straps, instructional placards, a glove compartment, and rear storage cubbies. The push-button starter was replaced with a keyed ignition under prior ownership.

A three-spoke steering wheel sits ahead of a 60-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel level, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and amperage. The five-digit odometer shows less than 200 miles, with actual mileage unknown.

The carbureted 134ci Go-Devil L-head inline-four features a downdraft carburetor and operates in conjunction with a six-volt electrical system. The battery was replaced in 2019, and the points and condenser were replaced in 2020.
A three-speed manual transmission routes power to the rear or all four wheels through a dual-range transfer case. The clutch was freed up in September 2023.
The Pennsylvania title carries an “Antique” brand.

This 2005 Ferrari F430 is finished in Rosso Corsa over Beige Tradizione leather and is powered by a 4.3-liter DOHC V8 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. It was optioned with a Hi-Fi sound system, power-adjustable seats, and a leather-trimmed headliner and rear parcel shelf. Additional equipment includes an electronically controlled limited-slip differential, 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels, cross-drilled brake rotors, carbon-fiber interior trim, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the current owner on BaT in October 2019, this F430 has just over 8,500 miles and is offered on dealer consignment in Utah with an owner’s manual, a luggage set, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.
The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Rosso Corsa and features xenon headlights, heated side mirrors, and quad exhaust tips exiting on either side of the rear diffuser.
The 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DW Tuned tires. Stopping power is provided by black-finished brake calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors.

Beige Tradizione leather covers the power-adjustable bucket seats and extends to the center console, headliner, rear parcel shelf, and door panels. Amenities include air conditioning, drilled aluminum pedals, and a Hi-Fi sound system with a subwoofer. Cavallino Rampante-embossed headrests and carbon-fiber trim are additional appointments.

The three-spoke steering wheel is equipped with an engine-start button as well as a manettino dial for control of dynamic settings. Instrumentation includes a central tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline as well as a 220-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates just over 8,500 miles, a handful of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted 4.3-liter F136 V8 features Bosch Motronic engine management and a dry-sump lubrication system. Factory-rated output was 483 horsepower and 343 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and an electronically controlled limited-slip differential. An oil change was carried out in preparation for the sale.
Ferrari-branded luggage will accompany the car.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1969 Plymouth GTX hardtop underwent a custom build under prior ownership in 2010 by Trans Am Specialties of Florida, and it is powered by an SRT-10 Viper-sourced 8.3-liter V10 that is fitted with a Paxton Novi supercharger and mated to a six-speed manual transmission. Finished in blue with a black vinyl roof, the car is also equipped with black Viper-sourced seats, Stewart-Warner gauges, a Pioneer Bluetooth head unit, air conditioning, Wilwood cross-drilled disc brakes, coilover suspension, and MagnaFlow mufflers. This modified GTX was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023 and is now offered with a clean Florida title.

The car was repainted blue as part of the 2010 build and features a black vinyl roof, a bright grille, quad HID headlights, chrome bumpers, GTX and Viper badging, dual side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets.

Aftermarket 18″ wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Wilwood cross-drilled disc brakes have been added with six-piston calipers up front. Other details include a Magnum Force four-link suspension and coilovers all around.

The front bucket seats were sourced from a Dodge Viper and are trimmed in black leather with microfiber inserts. Amenities include a Pioneer Bluetooth stereo, a custom sound system, Viper-branded floor mats, a custom shift knob, and air conditioning.

The dashboard has been replaced and hosts rocker switches and Stewart-Warner gauges including a 160-mph speedometer and 8k-rpm tachometer. The six-digit odometer shows 10,500 miles, and true chassis mileage is unknown.

The 8.3-liter V10 was sourced from an SRT-10 Viper and has been fitted with a Paxton Novi supercharger. Other features include a methanol injection system as well as various cooling and fuel system upgrades. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission also sourced from the donor Viper. A Dana 60 rear axle is said to be fitted. The custom exhaust features tubular headers and MagnaFlow mufflers.
Several photos of the build process have been provided by the selling dealer, who notes that the chassis was reinforced during the build.

This 1998 Dodge Viper GTS is #47 of 100 GT2 Championship Edition coupes built during a single model year to commemorate Chrysler’s winning of the 1997 FIA GT2 championship and a class victory in the 1998 24 Hours of Le Mans. The current owner purchased the car new and it now has 3,600 miles. It is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Stone White Clearcoat with blue stripes over black and blue leather. The car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 18″ BBS wheels, and projector-style headlights. This Viper GT2 is now offered on dealer consignment with manufacturer’s literature, a car cover, two model cars, an accident-free Carfax report ,and a clean New York title.

Championship Edition models received GTS-R badging along with a factory aero package including a front splitter, ground-effect side skirts, and a fixed rear wing. The Stone White Clearcoat body features blue stripes, and other exterior details comprise projector-style headlights, fog lights, a vented hood, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. The rear hatch struts were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The 18″ BBS alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot SX tires measuring 275/35 up front and 335/30 out back. The right-rear wheel has curb marks. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs, and a brake fluid flush was performed in June 2024.

The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather with blue inserts along with a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, door panels, and handbrake handle. Additional equipment includes Oreca racing harnesses, adjustable pedals, power windows, and dual airbags.
A plaque affixed to the gear selector surround indicates this as chassis #47 of Championship Edition examples built.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. Auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage are mounted atop the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 3,600 miles.

The 8.0-liter OHV V10 features a low-restriction air cleaner and was factory rated at 460 horsepower and 500 lb-ft of torque in GT2 Championship specification. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T-56 six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report notes at least one recall.

This 1995 Nissan 240SX SE is powered by a 2.4-liter inline-four paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Ruby Pearl over blue-green moquette cloth. Features include 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, disc brakes, front and rear spoilers, fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, an AM/FM/cassette stereo, cruise control, air conditioning, and front bucket seats. The car was registered in California through 2022 and was purchased by the selling dealer in 2024. This S14 240SX has 217k miles and is now offered in South Dakota at no reserve with a clean Arizona title.

Debuting for the 1995 model year, the second generation of the 240SX carried over the rear-drive platform of its predecessor and featured updated body styling. This example was originally finished in Ruby Pearl (AL0), and the selling dealer notes that it has been repainted. Features include a power antenna, front and rear spoilers, fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets. Scratches and door dings are present, and the bumper paint has faded.
The 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 205/55 Continental ControlContact tires, and braking is handled by power-assisted discs at each corner.

The 2+2 cabin is trimmed in blue-green moquette cloth with color-coordinated door panels, and interior equipment includes front bucket seats, an AM/FM/cassette stereo, a rear window defogger, cruise control, air conditioning, and power windows and locks.

The three-spoke steering wheel is mounted on a tilting column and frames a 120-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The six-digit odometer shows 217k miles, approximately 1,400 of which were added under current ownership.
The 2.4-liter KA24DE DOHC inline-four was factory rated at 155 horsepower and 160 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed approximately 1,300 miles ago. An oil leak is noted, as is rough idle when cold.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage.

This 1976 Triumph TR6 was refurbished under previous ownership and was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024. It is finished in British Racing Green over tan vinyl and is powered by a 2.5-liter inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a body-color removable hardtop, a black soft top, dual Zenith-Stromberg carburetors, front disc brakes, 15″ steel wheels, a luggage rack, a cabin heater, and an AM/FM radio. This TR6 is offered by the selling dealer with a clean Utah title.

The car is finished in British Racing Green with white pinstripes and Union Jack decals. Exterior details include a body-color removable hardtop, a black soft top, a tan top boot, a front chin spoiler, a door-mounted driver mirror, a Le Mans-style fuel filler cap, a luggage rack, US-specification bumpers, and quad exhaust outlets with polished finishers.

Silver 15″ steel wheels with polished trim rings are mounted with 185-series Michelin Redline tires. Braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums. The tie rod ends and bushings were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The foam padding of the bucket seats was replaced under previous ownership before reinstalling the factory seat tan vinyl covers. Replacement carpets line the floors, and additional appointments include a cabin heater, a locking glove box, and an AM/FM radio. Rubber floor mats are included in the sale.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a wood-veneer dashboard that houses a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 38k miles.
The 2.5-liter inline-six features dual Zenith-Stromberg carburetors and was factory rated at 101 horsepower and 128 lb-ft of torque. A custom dual exhaust system was installed in 2022.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.

This 1968 Ford Thunderbird was reportedly sold new in Pennsylvania and remained with its first owner until 2003, and it was relocated to Ontario, Canada, under current ownership. Powered by a 429ci “Thunder Jet” V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission, the car has been refinished in green over black vinyl upholstery. It also features a black vinyl roof, hideaway headlights, sequential taillights, 15″ wheels, air conditioning, crank windows, and a Philco AM radio. This Thunderbird shows 27k miles and is offered on dealer consignment in Ontario, Canada, with Ontario registration.

The car left the factory finished in Highland Green (R), and the selling dealer states that it was repainted under current ownership. Exterior details include a driver-side mirror, sequential taillights, and a black “Alligator-Grain” vinyl roof with landau bars. The vacuum system for the hideaway headlights was reportedly rebuilt under current ownership.

The 15″ wheels are mounted with 215/75 Goodyear Assurance All-Season front tires and Futura 855 rear tires. Stopping power is provided by power-assisted front disc brakes and rear drum brakes. The selling dealer states that the braking and power-steering systems were overhauled and the suspension bushings were replaced under current ownership.
The front bucket seats and the rear bench seat are trimmed in black vinyl. Appointments include air conditioning, crank windows, and a Philco AM radio.

The two-spoke steering wheel sits ahead of a woodgrain-trimmed instrument panel, which contains a 120-mph speedometer, a clock, and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 27k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The 429ci “Thunder Jet” V8 is equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and produced 360 horsepower when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission that was reportedly rebuilt under current ownership, and additional service is said to have involved adjusting the valves and replacing the radiator.
According to the selling dealer, the fuel tank and the dual exhaust system have been replaced. Photos show corrosion on various underbody components.
The vehicle does not have a title and is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada.

This 2006 Mini Cooper S convertible was first delivered to Rasmussen Mini in Portland, Oregon. It was purchased new by the seller, and it has 76k miles following registration history in Washington. Finished in Pure Silver Metallic with black hood stripes over black leatherette, the car is powered by a supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. The car is equipped with a black soft top, 16″ seven-spoke alloy wheels, grille-mounted auxiliary lights, heated front seats, a CD stereo, and air conditioning. This R52 Cooper S convertible is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, and a clean Washington title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Pure Silver Metallic with black hood stripes and features fog lights, grille-mounted auxiliary lights, heated mirrors, a hood scoop, and twin center-exit exhaust outlets. The Carfax report indicates that an accident involving another vehicle occurred in January 2007. A bumper cover was subsequently repaired, per the seller. The replacement power-retractable black convertible soft top is said to have been fitted in 2023, and it features a heated glass rear window. Imperfections are noted on the hood.

The 16″ seven-spoke wheels are mounted with Bridgestone DriveGuard tires, which show date codes from 2017. Curb marks are noted. The car is equipped with a sport suspension. The front-left wheel bearing and front brake rotors and pads were reportedly replaced in 2020.
The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in black leatherette. Equipment includes heated front seats, CD stereo, and air conditioning. The reverse sensor alert does not work.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a column-mounted 8k-rpm tachometer. A 150-mph speedometer with integrated fuel-level and coolant temperature gauges are mounted in the center of the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 76k miles.

The supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four was factory rated at 168 horsepower and 162 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the spark plugs were replaced in 2023, and the coolant overflow tank was replaced earlier this year.
Power is sent to the front wheels through a Getrag six-speed manual transaxle.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Rasmussen Mini in Portland, Oregon, along with factory equipment, colors, and a total suggested retail price of $26,500.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident.
listing_details: Pure Silver Metallic Paint w/Black Stripes

description: This 2024 Tesla Cybertruck AWD is a Foundation Series example with laser-etched badging, white interior trim, and Full Self-Driving capability. A dual-motor AWD model, it features stainless-steel bodywork, variable-ratio four-wheel steering, adaptive air suspension, 20″ Cyber wheels, heated and ventilated front seats trimmed in black Premium upholstery, front and rear touchscreens, and eight exterior cameras. The current owner purchased the truck new and has since added approximately 674 miles. This Cybertruck AWD Foundation Series is now offered with a charging cable, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Missouri title.

The Cybertruck is built with stainless-steel body panels and a unibody architecture comprised of a structural battery pack, high-strength steel, and cast aluminum subframes. This example has Foundation Series badging in addition to a power-operated front trunk, eight exterior cameras, automatic LED lighting, eight anchor points for accessories, and a full-length roof panel that is constructed with impact-resistant acoustic glass.

The composite 6′ cargo box has a storage compartment below the floor as well as LED light bars, 120- and 240-volt power outlets, and an L-track system. Buttons on the left-rear corner operate the tailgate release and the tonneau cover, which retracts into the forward bulkhead. Cargo and towing capacities are rated at 2,500 and 11,000 pounds, respectively.

The truck’s high-voltage lithium-ion battery sends power to all four wheels through a front induction motor and an AC permanent-magnet synchronous motor at the rear. The powertrain is factory rated at 593 horsepower and 525 lb-ft of torque, and maximum range is an estimated 340 miles. The variable-ratio steer-by-wire system requires less than one full turn from lock to lock, and the four-wheel disc brakes work in tandem with a regenerative braking system. Electronic stability and traction control are also provided, and the truck rides on adaptive air suspension and 20″ Cyber alloy wheels with 285/65 Goodyear Wrangler Territory RT tires.

The heated and ventilated front seats are trimmed in black Premium upholstery with white piping, and the Foundation Series specified white accents on the dashboard and door panel inserts. Other appointments include an 18.5″ front touchscreen, a 9.4” rear touchscreen, a 15-speaker sound system, heated rear seats, wireless charging pads, USB ports, and 110-volt power outlets.

The oblong steering wheel has buttons and scroll wheels instead of control stalks. The driver is aided by Full Self-Driving capability, automatic emergency braking, pedestrian detection, emergency lane departure avoidance, and eight exterior cameras. The digital odometer indicates 674 miles.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This Superformance GT40 Mk I was built by Holley Motorsports of Westfield, Indiana, in 2019 and purchased by the selling dealer in 2023. The car is powered by a Roush-built 427ci SR V8 and finished in Gulf Indigo and orange livery with #6 roundels. Equipment includes a Quaife five-speed manual transaxle, an AED Performance Holley four-barrel carburetor, ceramic-coated headers, QA1 coilovers, Wilwood four-wheel disc brakes, 15″ BRM-style wheels, fog lights, front canards, a driver-side Gurney bubble, an aluminum rear spoiler, air conditioning, and an Olthoff shifter. An oil change was performed in May 2024. This Superformance GT40 Mk I has 4,500 miles, and it is now offered with a Superformance build sheet, Manufacturer’s Statement of Origin, and Certificate of Authenticity as well as engine installation records and a Texas title.

The fiberglass body is finished in Gulf Indigo paint accented by an orange nose section and body-length stripe. Exterior equipment includes fog lights, painted front canards, dual flip-up fuel fillers, a driver-side Gurney bubble, white #6 roundels, Talbot-style mirrors, plexiglass side windows with pop-out vents, side air intakes, an aluminum rear spoiler, and a reverse light. XPel paint protection film was applied under previous ownership. The seller notes a scrape on the underside of the nose.

The 15″ BRM-style wheels feature orange centers, polished rims, and three-eared knock-off hubs. They are mounted with Avon radial tires showing 2017 date codes. The car is equipped with QA1 adjustable coilovers and Wilwood four-wheel disc brakes.

The left-hand-drive cabin features fixed-back racing seats trimmed in black suede-style upholstery with ventilation grommets, and matching upholstery extends to the center console and door-panel side pockets. Appointments include air conditioning, a push-button ignition, 12-volt power sockets, Olthoff Racing shifter, black carpets, GT40-branded floor mats, and Willans harnesses.

A Moto-Lita steering wheel is mounted to a quick-disconnect hub and fronts Smiths instrumentation that includes an 8k-rpm tachometer, a 200-mph speedometer, and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 4,500 miles, approximately 3,300 of which were added by the seller.

The 427ci Roush SR V8 was installed by the Mansfield Motor Group of Ohio. Induction comes from an AED Performance Holley four-barrel carburetor, and additional equipment includes Roush-branded valve covers and silver ceramic-coated exhaust headers. Dynamometer test results from March 2016 are provided in the gallery below, and an oil change was carried out in May 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Quaife five-speed manual transaxle.
The Superformance Certificate of Authenticity is presented above, while the Statement of Origin, build sheet, and engine installation records can be seen in the gallery.
The chassis plate is presented above. The Texas title lists the VIN as MV1N3741881ND.

This 2023 Winnebago Revel motorhome was built on a 2021 Mercedes-Benz Sprinter 2500 4×4 chassis and was acquired new by its current owner in 2022. The van is finished in Blue Gray over black vinyl upholstery and powered by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 linked to a seven-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes 17″ Method Race wheels, running boards, a rear ladder, roof-mounted solar panels, a Coleman air conditioner, and a power-operated awning. Additional features include swiveling front seats, a touchscreen infotainment system, a sleeping surface with a power-operated lift, a kitchenette, a bathroom, privacy shades, and a workstation with a removable table. This Revel is now offered on dealer consignment with manufacturer’s literature, accessories, warranty information, and a clean New Jersey title.

The extended-height body is finished in Blue Gray with black bumpers and trim. Details include fog lights, running boards, a power-operated awning with LED lighting, a rear ladder and roof rack, rooftop solar panels, and a receiver hitch fitted with a WeatherTech step. A sliding side door and rear barn doors provide access to the rear compartment, and the van has connections for water, waste disposal, and 30-amp electrical service.

Method Race 17″ alloy wheels are mounted with 245/70 BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A tires, and a spare is secured to the underside. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes. The motorhome measures approximately 19.5′ long, 10′ high, and 7’1″ wide.

The front cabin features individual swiveling seats upholstered in black vinyl accompanied by carbon-fiber-style accents on the dashboard and door panels. Amenities include power windows and door locks, automatic climate control, Distronic cruise control, a reverse-view camera, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation. Driving aids consist of blind spot monitoring as well as lane keeping, traffic sign, and active brake assists.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel sits ahead of a 130-mph speedometer, a 5k-rpm tachometer, a digital information display, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles.

The living quarters are outfitted with LED lighting, a gray rubber floor covering, privacy shades, overhead storage cabinets, USB and USB-C power ports, and residential-style power outlets. The kitchenette is equipped with a stainless-steel sink as well as electric appliances including a True Induction cooktop, a Nova Kool refrigerator and freezer, and a hydronic water heater. The dinette area also serves as a workstation and is furnished with a bench seat, a removable table, and a storage compartment that is integrated into the floor. The wet-bath-style bathroom features a shower with a tethered sprayer, a cassette toilet, a power-operated vent, and removable bamboo shelving.

A power-operated lift enables the rear sleeping surface to be raised for stowing. Amenities include of a foam mattress measuring 49″ wide and 79″ long, bump-out side panels with hinged windows, an outdoor shower connection, USB and 120-volt outlets, a roll-up rear screen door, and gear storage nets. House equipment includes a Coleman Mach air conditioner, a front power-operated ceiling vent, a lithium battery system, a Zamp solar charge controller, and Xantrex power management. Further equipment consists of 21-gallon freshwater and gray water tanks along with a control panel for the house systems.
The 3.0-liter BlueTec turbodiesel V6 was factory rated at 188 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2002 BMW M5 was first registered in Texas and relocated to Canada where it was purchased by the seller in 2022, and it now has 191k kilometers (~119k miles). The car is powered by a 4.9-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Jet Black over Silverstone and black Nappa leather upholstery. MTS Technkik Sport Series coilovers, an aftermarket head unit with Apple CarPlay, and a MOMO steering wheel have been added, and additional equipment includes 18″ Style 65 wheels, a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, fog lights, Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front seats, an M Audio system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. This E39 M5 is offered in Canada with service records, a clean Carfax report, and Alberta registration.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) with Shadowline trim and features aftermarket “angle eyes” headlights, an aftermarket rear diffuser, fog lamps, front and rear parking sensors, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, rain-sensing wipers, and quad exhaust outlets. The windshield is cracked and there is a ding on the left front wheel well. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Chrome Shadow 18″ Style 65 wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 Evo2 tires. The car features Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) with All Season Traction, and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs measuring 13.6″ and 12.9″ front and rear, respectively. MTS Technkik Sport Series coilovers and H&R wheel spacers have been added. Work performed since 2021 included changing the brake fluid and replacing the front and rear brake pads, control arms, rear brake hoses, and sway bar links.

The cabin features Silverstone and black Nappa leather covering the heated power-adjustable front sport seats, door panel inserts, center console, and lower dashboard, while carbon-fiber trim accents the upper dashboard, center console, and upper doors. An aftermarket head unit with Apple CarPlay has been added, and additional amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, a power rear sunshade, and an M Audio system. The removed factory head unit and steering wheel are included in the sale.

The three-spoke MOMO steering wheel is mounted to an aftermarket hub and fronts an M-branded 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 191k kilometers (~119k miles), approximately 12k of which were added under current ownership.

The 4.9-liter S62 V8 is equipped with individual throttle bodies and double-VANOS continuously variable valve timing. It was factory rated at 394 horsepower at 6,600 rpm and 369 lb-ft of torque at 3,800 rpm. The valve cover gaskets were replaced in 2021.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Getrag six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The exhaust muffler has been removed, and work performed in 2021 included changing the transmission fluid and replacing the output shaft seal, pinion seal, and gear selector rod.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
The vehicle is being sold on its Alberta registration, which serves as the ownership document in Alberta, Canada. The sale does not include a title.
listing_details: Silverstone and Black Nappa Leather Upholstery

description: This 1997 Chevrolet Camaro Z28 convertible was purchased new by the current owner and is one of 979 30th Anniversary Edition examples produced for the North American market. The car is powered by a 5.7-liter LT1 V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and has 2k miles. It is finished in Arctic White over Arctic White leather and is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, a White convertible soft top, a rear spoiler, a CD stereo, cruise control, power windows, and air conditioning. This Camaro Z28 convertible is now offered on dealer consignmetn with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Georgia title.

All 30th Anniversary Camaro examples were finished in Arctic White (10) with Hugger Orange stripes. Additional exterior details include a composite hood, front fog lights, an SS rear spoiler, a White convertible soft top, and black headlight surrounds.

The 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 245/45 General G-Max tires that were fitted in preparation for the sale. The car is equipped with the Performance Ride & Handling suspension. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS.

The cabin features front bucket seats upholstered in Arctic White leather with 30th Anniversary-embroidered headrests. Interior amenities include a CD stereo, cruise control, power windows, and air conditioning.

The two-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer and a tachometer as well as gauges for voltage, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 2k miles, all of which were added under current ownership.
The 5.7-liter LT1 V8 was factory rated at 285 horsepower.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker notes initial delivery to Ken Isaacs Chevrolet of Moultrie, Georgia, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total vehicle price of $29,675.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2002 Toyota 4Runner Limited is powered by a 3.4-liter 5VZ-FE V6 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is finished in Millennium Silver Metallic over Oak leather upholstery and features 16″ five-spoke aluminum wheels, a sunroof, air conditioning, cruise control, aftermarket seat heaters, an AM/FM/cassette/CD stereo, and a power rear window. The selling dealer purchased the truck in June 2024 and it now has 127k miles. This 4Runner is offered in Maryland with a clean Pennsylvania title.

The truck is finished in Millennium Silver Metallic and features a sunroof, fog lights, running boards, a roof rack, mud flaps, skid plates, and a rear window wiper. An August 2012 entry on the Carfax report notes that the vehicle was involved in an accident, though no further details are provided. The fuel cap was replaced in preparation for the sale.

The 16″ five-spoke aluminum wheels are mounted with 265/70 Michelin XLT tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums. The front brake pads, rear brake shoes, front axles, front sway bar links, and sway bar bushings were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The cabin features Oak leather upholstery on the seats along with a color-matching dash, center console, door panel inserts, and carpets while woodgrain trim adorns the center stack. Amenities include air conditioning, an AM/FM/cassette/CD stereo, cruise control, a digital clock, aftermarket seat heaters, and a power rear window. The front seat upholstery is torn and cracked in various spots.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 110-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 5,500-rpm redline, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 127k miles, approximately Less than 500 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.4-liter 5VZ-FE V6 was factory rated at 183 horsepower and 217 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The radiator was replaced in May 2024 and in preparation for the sale a replacement valve cover kit was installed, an oil change was performed, the rear axle seal was replaced, and the differential fluids were changed.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident.

This 1970 Honda CT70 Trail is an orange-finished example that is said to have undergone a refurbishment under prior ownership and is powered by a 72cc four-stroke single paired with a three-speed semi-automatic transmission. The bike has 10″ three-piece wheels, drum brakes, twist-locking folding handlebars, an inverted fork, chrome fenders, an upswept exhaust system, a side stand, and a black seat. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this CT70 Trail is now offered at no reserve with a clean Florida title.

The hollow T-bone frame is finished in orange with Honda decals. Color-matched components include the chain guard, fork and shock covers, swingarm, and headlight bucket, and the seat is trimmed in black. Additional details include a side stand, reflectors, trail lighting, and chrome fenders.

The silver 10″ three-piece wheels wear Bridgestone Trail Wing tires. Suspension consists of an inverted fork with rubber gaiters as well as dual shocks mounted to the swingarm, and braking is handled by drums at both ends.
The twist-locking folding handlebars frame a Nippon Seiki 50-mph speedometer that indicates recommended shift points. The five-digit odometer shows 151 miles.

The 72cc four-stroke single transfers power to the rear wheel through a three-speed transmission with an automatic clutch and a drive chain. A replacement battery was installed in preparation for the sale, per the seller.

This 1974 Harley-Davidson X-90 is powered by a 90cc two-stroke single paired with a four-speed transmission and is finished in black with red, white, and blue AMF/Harley-Davidson stripe decals. Equipment includes automatic oil injection, a full suspension, drum brakes, 10″ slotted steel wheels, stainless-steel fenders, trail lighting, a folding cross-braced handlebar, and a black vinyl seat. The selling dealer acquired the bike in 2024 and this X-90 showing 1,100 miles is now offered at no reserve with a clean Florida title.

The X-90 was manufactured for AMF/Harley-Davidson by the company’s Italian subsidiary Aermacchii. The 1.4-gallon fuel tank is finished in black with red, white, and blue AMF/Harley-Davidson stripe decals. Features include stainless-steel fenders, trail lighting, a left mirror, a black vinyl seat, and a side stand.
Slotted 10″ steel wheels with drum-brake hubs are mounted with Shinko tires. Suspension consists of a 28mm conventional telescopic fork and dual shocks mounted to the swingarm.
The folding cross-braced handlebar is mounted aft of an 80-mph speedometer with an inset five-digit odometer showing 1,100 miles.

The air-cooled 90cc two-stroke single was factory rated at 8 horsepower and 6 lb-ft of torque and features automatic oil injection, a 20mm Dellorto carburetor, a kick starter, and a high-mounted exhaust system with a standoff chrome guard.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a four-speed transmission and a drive chain with a black guard.

This 1982 Honda CT 110 Trail is finished in red with black and white graphics and is powered by a 105cc four-stroke single mated to a dual-range four-speed transmission with an automatic clutch. Equipment includes a kick starter, a snorkel air intake, a high-mounted exhaust system, drum brakes, 17″ wire-spoke wheels, street lighting, a quick-release swiveling handlebar, a black vinyl seat, an auxiliary fuel tank, and a luggage rack. This Trail 110 was acquired out of Pennsylvania by the seller in 2015 is now offered at no reserve with a tool kit and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The tube- and stamped-steel step-through frame is finished in red, as is the low-mounted front fender. Additional features include a 1.6-gallon fuel tank, street lighting, a black vinyl-upholstered seat, a chrome luggage rack, a removable 0.6-gallon auxiliary fuel tank, and both center and side stands.

Chrome 17″ rims are laced to black hubs with drum brakes and wrapped in older dual-purpose tires. Suspension consists of a telescopic fork with black gaiters as well as a pair of shocks mounted to the swingarm. One of the gaiters was replaced by the seller, who also changed the fork fluid.

The swiveling black handlebar carries dual mirrors and is secured by a quick-release clamp. A 60-mph Nippon Seiki speedometer that shows recommended shift points for both the high- and low-range gears is mounted in the headlight bucket. The five-digit odometer shows 3k miles, approximately 150 of which were ridden by the seller.

The horizontal 105cc SOHC single is suspended beneath the frame and protected at the front by chrome steel tubes descending to a skid plate underneath. The fuel lines and petcock were replaced by the seller who also replaced the battery in 2022 and rebuilt the carburetor in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a four-speed dual-range semi-automatic transmission with a heel/toe shifter as well as a drive chain.

This 1953 BMW R67/2 was acquired by the seller in 2001, and a subsequent eight-month refurbishment performed by Bench Mark Works of Sturgis, Mississippi, was completed in 2003 and included rebuilds of its 594cc opposed twin, four-speed transmission, and final drive as well as a repaint in black with white pinstriping. The bike is equipped with a driveshaft, a Pagusa solo saddle, a luggage rack, a hinged rear fender, a toolbox integrated atop the fuel tank, a pair of Bing carburetors, a magneto ignition system, a kick starter, and a chrome dual exhaust system with low-slung torpedo-style mufflers. This R67/2 is now offered with owner’s and repair manuals, a tool roll, refurbishment and service records, a BMW Mobile Tradition certificate, and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name.

The bike was refinished in black with white pinstriping during the refurbishment, and it features a 4.4-gallon fuel tank with black rubber knee grips and an integrated locking toolbox. The black rubber Pagusa solo saddle is adjustable for spring tension and height. Additional equipment includes a headlight, a brake light, a rear luggage rack, a center stand, and valanced fenders, the front of which features a lower stay that doubles as a front-wheel stand and the rear of which is hinged.

Interchangeable 19″ wire-spoke wheels are finished in black with silver center stripes and mounted with Heidenau K34 tires showing 2020 date codes. Suspension is handled by a conventional telescopic fork with black accordion gaiters up front as well as a pair of shrouded plunger shocks out back. Stopping power is provided by 200mm drum brakes with twin leading shoes up front and a single leading-shoe at the rear.

A chrome handlebar equipped with Magura grips and a mirror is clamped by pullback risers that frame the key-handle adjustment knob for a friction-plate damper in the steering stem. Instrumentation consists of a Veigel 120-mph speedometer and a trio of indicator lamps inset atop the headlight bucket. The five-digit odometer shows 12k miles ridden since completion of the refurbishment, though true mileage is unknown.

The 594cc opposed twin was factory rated at 28 horsepower and is equipped with a pair of 24mm Bing carburetors, a six-volt magneto ignition system, and a kick starter. The chrome low-mounted dual exhaust system features a balance pipe and torpedo-style mufflers. Service in 2023 included adjusting the valves, balancing the carburetors, and changing the oil.
The number 614201  stamped on the engine case matches the numbers stamped on the steering head plate and the left shock mount, photos of which can be viewed in the gallery.

Power is sent to the rear wheel through a single-plate dry clutch and a rebuilt four-speed transmission with an auxiliary hand shifter as well as an exposed driveshaft. The rebuilt final drive carries a 32/9 ratio according to the stamp on its housing.

The BMW Mobile Tradition certificate shows the bike as being manufactured in May 1953 and delivered to the V Harasty Corporation of Whitestone, Long Island, New York, in June of that year. Additional data includes the factory color as well as the chassis and engine serial numbers, and photos of the stampings can be viewed in the gallery.
The bike is accompanied by owner’s and repair manuals, refurbishment and service records, and a tool roll.

This 2008 Porsche Boxster S is #18 of 250 Limited Edition examples produced, all of which were finished in orange over black leather and gray Alcantara. It is powered by a 3.4-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes the Bose High-End Sound Package, a sport exhaust system, a black soft top, black 19″ Carrera S wheels, a speed-dependent rear spoiler, heated seats, bi-xenon headlights, and PCM 2.1 with extended navigation. The car has remained registered in California since new, and it now has 20k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this 987.1 Boxster S is now offered with the owner’s manual, accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in orange and features a power-operated black convertible top. Additional equipment includes black-accented quarter panel intakes, body-color roll bars, bi-xenon headlights, a speed-dependent rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets.

Black 19″ Carrera S wheels feature lighter outer rims and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires measuring 235/35 up front and 265/35 out back. The car is equipped with Porsche Stability Management (PSM), and braking is handled by four-piston Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors measuring 12.5″ and 11.8″ front and rear, respectively.

The cabin features heated seats upholstered in black leather and gray Alcantara complemented by body-color trim. Amenities include the Bose High-End Sound Package, a wind deflector, cruise control, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) 2.1 with extended navigation.
A plaque on the passenger side of the dashboard denotes the car as #18 of 250 Limited Edition examples.
The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel frames a central 8k-rpm tachometer, a 190-mph speedometer, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 20k miles.
The mid-mounted 3.4L flat-six is located ahead of the rear cargo area and was factory rated at 295 horsepower and 252 lb-ft of torque. The oil was most recently changed in June 2022.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. A sport exhaust system was equipped from the factory.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2009 Mercedes-Benz SL65 AMG has 26k miles, and it has spent most of its time registered in Texas and Arizona. Finished in Iridium Silver Metallic over quilted red leather, the car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 6.0-liter V12 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes a power-retractable hardtop, a panoramic glass roof, bi-xenon headlights, 19″ AMG split-spoke wheels, Active Body Control suspension, Keyless Go, heated and ventilated multi-contour seats, the Airscarf system, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. This R230 was previously offered by the selling dealer on BaT in May 2024 and is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manuals, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The car is finished in Iridium Silver Metallic (775) and features a power-folding convertible hardtop with a panoramic glass roof. Other equipment includes bi-xenon headlights with cornering illumination along with fog lights, fender air vents, and AMG bodywork consisting of a revised front spoiler, side skirts, and quad exhaust outlets. A ceramic coating was applied to the body in October 2022, at which time clear paint-protection film was applied to the nose.

Split-spoke 19″ AMG wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car features Active Body Control (ABC) suspension as well as an Electronic Stability Program (ESP), Automatic Slip Regulation (ASR), and an AMG High Performance Braking System with drilled and slotted rotors. The power steering and suspension fluids were flushed in August 2022, at which time the brake fluid was changed. The tire pressure monitor sensors were replaced in September 2022.

The heated, ventilated, and massaging power-adjustable multi-contour seats are upholstered in red leather with diamond-stitched inserts. Amenities include the Airscarf neck-warming system, burl walnut veneers, dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, a wind deflector, Keyless Go, and COMAND with navigation.
The leather-trimmed steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles.

The twin-turbocharged 6.0-liter M275 V12 was factory rated at 604 horsepower and 738 lb-ft of torque. Work in September 2022 included replacing the air filter, cabin filter, fuel filter, and spark plugs, while the thermostat and fuel pump were replaced in February 2023. The oil was changed in June 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission. The transmission fluid was flushed in August 2022.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

This 2007 Audi A4 cabriolet is finished in pearlescent blue over beige leather upholstery, and it has 59k miles. It was optioned with heated front seats, birch wood trim, a sport steering wheel, a Bose sound system, Audi DVD navigation, and the Convenience Package, which featured xenon headlights and auto-dimming mirrors. Power comes from a 3.2-liter V6 linked with a six-speed automatic transaxle and Quattro all-wheel drive. Acquired by its current owner in 2019, this B7 A4 is offered at no reserve on dealer consignment with the window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, two key fobs, partial service records, a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Moro Blue Pearl, and it has a bright windshield frame, auto-dimming and heated power-folding mirrors, and a blue power-operated convertible top. The selling dealer notes that a two-step paint correction was completed in preparation for the sale, and paint-meter readings around the vehicle are shown in the gallery below.
Split-spoke 18″ wheels are mounted with 235/40 Bridgestone Potenza RE980AS tires. The four-wheel disc brakes have Electronic Differential Lock traction control and 320mm ventilated front rotors.

The heated and power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in beige leather, and the four-passenger cabin has acoustic roof insulation, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Bose sound system, and an Audi navigation head unit, which was linked at the factory with a glovebox-mounted CD changer. A removable windscreen can be fitted over the rear seats.

Fitted with paddle shifters, the three-spoke steering wheel frames gray-dial instruments, and birch wood inlays accent the interior. The odometer indicates 59k miles, approximately 5k of which were added during current ownership.
The 3.2-liter V6 was factory rated at 255 horsepower and 243 lb-ft of torque.
Power is delivered to all four wheels via a Tiptronic six-speed automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system with a Torsen center differential.
The included window sticker shows initial delivery to Legend Autorama of Amityville, New York and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $54,050.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1975 Pontiac Grand Ville Brougham convertible was reportedly owned by a Pontiac employee before it was purchased by a family member of the seller in 2003 and acquired by the seller in 2011. The car is powered by a 455ci V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission and finished in Arctic Blue over blue cloth and white vinyl. Features include a power-operated white soft top, power steering, power-assisted front disc brakes, 15″ Rally II wheels, power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a vintage-look Bluetooth radio, Polk Audio speakers, and power windows, locks, and mirrors. This Grand Ville convertible is offered at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

Finished from the factory in Arctic Blue, the seller reports that a partial repaint was carried out under previous ownership and that the power-operated white soft top was replaced in the late 1980s. Exterior details include white pinstriping, chrome bumpers and trim, cornering lights, and rear fender skirts. Weathered rubber seals are noted and blemishes in the finish can be viewed in the gallery below.
The 15″ Rally II wheels are wrapped in 225/75 Hankook Optimo H724 narrow-whitewall tires. The car is equipped with power steering and braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The power-adjustable split front bench seat and rear bench are upholstered in blue cloth with white vinyl accents while woodgrain trim adorns the dashboard and door panels. Appointments include adjustable pedals, automatic climate control, cruise control, a digital clock, a vintage-look Bluetooth radio, Polk Audio speakers, and power windows, locks, and mirrors.

The three-spoke steering wheel is mounted to a tilting column and fronts a 100-mph speedometer and fuel economy gauge encircled by readouts for fuel level, coolant temperature, voltage, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer shows 27k miles, approximately 8k of which were added under current ownership.
The 455ci V8 is equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and was rated at 200 horsepower and 345 lb-ft of torque when new. The battery was replaced and the oil was changed in May 2023.
Power is delivered to rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission. Rust is visible on the underside, additional photos of which are provided in the gallery.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Schultz Bros in Algona, Iowa, along with factory colors, equipment, and a total amount of $8,079.80.

This 1988 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter flat-six paired with a G50 five-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Marine Blue Metallic over blue leather. Equipment includes a high-performance ECU chip, a high-flow air filter, a Fabspeed Maxflo exhaust system, sport suspension, 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, a power sunroof, a rear spoiler, power-adjustable front seats, air conditioning, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. The selling dealer purchased the car in 2024 and subsequent work consisted of servicing the engine, overhauling the brakes, replacing the rear window trim, and removing an aftermarket alarm system. This Carrera coupe shows 142k miles and is offered by the selling dealer in North Carolina with an owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title.

The car is finished in Marine Blue Metallic and features fog lights, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, a power sunroof, a rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers. Blemishes in the paint are noted on the roof, right fender, and right quarter panel, and paint meter readings from around the car are presented in the gallery.  The rear glass window frame was replaced under current ownership.

The 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with 205/55 front and 225/50 rear Continental DWS tires. The car was optioned with sport shocks, and braking is handled by four-wheel discs. The wheel bearings, brake rotors, and brake pads were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The power-adjustable front seats and individual rear seats are upholstered in blue leather with white piping. Appointments include air conditioning, cruise control, power windows and locks, a wood shift knob, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. An aftermarket alarm system was removed under current ownership.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer, a Quarz clock, and gauges for oil level, oil pressure, oil temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 142k miles. The horn contact plate was replaced in preparation for the sale.

The 3.2-liter M930/25 flat-six features Bosch Motronic engine management with a performance ECU chip as well as a conical high-performance air filter and a Fabspeed Maxflo exhaust system with a Euro-style pre-muffler pipe. The catalytic converter has been removed. A top-end rebuild was completed in 2010 at ~110k miles, and work in preparation for the sale consisted of replacing the crankshaft sensors and spark plugs and changing the oil.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a G50 five-speed manual transaxle. The clutch assembly was replaced in September 2010, and the left outer axle boot was replaced in March 2024.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in New York, Georgia, and Virginia
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the 911 Carrera when it was new? Click here to check out their February 1984 Road Test.

This 2014 Mercedes-Benz SL550 has been registered in California since new and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.7-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Finished in Diamond White Metallic over beige leather, the car is equipped with the Premium Package, the Driver Assistance Package, Brabus-style 20″ wheels, a Brabus-style body kit, a power-retractable hardtop, a panoramic roof, bi-xenon headlights, heated and ventilated power-adjustable seats, a back-up camera, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this R231 has 38k miles and is now offered with the owner’s manual, two remote keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Diamond White Metallic and features a panoramic roof with Magic Sky Control as well as a power-retractable hardtop, bi-xenon headlights, LED daytime running lights, LED taillights, and a Brabus-style body kit. The Carfax report indicates “minor damage” to the front of the vehicle, and the front bumper cover is said to have been repainted.
The Brabus-style 20″ wheels were powder-coated black and mounted with Falken Azenis FK510 tires under current ownership. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated rotors.

The cabin features heated and ventilated active multi-contour seats upholstered in beige leather as well as a color-coordinated center console and door panels. Interior amenities include a back-up camera, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, blind-spot monitoring, Lane Keep Assist, a Harman Kardon sound system, Airscarf neck-level heating, Keyless Go, navigation, cruise control, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 38k miles, approximately 500 of which were added under current ownership.
The twin-turbocharged 4.7-liter M278 V8 was factory rated at 429 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 7G-Tronic Plus seven-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident and lists registration history in California.

This 2007 BMW M6 convertible has 36k miles following registration history in Wisconsin and Texas. It is powered by a 5.0-liter V10 paired with a seven-speed SMG transmission and is finished in Silverstone Metallic over Silverstone Merino leather. Equipment includes a black convertible soft top, 19″ Style 167M alloy wheels, Dynamic Stability Control with M Dynamic Mode, Park Distance Control, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front seats, Comfort Access, a head-up display, iDrive with navigation, dual-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control. This E64 M6 is now offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The car is finished in Silverstone Metallic and features a black convertible soft top as well as M-specific body styling. Additional equipment includes Shadowline trim, adaptive xenon headlights with washers, front and rear parking sensors, M6 fender badging, and quad exhaust outlets.

Staggered-width 19″ Style 167M alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+. The M6 featured revised suspension geometry and stiffer bushings front and rear when compared to the standard 6-Series and was also factory equipped with Electronic Damping Control, Dynamic Stability Control, and M Dynamic Mode. Braking is handled by four-wheel vented and cross-drilled rotors measuring 14.7″ and 14.6″ front and rear, respectively. The steering lock was replaced in April 2021.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in Silverstone Merino leather, while carbon-fiber-style trim accents the dashboard. Amenities include Comfort Access, a head-up display, iDrive with navigation, driver-seat memory settings, dual-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features tri-color stitching and paddle shifters and frames a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for oil temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 36k miles.
The 5.0-liter S85B50 V10 was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 383 lb-ft of torque. A radiator hose was replaced in January 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed SMG sequential transmission and a Variable M Differential Lock. An entry in the Carfax report notes that the transmission was replaced in May 2009.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This Porsche 356 Speedster replica was reportedly assembled by Vintage Speedsters of Hawaiian Gardens, California, and was acquired by the current owner in July 2010. Powered by an air-cooled 1.6L flat-four paired with a four-speed manual transaxle, the car is finished in silver over black vinyl upholstery. Equipment includes 15″ chrome steel wheels, front disc brakes, and a black convertible soft top, boot cover, and side curtains in addition to a rear luggage rack, a banjo-style steering wheel, a Kenwood CD stereo, lap belts, dual carburetors, and a GT-style exhaust. This Speedster replica is now offered by the seller with a repair manual and a Florida title in the current owner’s name listing it as a 1968 Volkswagen.

The fiberglass body is finished in silver and fitted over a modified Volkswagen Beetle chassis. Exterior details include a black convertible soft top, boot cover, and side curtains as well as chrome headlight grilles, teardrop taillights, a single grille decklid, a luggage rack, gold-finished Porsche and 1600 Super badging, a reproduction Reutter badge on the right fender, and body-color bumpers with chrome overriders and rub strips.
Chrome 15″ steel wheels wear matching hubcaps and are mounted with 165-series Kelly Metric Radial tires. Stopping is provided by front disc and rear drum brakes.

The fixed-back bucket seats are trimmed in black vinyl upholstery, which extends to the dashboard pad, door panels, rear parcel shelf, and shifter and parking brake boots. Additional interior elements include black square-weave carpeting, Porsche Speedster-branded floor mats, a cabin heater, and an adjustable height rearview mirror, and a Kenwood CD stereo linked to speakers in the door panels.

The banjo-style steering wheel wears a Porsche-crest horn button and frames a central tachometer flanked by a 130-mph speedometer and a combination gauge for fuel level and oil temperature. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 3k miles, approximately 2k of which have been added under current ownership.
The air-cooled 1.6L flat-four features dual carburetors, Scat air cleaner covers, a Bosch blue coil, PerTronix electronic ignition, and a GT-style muffler with heater boxes.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle.
The chassis number 118095905 shown above is consistent with a 1968 Volkswagen Beetle and matches the VIN on the current Florida title.
listing_details: Black Convertible Soft Top, Boot, & Side Curtains

description: This 2009 Aston Martin V8 Vantage roadster is finished in Stratus White over Bitter Chocolate leather and is powered by a 4.7-liter V8 paired with a Sportshift six-speed automated transaxle. The car spent time in Texas and Florida before the selling dealer’s recent acquisition, and it now has under 7k miles. Equipment includes a Bitter Chocolate convertible soft top, 19″ split-spoke wheels, a limited-slip differential, xenon headlights, parking sensors, heated power-adjustable seats, and navigation. This V8 Vantage roadster is now offered in Illinois by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Stratus White and features a Bitter Chocolate convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, front and rear parking sensors, an integrated rear spoiler, hood vents, LED taillights, and dual exhaust tips.

The 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Bridgestone tires measuring 235/40 up front and 275/35 out back. Braking is from Aston Martin-branded silver calipers over slotted rotors at all four corners.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable seats trimmed in Bitter Chocolate leather that extends to the dashboard, center console, door panels, and convertible top cover panel. Additional features include a retractable navigation screen, a CD stereo, cruise control, aluminum pedals, a wind deflector, and seat-position memory settings.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 220-mph speedometer, a reverse-sweep tachometer, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates under 7k miles. The left instrument cluster screen has scratches.
The 4.7-liter V8 was factory rated at 420 horsepower and 346 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Sportshift six-speed automated transaxle and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2002 Honda S2000 has 28k miles following registration history in New Jersey and Pennsylvania, and it was purchased by its current owner in March 2022. Finished in Sebring Silver Metallic over black leather, the car is powered by a 2.0-liter VTEC inline-four linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, a black convertible soft top, xenon headlights, air conditioning, a CD stereo, and cruise control. This AP1 S2000 is now offered in Maryland on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Sebring Silver Metallic (NH-552M) and features a power-operated black soft top with a glass rear window. Additional exterior features include xenon headlights, a black windshield surround, roll hoops, and dual exhaust outlets. Photos showing body panel VIN stickers are included in the gallery.
