Factory 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V2 Concept2 tires, which were fitted in September 2021. The car features double-wishbone suspension and four-wheel disc brakes. The brake fluid was changed in April 2022.

The cabin features seats upholstered in black leather with color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include push-button ignition, air conditioning, cruise control, a CD stereo, and a leather-wrapped aluminum shift knob.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a digital speedometer and a bar-style tachometer with an 8,900-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 28k miles, approximately 3,500 of which were added under current ownership.
The 2.0-liter VTEC F20C inline-four was factory rated at 240 horsepower and 153 lb-ft of torque. The battery was replaced in February 2024.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The transmission and differential fluids were changed in April 2022.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their August 1999 Road Test for the S2000.

This 2005 Honda Rune is a limited-production motorcycle based on the contemporary Valkyrie and it was purchased new by an uncle of the seller, who acquired the bike in 2023. Finished in Bloodstone Red Metallic with chrome accents, it is powered by a 1,832cc SOHC flat-six mated to a five-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft. Equipment includes a digital instrument display, an ignition immobilizer, LED taillights, a black solo seat, a trailing-link fork, and a Unit Pro-Link linkage and monoshock along with a single-sided swingarm, chrome-plated 18″ and 17″ alloy wheels, triple Nissin disc brakes, electronic fuel injection, and a six-into-two exhaust system. This Rune has 2k miles and is now offered with two keys, a service record, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in Bloodstone Red Metallic and features an aluminum twin-spar frame, a black solo seat, a 6.1-gallon fuel tank, a chrome engine guard, and a side stand. The lighting package is comprised of dual headlights housed in a triangular color-keyed bucket with a chrome visor in addition to chrome turn signals and a pair of vertical LED taillight strips incorporated into the rear fender. Photos showing a scratch on the rear fender are provided in the gallery below. The seller notes the bike has been ceramic coated and there are chrome imperfections on the right engine cover and foot peg.

Five-spoke aluminum wheels measuring 18″ up front and 17″ out back wear Dunlop D251 tires, and suspension consists of a chrome trailing-link fork along with a single-sided swingarm attached to a Unit Pro-Link linkage and remote-reservoir monoshock. Braking is handled by dual Nissin three-piston calipers mounted over cross-drilled rotors up front as well as a two-piston Nissin caliper and a cross-drilled rotor at the rear.

The tubular chrome handlebar carries matching controls, grips, and mirrors. A digital screen housed in a chrome console atop the fuel tank displays a speedometer, a fuel-level readout, and a pair of trip meters. The digital odometer indicates 2k miles, approximately 150 of which were ridden under current ownership. The bike is equipped with the Honda Ignition Security System (HISS), which engages the immobilizer and steering lock when the key is removed.

The liquid-cooled 1,832cc SOHC flat-six features two valves per cylinder, electronic fuel injection, and a chrome six-into-two exhaust system. Factory-rated output was 118 horsepower and 120 lb-ft of torque. The PGM-FI unit was replaced in 2021, and replacement keys were cut and programmed at that time. The most recent oil change was reportedly carried out within the last 50 miles.
Power is transferred to the rear wheel through a hydraulically actuated clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a driveshaft enclosed within the swingarm.

This 2020 Ford Mustang Shelby GT350R is a black-over-black example that has 616 miles and was initially delivered to Ford of Port Richey in Florida prior to being purchased by the owner in 2022. Powered by a 5.2-liter Voodoo V8 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential, the car has blue and red over-the-top stripes, black-finished 19″ carbon-fiber seven-spoke wheels, Brembo brake calipers, a carbon-fiber wing, a touchscreen infotainment system with voice-activated navigation, the Technology Package, a rearview camera, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, adjustable strut mounts, and Recaro seats. This GT350R is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Shadow Black with optional over-the-top blue and red racing stripes and features HID projector headlights, side graphics, functional hood and fender vents, a front splitter with the Shelby logo, a carbon-fiber wing, LED taillights with sequential turn signals, and quad exhaust outlets.

The black 19″ carbon-fiber seven-spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 305/30 up front and 315/30 at the rear. The car is equipped with a MagneRide damping system and adjustable strut mounts, and braking is handled by two-piece brake rotors with Brembo calipers at all four corners.

The cabin features Recaro sport seats trimmed in Ebony cloth and Miko suede with red accents, while carbon-fiber trim adorns the dashboard. The rear seat is omitted on R models, and interior appointments include carpeted floor mats, a rearview camera, dual-zone automatic climate control, a touchscreen infotainment screen with navigation, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, a CD stereo, and cruise control.
The passenger-side dashboard plaque designates this GT350R as chassis LR294.

The Alcantara- and leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer with an 8,250-rpm redline, auxiliary gauges, and a central multi-function digital display. Additional gauges for oil pressure and oil temperature are mounted in the center stack. The digital odometer indicates 616 miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.2-liter Voodoo V8 features a flat-plane crankshaft along with dual overhead camshafts, variable valve timing, and an engine oil cooler. A commemorative plaque displays the signature of the engine builder, and factory-rated output was 526 horsepower and 429 lb-ft of torque. Additional coolers for the engine, transmission, and differential were standard. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Tremec TR-3160 six-speed manual transmission and a 3.73:1 Torsen limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Ford of Port Richey in Florida, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total MSRP of $78,020.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.
listing_details: Shadow Black Paint w/Blue and Red Stripes
Ebony Cloth & Miko Suede Upholstery w/Red Accents

description: This 1995 Land Rover Range Rover County Classic is finished in Beluga Black over Lightstone leather and is factory-equipped with a Tom Walkinshaw Racing (TWR) body kit. Power comes from a 3.9-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a two-speed transfer case, and additional equipment includes 16″ Cyclone-design alloy wheels, Bilstein shock absorbers, a sunroof, LED headlights, fog lights, a receiver hitch, heated and power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, air conditioning, and a Pioneer head unit. The truck has remained registered in Washington since new and was acquired by the current owner in 2021. Work performed since then involved replacing the radiator, alternator, power steering gearbox, rear main seal, transmission pan gasket, and brakes. This Range Rover shows 129k miles and is now offered on dealer consignment in Oregon with partial service records, the removed factory radio, a Carfax report, and a clean Washington title.

The truck is finished in Beluga Black and features a TWR body kit with revised bumper covers. Additional details include a power-operated sunroof, LED headlights, fog lights, a rear window wiper, and a receiver hitch. The selling dealer notes dings on various body panels, and the Carfax report notes damage to the rear of the vehicle occuring in September 2009.

The 16″ Cyclone-design alloy wheels are mounted with 235/75 Yokohama Geolandar H/T G056 tires. The factory air suspension has been replaced with a coil spring setup and Bilstein shock absorbers, and the four-wheel anti-lock disc brakes are said to have been replaced in February 2022. The power steering gearbox was replaced and fluid leaks were repaired in August 2023.

The heated and power-adjustable front seats and split-folding rear bench seat are upholstered in Lightstone leather, and wood trim accents the cabin. Amenities include air conditioning, cruise control, an analog clock, and a touchscreen Pioneer head unit with a rearview camera and Bluetooth connectivity linked to an aftermarket amplifier and speakers. A tear is noted in the driver’s seat bottom, and the SRS light illuminates intermittently.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 135-mph speedometer, a 6k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 129k miles, approximately 2k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.9-liter Rover V8 was factory rated at 182 horsepower and 232 lb-ft of torque. Work performed since 2021 involved replacing the radiator, alternator, and rear main seal, and a fluid leak was repaired at the oil cooler lines. The most recent oil change was performed in August 2023.
Power is delivered to all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a two-speed transfer case. The transmission pan gasket was replaced in August 2023.

The British Motor Industry Heritage Trust Certificate lists factory colors, identification numbers, and a build date of January 11, 1995, as well as initial delivery to Land Rover Seattle in Washington.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned September 2009 damage report.

attributes.value: Rover Range Rover County Classic TWR

description: This 2018 Dodge Challenger SRT Demon is a black-over-black example that has 26k miles and is #1,612 of approximately 3,300 examples built for the model year. Powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential, the car has 18″ Hole Shot aluminum wheels, Brembo brakes, an Air-Grabber hood, a front splitter, a rear spoiler, Air-Catcher xenon headlights, widebody fender flares, heated and ventilated seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a heated steering wheel, and a power-adjustable driver’s seat as well as a rearview camera, dual-zone automatic climate control, and UConnect infotainment with navigation. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2024 following registration history in California. This SRT Demon is now offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Pitch Black and has a front splitter as well as an Air-Grabber hood, a rear spoiler, Air-Catcher xenon headlights, widebody fender flares, and LED taillights. Scratches are noted on the front splitter and side skirts.

The 18″ Hole Shot aluminum wheels are mounted with 315/40 Nitto NT555 tires. Braking is handled by red-finished Brembo calipers fitted over slotted rotors at all four corners. The Demon is equipped with an active damping suspension as well as Drag Mode and Launch Assist, which alter the engine management profiles and activate the transbrake and line lock functions. One wheel has curb damage.

The heated and ventilated bucket seats are trimmed in black Laguna leather with Alcantara inserts and Demon logos on the backrests. Appointments include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, a rearview camera, dual-zone automatic climate control, bright-finish pedals, a Harman Kardon sound system, a power-adjustable steering column, and UConnect infotainment with navigation.
A carbon-fiber dashboard tag identifies the car as Demon #1,612.

The heated Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with paddle shifters. Instrumentation includes a 200-mph speedometer, a configurable LCD screen, and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

The 6.2-liter Hemi V8 features a 2.7-liter twin-screw supercharger and was factory rated at 808 horsepower and 717 lb-ft of torque on premium fuel. The car passed an emissions inspection in November 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report states the car was “reported stolen” in January 2024 and was “recovered after theft” in February 2024.
listing_details: Black Laguna Leather and Alcantara Upholstery

description: This 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air two-door hardtop that has been modified with a fuel-injected 454ci V8 linked to a 700R4 automatic transmission and a 9″ rear end with a limited-slip differential and 3.90 gears. Long-tube headers and a dual exhaust system with electric cutouts were also installed, and the car rides on 17″ wheels backed by coilover suspension, a four-link rear end, and Wilwood four-wheel disc brakes. The custom interior has bucket seats, a center console, a Vintage Air climate-control system, and a modern sound system. Acquired by the current owner in 2018, this Bel Air is now offered on dealer consignment with a clean Indiana title.
The two-door hardtop has black paintwork accented by a silver roof and chrome trim. Twin rectangular exhaust tips are mounted below the rear bumper.

The rear end has been mini-tubbed to fit the 17×10″ wheels, and 17×7″ wheels are mounted up front. 2″ drop spindles and CPP tubular control arms were also installed along with double-adjustable Viking Performance coilover shocks, while the 9″ rear axle is suspended on a four-link setup. The car also has Wilwood four-wheel disc brakes and power steering.
Power-adjustable bucket seats were installed up front along with a center console housing a Lokar shifter, and a Vintage Air climate-control system and vintage-look stereo were also fitted.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a chrome horn ring and frames a 120-mph speedometer flanked by coolant temperature and fuel level gauges. Auxiliary gauges are mounted ahead of the Lokar shifter and FiTech controller in the center console. The five-digit odometer shows 40k miles.

The 454ci V8 has an FiTech fuel-injection system mounted on the Edelbrock Performer aluminum intake manifold. The Patriot long-tube headers flow into a 2.5″ exhaust system with electrical cutouts. An electric pusher fan is mounted ahead of the aluminum radiator. The battery has been relocated to the trunk.

The four-speed 700R automatic transmission was built with Bowler and TCI components and is linked to a 9″ rear end with a limited-slip differential and 3.90 gears. Safety loops have been installed around the driveshaft.
Documentation is included in the sale.

This 2011 Porsche Cayenne Turbo is finished in Sand White over Luxor Beige leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.8-liter V8 linked with an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and locking center and rear differentials. Equipment includes a Burmester sound system, Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control, 21″ Cayenne SportEdition wheels, a panoramic sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, heated rear seats, PTV Plus, PCM with navigation, and xenon headlights with PDLS. The car has remained registered in Florida since new and now has 87k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this Cayenne Turbo is now offered at no reserve with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Florida title.

The vehicle is finished in Sand White and features xenon headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS) as well as a panoramic sunroof, fog lights, front and rear ParkAssist, running boards, aluminum-look roof rails, LED taillights, and stainless-steel skid plates. A run in the finish is visible on the front bumper cover, and photos of paint meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

The 21″ Cayenne SportEdition alloy wheels are mounted with 295/35 Michelin Pilot Sport All Season 4 tires. The vehicle is equipped with an adjustable air suspension, Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control (PDCC), Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), and Power Steering Plus. Stopping power is provided by red-finished six-piston front and four-piston rear brake calipers over ventilated rotors at each corner. The selling dealer states that the right-front TPMS sensor is inoperative.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats and a heated rear bench upholstered in Luxor Beige leather complemented by walnut wood trim. Amenities include a Burmester sound system, a backup camera, dual-zone automatic climate control, rear side airbags, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation. The front seat lower bolsters are worn.

The leather-wrapped SportDesign steering wheel features shift paddles and frames a 190-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,600-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 87k miles.
The twin-turbocharged 4.8-liter V8 features VarioCam Plus and was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and locking center and rear differentials with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV) Plus.
The Carfax report notes at least one recall.

This 2014 Porsche Cayenne Diesel is finished in white over Luxor Beige standard leather and is powered by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 linked with an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential. Equipment includes the Convenience and Bose Audio packages as well as 19″ Cayenne Design II wheels, a panoramic sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, a SportDesign steering wheel, PCM with navigation, and xenon headlights with PDLS. The vehicle has spent time in California and Florida and now has 80k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this Cayenne Diesel is now offered in Virginia at no reserve with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title.

The vehicle is finished in white and features xenon headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS) as well as a panoramic sunroof, fog lights, and LED taillights. The selling dealer notes that the front bumper cover has been repainted.

The 19″ Cayenne Design II alloy wheels are mounted with 265/50 Goodyear Eagle LS2 tires. Stopping power is provided by six-piston front and four-piston rear brake calipers over ventilated rotors at each corner. Rear ABS sensor assembly replacement is noted on the Carfax report in June 2024.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats and a rear bench upholstered in Luxor Beige leather joined by color-matching door panels. Amenities include a Bose sound system, driver memory settings, dual-zone automatic climate control, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation.

The leather-wrapped SportDesign steering wheel features shift paddles and frames a central tachometer, a 175-mph speedometer, a configurable digital display, and gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 80k miles.
The 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 was factory rated at 240 horsepower and 406 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential.
The window sticker notes initial delivery to Rusnak/Pasadena Porsche in California, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total price of $71,770.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1957 Volkswagen Karmann Ghia coupe was acquired as a disassembled project in 2017 by the seller, who initiated a refurbishment that was completed in 2019. Work included rebuilding rust remediation, repainting the body in Gazelle Beige, reupholstering the interior in copper red and brown upholstery, and overhauling the suspension and brake systems. Additionally, the air-cooled flat-four was modified to displace 1,395cc by fitting 69.5mm crankshaft and 80mm pistons and cylinders in addition to Okrasa-style dual-port cylinder heads, an Okrasa-specification camshaft, a Hengst cartridge-style oil filter, Dual Solex 32 PBIC carburetors, and Knecht air filters. More details regarding the refurbishment can be found via the seller’s forum thread here. This Karmann Ghia coupe is now offered with a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car was disassembled and received replacement floor pans under previous ownership before undergoing further refurbishment by the seller. Work included performing rust remediation and priming the body before applying four coats of Gazelle Beige (L376) using single-stage Acrylic Urethane paint, per the seller. The headlight rings were re-chromed and stainless steel reproduction bumpers have been installed along with replacement seals and gaskets. Additional exterior details include dual side-view mirrors, pop-out rear quarter windows, and dual “pea shooter” exhaust outlets.

Steel 15″ wheels wear re-chromed VW-stamped hubcaps and are mounted with 165-series Firestone F-560 tires. The spindles were rebuilt and the shocks, tie rod ends, and steering damper were replaced in addition to the brake lines, master cylinder, and wheel cylinders as part of the refurbishment.

Said to have been refurbished with materials ordered from Germany, the interior features thin back bucket seats, a folding rear bench, and door panels are trimmed in copper red vinyl with white piping and brown corduroy inserts in addition to German square-weave carpets, a rubber floor mat, and a wool headliner. The doors do not lock and the horn is inoperative.

The refurbished two-spoke steering wheel wears a Wolfsburg crest horn button and fronts a 90-mph VDO speedometer and an ISP West tachometer. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 4,400 miles, which is said to represent the distance traveled since the completion of the refurbishment. True mileage is unknown.
The air-cooled flat-four engine has been modified to displace 1,397cc by installing a 69.5mm crankshaft and 80mm pistons and cylinders in addition to the following:
Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a fully synchronized four-speed manual transaxle with a 4.37:1 ring and pinion.

This 1966 Ford Mustang convertible was acquired by the seller’s spouse in 1976, and work in the early 2000s included a repaint, re-covered front seats, a rebuild of the three-speed manual transmission, repairs of the floors, and the installation of a replacement rebuilt 289ci V8. The car is finished in red over black vinyl and features a black soft top, 14″ steel wheels with covers, front bucket seats, a cassette radio, and a cabin heater. This Mustang is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a car cover, and a clean Delaware title in the names of the seller and their spouse.

The car was delivered from the factory in Candy Apple Red and was repainted in 2003, at which time the left rear quarter panel was replaced and a replacement windshield, chrome bumpers, and soft top were installed. The seller notes several repaired holes in the soft top and states that the top requires two people to fully secure.
The 14″ steel wheels wear covers and are mounted with 195/75 Uniroyal Tiger Paw tires that were installed in 2020. Braking is handled by front and rear drums.

The cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench trimmed in black vinyl and equipped with lap belts. The front seats were reupholstered in 2001, at which time the carpets and dash pad were replaced and a cassette radio was installed. The seller notes the rear windows do not raise and the parking brake handle is cracked. Seam separation on the rear bench is shown up close in the gallery.
The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel level, oil pressure, amperage, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer has rolled over and shows 44k miles.
The replacement 289ci V8 was rebuilt and installed in 2001, at which time a replacement clutch and alternator were installed.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed manual transmission and a rear axle with 2.80:1 gears. The front frame was repaired and the floors, battery apron, and torque boxes were replaced in 2000, and photos from the work are provided at the end of the gallery. There are rust holes in the muffler.
The warranty number is consistent with a 1966 Mustang convertible that was built in Metuchen, New Jersey and equipped with a 289ci V8. Decoding the trim tag reveals the following information:

This 2011 Mercedes-Benz ML63 AMG is a Canadian-market example that has remained registered in British Columbia since new, and it now has 119k kilometers (~74k miles). It is finished in Obsidian Black Metallic over black Exclusive leather and is powered by a 6.2-liter V8 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes Parktronic, 21″ split-spoke wheels, heated and ventilated multi-contour front seats, heated rear seats, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, a back-up camera, and three-zone automatic climate control. Acquired by the current owner in 2017, this W164 ML63 AMG is now offered at no reserve in Canada on dealer consignment with an ICBC vehicle claims history report, a US Carfax report, and British Columbia registration.

The vehicle is finished in Obsidian Black Metallic (197) and features bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination as well as headlight washers, a sunroof, parking sensors, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, running boards, roof rails, a receiver hitch, a power liftgate, and quadruple exhaust outlets. The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia (ICBC) vehicle claims history report notes $21,222.72 in repairs in June 2014 to address damage affecting the left-rear corner and front center of the vehicle, $1,448.87 in repairs in February 2017 to address damage to the left rear of the vehicle, and $2,177.67 in repairs to address damage to the right rear of the vehicle after it was stolen in March 2024.

The 21″ AMG double-spoke wheels are mounted with Continental tires. The vehicle is equipped with an Electronic Stability Program (ESP), a four-wheel Electronic Traction System (4-ETS), and an Airmatic air suspension with an Adaptive Damping System (ADS II). Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs. Air suspension compressor repairs are noted on the US Carfax report in November 2016.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in black Exclusive leather, while burl walnut wood trim adorns the center stack, console, and door panels. Additional appointments include heated and ventilated power-adjustable multi-contour front seats, heated rear seats, blind-spot monitoring, Keyless Go, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, a back-up camera, three-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features shift paddles and fronts a 320-km/h speedometer and a tachometer as well as an analog clock, a fuel-level gauge, and a digital information display. The digital odometer indicates 119k kilometers (~74k miles).
The 6.2-liter V8 was factory rated at 503 horsepower and 465 lb-ft of torque.
Power is delivered to all four wheels through an AMG Speedshift seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system.
The US Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. The ICBC vehicle claims history report notes the aforementioned theft and collision entries.
The vehicle is being offered on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 2013 Porsche Cayenne S is modified with a Wald Black Bison body kit and exhaust system as well as KW suspension, 24″ aftermarket wheels, and AZR brake calipers. The US-spec vehicle was exported to Japan in October 2013 before being brought back to California in April 2024, and it now has 45k miles. The black-over-black truck is powered by a 4.8-liter V8 linked with an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential. Equipment includes the Premium Package, a panoramic sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, a Bose surround-sound system, PCM with navigation, and xenon headlights with PDLS. Recently acquired by the seller, this Cayenne S is now offered in California at no reserve with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

The Wald Black Bison body kit consists of a front bumper cover with LED daytime running lights, a rear bumper cover with LED brake lights, a straked hood, rear hatch spoilers, fender flares, and side skirts. Retained factory equipment includes xenon headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS) as well as a panoramic sunroof, aluminum-look roof rails, LED taillights, and front and rear parking sensors.

Aftermarket 24″ wheels are mounted with Lionhart LH-Five tires. KW Suspensions dampers and springs are installed, and stopping power is provided by AZR brake calipers over ventilated rotors at each corner.

The cabin features heated 14-way power-adjustable front seats and a rear bench upholstered in black leather joined by color-matching door panels. Amenities include a Bose surround-sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, front-seat memory settings, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation.

The heated leather-wrapped steering wheel features shifter switches and frames a 175-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 45k miles.
The 4.8-liter V8 features VarioCam Plus and was factory rated at 400 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential. A Wald exhaust system is installed, and the vehicle passed a California emissions inspection in May 2024.
The Carfax report notes at least one recall and manufacturer voluntary service action.

This 2011 Mercedes-Benz SL550 was first delivered to Bob Ross Buick in Centerville, Ohio, and it has 35k miles following registration history in Pennsylvania. Finished in Quartz Blue over Stone and Dark Beige leather, the car is powered by a 5.5-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes a power-folding hardtop, bi-xenon headlights, 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels, Parktronic, Keyless Go, heated and ventilated seats, an Airscarf neck-warming system, a Harman Kardon sound system, and COMAND with navigation. This R230 is now offered by the selling dealer with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.
The car is finished in Quartz Blue and is equipped with a power-folding convertible hardtop, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, and fender air vents.

The 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Goodyear Eagle F1 tires. The car features Active Body Control (ABC) suspension as well as an Electronic Stability Program (ESP) and Automatic Slip Control (ASR).

The cabin is trimmed in Stone and Dark Beige leather and features heated, ventilated, and massaging multi-contour seats with position memory. Amenities include an Airscarf neck-warming system along with a wind deflector, dual-zone automatic climate control, a wood trim, Parktronic, cruise control, Keyless Go, a Harman Kardon sound system, and COMAND with navigation.
The wood- and leather-rimmed steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 35k miles.
The 5.5-liter M273 V8 was factory rated at 382 horsepower and 391 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Bob Ross Buick in Centerville, Ohio, along with factory colors, equipment, and a total retail price of $113,345.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

This 2023 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Jailbreak is a black-over-black Last Call edition example that has 10 miles and is powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car was optioned with Brembo brake calipers, an SRT-tuned Bilstein suspension, 20″ split-spoke lightweight wheels, HID Air-Catcher headlamps, heated and ventilated front seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a Uconnect infotainment system with navigation. Delivered new to the selling dealer, this Hellcat Jailbreak Last Call is now offered on its MSO in Michigan with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, spare parts, and a clean Carfax report.

The car is finished in Pitch Black with satin black front and rear spoilers. Additional details include HID Air-Catcher headlamps, an aluminum hood with dual air scoops, Hellcat fender badges, chin spoiler guards, a rearview camera, rear parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets.

Black 20″ split-spoke lightweight wheels are mounted with 275/40 Pirelli P Zero Nero tires. The car is equipped with an SRT-tuned Bilstein three-mode active suspension, traction control, and electronic stability control. Braking is provided by four-wheel discs with red six- and four-piston Brembo calipers.

The heated and ventilated front seats are upholstered in black Laguna leather with embossed Hellcat logos on the front backrests. Amenities include driver-seat power adjustability, a folding rear seat, keyless entry, push-button start, Jailbreak badging, a Uconnect infotainment system, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and dual-zone automatic climate control.
The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a red 200-mph speedometer and 7k-rpm tachometer along with a configurable digital display. The digital odometer indicates 10 miles.
The supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 produced 717 horsepower and 656 lb-ft of torque when new and is equipped with aluminum cylinder heads and a forged-steel crankshaft, connecting rods, and pistons.
A “Last Call” plaque is affixed under the hood near the driver-side headlight.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through an eight-speed TorqueFlite automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker shows initial delivery to Zeigler Dodge of Kalamazoo, Michigan, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $84,259.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This car does not have a title as it has never been sold to a private party owner. It is being offered with its Manufacturer’s Certificate of Origin, and the selling dealer will assist the buyer with registration, titling, and tax collection.

attributes.value: Challenger SRT Hellcat Jailbreak Last Call

description: This 1989 Freightliner Unimog FLU419 is a former US military vehicle that was overhauled in 2004 at the Red River Army Depot and acquired by the seller in 2016. It is finished in a drab camouflage paint scheme and powered by a 5.7-liter Mercedes-Benz diesel inline-six mated to a manual gearbox and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes a hydraulic front-end loader, a rear-mounted backhoe, a snorkel, storage lockers, locking differentials, portal axles, and four-wheel disc brakes. This Unimog is offered in Nebraska on a bill of sale.

Classified as a Small Emplacement Excavator, the Unimog 419 was used by the US Army as an engineering vehicle. This one is finished in a drab camouflage paint scheme and equipped with a detachable hydraulically operated front-end loader in addition to a rear-mounted backhoe that folds onto the back of the truck. An air-intake snorkel, a roof guard, and passenger-side storage lockers are other details. One of the hoses on the front-end loader leaks.
Steel 20″ wheels are mounted with Michelin tires that have cracked sidewalls. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs.
Two low-back bucket seats trimmed in brown vinyl upholstery reside in the cabin. Controls for the gearbox, transfer case, and accessories are located behind the removable engine cover.

VDO instrumentation includes an 80-mph speedometer, a tachometer, a combination gauge, and a voltage readout. An inclinometer is affixed to the dash. The six-digit odometer shows 1,200 miles, and total mileage is unknown.

A removable engine cover in the cab provides access to the 5.7-liter Mercedes-Benz OM352 diesel inline-six. The engine is linked to a four-speed manual gearbox with a high/low range and a splitter, offering sixteen forward gears and eight reverse gears. The batteries were replaced in late 2023 according to the seller.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a four-speed manual gearbox, a dual-range transfer case, locking differentials, and portal axles.
Data tags riveted to the bulkhead between the seats indicate that the vehicle was produced in September 1989 and overhauled at the Red River Army Depot in Texas in 2004.
The truck does not have a title because it has not been registered for road use. It is being sold on a bill of sale.

This 1959 Chevrolet Apache 3100 was acquired by the prior owner in 2020 as a non-running project that was burned in Paradise, California during the 2018 Camp wildfire. It was subsequently modified and refurbished with work consisting of replacing the frame and running gear, refinishing the corroded sheet metal in clearcoat, retrimming the interior in black leather and suede, and installing a modified 6.0-liter LQ9 V8 and a four-speed automatic transmission. Additional equipment includes a narrowed rear end, a Detroit Truetrac limited-slip differential, power-assisted rack-and-pinion steering, air suspension with an AccuAir control system, QA1 adjustable dampers, Wilwood disc brakes, 20″ Bespoke Billet Wheels, a 3″ stainless-steel dual exhaust system with Borla mufflers, a Classic Instruments gauge cluster, Restomod climate control, and a Bluetooth stereo with four speakers and two subwoofers. The truck was previously listed on BaT in November 2023 and was acquired by the selling dealer in June 2024. This 3100 is offered at no reserve in Texas with a clean California title.

The pickup was burned in the 2018 Camp Fire, which destroyed the town of Paradise, California and was the deadliest wildfire in California history. The fleetside body was reportedly treated with CLR rust remover before being refinished in matte clearcoat over visible surface corrosion, dents, and perforations. Additional work included installing a custom bed floor and side-exit exhaust ports, widening the wheel tubs, and replacing the firewall, glass, badges, and sheet metal around the transmission tunnel. The bed features a wood-lined floor as well as a cutout to accommodate the air tanks for the suspension system. Additional details include steel bumpers, quad LED headlights, dual mirrors with black housings, and a fold-down tailgate with chain supports. Rust is present on the grille, front bumper, above the left wheel arch, and on the wheel tubs. The wheel tubs have not been clear-coated.

Staggered-width 20″ Bespoke Billet wheels are finished in antique bronze with matching hubcaps and are mounted with 245/35 front and 345/25 rear Lexani LX Twenty tires. Stopping power is from Wilwood six-piston front and four-piston rear calipers over cross-drilled rotors. A Roadster Shop Slammed SPEC Series frame and multi-link rear suspension setup were installed during the build along with an air suspension system with Fox airbags, QA1 adjustable shocks, dual Viair compressors, FLO air tanks, and an AccuAir control system.

The cabin houses a Snowden bench seat trimmed in black leather with suede inserts that extend to the door panels, cup holder console, and headliner. The windshield, side windows, rear windscreen, weatherstripping, switches, handles, and wiring harness were replaced during the build, and sound-damping material was applied throughout the cabin. An AccuAir suspension control panel is mounted to the floor console, and additional features include black-painted sheet metal, an unfinished dash top, black carpets, a Lokar column shifter, Restomod climate control, power windows, a glove box, lap belts, and a Bluetooth stereo with Focal speakers and JL Audio subwoofers. Stitches are missing from the driver’s side seat cushion insert.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a bronze horn ring and is mounted on an Ididit tilt-adjustable column. Classic Instruments instrumentation includes a 140-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, voltage, oil pressure, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer indicates 5k miles, though total chassis mileage is unknown.

The 6.0-liter LQ9 V8 was installed during the build, and Holley equipment includes Sniper fuel injection, a serpentine accessory drive, a Terminator ECU, and an upgraded intake manifold and oil pan. Additional features include a gold-painted block, black Chevrolet-script valve covers, a Melling oil pump, MSD electronic ignition, an aluminum radiator, stainless steel headers, a 3″ exhaust system, a 20-gallon fuel tank, and dual Odyssey AGM batteries.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a 4L80 four-speed automatic transmission, a narrowed 9″ rear axle assembly, and an Eaton Detroit Truetrac limited-slip differential with 4.11:1 gearing. Rust is visible on the underside.

This 2000 Dodge Viper RT/10 shows 8k miles, and it was first delivered to Don Miller Dodge in Madison, Wisconsin. Finished in Viper Red over black leather, the car is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ five-spoke alloy wheels, “smooth” air-intake tubes, a removable hardtop, power windows, an Alpine CD stereo, and air conditioning. This Viper is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, and a Florida title.

The car is finished in Viper Red (PRN) and features a removable hardtop, a removable rear window, fog lights, a forward-opening clamshell hood, and center-exit dual exhaust outlets. A scuff is noted on the hood in an inspection report, which can be viewed here.

The 18″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Toyo R888 R tires showing 2023 date codes. The RT/10 is equipped with power-assisted rack-and-pinion steering, four-wheel independent suspension, and four-wheel vented disc brakes with Viper-branded calipers up front. 2000 models were not equipped with ABS.

The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather with a matching dashboard, center console, and door panels. Additional equipment includes a heater, air conditioning, power windows, and an Alpine CD stereo.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. Auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage are mounted atop the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 8k miles.
The 8.0-liter OHV V10 was factory rated at 450 horsepower. “Smooth” air-intake tubes have been fitted, and the muffler has been removed.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T-56 six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Don Miller Dodge in Madison, Wisconsin, along with factory equipment, colors, and a total price of $73,700.
The Carfax report shows at least one open recall.
There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

This 1998 Porsche Boxster has 52k miles and is powered by a 2.5-liter flat-six paired with a five-speed Tiptronic automatic transaxle. It is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over Savanna Beige partial leather and optioned with a body-color hardtop and a black soft top. Further equipment includes 17″ Carrera-look twist-spoke wheels, a deployable rear spoiler, heated seats, a Hi-Fi sound system, an automatic braking differential, and traction control. The car spent time in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Minnesota, and Florida before the selling dealer’s 2024 acquisition. This 986 Boxster was previously offered by the selling dealer on BaT in June 2024 and is now offered in Pennsylvania at no reserve with partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Minnesota title.

The car is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic with a matching removable hardtop as well as a black soft top. Additional details include a speed-activated rear spoiler, side air intakes, and roll hoops.

The 17″ Carrera-look twist-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. Braking is handled by four-piston Porsche-branded calipers fitted over vented rotors at all four corners. The car was ordered with traction control with anti-slip regulation (ASR) and an automatic braking differential (ABD).

The cabin features heated seats upholstered in Savanna Beige leather with a color-coordinated dashboard and door panels. Features include central locking, a Hi-Fi sound system, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features Tiptronic shift buttons and fronts a central tachometer, a 160-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 52k miles.
The mid-mounted 2.5-liter M96 flat-six was factory rated at 201 horsepower and 181 lb-ft of torque. The mass airflow sensor was replaced in May 2023.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed Tiptronic automatic transaxle.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2019 Porsche 911 Speedster is a Canadian-market example that has 4,500 kilometers (~2,800 miles) and is #1,144 of 1,948 units produced for the model year. Powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, it is finished in Guards Red over black leather upholstery. The car was optioned with the Chrono Package, 20″ GT3 center-lock alloy wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a limited-slip differential, a black soft top, a carbon-fiber twin-hump convertible-top cover panel, LED headlights with PDLS+, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, Porsche Communication Management with navigation, a Bose sound system, aluminum pedals, and a speed-activated rear spoiler. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 911 Speedster is now offered with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and Ontario registration.

The Speedster shares styling cues with the 991 GT3 including a similar front splitter and bumper covers, while features unique to the Speedster consist of a shorter windshield, a manually retractable black soft top, and a body-color carbon-fiber twin-hump convertible-top cover panel. This example is finished in Guards Red and has LED headlights with PDLS+, a backup camera, black rear stone guards, carbon-fiber mirror caps, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets.

Center-locking 20″ forged alloy wheels feature red accent stripes and are mounted with 245/35 front and 305/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes with yellow Porsche-branded calipers. Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), Porsche Stability Management (PSM), and rear-axle steering were standard on the Speedster.

The two-place cockpit features carbon-fiber full bucket seats upholstered in black leather with “Speedster” embroidery on the headrests, red seatbelts, and color-contrasting stitching that extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Carbon-fiber trim accents the interior, and additional appointments include aluminum pedals, a Bose sound system, carbon-fiber illuminated door sill guards, Porsche-branded floor mats, Porsche Communication Management with navigation, dual-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control.
A serialized plaque located between the seats denotes this example as #1,144 of 1,948 Speedsters produced.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline along with a 350-km/h speedometer and gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The Chrono Package adds a stopwatch to the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 4,500 kilometers (~2,800 miles).

The naturally aspirated, GT3-sourced 4.0L flat-six features VarioCam Plus valve timing and was updated for the Speedster with revised individual throttle bodies and high-pressure fuel injectors. Factory rated power output was 502 horsepower and 346 lb-ft of torque. According to the seller, the car is due for an oil service.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The car is equipped with an optional 23.7-gallon extended-range fuel tank.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
The vehicle is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring is a black-finished example that has 6k miles, and it was optioned from the factory with Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, a front-axle lift system, the Touring Package in Black, and Guards Red instrument dials and seat belts. Satin paint protection film and red Porsche hood and side graphics have been added, and the interior is trimmed in black extended leather and fabric upholstery with deviated red stitching. Powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, the car is equipped with the Sport Chrono Package, 20″ center-lock alloy wheels, an extended-range fuel tank, LED headlights, a backup camera, carbon-fiber-backed bucket seats, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Torque Vectoring. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 991.2 GT3 Touring is now offered in Indiana with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Virginia title.

The GT3 Touring includes a revised decklid with a mesh grille as well as a retractable rear spoiler in place of the raised wing found on the standard GT3. This example is finished in black and features satin paint protection film with red Porsche hood and side graphics. Exterior details consist of black window trim and rear Porsche lettering, a backup camera, LED taillights, and LED headlights with Porsche Dynamic Lighting System (PDLS). Imperfections are noted on the front splitter.

The gloss-black finished 20″ center-lock alloy wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 305/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires that show 2018 production codes. The car was optioned with a front-axle lift system, and braking is handled by yellow Porsche-branded calipers over ceramic-composite rotors.

The cabin houses carbon-fiber-backed bucket seats trimmed in black leather with fabric inserts and deviated red stitching that extends to the interior panels. Leather upholstery covers the dashboard and door panels, and additional appointments include Guards Red seatbelts, a Bose sound system, PCM with navigation, cruise control, and Porsche-branded floor mats with red stitching.

A three-spoke steering wheel frames a central GT3-branded tachometer with a Guards Red dial as well as a 225-mph speedometer, an LCD screen, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 6k miles. A November 2023 entry in the Carfax report lists a mileage inconsistency, though the report indicates this may be the result of a clerical error.

The 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring. The car is equipped with an extended-range 23.7-gallon fuel tank.
The window sticker shows factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $209,350.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned mileage inconsistency.
listing_details: Satin Paint Protection Film w/Red Graphics

description: This 1985 Porsche 911 Carrera cabriolet is powered by a 3.2-liter flat-six paired with a 915 five-speed manual transaxle, and it shows 52k miles. The car is finished in Guards Red over black leather, and it is equipped with 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, a black soft top, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, and Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment with navigation. The car was purchased by the current owner in January 2021, and subsequent work has included performing an electrical repair as well as replacing the engine speed sensors and the oil pressure sender/switch. This Carrera cabriolet is now offered on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, a service manual, service records, spare parts, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The car is finished in Guards Red (L027) and features a black soft top, a convertible top boot, fog lights, and heated power-adjustable side mirrors. Photos of paint chips are provided in the gallery.
The 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires showing date codes from 2018. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs, the fluid for which was replaced in February 2024.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in black leather, while woven floor mats line the foot wells. Appointments include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment, and power windows. Photos showing the floors with the carpets removed are provided in the gallery.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer, a Quarz clock, and gauges for oil level, oil pressure, oil temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 52k miles.

The 3.2-liter M930/21 flat-six was factory rated at 202 horsepower and 185 lb-ft of torque. A circuit in the fusebox was repaired in December 2022, the engine speed sensors were replaced in March 2023, while the oil pump seal, oil pressure sender/switch, an engine oil cooler line, and the battery were replaced in February 2024, and an oil change was performed in April 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Type 915 five-speed manual transaxle.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage with an initial entry in May 1997.

This Sunbeam Tiger Mk I was produced in 1964 as the 580th Tiger and sold new by Hollywood Sports Cars, and has remained in California with a single family until 2011. It was then owned as part of a collection through its sale on BaT in March 2017. It achieved a Historic Vehicle Association “This Car Matters” award at the 2014 Hilton Head Island Concours and a preservation-class win at the Boca Raton Concours, and the car has been listed in the “Book of Norman” and featured in Classic Motorsports magazine. The Embassy Black-over-red convertible is is powered by a 260ci V8 linked with a four-speed manual transmission, and it is equipped with LAT 9 wheels, soft and hardtops, and a luggage rack. Acquired by its current owner in 2017, the car now shows 10,286 miles and is offered by the seller on their behalf with a Pennsylvania title listing the car as a 1965 model.

The car was ordered in Embassy Black (1), and it has a matching hardtop, a black soft top, dual mirrors, a rear luggage rack, Lucas headlights, early hidden-screw taillights, dual exhaust outlets, and chrome trim. A tonneau cover is included in the sale.
Cast-alloy LAT-9 13″ pie-cutters are mounted with BFGoodrich tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums, and the brake lines were replaced under previous ownership.

The interior features bucket seats trimmed in red vinyl accented by black piping and accompanied by matching door panels and rear cockpit trim. Equipment includes a passenger-side glove compartment, a heater, 1964-dated Roberk lap belts, and an ashtray. The carpeting has been replaced.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel sits ahead of a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level along with an optional ammeter and an analog clock. The five-digit odometer shows 10,286 miles. The varnish has cracked on the burl wood dashboard panel.

The 260ci Ford V8 was factory rated at 164 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. The car retains herringbone hoses in the engine bay as well as a yellow-striped hose secured by “sardine can” clamps to the rebuilt brake booster. The water pump was replaced in 2018, and the oil was most recently changed in 2022.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.
The current Pennsylvania title carries an Antique brand.

This 1982 Honda Motocompo is finished in Caribbean Red and is powered by an air-cooled 49cc two-stroke single linked to a single-speed transmission with an automatic clutch. Features include a pop-up seat and handlebars that fold flat as well as 8″ three-spoke steel wheels, front and rear drum brakes, street lighting, oil injection, full suspension, a center stand, and integrated lift/tie-down points for transport. This Motocompo was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023 and is now offered at no reserve with a clean Washington title.

The bike is finished in Caribbean Red with black rubber side strips as well as white Motocompo graphics. Features include a black vinyl pop-up solo seat, a black front fender, a rear mudflap, a center stand, street lighting, a handlebar-mounted mirror, an integrated security cable, and folding handlebars and foot pegs.

Steel 8″ three-spoke wheels are finished in black and are wrapped with 2.50″ Dunlop tires. Braking is from drums at both ends. Suspension consists of a leading-axle telescopic fork as well as a monoshock connected to the drive unit, which doubles as the swingarm.

Instrumentation consists of a handlebar-mounted 50-km/h speedometer and an oil indicator light as well as a fuel-level gauge located atop the fuel tank. No odometer was equipped from the factory, therefore total mileage is unknown.

The air-cooled 49cc two-stroke single is mounted horizontally and was factory rated at 2.5 horsepower and 2.75 lb-ft of torque. Features include oil injection, a kickstarter, and an exhaust system that is tucked beneath the rear bodywork. The seller notes that the oil indicator light remains, even when the tank is full.
Power is sent to the rear wheel via a single-speed transmission with an automatic clutch.

The Motocompo was designed to fold and fit into the trunk of the contemporary Honda City. The handlebars, seat, and foot pegs fold flat, and the body features a master fuel switch as well as integrated lift handles and tie-down points to facilitate transport.

This 2011 Harley-Davidson Dyna Super Glide Custom has 78 miles and is powered by an air-cooled 96ci Twin Cam V-twin paired with a six-speed transmission. It is finished in two-tone blue and black and features chrome trim, a two-up seat, a mid controls, disc brakes, and electronic fuel injection. This FXDC is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer in Illinois with a Michigan title.

The bike is finished in blue and black and features a five-gallon fuel tank, a two-up seat, a full-coverage rear fender, mid-mounted foot controls, chrome mirrors, a chrome side stand, and folding passenger foot pegs. Photos showing the condition of the chrome can be viewed in the gallery.

Wire-spoke wheels measuring 19″ up front and 17″ at the rear are mounted with Michelin tires. Suspension consists of a conventional 49mm telescopic fork with chrome lowers as well as dual shocks mounted to the swingarm. Braking is handled by single discs with drilled rotors, the front of which is floating.
A tank-mounted 120-mph speedometer is flanked by a fuel cap on the right along with a fuel level gauge integrated into the faux fuel cap on the left. The digital odometer indicates 78 miles.

The air-cooled 96ci Twin Cam V-twin was factory rated at 92 lb-ft of torque and features Electronic Sequential Port Fuel-Injection (ESPFI), a dry-sump oiling system, and a chrome dual exhaust system. The engine oil was changed and the battery replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a six-speed transmission and a drive belt.
The Michigan title is listed as a duplicate.

This 1993 Mercedes-Benz 400SEL is a Canadian-market example that has been registered in British Columbia since new. It is powered by a 4.2-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Anthracite Gray Metallic over gray leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ Alamak alloy wheels, a sunroof, soft-close doors, heated power-adjustable front seats, an electric rear-window shade, dual-zone automatic climate control, a cassette stereo, and a Bose sound system. The seller purchased the car in 2024 and subsequent work has included replacing the spark plugs and ignition coils as well as performing an oil change. This V140 400SEL is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, two electronic fobs, a first-aid kit, and British Columbia registration.

The car is finished in Anthracite Gray Metallic and features light gray lower cladding. Exterior equipment includes a powered sunroof, double-pane side glass, soft-close doors, rear parking aerials, a power antenna, and headlight wipers. The Carfax Canada report lists a glass record in May 2004 as well as a collision in May 2022, and the seller notes the windshield has been replaced. Photos of paint meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

The 16″ Alamak alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Defender tires. The car was factory equipped with Anti-Slip Regulation (ASR) traction control, and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The seats are upholstered in gray leather, while Zebrano wood trim accents the cabin. Amenities include heated power-adjustable front seats with position memory as well as an electric rear-window shade, a cassette stereo, a Bose sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 260-km/h speedometer, a tachometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, instant fuel economy, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 53k kilometers (~33k miles), approximately 20 of which were added under current ownership. The US Carfax report shows a potential odometer rollback in February 1997, and total mileage is unknown.

The 4.2-liter V8 was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 302 lb-ft of torque. Reported service in preparation for the sale included replacing the spark plugs and ignition coils as well as performing an oil change.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission. Additional underside photos are provided below.

The Carfax report lists the aforementioned potential odometer rollback in 1997. A Carfax Canada report is included in the gallery and lists the aforementioned glass record in 2004 and collision in 2022.
The vehicle is being sold on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada.

This 1992 Jeep Cherokee Laredo is finished in matte green over gray cloth upholstery and is powered by a replacement 4.0-liter inline-six mated to a four-speed automatic transmission and a Selec-Trac dual-range transfer case. Additional equipment includes 15″ alloy wheels, an aftermarket front bumper, a front LED light bar, LED headlights, a receiver hitch, front bucket seats, a Boss head unit, air conditioning, and a cabin heater. The current owner purchased the truck in 2023 and it now shows 241k miles. This XJ Cherokee is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Idaho title in the current owner’s name.

The truck was refinished in matte green under previous ownership and features an aftermarket front bumper, a front LED light bar, LED headlights, a receiver hitch, a rear window wiper, and black wheel-arch flares. The side mirrors, window trim, and front grille show chipped paint, the antenna is bent, and additional cracks, blemishes, and scratches around the body are presented in the gallery below.
The 15″ alloy wheels are mounted with 30×9.5″ Falken Wildpeak tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums. Paint chips are visible on the wheels.

The cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench trimmed in gray cloth along with a color-coordinated headliner and door panels. Amenities include a Boss head unit, air conditioning, power windows, rubber floormats, a black dash pad, and a cabin heater.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel wears an aftermarket cover and fronts instrumentation consisting of an 85-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and voltage. The six-digit odometer shows 241k miles.
The replacement 4.0-liter inline-six was installed under current ownership and was factory rated at 190 horsepower and 225 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a Selec-Trac dual-range transfer case.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This Tornado Red 1992 Volkswagen Passat was modified under previous ownership with a turbocharged 1.8-liter inline-four and five-speed manual transaxle sourced from a 2003 Volkswagen Jetta. Additional modifications include a front-mount intercooler, an Integrated Engineering oil catch can, an aftermarket turbo inlet pipe, a three-inch downpipe, a Techtonics Tuning exhaust system, a drive-by-wire pedal adapter, a 5×100 bolt pattern, 17″ RH ZW1 wheels, directional slotted brake rotors, tubular control arms, and adjustable coilovers in addition to a MOMO steering wheel, a European-specification seatbelt conversion, Hella DE headlights, Hella smoked taillights, and a European-specification license rear plate tub. The car was sold new in Michigan and has remained registered in the state through the selling dealer’s 2024 acquisition. This B3 Passat is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with spare parts, coilover wrenches, a clean carfax report, and a clean Michigan title.

The car is finished in Tornado Red (LY3D) and features a custom grille, Hella DE round headlights, Hella smoked taillights, a European-specification license plate tub, “Turbo” side graphics, and “Passat” license plates. The added smoked fender markers and fog lights are inoperative. Portions of the exterior have been repainted.

Staggered-width 17″ RH ZW1 wheels have been powder-coated Nostalgic Red and are mounted with adapters and 205/40 Achilles ATR Sport 2 Performance Radial tires. The car has been converted to a 5×100 bolt pattern, and the suspension and braking systems have been modified with ball joints, knuckles, and front calipers sourced from a 1997 Volkswagen GTI VR6 as well as:

The seating surfaces are trimmed in grey patterned cloth upholstery that extends to the door panel inserts. Black carpeting lines the footwells, and additional interior elements include a lockable glove compartment, power windows and mirrors, European-specification seatbelts, a golf ball shift knob, and a black faux suede headliner. The Pioneer CD stereo is not fully seated and the sunvisors have been dyed black.
The MOMO Prototipo steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and a combination gauge for fuel level and coolant temperature. The six-digit mechanical odometer shows 195k miles.

The turbocharged 1.8-liter (AWW) inline-four is sourced from a 2003 Volkswagen Jetta and installed under previous ownership. The secondary air injection, PCV, and EVAP systems were deleted along with the N249 valve, and the timing belt, water pump, tensioner, and cam chain tensioner were replaced when the engine was installed in 2020. There is no catalytic converter installed. Additional engine details include:
Power is sent to the front wheels through a five-speed 02J manual transaxle and shift box sourced from a 2003 Volkswagen Jetta.
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other reported damage.

This 2006 Lamborghini Murciélago roadster has 9k miles, and it was specified in Rosso Vik over black and red leather. It was purchased by its current owner in May 2021, and work in preparation for the sale included replacing the clutch, throw-out bearing, rear main seal, E-gear sensor assembly, and tires. Power is supplied by a 6.2-liter V12 that drives all four wheels through an E-gear six-speed automated transmission, and equipment includes a limited-slip rear differential, a black removable soft top, 18″ Hercules alloy wheels, a front-axle lift system, a speed-activated rear spoiler, xenon headlights, automatically deploying rear intakes, automatic climate control, and a CD stereo. This Murciélago roadster is now offered on dealer consignment with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The Murciélago was designed by Luc Donckerwolke and was publicly unveiled in 2001 at the Frankfurt Motor Show as the replacement for the Diablo. This example is finished in Rosso Vik and features a black removable soft top, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a pantograph windshield wiper, xenon headlights, scissor doors, rear fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, and automatically deploying rear intakes to aid in cooling. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery.

The 18″ Hercules alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero Corsa tires, which were fitted in October 2023. Stopping power is provided by silver-finished calipers fitted over cross-drilled rotors at each corner. The car is equipped with active dampers and a front-axle lift system.
The cabin houses manually adjustable seats trimmed in black and red leather with red stitching, and amenities include automatic climate control, inboard shoulder restraints, and a CD stereo.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 220-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer as well as auxiliary gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 9k miles.
The mid-mounted 6.2-liter V12 was factory rated at 572 horsepower and 479 lb-ft of torque.

Power is routed to all four wheels via an E-gear six-speed automated transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. Work in August 2023 included replacing the clutch, throw-out bearing, rear main seal, and E-gear sensor assembly.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Black & Red Leather Upholstery w/Red Stitching

description: This 1967 Rolls-Royce Silver Shadow is reported to be one of ten pre-production long-wheelbase examples produced and was initially ordered by a publishing magnate in San Francisco. Now finished in black over beige Connolly leather, the car is powered by a 6.2-liter V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes 15″ steel wheels with full covers, power-adjustable front seats, rear-passenger tables and footrests, power windows, and air conditioning. Following the seller’s 2019 acquisition, the brake system was refurbished along with the dual SU carburetors and the distributor. This Silver Shadow LWB is now offered with factory correspondence, a 1967 invoice, service records, spare parts, a car cover, and a clean Minnesota title in the seller’s name.

Factory finished in Sable, the four-door saloon wears an older repaint in black performed under previous ownership. It is equipped with a stainless-steel Doric-inspired grille with a Spirit of Ecstasy ornament and quad round headlights. Dents and dings are present around the bodywork, there are rust holes in the rear valance, and the windshield wipers require repair.

Steel 15″ wheels with full covers wear 235/70 Michelin XVS tires. Factory equipment included a four-wheel independent suspension with coil springs, anti-roll bars, telescopic dampers, and a hydraulic self-leveling system. Stopping power is provided by disc brakes at all four corners. The brake calipers are said to have been rebuilt in 2019 along with the fluid reservoir, pumps, switches, and spheres. The hoses were replaced, and the seller states the system has since been flushed every other year.

The power-adjustable front bucket seats are upholstered in beige Connolly leather, while wood trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior appointments include a rear bench seat, flip-out tray tables for the rear passengers, rear-passenger footrests, power windows, air conditioning, and an aftermarket stereo.

The steering wheel frames Smiths instrumentation consisting of a 130-mph speedometer alongside an ammeter and gauges for fuel level, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 88k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.
The 6.2-liter V8 is fitted with dual SU carburetors along with an electric fuel pump and a Ford alternator. The carburetors and ignition distributor were reportedly rebuilt in 2019.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a GM-sourced three-speed automatic transmission, and the seller states the shift servo was cleaned in preparation for the sale.
The underhood plate indicates chassis number LRX2718, while the Minnesota title shows a VIN of RR67LRX2718.

This 2017 Ducati 1299 Panigale S Anniversario is #61 of 500 produced to commemorate the 90th anniversary of the founding of Ducati, and it was acquired new in 2016 by the seller who has ridden it 702 miles. The bike is powered by a 1,285cc Superquadro L-twin paired with a six-speed transmission, and is finished in red, white, and black. It has been modified with a license-plate relocation kit, Superleggera wheels, Gilles rearsets, an Oberon clutch slave, AELLA frame sliders, Rizoma Stealth mirrors, and Rizoma brake and clutch levers. Additional equipment includes Ducati’s Quick Shift (DQS) system, a carbon-fiber clutch cover guard, carbon-fiber fenders, semi-active Öhlins suspension components, and triple disc brakes with Brembo calipers and cornering ABS as well as a color TFT digital dashboard with controls for the suspension, engine braking control, riding and power modes, and EVO traction and wheelie control. This Panigale S Anniversario is now offered with removed parts, an AGV Pista GP helmet, records, a pit stand, owner’s literature, and a clean Alaska title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in red, white, and black with 90th anniversary graphics. It features a cast alloy monocoque frame that utilizes the engine as a stressed member in addition to carbon-fiber trim, a clear windscreen, AELLA frame sliders, a relocated license plate kit, Gilles rear-set foot controls, and Rizoma mirrors and control levers.

Superleggera 17″ forged magnesium wheels are finished in gold and wear 120/70 front and 200/55 rear Pirelli Diablo Supercorsa tires. The Bosch six-axis IMU provides cornering anti-lock braking capability, and stopping power is provided by dual 330mm discs with radially mounted Brembo M50 four-piston calipers up front as well as a 245mm disc with a Brembo two-piston caliper at the rear.

Semi-active Öhlins suspension enables electronic compression and rebound damping adjustments for the 43mm NIX30 inverted fork as well as the TTX36 monoshock, which is connected to the alloy single-sided swingarm via an adjustable linkage.

An adjustable Öhlins piston-style steering damper is secured to the upper triple clamp, which is laser inscribed with the model name and production number. The digital dashboard features a full-color TFT display that includes a digital speedometer, an arcing bar-style tachometer, and a gear indicator as well as integrated controls for the traction control, Ducati Wheelie Control, engine braking control, cornering ABS, and riding modes. The digital odometer indicates 702 miles.

The 1,285cc Superquadro L-twin was factory rated 197 horsepower and 101 lb-ft of torque and features a ride-by-wire throttle, chain-driven double-overhead camshafts, and four desmodromically actuated valves per cylinder. The battery was replaced and the fluids changed in April 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a wet slipper clutch with an Oberon slave cylinder, a six-speed transmission equipped with the Ducati Quick Shift (DQS) system, and a drive chain.
Removed parts, owner’s literature, service records, and a pit stand, as well as a custom-painted carbon-fiber AGV Pista GP helmet in size XL are included in the sale.

This 2005 Mercedes-Benz S600 was purchased by the seller on BaT in December 2022, and it now has 67k miles. Powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V12 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission, the car is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic over gray leather. A coil-spring suspension conversion was installed under previous ownership and stock equipment includes 18″ six-hole wheels, a sunroof, Parktronic, bi-xenon headlights, Keyless Go, power-adjustable seats, an aftermarket touchscreen stereo head unit, and a Bose sound system. This W220 S600 is now offered at no reserve in Maryland with two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic and features bi-xenon headlights, a sunroof, front and rear Parktronic parking sensors, door closing assist, and auto-dimming side-view mirrors with integrated signal lighting. Evidence of paintwork is noted on the rear bumper cover. The seller states that the trunk latch and right-rear door latch were replaced in 2023, and both headlight housings were replaced in 2024. The trunk-closing assist function and the windshield washers are inoperative, and the left corner of the front bumper cover is scuffed.

The 18″ six-hole wheels are mounted with 245/45 Michelin Primacy MXM4 tires. A Strutmaster strut conversion kit with Eibach coil springs was installed in the place of the car’s Active Body Control (ABC) suspension system in 2020. The tire pressure monitoring system is inoperative.

The cabin features 14-way power-adjustable front seats upholstered in Grey Leather. Amenities include four-zone automatic climate control, Keyless Go, Distronic adaptive cruise control, power-adjustable rear seats, an electric rear window shade, a Bose sound system, and an aftermarket touchscreen stereo head unit.
