The front seat massage functions and the heating and cooling for the front and rear seats do not work, and the car’s emergency call system is inoperative. Wear is noted on the shifter.

The multifunction steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 5,800-rpm redline, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 67k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter M275 V12 was factory rated at 493 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. The oil pan was reportedly replaced in 2022, and the seller states that work performed in 2023 included replacing the spark plugs, right-side coil pack, battery, belt tensioner, and idler pulleys.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1968 Chevrolet K10 Suburban was acquired by the selling dealer in 2019 and subsequently underwent a refurbishment that involved a repaint in teal and an interior re-trim. Power is provided by a replacement 350ci V8 paired with floor-mounted shifters controlling the four-speed manual transmission and dual-range transfer case. Features include a single driver-side door along with a pair of passenger curbside doors and a clamshell-style tailgate. On the inside, the bench seats are trimmed in black vinyl and cloth, and additional equipment includes polished 17″ alloy wheels, Monroe Gas-Magnum shocks, Mile Market locking front hubs, a Rancho steering stabilizer, and an aftermarket head unit. This K10 Suburban is now offered with a clean Montana title in the name of the selling dealer.

The truck is configured with a single driver-side door as well as a pair of passenger curbside doors and a clamshell-style tailgate. It was repainted in its current shade of teal as part of the aforementioned refurbishment completed under current ownership. Aftermarket tint film has been applied to the rear windows.

Polished 17″ alloy wheels are wrapped in BFGoodrich Trail-Terrain T/A tires. The front axle is fitted with Mile Marker manually locking hubs, and the truck rides on Monroe Gas-Magnum shocks. Further equipment includes a Rancho steering stabilizer, power steering, and power-assisted four-wheel drum brakes.

The cabin houses two bench seats that have been reupholstered in black vinyl with gray cloth inserts. The shifter and transfer-case selector exit from the floor, which is lined in gray carpet. An aftermarket head unit has been added, and further details include a heater, vent windows, and lap belts.
The split-spoke steering wheel sits ahead of a 100-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 68k miles, and true mileage is unknown.
The replacement 350ci V8 was installed under previous ownership. It is equipped with a Summit Racing air cleaner as well as GM Goodwrench–branded valve covers.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.

This 2011 Aston Martin DBS Volante has remained registered in California through the current owner’s acquisition in 2021. The car was specified with a carbon-fiber front spoiler, rear diffuser, and mirror caps, and it is finished in Jet Black over Obsidian Black leather upholstery. Power is provided by a 6.0-liter V12, and additional equipment consists of a six-speed automatic transaxle, 20″ wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, parking sensors, power-adjustable and heated seats, automatic climate control, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and a pop-up navigation screen. This DBS has 26k miles and is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, an umbrella, two keys, a tire inflation kit, a clean Carfax report, and a California title.

Jet Black (AST1328H) paint finishes the exterior, and features consist of a decklid spoiler and side sill extensions as well as a carbon-fiber front lip spoiler, rear diffuser, and mirror supports. Additional equipment includes a black convertible soft top, xenon headlights, front and rear parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets. A paint correction and full PPF was reportedly applied in 2021. There are paint chips on the front end, a section of the soft top is raised above the rear window, and additional photos of the exterior condition are viewable in the gallery below.

The 20″ forged alloy wheels are mounted with 245/35 and 295/30 Pirelli P Zero tires. Braking is handled by carbon-ceramic rotors with Aston Martin S-branded black six-piston calipers up front and four-piston calipers out back. The brake fluid was flushed in February 2024, according to the seller.

The cabin features Obsidian Black leather upholstery with DBS-embroidered seat back logos as well as a color-matching center console and carpets. Piano black veneers accent the dashboard, and additional appointments consist of power-adjustable and heated front seats with memory settings as well as carbon-fiber door panel trim, automatic climate control, auto-dimming mirrors, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and a pop-up navigation screen. Creases are present on the driver’s seat.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 220-mph speedometer, a reverse-sweep tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles, approximately 7k of which were added under current ownership.
The 6.0-liter V12 was factory rated at 510 horsepower and 420 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in February 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a rear-mounted six-speed automatic transaxle.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
There is currently a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.

This 2023 Moke America Electric Moke is finished in black with a tan bimini soft top and is powered by a 7.5-kilowatt electric motor connected to a 60-volt AGM battery system to drive the front wheels through a double-reduction transaxle. Equipment includes black 14″ 10-spoke wheels, a rear-mounted spare tire, a slotted grille, roll bars, a rearview camera, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and a Bluetooth-capable stereo. This Electric Moke has approximately 13 miles and is now offered in Delaware by the selling dealer at no reserve with a Manufacturer’s Certificate of Origin.

The body is finished in black and features a tan bimini soft top in addition to a slotted grille, roll bars, windshield wipers, side mirrors, Moke-branded rear mud flaps, a lockable rear storage area, and front and rear lighting with turn signals.
Black 14″ 10-spoke wheels are mounted with 175/60 Minnell Radial P07 tires, and a spare tire is mounted to the rear of the vehicle. Stopping power is provided by front disc and rear drum brakes.

High-back individual front seats and a rear bench feature hard backs and are accented by a dash, floor, and side sills finished in the same color as the exterior. Interior appointments include three-point seatbelts, floor mats, a rearview camera, dashboard-mounted speakers, and a JSD stereo with Bluetooth connectivity.
The wood-rimmed steering wheel sits ahead of a 60-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges for temperature and battery-charge level. The digital odometer indicates 13 miles.

The car is equipped with a 7.5-kilowatt AC electric motor that is connected to AGM batteries forming a 60-volt electrical system, and it was rated at approximately 20 horsepower and 70 lb-ft of torque. An Eagle Performance battery charger has been fitted under the hood.
Power is routed to the front wheels through a double-reduction transaxle.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This vehicle does not have a title, as it has never been sold to a private party. It is being offered with its Manufacturer’s Certificate of Origin from Cruise Car, Inc which lists it as a Low-Speed Vehicle.

This 1976 Motobecane Mobylette 50L is finished in orange and powered by a 49cc two-stroke single mated to an automatic centrifugal clutch. It is equipped with an underslung exhaust and a crankset and pedals for starting as well as a solo saddle, orange saddle bags, leg guards, drum brakes, full suspension, and wire-spoke wheels with 17″ chrome steel rims. The seller acquired the moped out of a collection in 2022 and subsequently replaced the carburetor. This Moby 50L is now offered at no reserve in Florida with a bill of sale.

The moped is finished in orange and features a pressed-steel frame with a one-gallon fuel tank integrated with the backbone. Color-matched leg guards have been added, and additional equipment includes a stainless-steel front fender, a black solo saddle, a headlight and taillight, a chrome rear luggage rack, a center stand, and orange vinyl saddle bags with white piping. The side covers are missing.

Wire-spoke wheels with 17″ chrome steel rims are mounted with 2.25″-width street tires. Suspension consists of an inverted telescopic fork along with a pair of shrouded shocks fitted to the swingarm. Braking is handled by drums at both ends. The fork gaiters are torn.

The chrome high-rise handlebar carries a front brake lever and ignition switchgear on the left as well as a twist-grip throttle and levers for the rear brake and compression release on the right. The headlight bucket houses a Huret 35-mph speedometer with an inset four-digit odometer that shows 3,200 miles. Approximately 50 miles were ridden by the seller.

The 49cc two-stroke single features a crankset and pedals for starting along with a six-volt electrical system and an underslung exhaust system. Power is sent to the rear wheel via an automatic centrifugal clutch and a drive chain. A replacement carburetor was installed in 2022.
The moped does not have a title or registration. It is being sold on a bill of sale only.

This 2001 Mercedes-Benz SLK320 is equipped with a six-speed manual transmission and was offered on BaT in May 2023 before it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter V6, and the car is finished in Magma Red Metallic over Charcoal leather. Equipment includes a body-color retractable hardtop, xenon headlights, black-finished 16″ wheels, heated power-adjustable seats, dual-zone climate control, a CD changer, and a Bose sound system. This 20k-mile R170 is now offered by the selling dealer with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, partial service records, a Carfax report, and a Pennsylvania title.

The red-finished roadster features a power-retractable hardtop, a heated rear window, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, fog lights, window tint film, and optional xenon headlights with washers. A May 2023 entry of the Carfax report lists “minor damage.”

Black-painted 16″ five-spoke wheels are mounted with 205/55 front and 225/50 rear Continental ExtremeContact DW Tuned tires. The car is equipped with an independent front and rear multilink suspension as well as an Electronic Stability Program (ESP). Braking power is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable seats upholstered in Charcoal leather, while wood trim accents the center console and door panels. Amenities include dual-zone climate control, roll bar hoops, SLK-embroidered carpet floor mats, aluminum door sill inserts, a Bose sound system, and a trunk-mounted six-CD changer.

The leather-wrapped and wood-trimmed steering wheel frames white-dial instrumentation consisting of a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 20k miles, approximately 100 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 3.2-liter M112 V6 was factory-rated at 215 horsepower and 229 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Mercedes-Benz of Devon, Pennsylvania, factory colors and equipment, and a total retail price of $46,090.

This 2013 Ford F-150 SVT Raptor SuperCrew has been modified by Roush Industries in Plymouth Township, Michigan, with the Roush Off-Road package and is powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter Boss V8 linked with a six-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is finished in Race Red over black leather upholstery and features Fox Racing internal-bypass shocks, an electronically locking rear differential, hill descent control, the Raptor Graphics Package, the Raptor Plus Package, the Luxury Package, 18″ Fuel Trophy wheels, xenon headlights, a sunroof, front- and rear-view cameras, heated and cooled power-adjustable front seats, navigation, a six-disc CD stereo, and SYNC infotainment. The seller purchased the truck in 2017 and has since added approximately 42k of the 86k miles. This SVT Raptor is now offered with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The four-door truck is finished in Race Red and features a black hood decal as well as Roush and Raptor graphics on the rear fenders. Additional exterior equipment includes xenon headlights, a front skid plate, a sunroof, front- and rear-view cameras, a power-sliding rear window, running boards, a tailgate step, a bed extender, a folding tailgate step handle, a tonneau cover, a Protech spray-in bedliner, a keyless entry keypad, and a receiver hitch. The optional Raptor Plus Package added a backup camera and trailer brake controller. The windshield has a crack, the headlights show yellowing, and the tonneau cover requires extra effort to close properly.

The black-finished 18″ Fuel Trophy wheels are mounted with 35×12.5″ BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A K02 tires. An alignment was performed in June 2024. The Raptor is equipped with aluminum front control arms and Fox Racing internal-bypass shocks with increased suspension travel. The tires will sometimes rub at full lock.

The cabin is upholstered in black leather with Raptor and Roush Off-Road embroidery on the front seats, while the dash, door panels, and center console are accented with silver trim. Interior amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, power-adjustable pedals, heated and ventilated front seats, remote start, navigation, a six-disc CD stereo, SYNC infotainment, cruise control, and auxiliary switches.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5,900-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, transmission temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 86k miles, approximately 42k of which were added under current ownership. The phone hang-up button on the steering wheel is inoperable.

The 6.2-liter Boss V8 was modified with a Roush supercharger, a Roush air intake, upgraded fuel injectors, a replacement idler pulley, and a performance exhaust system. Roush rated the engine at 590 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in June 2024.

Power is delivered to the rear or all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The rear axle features an electronically locking differential with 4.10:1 gears.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2013 BMW M6 convertible is finished in Silverstone Metallic over black Merino leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The car remained with its original owner in Oklahoma until 2024, and it now has 10k miles. Features include the Driver Assistance and Executive packages as well as a black convertible top, heated and ventilated front sport seats, 20″ Style 343M wheels, Park Distance Control, a heated steering wheel, and rear-, side-, and top-view cameras. This F12 M6 convertible is now offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer with two window stickers, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Oklahoma title.
The car is finished in Silverstone Metallic (A29), and exterior details include M aerodynamic bodywork, a black convertible top, LED lighting, soft-close doors, and quad exhaust finishers.
The 20″ Style 343M alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car is equipped with Dynamic Damper Control and Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) with M Dynamic Mode.

The cabin features heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats that are trimmed in black Merino leather along with carbon-fiber interior trim. Amenities include rear-, side-, and top-view cameras as well as Comfort Access, Park Distance Control, dual-zone automatic climate control, and iDrive infotainment with navigation.

The heated leather-wrapped steering wheel features shift paddles and frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7,200-rpm redline as well as auxiliary gauges for fuel level and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 10k miles.
The twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter S63B44T1 V8 was factory rated at 560 horsepower and 500 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission and an Active M differential.
The window stickers note initial delivery to Jackie Cooper Imports in Edmond, Oklahoma, and list factory equipment, colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $127,395.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1991 Mercedes-Benz 300CE coupe was first registered in Ontario and relocated to California after the seller’s purchase in 1999. The car is powered by a 3.0-liter M104 inline-six paired with a four-speed automatic transmission, and it is finished in black over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 15″ Alamak alloy wheels, a sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, a cassette stereo, a trunk-mounted CD changer, automatic climate control, and R134a-based air conditioning. This C124 300CE shows 224k miles and is offered with manufacturer’s literature and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in black with gray lower cladding and exterior features include a sunroof, headlight wipers and washers, fog lights, a power antenna, and a mono-blade windshield wiper. An October 2001 entry on the Carfax report lists “moderate damage” to the left front corner of the car, and the seller notes corrosion beneath the right rear tail light and left rear wheel well. There is a ding in the right rear fender and a crack in the windshield, and close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.
Silver 15″ Alamak alloy wheels are mounted with Khumo Ecsta tires. Braking is handled by ventilated front and solid rear disc brakes with ABS.

The cabin features seating upholstered in black leather along with wood trim and a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, door panels, and carpets. Interior appointments include heated power-adjustable front seats, driver position memory, a cassette stereo linked to a trunk-mounted CD changer, automatic climate control, a passenger airbag, and air conditioning, the latter of which has been converted to utilize R134a refrigerant. The wood trim is cracked and the cruise control does not work.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a replacement 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer as well as an analog clock and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 224k miles, approximately 140k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.0-liter M104 inline-six was factory-rated at 217 horsepower and 229 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission. The seller notes that a larger diameter cooling fan, transmission cooler, and revised viscous fan clutch have been added. The car passed a California emissions inspection in preparation for the sale.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery.

The Carfax report lists the aforementioned October 2001 damage. An entry in March 2014 states that the car was designated a gross polluter in California, although the car has since passed California emissions inspections, including most recently in June 2024.
The car is registered as Planned Non-Operation in the state of California.

This Factory Five Racing Mk3 Roadster was assembled between 2006 and 2008 by the seller’s father-in-law, who fitted a Ford Racing 302ci V8 that is linked to a Tremec World Class T-5 five-speed manual transmission and an 8.8″ rear axle with a limited-slip differential. The car is finished in red over black vinyl upholstery and features a removable hardtop, polished bumperettes, a single roll hoop, and AC badging. Additional details include a wood-rimmed steering wheel, AutoMeter instrumentation, a fire extinguisher, 15″ Halibrand-style wheels, disc brakes, adjustable coilovers, an Edelbrock Weber carburetor, a Mallory distributor, and a rear-exit dual exhaust system. Acquired by the seller in 2018, this Mk3 Roadster is now offered with a Manufacturer’s Statement of Origin, build documents, spare parts, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name describing it as a 1964 ACE Convertible.

The fiberglass body is said to have been coated in Dupont 4004S primer before being finished in red with Dupont Centari acrylic enamel, per the seller. Exterior details include polished bumperettes, a hood scoop, fender vents, a Talbot Berlin-style mirror, wind wings, a single roll hoop, AC badging, and a Le Mans-style fuel filler. A black hardtop is included in the sale.

Halibrand-style 15″ wheels wear faux knock-off spinners and are mounted with BF Goodrich Radial T/A white letter tires measuring 235/60 up front and 275/50 out back. The car is equipped with rack-and-pinion steering, Bilstein adjustable coilovers, adjustable front upper control arms, a three-link rear suspension, and a rear panhard bar. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes.

The low-back bucket seats are trimmed in black vinyl and are fitted with Simpson racing harnesses. Additional interior elements include a center console, leather door check straps, a glove compartment, a fire extinguisher, AC-branded pedals, and a passenger grab handle. The fuse block is mounted in the glove compartment. The windshield blower motor is inoperative.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel wears an AC-branded center cap and fronts a black upholstered dashboard housing AutoMeter instrumentation consisting of a reverse-sweep 180-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 1,500 miles, approximately 600 of which have been added under current ownership.

The front-hinged hood opens to reveal a Ford Racing 302ci V8 with 9.0:1 compression and equipped with GT-40 aluminum cylinder heads, a dual plane “Performer RPM” intake manifold, a hydraulic roller camshaft, roller rockers, a Mallory distributor, an Edelbrock Weber four-barrel 600-CFM carburetor, and Short tube headers that flow into a 2.5″ dual exhaust with Flowmaster mufflers. Work under current ownership reportedly included repairing an intake manifold leak and performing fluid changes.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a Tremec World Class T-5 five-speed manual transmission and an 8.8″ rear axle with a Summit Racing girdle cover and a limited-slip differential.
The reproduction chassis tag CSX30561, shown above matches the VIN listed on the current Georgia title which describes the car as a 1964 Ace Convertible.
Photos taking during the build process are viewable in the image gallery below.
listing_details: Tremec World Class T-5 5-Speed Manual Transmission

description: This 2012 Mercedes-Benz S550 has remained registered in California from new and now has 35k miles. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.7-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Iridium Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. Features include 18″ five-spoke wheels, bi-xenon headlights, a sunroof, Parktronic, soft-close doors, a backup camera, COMAND with navigation, Harman Kardon audio, and heated and ventilated front seats. This W221 S550 is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, spare keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Iridium Silver Metallic and features bi-xenon headlights, a sunroof, Parktronic, soft-close doors, a power-operated trunk lid, dual exhaust outlets, and auto-dimming side-view mirrors with integrated signal lighting. Scrapes are visible on the rear bumper cover behind the right wheel, and additional blemishes are shown in the gallery.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in May 2024 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner’s participation on BaT has been restricted.

The 18″ five-spoke wheels wear 255/45 Michelin Pilot Sport A/S tires. The car is equipped with Airmatic semi-active suspension, and braking is handled by four-wheel vented disc brakes with cross-drilled front rotors.

The cabin features heated and ventilated 14-way power-adjustable front seats upholstered in black leather. Amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, a backup camera, a Harman Kardon sound system, and COMAND infotainment with navigation.
The multi-function steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 35k miles.
The twin-turbocharged 4.7-liter M278 V8 was factory rated at 429 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque. A replacement battery was installed in February 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2001 BMW M3 convertible has 41k miles following registration history in Pennsylvania and North Carolina. Finished in Imola Red II over black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered in Florida by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean North Carolina title.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as fog lights and quad exhaust outlets. The front fender liners were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake fluid was flushed in July 2023.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and High-Gloss Black trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include seat-position memory for the driver along with cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 41k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential fluid was changed in June 2024.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Harman Kardon Sound System w/BMW Business CD Stereo

description: This 2018 Volkswagen Golf R was purchased new by its late owner at Molle Volkswagen of Kansas City, Missouri, and it now indicates 21k miles. Finished in Lapiz Blue Metallic over Titan Black leather upholstery, the car is powered by a turbocharged 2.0-liter inline-four linked with a seven-speed automatic transaxle and a 4MOTION all-wheel-drive system. It has been modified with an Integrated Engineering intake, a RacingLine oil catch can, OZ Racing 19″ Ultraleggera HLT wheels, and APR components including an intercooler, ignition coils, lowering springs, engine control unit (ECU) and transmission control unit (TCU) tunes, and exhaust components. Additional features include selectable driving modes, adaptive LED headlights, adaptive cruise control, heated front sport seats, and Fender Premium Audio linked to an 8″ touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, VW AppConnect, satellite radio, and Bluetooth connectivity. This Golf R is offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of the late owner’s estate with a window sticker, service and parts invoices, spare and removed parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Missouri title.

The Golf R is differentiated from the standard Golf by revised bodywork including the hatch spoiler, rear diffuser, front fascia with larger air intakes, and side skirts. This example is finished in Lapiz Blue Metallic (L9L9) with black lower-body accents and mirror caps. Clear paint protection film was applied to a portion of the front fascia along with the rear bumper cover, headlight lenses, rocker panels, and lower doors in 2018. The seller states that the car was damaged by hail in 2022, and subsequent work included repairing and refinishing a portion of the left roof rail along with performing paintless dent repair on the hood, roof, doors, front fenders, quarter panels, and tailgate. The right-side taillight lens is cracked.

OZ Racing 19″ Ultraleggera HLT wheels were mounted with 235/35 Continental ExtremeContact DWS 06 Plus tires in April 2024. The four-wheel independent sport suspension features adaptive Dynamic Chassis Control dampers and has been modified with APR lowering springs. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated disc brakes with black-finished R-branded front calipers. The seller notes blemishes on the right-front wheel.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Titan Black leather with contrasting piping, and embroidered R emblems accent the backrests of the heated “Top Sport” front bucket seats. Amenities include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, dual-zone automatic climate control, keyless entry, ambient lighting, “Carbon Touch” dashboard and door panel trim, selectable driving modes, and Fender Premium Audio linked to an 8″ infotainment system with navigation, VW AppConnect smartphone integration, satellite radio, and Bluetooth connectivity. Driver-assistance systems comprise active blind-spot monitoring, lane-keeping assist, and adaptive cruise control with forward collision warning and autonomous emergency braking. A COBB Tuning AccessPort tuning module is mounted ahead of the driver-side air vent.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel is equipped with paddle shifters and fronts a Volkswagen Digital Cockpit instrument display, which contains a configurable central menu, a 200-mph speedometer with an inset coolant temperature gauge, and a tachometer with an inset fuel level gauge. The digital odometer indicates 21k miles.

The turbocharged 2.0-liter EA888 inline-four features direct fuel injection, dual overhead camshafts, and a replacement turbocharger, and it drives all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transaxle and a 4MOTION all-wheel drive system. The engine was fitted with a replacement long block by Habibi Motorsports of Maryland Heights, Missouri, in May 2020, and it has been modified with an Integrated Engineering intake, a Racingline oil catch can, and APR components including an engine control unit (ECU) tune, a transmission control unit (TCU) tune, an intercooler, ignition coils, an exhaust downpipe without an integrated catalyst, and an exhaust system with black-finished 3.5″ tips.
Additional underbody photos are presented in the gallery below.

The included window sticker displays initial delivery to Molle Volkswagen of Kansas City, Missouri, and it lists factory colors and equipment along with a total price of $42,055. Removed Englishtown wheels, service and parts invoices, and various additional spare and removed parts will also accompany the car.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Missouri.

This 2023 Audi R8 is number 157 of 333 GT models produced for the model year, and it is one of 50 Mythos Black Metallic examples allocated to the US. The interior is upholstered in black Nappa leather and Alcantara, and the car is powered by a 5.2-liter V10 mated to a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Additional equipment includes forged 20″ Audi Sport wheels, a carbon-fiber front roll bar, carbon-ceramic brakes, LED headlights, and carbon-fiber bodywork and interior trim in addition to selectable Torque Rear slip control, an Audi Virtual Cockpit instrument panel, heated seats, Bang & Olufsen audio, automatic climate control, and Audi MMI infotainment with navigation. Acquired by the selling dealer in March 2024, this R8 GT has 10k miles and is now offered with a tool and tire-inflation kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

Audi allocated 150 of the second-generation R8 GT cars to the US market, and this example is finished in Mythos Black Metallic with a carbon-fiber aero package consisting of a front splitter and canards, side skirts, a rear diffuser and bumper-side elements, and a goose-neck rear wing. Additional exterior details include LED headlights with Audi Laser Light along with Carbon Sigma side blades, front and rear parking sensors, and dual black-finished exhaust outlets. The front splitter was replaced in preparation for the sale.

Forged 20″ Audi Sport wheels are finished in black and wear 245/30 front and 305/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. The factory sport suspension system features a carbon-fiber front sway bar, and braking is provided by carbon-ceramic brakes with six-piston calipers and 380mm rotors up front along with four-piston calipers and 356mm rotors out back.

The heated and power-height-adjustable seats are trimmed in black Nappa leather with Alcantara inserts as well as red stitching and matching backrest embroidery. Additional appointments include carbon-fiber trim, red seat belts, automatic climate control, a Bang & Olufsen audio system, a diamond-stitched Alcantara headliner, and Audi MMI infotainment with navigation.
Production numbers embedded in the center-console trim indicate this is number 157 of 333 R8 GT examples produced.

The suede-wrapped, flat-bottom steering wheel carries selectors for Torque Rear mode, which allows variable levels of rear-wheel slip. Shift paddles and a configurable Audi Virtual Cockpit instrument display are ahead, and the digital odometer shows 10k miles.
The 5.2-liter V10 was factory rated at 602 horsepower and 413 lb-ft of torque. The oil was most recently changed in February 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed S Tronic dual-clutch automatic transaxle.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Audi Van Nuys in Sherman Oaks, California, factory colors and equipment, and a total manufacturer’s suggested retail price of $253,290.
The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries.

This 1968 Porsche 912 coupe was sold new at Ely Volkswagen of Oakland, California, and it is finished in Signal Green over black leatherette upholstery. The car is powered by a 1.6-liter flat-four mated to a five-speed manual transaxle and features 15″ perforated steel disc wheels, disc brakes, H4 headlights, bright bumper guards, bucket seats, lap and shoulder belts, an AM/FM radio, and a heater. This SWB 912 coupe was acquired by the current owner in 2021 and is now offered in California on dealer consignment with a copy of the Kardex, the owner’s manual, a tool kit, and a clean Alaska title.

The car came finished from the factory in Signal Green (R6001) and is equipped with H4 headlights, bright bumpers, black windshield wipers, and a single exhaust outlet. The seller notes that the decklid has been repainted and prior rust repair has been performed on the right front fender near the A-pillar. Touch up paint has been applied to the body and there is rust around the trim on the left rocker panel.

The 15″ perforated steel disc wheels wear bright covers and are mounted with 185/70 Michelin Cinturato tires. The car is equipped with an independent front and rear suspension, and stopping power is provided by disc brakes at all four corners.

The 2+2 cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in black leatherette upholstery as well as a matte-black dashboard with aluminum trim. Appointments include lap and shoulder belts, rear vent windows, a Blaupunkt AM/FM radio, and a heater. The seats, dash, and package shelf have been refurbished.

The wood-rimmed four-spoke steering wheel sits ahead of VDO instrumentation including a 7k-rpm tachometer, a 120-mph speedometer, auxiliary gauges, and an analog clock. The five-digit odometer shows 8k miles, approximately 360 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The 1.6-liter flat-four is equipped with dual Solex carburetors and was factory rated at 90 horsepower and 90 lb-ft of torque. Compression test results are viewable in the gallery.
Engine stamping *1282544* is shown above, and a corresponding number is listed on the Kardex.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle.
A copy of the Kardex is viewable above and lists the factory colors and serial numbers along with original delivery to California.

This 2008 Mercedes-Benz ML350 was initially delivered to Continental Imports in Austin, Texas, and it now has 103k miles following registration history in that state since new. It is finished in black over black MB-Tex upholstery and is powered by a 3.5-liter V6 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes the Premium 1 Package, a sunroof, 19″ five-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, a backup camera, and dual-zone automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this W164 ML350 is offered in Florida at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The truck is finished in black and features a sunroof, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, a receiver hitch, a power liftgate, and polished exhaust outlets. Photographs of paint-meter readings are presented in the gallery.

Silver 19″ five-spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires that have 2023 date codes. The truck is equipped with an Electronic Stability Program (ESP) and a four-wheel Electronic Traction System (4-ETS). Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs with Emergency Brake Assist.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in black MB-Tex along with a matching center console and door panels. Additional appointments include heated power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, Keyless Go, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, a backup camera, dual-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, an analog clock, a fuel-level gauge, and a digital information display. The digital odometer indicates 103k miles. There is wear on the steering wheel buttons.
The 3.5-liter M272 V6 was factory-rated at 268 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is delivered to all four wheels through a 7G-Tronic seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Continental Imports in Austin, Texas, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a Total Retail Price of $51,280.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2000 Mercedes-Benz CLK430 cabriolet has 37k miles following registration history in Wisconsin, Connecticut, and Florida. Finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic over Charcoal leather, the car is powered by a 4.3-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Features include a black convertible soft top, 17″ five-spoke AMG monoblock lightweight alloy wheels,   fog lights, power-adjustable front seats,   cruise control, dual-zone automatic climate control, COMAND infotainment with navigation, and a Bose sound system. This A208 CLK430 cabriolet is now offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a Florida title.

The car is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic (744), and exterior details include an AMG-designed front air dam, side skirts, and rear apron as well as a power-operated black convertible soft top, a monoblade windshield wiper, fog lights, and heated side mirrors. The soft top’s hydraulic cylinders were rebuilt in February 2024.
Five-spoke 17″ AMG monoblock lightweight alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Braking is handled by discs at each corner, and the car is equipped with electronic stability control.

The cabin features  power-adjustable front seats trimmed in Charcoal leather, while wood veneers accent the center console and door panels. Amenities include front seat position memory,   cruise control, dual-zone automatic climate control, COMAND infotainment with navigation, and a Bose sound system.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 37k miles.
The 4.3-liter SOHC V8 was factory rated at 275 horsepower and 295 lb-ft of torque. The battery was replaced in August 2022.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: 17" Five-Spoke AMG Monoblock Lightweight Alloy Wheels

description: This 2007 Subaru Impreza WRX STi is powered by a turbocharged 2.5-liter flat-four that was serviced with a replacement short block in December 2023, at which time the cylinder heads are said to have been rebuilt and various gaskets were replaced. Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle, a driver-controlled center differential, and limited-slip front and rear differentials. Finished in Urban Gray Metallic over black and blue upholstery, the car has been fitted with an aftermarket exhaust system and a Pioneer head unit. It also has a rear spoiler, Brembo brake calipers, black-finished 17″ 10-spoke wheels, and automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the car in April 2023, and subsequent service is noted to have included replacing the oil pump, crankshaft seals, and spark plugs. This WRX STi has 138k miles and is offered in California at no reserve with service records and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in Urban Gray Metallic (45A) and features an aluminum hood with a scoop as well as HID headlights, side skirts, power-adjustable mirrors, a roof spoiler, and a single exhaust outlet. The selling dealer notes the trunk lid has been replaced, and the Carfax report notes damage to the front and right side in January 2015. Close-up photos of the paintwork and trim are presented in the gallery.

Black-finished 17″ 10-spoke wheels are mounted with 245/45 TBB TR-66 tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with Brembo four-piston front and two-piston rear calipers over cross-drilled and slotted rotors. Service in December 2023 included replacing the front struts, strut mounts, ball joints, control arms, and lower control arm bushings.

The front bucket seats are trimmed in black cloth with blue Alcantara inserts, and color-coordinated upholstery extends to the rear seats and the door panels. Amenities include cruise control, automatic climate control, and a Pioneer head unit with a CD player and Bluetooth in addition to a Blaupunkt amplifier stored in the trunk. The door trim and shifter linkage bushings were reportedly replaced in 2024.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is noted to have been replaced in February 2024 and fronts a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 138k miles, approximately 900 of which were added under current ownership.

The turbocharged 2.5-liter flat-four was reportedly fitted with a replacement short block in December 2023, a work order for which can be viewed in the gallery. Subsequent service is said to have included replacing the oil pump, cylinder head gaskets, crankshaft seals, timing belt, mass airflow sensor, engine mounts, accessory belts, fuel tank, spark plugs, and thermostat. The Carfax report notes the short block was replaced in 2007.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle, a driver-controlled center differential, and limited-slip front and rear differentials. An aftermarket exhaust system with a catalytic converter has been installed according to the selling dealer.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned damage entry.
The selling dealer states that the car cannot pass a California emissions test, therefore it cannot be sold to an in-state private party buyer.

This 1998 Ford E-350 underwent a camper van conversion by Sportsmobile West under prior ownership, and it was acquired by the current owner in November 2019. It is finished in cream with contrasting graphics over black leather upholstery, and it is powered by a 6.8-liter V10 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The van features a pop-up roof, swing-out storage and spare tire carriers, a winch, 17″ Method wheels, air conditioning, a CD stereo, a lofted sleeping surface, a sink, a refrigerator, and storage cabinets. This E-350 has 173k miles and is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The van is finished in cream with contrasting graphics and a pop-up roof. Additional equipment includes a roof-mounted solar panel, aftermarket bumpers, a winch, and a rear-mounted spare tire and storage box.
Black-finished 17″ Method alloy wheels wear 35×12.50″ BFGoodrich All-Terrian K02 tires. Stopping power is provided by front disc and rear drum brakes.
The front captain’s chairs are trimmed in black leather. Features include power windows and locks, air conditioning, and a Kenwood touchscreen head unit.

The two-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges. The six-digit odometer shows 173k miles, approximately 16k of which were added under current ownership. The airbag and ABS lights are illuminated.
The rear of the cabin has a lofted sleeping surface, a refrigerator, a sink, and storage cabinets.
The 6.8-liter V10 was factory rated at 268 horsepower and 410 lb-ft of torque when new. The vehicle most recently passed a California emissions test in December 2022.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The transmission was rebuilt in July 2010.

This 2013 Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG coupe is a black-over-black example that was initially sold by Rallye Motors of Roslyn, New York, and now has 8k miles. Powered by a 6.2-liter M156 V8 paired with a seven-speed AMG Speedshift MCT automatic transmission, the car has a limited-slip differential, 18″ split-spoke AMG alloy wheels, bi-xenon headlights, Parktronic, heated power-adjustable front seats, a panoramic sunroof, Keyless-Go, Blind Spot Assist, Lane Keeping Assist, COMAND infotainment, navigation, wood trim, a Harman Kardon sound system, a rearview camera, and dual-zone automatic climate control. Purchased by the current owner in 2020, this C63 AMG is now offered on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Obsidian Black Metallic and has bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination as well as a panoramic sunroof, front and rear parking sensors, a rear spoiler, bright trim, and quad exhaust outlets. According to the seller, the front bumper cover has been refinished.

The 18″ split-spoke AMG alloy wheels are mounted with staggered-width Bridgestone Potenza tires showing 2021 and 2022 date codes. The C63 AMG features a revised front suspension with a widened front track compared to the standard C-Class as well as an AMG Sport Suspension and an Electronic Stability Program (ESP). Braking is handled by silver AMG-branded six- and four-piston calipers over drilled and slotted rotors.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are trimmed in black leather with AMG logos on the backrests, while wood trim accents the cabin. Rubberized floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include Keyless-Go, Blind Spot Assist, Lane Keeping Assist, COMAND infotainment, navigation, a rearview camera, front-seat position memory settings, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features aluminum shift paddles. AMG instrumentation includes a 200-mph speedometer with an inset digital display, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 8k miles, approximately 2,500 of which were added under current ownership.
The 6.2-liter M156 V8 was factory rated at 451 horsepower and 443 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed as part of an “A service” in preparation for the sale, according to the seller.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a seven-speed AMG Speedshift MCT automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Seven-Speed AMG Speedshift MCT Automatic Transmission
Lane Keep and Blind Spot Assist

description: This 2005 Lexus ES330 was initially sold in British Columbia, Canada, and remained registered in the province through the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024. Now showing 63k kilometers (~39k miles) it is finished in silver over black leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.3-liter V6 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes 17″ alloy wheels, fog lights, a power sunroof, heated and ventilated front seats, power-adjustable pedals, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a CD stereo. This ES330 is offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a British Columbia registration.

The car is finished in silver and features projector-style headlights, fog lights, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, and a power sunroof. Dings and evidence of touched-up paintwork are visible on the left side of the rear bumper cover.
Silver-finished 17″ alloy wheels have scuffs and are wrapped in 215/55 Bridgestone Ecopia tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs with ABS.

The heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats and rear bench are trimmed in black leather upholstery. Woodgrain trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and additional appointments include front seat position memory, power-adjustable pedals, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a CD stereo with a six-disc in-dash changer.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 220-km/h speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 63k kilometers (~39k miles).
The 3.3-liter V6 was factory rated at 225 horsepower and 240 lb-ft of torque and features VVT-i continuously variable valve timing. A factory strut tower brace spans the engine bay.
Power is sent to the front wheels through a five-speed automatic transaxle.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in British Columbia, Canada from new.
The vehicle does not have a title and is being sold on its British Columbia registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada

This 1999 Panoz AIV Roadster is one of 176 examples produced between 1996 and 1999 and is powered by a Ford 4.6-liter DOHC V8 mated to a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It is finished in silver over black leather upholstery and has a removable black soft top and side curtains as well as 18″ wheels, adjustable coilovers, wind wings, a Nardi steering wheel, air conditioning, carbon-fiber interior trim, and an Eclipse CD stereo. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this AIV Roadster shows 2k miles and is offered with an owner’s manual, supplementary literature, a model car, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

Designed by Freeman Thomas, the AIV, or Aluminum Intensive Vehicle, featured a superplastic-formed aluminum body with fiberglass fenders and a hood scoop. This example is finished in silver and features chrome-finished bumpers and headlight housings in addition to wind wings, rear gravel guards, twin central exhaust outlets, and body-color mirror caps. Photos of the removed black soft top and side curtains are provided in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 18″ wheels are mounted with 245/40 front and 295/35 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car rides on a four-wheel independent suspension with adjustable coilovers, and braking is handled by four-wheel discs.

The cockpit features high-back bucket seats trimmed in black leather with debossed Panoz logos on each headrest. Color-coordinated upholstery extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and additional appointments include air conditioning, carbon-fiber trim, drilled metal pedals, and an Eclipse CD stereo.
The flat-bottom Nardi steering wheel fronts centrally positioned instrumentation that includes a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The six-digit odometer shows 2k miles.

The 4.6-liter DOHC V8 was sourced from Ford’s SVT division and was rated at 300 horsepower and 305 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a Ford 8.8″ rear end with a limited-slip differential.
Additional underside photos can be seen in the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2018 Land Rover Range Rover HSE Td6 has remained registered in Tennessee from new and is powered by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. It is finished in Santorini Black Metallic and has a panoramic roof, LED headlights, soft-close doors, 20″ wheels, and electronic air suspension. The cabin is upholstered in Almond and Espresso leather, and other equipment includes heated and ventilated front seats, a Meridian sound system, four-zone climate control, and a 10″ touchscreen with navigation as well as adaptive cruise control, a head-up display, and a surround-view camera system. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this Range Rover has 28k miles and is offered at no reserve in Virginia with an owner’s manual, two key fobs, a clean Carfax report, and an Ohio title.

The truck is finished in Santorini Black Metallic and has a panoramic roof, LED headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, auto-dimming mirrors, parking sensors, dual exhaust outlets, and a power-operated tailgate. Blemishes are shown in the gallery below.

The 20″ multi-spoke Style 1065 wheels are mounted with 255/55 Yokohama Geolander tires. Equipment includes an electronic air suspension with variable ride height as well as a terrain response system, Adaptive Dynamics stability control, Hill Descent Control (HDC), Electronic Traction Control (ETC), and ventilated disc brakes at each corner.

The heated and ventilated front seats are trimmed in Almond leather that extends to the heated and reclining rear bench, while Espresso upholstery covers the upper dash. Shadow walnut trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include a Meridian sound system, four-zone climate control, soft-close doors, and a 10″ touchscreen with navigation.

The heated steering wheel has paddle shifters and frames a configurable digital instrument cluster with a 6k-rpm tachometer and a 150-mph speedometer. The digital odometer indicates 28k miles. Driver aids include adaptive cruise control, lane keep assist, blind spot assist, a surround-view camera system, and a head-up display.

The 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 was factory rated at 254 horsepower and 443 lb-ft of torque. The engine powertrain module was replaced in 2020, the diesel particulate filter was replaced in 2023, and an oil change was performed in 2024.
Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission and a two-speed electronically controlled transfer case.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

attributes.value: Rover Range Rover HSE Td6 Diesel

description: This 2007 Honda S2000 remained with its initial owners in Oregon until 2022 and was previously sold on BaT in August 2022. It is finished in Rio Yellow Pearl over black leather and is powered by a 2.2-liter VTEC inline-four linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a black convertible soft top, 17″ 10-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, air conditioning, a CD stereo, and cruise control. The seller purchased the car in 2023 and has since added approximately 200 of the 6k miles. This AP2 S2000 is offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature and a clean Nevada title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Rio Yellow Pearl (Y-65P) and features a power-operated black soft top with a glass rear window. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, a black windshield surround, roll hoops, and oval-tipped exhaust outlets. The seller notes the front bumper cover was repainted and repaired under current ownership, and the Carfax report lists damage in April 2023.

The 17″ 10-spoke wheels are mounted with older Bridgestone Potenza RE050 tires measuring 215/45 up front and 245/40 out back. The car features double-wishbone suspension and four-wheel disc brakes. The brake fluid was flushed in February 2024.

The cabin features seats upholstered in black leather along with color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include push-button ignition, air conditioning, cruise control, a CD stereo, and a leather-wrapped aluminum shift knob.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a digital speedometer and a bar-style tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 6k miles, approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership.
The 2.2-liter VTEC F22C1 inline-four was factory rated at 237 horsepower and 162 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed and the serpentine belt was replaced in February 2024.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned damage entry.

This 2005 Mini Cooper S convertible is equipped with the John Cooper Works Tuning Kit, and it has 56k miles following registration history in Georgia and Florida. Finished in Hyper Blue Metallic over Lapis Blue leather, the car is powered by a supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed manual transaxle. Additional equipment includes a blue soft top, 18″ R95 star-spoke wheels, a limited-slip differential, Park Distance Control, heated front seats, a CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and air conditioning. This R52 Cooper S convertible is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a Florida title.

The car is finished in Hyper Blue Metallic with a power-retractable blue convertible soft top and white hood stripes. Exterior features include driving lights, fog lights, Park Distance Control, body-color mirror caps, a hood scoop, and twin center-exit exhaust outlets engraved with “John Cooper Works” script.
Silver-finished 18″ R95 star-spoke wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires, which were fitted in April 2022. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control and a sport suspension.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Lapis Blue leather with red stitching. Equipment includes heated front seats, a CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and air conditioning. Wear is evident on the driver’s seat.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a column-mounted 8k-rpm tachometer with an integrated digital speedometer, while the centrally mounted 150-mph speedometer houses the coolant temperature and fuel level gauges. The digital odometer indicates 56k miles.

The supercharged 1.6-liter inline-four is fitted with the John Cooper Works tuning kit, which included re-mapped engine management software and an upgraded cylinder head, supercharger pulley, air intake, and fuel injectors when compared with the standard Cooper S. The timing chain and spark plugs were replaced in May 2023, and the oil was changed in June 2024.
Power is sent to the front wheels through a Getrag six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Hyper Blue Metallic Paint w/White Hood Stripes
Harman Kardon Sound System w/CD Stereo

description: This 1978 Ford Thunderbird is a Diamond Jubilee Edition finished in Diamond Blue Metallic over blue luxury cloth upholstery and is powered by a 351ci V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission. Standard exterior elements included a padded vinyl roof, opera windows, accent stripes, bodyside moldings, a jewel-like hood ornament, a power antenna, hideaway headlights, and a color-keyed grille, mirrors, rubber bumper strips, and aluminum wheels. A 22k gold-finished owner nameplate is fitted above the glovebox and additional equipment consists of air conditioning, cruise control, a power-adjustable driver seat, a hand-stitched leather instrument panel, Ebony wood-tone interior appliques, cut-pile carpeting, and a push-button AM/FM stereo. The car spent time in Connecticut and Nevada before being sold on BaT in February 2024, after which new tires were installed. This Thunderbird Diamond Jubilee Edition shows 25k miles and is now offered on dealer consignment in South Carolina with an owner’s manual, service records, historical documentation, and a clean Nevada title.

The Diamond Jubilee Edition was created to commemorate Ford’s 75th anniversary as an automotive manufacturer. The car left the factory finished in Diamond Blue Metallic with bright accents. Details include a jewel-like hood ornament, a power antenna, a padded vinyl roof, opera windows, “Diamond Jubilee Edition” window script, accent stripes, bodyside moldings, hideaway headlights, and a color-keyed grille, mirrors, fender vents, and rubber bumper strips. Paint meter readings and blemishes are shown in the gallery.

Blue-accented 15″ cast aluminum wheels wear 235/70 Auburn Premium Radial narrow-whitewall tires mounted in preparation for the sale, photos of which are presented in the gallery. A matching replacement spare is located in the trunk. The car is equipped with power steering and braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The front split bench and rear bench are upholstered in blue luxury cloth with biscuit-style stitching. Thunderbird badges are fitted to the front seat backs and equipment includes air conditioning, cruise control, a power-adjustable driver seat, a hand-stitched leather instrument panel, Ebony wood-tone interior appliques, cut-pile carpeting, power windows, folding center armrests, illuminated vanity mirrors, and a push-button AM/FM stereo. A 22k gold-finished owner nameplate is mounted above the glovebox door.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel sits on a tilt column and frames an 85-mph speedometer, a tachometer, an analog clock, and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 25k miles, a handful of which were added by the selling dealer.
The car is powered by a 351ci V8, and power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission. An oil change was most recently performed in February 2024.
An owner’s manual, a Thunderbird Diamond Jubilee Edition pamphlet, service records, and historical documentation are included in the sale.

This 1963 Chevrolet Corvair Monza convertible is powered by a turbocharged 145ci flat-six paired with a four-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Saddle Tan over matching vinyl upholstery. Equipment includes a tan convertible soft top, a louvered rear decklid, 13″ steel wheels, four-wheel independent suspension, Pertronix electronic ignition, a retro-styled digital radio, and a heater. Refurbishment work in 2006-07 included repairing rust damage, replacing the top, and re-plating or replacing the trim along with rebuilding the turbocharger, differential, brakes, and more as detailed below. The battery, voltage regulator, and fuel lines were replaced in 2023 along with the wheel bearings and the front brake lines and wheel cylinders. With known history in Michigan and Florida, the car was acquired by the selling dealer in April 2024 and subsequently repainted. This Corvair Monza convertible is now offered with service records, spare parts, and a Florida title.

The Corvair was the first unibody model produced by Fisher Body, and this example was factory-finished in Saddle Tan (932). Rust repairs and body-panel replacements were carried out before a repaint in 2007, and the selling dealer reports another exterior repaint in preparation for the sale. Features include a replacement tan convertible soft top and a matching top boot in addition to quad T-3 headlights, dual side mirrors, and bright bumpers.

Steel 13″ wheels with a mixed set of covers are mounted with 185/80 Hankook Radial H714 thin-whitewall tires that have 2008 production-date codes. The Corvair’s factory independent suspension utilized coil springs all around and swing axles at the rear, and it was rebuilt in 2006. IECO quick-steering arms and 1964-style finned brake drums were installed at that time, and the wheel bearings were replaced in 2023 along with the front hubs, brake lines, and wheel cylinders.

The front bucket seats and the rear bench are upholstered in Saddle vinyl (705), and the door panels are trimmed to match. Interior appointments include a heater, aftermarket front headrests, a vintage-styled digital radio, a tissue dispenser, and front lap belts. A crack in the dashboard, above the radio, is depicted in the gallery.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a chrome horn ring and frames a 120-mph speedometer, a 6k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for manifold pressure, cylinder-head temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 29k miles, approximately 20 of which were added under current ownership. The car’s Florida title carries a “not actual” odometer notation, and total mileage is unknown.

The rear-mounted, air-cooled, and turbocharged 145ci flat-six was factory rated at 150 horsepower and 210 lb-ft of torque, and a Purolator fuel-pressure regulator and Pertronix electronic-ignition components have been fitted. The turbocharger was rebuilt in 2006, and its housing was ceramic-coated along with the inlet and outlet. In February 2023, the battery, voltage regulator, and fuel lines were replaced.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle, and an IECO shifter is in place. The differential was rebuilt in 2006 with 3.27:1 final-drive gearing, and the clutch was replaced at that time. The exhaust system has been ceramic-coated.
Decoding the Fisher body tag reveals:
Spare parts are included in the sale.

This 2003 Harley-Davidson Sportster 883R 100th Anniversary has 74 miles and is said to have been acquired by the selling dealer in June 2024, reportedly from its original owner who primarily kept it on display. It is powered by an 883cc V-twin mated with a five-speed transmission and is finished in orange with checkered-flag graphics. Features include black-finished engine trim, triple disc brakes, a two-up seat, mid controls, and a two-into-one exhaust system. This XL883R is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer in Missouri with a clean Illinois title.
The bike is finished in orange with black and silver graphics, and it features a black two-up seat and mid controls.

Thirteen-spoke cast alloy wheels measuring 19″ up front and 16″ at the rear are wrapped in Dunlop tires. Suspension consists of a telescopic fork as well as a pair of preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm. Braking is handled by dual discs up front and a single version out back.

The black-finished handlebar carries dual mirrors and is secured by a black-finished clamp with a bright badge bearing a Harley-Davidson 100th Anniversary logo along with a “2003 XL 88R 100th Anniversary” inscription. The digital odometer indicates 74 miles, three of which have been ridden by the selling dealer.

The 883cc Sportster Evolution V-twin features black powder-coated cases, a matching battery cover and oil tank, and a chrome two-into-one exhaust system. The battery has been replaced in the last year, and an oil change was performed in June 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheel via a multi-plate wet clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a drive belt with a black belt guard.

This 1964 Chevrolet Corvette convertible was refurbished after the current owner’s 2008 acquisition, and it was repainted in red with a matching hardtop and a black soft top. Rebuilds on the 327ci V8 and four-speed manual transmission were commissioned in 2016 and 2022, respectively, and further equipment includes a Holley carburetor, a side-outlet exhaust system, flip-up headlights, chrome bumperettes, 15″ turbine-style wheels, drum brakes, and power steering. The cabin is outfitted with black vinyl upholstery, a heater, a cueball shift knob, and an AM/FM radio. This C2 convertible is offered on dealer consignment with service records, refurbishment photos, and a Mississippi title.

The fiberglass body left the factory finished in Ermine White (936) and was refinished in red during the refurbishment. Details include a black soft top, a body-color hardtop, flip-up headlights, fender vents, and a side-outlet exhaust system with heat shields. Photos of the soft top in the raised position are provided in the gallery.

The 15″ turbine-style wheels are mounted with Cooper Trendsetter SE white-stripe tires. The C2 was the first Corvette to offer fully independent suspension, with upper and lower control arms at the front and a three-link setup with a transverse leaf spring at the rear. Braking is handled by four-wheel drums.
The bucket seats are upholstered in black vinyl and are joined by color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include a heater, a cueball shift knob, and an AM/FM radio.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline along with gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, amperage, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 86k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.

The 327ci V8 was rebuilt in October 2016 by Dorr’s Automotive in Louisiana, and it was painted orange and black before being reinstalled. It is equipped with a Holley 4160 carburetor and a chrome air cleaner lid and ignition cover. Distributor repairs were completed in 2019, and insulation was applied to the firewall in July 2021.
An engine stamp photo is displayed above.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission that was rebuilt in July 2022.
Decoding the trim tag reveals the following information:
Photos from the refurbishment can be seen in the gallery.
There is currently a lien on the vehicle, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.

This 1997 Nissan Stagea 25X is a right-hand-drive Japanese-market wagon powered by a 2.5-liter DOHC inline-six driving the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission. Finished in Super Clear Red II over gray cloth, the car is equipped with a rear spoiler, roof rails, 16″ alloy wheels, four-wheel disc brakes with ABS, power windows and locks, automatic climate control, and a factory CD/cassette stereo. It was imported to the US from Japan by the seller in May 2024, after which the tires, front brake pads, and various fluids were replaced and the air conditioning was recharged. This Stagea is now offered at no reserve in California with import documents and a clean Tennessee title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Super Clear Red II and equipped with a rear spoiler, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, roof rails, a rear window wiper, black side moldings, and side window deflectors. Paint chips are noted on the front bumper cover and hood, and there are dents on the rear doors. Damage is visible on the rear bumper cover along with a scratch on the front bumper cover and on the passenger-side fender. Paint meter readings from around the car are presented in the gallery below.

Five-spoke 16″ wheels wear 195/65 Seiberling SL101 tires with 2023 date codes. Braking is by four-wheel ABS discs, and the power steering fluid and front brake pads were changed following the seller’s acquisition.

The seating surfaces are upholstered in gray cloth with patterned inserts. The car has woodgrain trim, power windows and locks, automatic climate control, and a factory CD/cassette stereo. The air conditioning was recharged in preparation for the sale. There is a burn mark on the driver seat upholstery.
The digital odometer indicates 160k kilometers (~99k miles), approximately 700 of which were added under current ownership.

The naturally aspirated 2.5L DOHC RB25DE inline-six was factory rated at 200 horsepower. The coolant, engine oil, and air filter reportedly were replaced following the seller’s acquisition. Compression test results and spark plug photos are presented in the gallery.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission. The transmission and rear axle lubricants were changed in preparation for the sale.
The car has not been inspected by the California Bureau of Automotive Repair and it has not passed a California smog test.

This 2006 Chevrolet Corvette convertible is powered by a 6.0-liter LS2 V8 paired with a six-speed manual gearbox and is finished in Velocity Yellow Tintcoat over Ebony leather. Indicating 12k miles, the car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 18″ and 19″ five-spoke alloy wheels, Magnetic Selective Ride Control, a power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, navigation, heated seats, a Bose sound system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. This C6 Corvette was listed on BaT in June 2024 and is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer in Pennsylvania with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title.

The car is finished in Velocity Yellow Tintcoat and features a power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, fog lights, and polished quad exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.
Staggered-diameter 18″ and 19″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Goodyear tires. The car is equipped with Magnetic Selective Ride Control.

The cabin features heated bucket seats upholstered in Ebony leather. Amenities include navigation, driver position memory, a Bose sound system, Keyless Access, cruise control, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 12k miles, approximately 100 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 6.0-liter LS2 V8 was factory-rated at 400 horsepower and 400 lb-ft of torque. The muffler was replaced and an oil change was performed in 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential. The differential fluid was changed in 2022.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1984 BMW R65 is powered by a 648cc opposed twin paired with a five-speed transmission and is finished in black. It is equipped with a driveshaft, an electric starter, dual Bing carburetors, a Brembo front disc brake, and preload-adjustable shocks as well as 18″ alloy snowflake wheels, a chrome dual exhaust system, a black two-up seat, and both center and side stands. Acquired by the selling dealer in June 2024, this R65 is now offered at no reserve with a Florida title.

The bodywork is finished in black with gold-tone pinstripes and graphics. Features include a stepped two-up seat with a grab strap in addition to an H4 headlight, folding passenger foot pegs, a left-side lift-assist handle, and both center and side stands. The bike is not equipped with mirrors, and photos showing holes in the seat cover and dents in the right-side muffler are provided in the gallery below.

Alloy 18″ snowflake wheels wear Shinko 712 tires. Suspension consists of a conventional telescopic fork as well as dual preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm on the left and the final drive enclosure on the right. Braking is from a Brembo caliper and a 260mm cross-drilled rotor up front along with a 200mm drum at the rear.
MotoMeter instrumentation consists of a 120-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline. The five-digit odometer shows 40k miles.
The air-cooled 648cc opposed twin was factory rated at 50 horsepower and is equipped with an electric starter, dual Bing carburetors, and a chrome dual exhaust system.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft.
The motorcycle’s Florida title is a duplicate.

This 1989 Chevrolet Camaro RS coupe has remained registered in Indiana since new and now shows 12k miles. It is finished in Dark Red Metallic over red cloth upholstery and is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes 16″ five-spoke aluminum wheels, power steering, front disc brakes, a rear spoiler, a louvered hood, and a cassette stereo. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2022, this RS coupe is offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Indiana title.

The car is finished in Dark Red Metallic and has been fitted with a louvered hood and IROC-Z graphics. Exterior details include a rear spoiler, fog lights, and body-color front and rear fascias. The selling dealer notes that the hood is miscolored.
The 16″ five-spoke aluminum wheels are mounted with Kumho tires. Stopping power is provided by front discs and rear drums, and the car is equipped with power steering.
The seating surfaces are upholstered in red cloth, and amenities include hand-crank windows, a center console, and a cassette stereo. The air conditioning does not blow cold.
