The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 115-mph speedometer and a 7k-rpm tachometer with an inset oil pressure gauge as well as auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, fuel level, and voltage. The five-digit odometer shows 12k miles, approximately 100 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 5.0-liter L03 V8 features electronic fuel injection and was factory rated at 170 horsepower and 255 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.

This 2023 American Coach Patriot Freedom motorhome was built on a 2022 Mercedes-Benz Sprinter 2500 4×4 chassis. The van is finished in Iridium Silver and powered by a 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 linked with a seven-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes 17″ Method wheels, insulated front privacy shades, soft-close drawers, a water heater, screened windows, a shore power hook-up, a power-operated awning, two showers, a kitchenette, a toilet, a Lagun table, a back-up camera, an LCD TV, JL Audio surround sound, and the Freedom 1080 package which added a Dragon Fly battery system, a 20k-BTU air conditioner, a 320-watt solar charging system, and a heavy-duty alternator. The selling dealer acquired the van in 2023 and it is now offered with a clean Texas title describing it as a 2023 American Patriot van.

The van is finished in Iridium Silver and equipped with side steps, a receiver hitch, a shore power hook-up, a power-operated awning, an exterior shower, a back-up camera, a 20k-BTU rooftop air conditioner, and a 320-watt solar charging system.
The 17″ Method Race wheels are finished in black and wear BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A K02 tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes.

The front cabin features individual seats upholstered in diamond-quilted graphite leather. Amenities include power windows and door locks, automatic climate control, Distronic cruise control, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation. Driving aids consist of blind spot monitoring as well as lane keeping, traffic sign, and active brake assists.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel sits ahead of a 130-mph speedometer, a 5k-rpm tachometer, a digital information display, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer displays approximately 8k miles.

The rear cabin is outfitted with insulated front privacy shades, soft-close drawers, a water heater, screened windows, a wet bath with a shower and a toilet, a kitchenette with an induction cooktop, a Lagun table, an LCD TV, and JL Audio surround sound.

The 3.0-liter turbodiesel V6 was factory rated at 188 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque and drives the rear or all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
Additional underside images are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Indiana and Texas.

This 2019 BMW Alpina B6 xDrive Gran Coupe has been wrapped in matte gray vinyl and is powered by a replacement twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V8 that drives all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes Ivory White Nappa leather upholstery, LED headlights, a sunroof, Surround View cameras, 20″ Alpina Classic wheels, heated and ventilated multi-contour front seats, heated rear seats, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, Driver Assistance Plus, quad-zone automatic climate control, and iDrive with navigation. The car was first registered in California before being purchased by the current owner in 2020. Now with 15k miles, this F06 B6 Gran Coupe is offered in Texas on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, a key fob, and a branded New Jersey title.

A matte gray vinyl wrap covers the Gran Coupe body finished in Black Sapphire Metallic (475), which also features an Alpina-specific styling package that consists of a rear spoiler, Alpina badging, and revised front and rear bumper covers. Additional exterior equipment includes a sunroof, adaptive LED headlights, LED fog lights, tinted windows, soft-close doors, tinted taillights, Surround View cameras, front and rear Park Distance Control sensors, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists “minor damage” to the rear from an accident in November 2021, and blemishes around the exterior are highlighted in photos provided below.

Black 20″ Alpina Classic alloy wheels show curb marks and are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car is equipped with stiffer Alpina-specific springs and a lower ride height than the standard 6-Series along with Active Roll Stabilization and Adaptive Drive active suspension. Stopping power is provided by ventilated discs at each corner. The power steering pump was replaced in December 2023.

The heated and ventilated multi-contour front seats and heated rear outer seats are upholstered in Ivory White Nappa leather with dark piping, while contrasting leather and wood trim adorn the dashboard, door panels, and center console. Interior appointments include a head-up display, a rear-view camera, ceramic finished controls, Active Blind Spot Detection, Driver Assistance Plus, Comfort Access, a power rear sunshade, quad-zone automatic climate control, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and iDrive infotainment with navigation.

The heated leather-wrapped steering wheel features shift buttons and an Alpina crest. It fronts Blue-dial instrumentation including a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 15k chassis miles, approximately 9k of which were added under current ownership.

The twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter N63B44 V8 was factory rated at 600 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. The Carfax report shows that the car was reacquired by its manufacturer in January 2019 due to a check engine light, and the selling dealer notes that the engine was replaced as a result.

Power is delivered to all four wheels through a ZF eight-speed automatic transmission. The current owner notes that a software update in April 2024 was incorrectly entered on the Carfax report as a transmission replacement.

The Carfax report notes that the vehicle was reacquired by BMW of North America in January 2019, and “manufacturer buyback or lemon reported” titles were issued in California in 2019 and New Jersey in 2020. It also lists the aforementioned accident in 2021.
The New Jersey title carries a Lemon Law brand, and the car is currently registered in Texas.
listing_details: Black Sapphire Metallic Paint w/Vinyl Wrap

description: This 2021 Triumph Scrambler 1200 Bond Edition is one of 250 built for the model year, all of which were finished in black with silver and white accents. It is powered by a 1,200cc parallel twin paired with a six-speed transmission and is equipped with electronic fuel injection, Arrow mufflers, a torque-assist clutch, an adjustable Showa inverted fork, adjustable Öhlins piggyback shocks, Brembo anti-lock triple disc brakes, and wire-spoke wheels with Akront rims as well as LED lighting, hand guards, keyless ignition, a two-up seat, and a side stand. The bike was acquired by the seller in 2022 and an oil change was completed in preparation for the sale. This Bond Edition Scrambler has 3,100 miles and is offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, a certificate of authenticity, and a clean Ohio title.

The bike is finished in black with silver accents, white tank graphics, “Bond Edition” seat embroidery, and debossed Bond 007 logos on the left side panel and exhaust heat shield. Features include LED lighting, a headlight grille, a high-mount aluminum fender, LED auxiliary riding lights, a black SW-MOTECH engine guard, a skid plate, a two-up seat, a rear grab bar, and a side stand.

Black-finished Akront rims measuring 21″ up front and 17″ out back are laced with rim-edge spokes and are mounted with Metzeler Tourance tires. Adjustable suspension consists of an inverted Showa 47mm fork as well as twin Öhlins dual-spring piggyback shocks attached to the aluminum swingarm. Anti-lock braking is handled by Brembo four-piston calipers over 320mm discs up front and a two-piston caliper over a 255mm disc at the rear.

The aluminum handlebar carries hand guards, dual mirrors, and a keyless ignition switch on the right. The digital instrument cluster includes a speedometer, a tachometer, and readouts for gear position, fuel level, and other configurable settings. The digital odometer indicates 3,100 miles, approximately 2,200 of which were ridden under current ownership.
A laser-etched billet aluminum handlebar clamp denotes this unit as #34 of 250 produced.

The liquid-cooled 1,200cc parallel twin features electronic fuel injection, four valves per cylinder, and a high-mount exhaust system featuring dual Arrow mufflers with carbon-fiber end caps. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a torque-assist multi-plate wet clutch, a six-speed transmission, and a drive chain.
An owner’s manual, a certificate of authenticity, and spare keys accompany the motorcycle.
There is currently a lien on the bike, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.

This 2010 Land Rover Range Rover has been registered with one family since new, and it was optioned with the HSE Luxury trim package, which featured heated and ventilated front seats, premium Oxford leather, and 20″ wheels. Finished in Nara Bronze over Ivory and Arabica upholstery, it is powered by a 5.0-liter AJ133 V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission, and it also has an electronic center differential, adjustable air suspension, selectable Terrain Response driving modes, heated rear seats, a rearview camera, touchscreen infotainment, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This Range Rover HSE Luxury has 43k miles and is offered at no reserve with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

Equipment includes adaptive xenon headlights, auto-dimming mirrors, parking sensors, a heated windshield, and a receiver hitch. Damaged paint on the roof and other flaws are pictured in close-up photos shown in the gallery below.

The 20″ multi-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/50 Milestar MS932 Sport tires that have sidewall cracks. The truck is equipped with an adjustable air suspension, and the front strut assemblies, right-front air hose, and a power steering hose were replaced in 2021. The rear brake rotors and pads were replaced along with brake lines and the suspension compressor valve block in 2022.

The heated and ventilated front seats are upholstered in Ivory Oxford leather, while Arabica leather and cherry wood trim accent the cabin, which has keyless entry, push-button start, a rearview camera, a Harman Kardon sound system, touchscreen infotainment with navigation, and heated rear seats. The sunroof was disabled in May 2023.
The heated steering wheel frames a 12.3″ digital instrument cluster. The odometer indicates 43k miles.
The 5.0-liter AJ133 V8 was factory rated at 370 horsepower and 376 lb-ft of torque. An air inlet pipe was replaced in September 2022. The battery and engine oil were replaced in April 2024.
Additional photographs of the underside are shown at the end of the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This dune buggy was assembled circa 1971 using one of approximately 50 Thunder Bug fiberglass bodies designed and produced by Clay Diekmann and Tony Vierra of Bugformance in Sunnyvale, California. The car was reportedly placed in storage from 1982 until its acquisition by the seller in March 2024. Subsequent work is said to have included an oil change, a valve adjustment, a fuel tank flush, and replacement of the fuel pump, filter, sender, spark plugs, and steering damper as well as the brake shoes, hoses, master cylinder, and wheel cylinders. The body is finished in orange metal flake gelcoat with black sides and is mounted to a modified Volkswagen Beetle chassis, which is fitted with an air-cooled 1.6L Type 3 flat-four paired with a four-speed manual transaxle. Additional details include a white convertible soft top, a roll bar, staggered diameter steel wheels, Eelco flip-up fuel cap, Dietz headlight housings, front and rear lap belts, and dual Solex carburetors. This dune buggy is now offered with a clean California title in the seller’s name describing it as a 1971 SPCN.

The fiberglass body is mounted to a modified Volkswagen chassis and finished in orange metal flake gelcoat with black sides and a white convertible soft top. Additional exterior details include an Eelco flip-up fuel cap, Dietz headlight housings, a left side-view mirror, and chrome taillight housings as well as a “Keep On Truckin” license plate frame, a De Anza College parking sticker, and Thunder Bug badging. Images detailing the condition of the exterior are presented in the gallery below.

The 14″ and 15″ steel wheels wear chrome VW-stamped hubcaps and are mounted with older Goodyear Polyglas tires up front and Pos-A-Traction Stagger Block rubber out back. Per the seller, a replacement steering damper was fitted and the drum brakes were serviced with replacement of the shoes, hoses, master cylinder, and wheel cylinders in 2024.

Inside, a pair of sliding and tilting fixed-back bucket seats trimmed in black vinyl have been fitted and are joined by a color-coordinated rear bench seat. Interior elements include a three-spoke steering wheel, front and rear lap belts, a foot-operated high/low-beam switch, and a roll bar.
Instrumentation includes 90-mph VDO speedometer, a tachometer, and readouts for fuel level and amperage. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 63k miles.

The air-cooled 1.6L “Pancake” flat-four was reportedly sourced from a Type 3 model and is equipped with dual exhaust and Solex carburetors. The buggy utilizes a 6-volt electrical system, and the seller notes the fuel tank was flushed, and oil change and valve adjustment were performed, and the fuel pump, filter, sender, and spark plugs were replaced in 2024. Per the seller, the carburetors require tuning.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle. A rear skid plate is fitted. Corrosion and seems where the chassis was shortened are visible.

The chassis number 115187669 shown above is consistent with a 1965 Volkswagen Beetle and matches the VIN on the current California title, which describes the car as a 1971 SPCN. The car is registered as Planned Non-Operation (PNO) in the state of California.

This 1959 Alfa Romeo Giulietta Spider was refurbished under previous ownership with work involving refinishing the body in blue, refreshing the interior in tan leather, and installing a replacement 2.0L twin-cam inline-four and five-speed manual transmission. The car was acquired by the seller on BaT in January 2022, and it features dual Weber carburetors, 15″ Panasport-style wheels, front disc brakes, Koni shocks, a Nardi steering wheel, and Imasaf exhaust components. This Giulietta spider is now offered with a removed roll bar, service records, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The Giulietta was introduced at the 1954 Turin Auto Show with the Bertone-designed Sprint 2+2 coupe. The two-seat Spider was revealed the following year with bodywork by Pinin Farina. This example is said to have been stripped to bare metal and repainted in its current Dutch Blue as part of the refurbishment. Exterior details include chrome bumpers, dual side mirrors, bright trim, and a single exhaust outlet with a polished finisher. The car does not have a top, though a tonneau cover will accompany the sale.

Silver-finished 15″ Panasport-style wheels are wrapped in 185/60 Pirelli P4 tires, as is a matching spare wheel located in the trunk compartment. The suspension is reportedly fitted with Koni shocks, and braking power is provided by front discs and rear drums.

The reupholstered cabin features low-back bucket seats reportedly trimmed in Marrone Cuoio leather and fitted with latch-and-link lap belts. A black dash pad tops the body-colored metal dashboard, while rubber linings and Coco floor mats cover the black carpets. A radio blanking plate has been fitted in the dash. The previously-installed roll bar will accompany the vehicle.

The Nardi steering wheel frames a 7k-rpm tachometer with an inset oil pressure gauge as well as a 120-mph speedometer and a combination gauge for oil temperature, water temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 2,800 miles, which is said to reflect the distance traveled since completion of the refurbishment. Approximately 500 miles have been added by the seller, and total mileage is unknown.

The replacement 2.0-liter inline-four features dual Weber carburetors and is said to have been rebuilt under previous ownership. Additional work is noted to have involved installing a custom air intake manifold and engine mounts as well as overhauling the carburetors. An oil change was performed in May 2024.

This 1972 Moto Guzzi V7 Sport was acquired by the seller in 1982 and has been modified with Race Tech fork internals, Dynatek ignition components, K&N air filters, Japanese-style switchgear, Silentium silencers, and bar-end mirrors. It is powered by a 748cc V-twin paired with a five-speed transmission and is finished in red over a silver frame. Additional equipment includes a two-up seat, adjustable handlebars, Borrani alloy rims, a four-leading-shoe front drum brake, a driveshaft, and both side and center stands. This V7 Sport is now offered with spare parts, owner’s literature, and a clean Oregon title in the owner’s name.

The fuel tank and side covers are finished in red while the frame is finished in silver and the fenders are stainless steel. The fuel tank was internally cleaned with Evapo-Rust in preparation for the sale. Equipment includes a stepped two-up seat, bar-end mirrors, a chrome headlight bucket, and both side and center stands.

Wire-spoke wheels with 18″ Borrani alloy rims wear Metzeler tires. Suspension consists of a conventional telescopic fork with Race Tech internals as well as dual chrome Koni shocks mounted to the swingarm on the left and the final drive housing on the right. Braking is from drums at both ends, the front of which features a four-leading-shoe design.

Adjustable Swan Neck clip-on handlebars sit below Veglia instrumentation consisting of a refurbished 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7,300-rpm redline. The five-digit odometer shows 17k miles, 14k of which were ridden by the seller. Japanese-style switchgear was fitted under previous ownership along with custom front turn-signal fork brackets and a Bosch quartz halogen headlight. The headlight bucket and rim were not replaced.

The longitudinally mounted 748cc V-twin was factory rated at 70 horsepower and features a gear-driven camshaft and an alternator located at the front of the crankshaft. It has been modified with a Dyna electronic ignition module, Dyna coils, K&N air filters, a Shorai battery, and Silentium “shark gill” silencers. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft.

This 2011 Mercedes-Benz E350 4MATIC wagon is powered by a 3.5-liter V6 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission and is finished in IPalladium Silver Metallic over black MB-Tex upholstery. Features include a sunroof, a rear-view camera, a self-leveling Airmatic system, 18″ eight-spoke alloy wheels, navigation, heated power-adjustable front seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, a CD stereo, Keyless Go, and dual-zone automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this S212 E350 4MATIC wagon has 142k miles and is now offered in Oregon by the selling dealer at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Palladium Silver Metallic (792) and features roof rails, tinted windows, a rear window wiper, and a sunroof. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 18″ eight-spoke alloy wheels have curb marks and are mounted with Laufenn tires. The car features a comfort-tuned suspension that includes a self-leveling AIRMATIC system at the rear, and stopping power is provided by ventilated discs at each corner.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in black MB-Tex along with a color-coordinated lower dashboard, center console, door panels, and carpets. Interior amenities include heated power-adjustable front seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a rear-view camera, cruise control, Keyless Go, dual-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. There is wear on the center console.
The cargo area is equipped with a retractable cargo cover and a stowable rear-facing bench seat.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as an analog clock and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 142k miles, approximately 550 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 3.5-liter M272 V6 was factory-rated at 268 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a 7G-Tronic seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. The front driveshaft was reportedly replaced in 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2001 Honda RVT1000R RC51 is powered by a fuel-injected 999cc DOHC V-twin mated to a six-speed transmission, and the bike is finished in red and metallic silver with black accents. Features include a black-finished twin-spar frame, electronic fuel injection, adjustable Showa suspension, triple Nissin disc brakes, six-spoke 17″ alloy wheels, side-mounted radiators, separate rider and passenger seats, and a side stand. This RC51 is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a clean Idaho title.

The fully faired bodywork is finished in red and silver metallic with black accents and is mounted over a brushed aluminum twin-spar frame. The bike has been equipped with an aftermarket rider seat and windscreen, and additional equipment includes a passenger pillion, a side stand, the stock license place bracket, and fairing-mounted mirrors.

Black-finished 17″ cast-alloy wheels are wrapped in ZR-rated Continental tires measuring 120/70 up front and 190/50 out back. The seller states that the tires should be replaced due to age. Adjustable suspension consists of an inverted 43mm Honda Multi-Action System (HMAS) cartridge fork as well as a Pro-Link piggyback monoshock mounted to the aluminum swingarm. Stopping power is provided by gold-finished Nissin four-piston calipers and dual 320mm floating rotors up front in addition to a single-piston Nissin caliper and a 220mm disc out back.

Clip-on handlebars are mounted below the upper triple clamp. The digital instrument panel contains a speedometer and an arcing digital tachometer with a 10k-rpm redline as well as a row of indicator lights for fuel-injection malfunction, low fuel level, high beam, neutral gear indication, turn signals, high coolant temperature, and low oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles, approximately 150 of which were ridden by the seller.

The liquid-cooled 999cc DOHC V-twin was factory rated at 136 horsepower and features forged engine hangers, dual 62mm throttle bodies, two fuel injectors per cylinder, dual side-mounted radiators, digital ignition, and a two-into-one-into-two exhaust system. Work in April 2024 included replacing the fuel pump and filter, bleeding the clutch and brakes, and changing the oil.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a multi-disc wet clutch, a six-speed transmission, and a drive chain.

This 1989 Ford Mustang LX notchback is said to have been initially commissioned as a Florida Highway Patrol vehicle and was modified for track duty by Racer Walsh of Jacksonville, Florida. The car is powered by a replacement 302ci V8 that is equipped with updated tuning, GT40-specification heads, a Holley carburetor, an Edelbrock intake manifold, and thermally-wrapped headers, and power is sent to the rear wheels through a Super Duty T5 five-speed manual transmission and a 9″ rear end with a limited-slip differential and 31-spline axles. It is finished in blue and yellow, and the race-prepped cabin is fitted with a roll cage, a fire-suppression system, and a fixed-back racing seat with a safety harness. The car appeared in the December 1996 issue of Ford High Performance, and it was acquired by the current owner in 2016. This Fox-body Mustang race car is offered on dealer consignment in Washington state at no reserve with spare parts, records, and a bill of sale.
The car is finished in blue and yellow with sponsor graphics and #9 decals. The hood and doors are secured by pins, and damage on the fenders and rear quarter panels are displayed in the gallery.

Silver ROH 16×8″ wheels are mounted with 255/50 BFGoodrich g-Force Sport Comp 2 tires. The car rides on a modified suspension with Koni dampers, adjustable spring mounts, upsized sway bars, a Griggs torque arm, and a fabricated panhard rod. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs with braided stainless-steel lines.

The race-prepped cabin is equipped with a roll cage with door bars and driver’s window nets, and the fixed-back racing seat is fitted with a Speedway Motors harness. A fire extinguisher and fire-suppression system are installed along with auxiliary switchgear on the transmission tunnel. A fuel cell is mounted in the trunk.

The Grant GT steering wheel frames a custom dashboard fascia with a tachometer and readouts for voltage, oil pressure, water temperature, oil temperature, and fuel pressure. Gauges for front and rear brake pressure are mounted on the transmission tunnel. No odometer is present, total mileage is unknown.

The replacement 302ci V8 is equipped with GT40 cylinder heads, revised engine tuning, and a 600-cfm Holley carburetor atop an Edelbrock intake manifold. A Mallory distributor and MSD ignition components provide spark, and further equipment includes a Mishimoto radiator, an electric fan, and a Holley electric fuel pump. Thermally-wrapped headers feed a dual exhaust system with an H-pipe midsection.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec “Super Duty” T5 five-speed manual transmission and a 9″ rear end with a limited-slip differential, 31-spline axles, and 3.55:1 gears, according to the seller.

Historical photos of the car are provided in the gallery, and it was featured in the December 1996 issue of Ford High Performance. Spare parts, records, and a spare set of wheels and tires are included in the sale.
The Carfax report for this vehicle lists no entries.

This 2011 Mercedes-Benz SL550 was initially sold in California and was later relocated to Texas where it was purchased by the seller in March 2017, and it now has 66k miles. It is powered by a 5.5-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Black over brown Nappa leather. Features include the AMG Sport Package, a power-folding hardtop, a panoramic glass roof, bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination, chrome-finished 19″ five-spoke alloy wheels, Parktronic, heated and ventilated multi-contour seats, Airscarf neck-warming, a Harman Kardon sound system, Keyless Go, and COMAND with navigation. This R230 is now offered with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Black (040) and features a power-folding convertible hardtop, a panoramic glass roof, bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination, fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, fender air vents, and the AMG Sport Package, which added revised bumper covers and aerodynamic side skirts. Stainless-steel mesh grille inserts, a rear spoiler, and a trunk-lid badge have been as a part of the Carlsson Package.

The 19″ AMG 5-spoke alloy wheels wear a chrome finish and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport All-Season 4 tires that show date codes from 2023. The car features Active Body Control (ABC) suspension as well as an Electronic Stability Program (ESP) and Automatic Slip Control (ASR).

The cabin features heated and ventilated multi-contour seats trimmed in brown Nappa leather as well as wood veneer accents in the center console and door panels. Amenities include the Airscarf neck-warming system, seat position memory settings, dual-zone automatic climate control, a wind deflector, Parktronic, cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, Keyless Go, and COMAND with navigation. There are scratches on the infotainment screen.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 66k miles, approximately 17k of which were added under current ownership.
The 5.5-liter M273 V8 was factory rated at 382 horsepower and 391 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the car’s computer was reset to address a starting issue.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 2008 Ford Mustang Shelby GT500 Super Snake coupe is powered by a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in blue over black leather upholstery. Modifications performed by Shelby American included the installation of a Kenne Bell supercharger and Baer cross-drilled and slotted disc brakes in addition to forged 20″ Shelby Alcoa wheels, Super Snake matte black stripes, carbon-fiber exterior trim, side and quarter window scoops, and a fiberglass hood with a scoop and pins. The cabin is outfitted with a Shaker 1000 audio system, an in-dash CD changer, a short-throw shifter, Shelby-branded AutoMeter instrumentation, and a power-adjustable driver’s seat. This Super Snake has 2,200 miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with an accident-free Carfax report, a Shelby American build invoice, and a clean Florida title in the current owner’s name.

The car is finished in blue with matte black “Le Mans” center stripes and “Super Snake GT500” side stripes as well as a carbon-fiber front splitter, rocker panels, and mirror caps. Additional exterior details include a fiberglass hood with a scoop and pins as well as black grille inserts, fog lights, side and quarter window scoops, a rear decklid spoiler, sequential taillights, and Shelby trunk lid lettering.

Forged 20″ Shelby Alcoa wheels are wrapped in 255/35 front and 275/35 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. Braking is handled by cross-drilled and slotted discs at all four corners with blue-finished Shelby Baer six-piston front calipers. The car is also equipped with brake ducts as well as a front strut tower brace and Ford/Tokico dampers.

The front bucket seats and contoured rear seat are upholstered in black leather joined by a color-coordinated center console lid and door panels. The seat backs and center console lid feature embroidered Super Snake logos while interior appointments include a power-adjustable driver seat, air conditioning, cruise control, a short-throw shifter with a white Shelby knob, and a Shaker 1000 audio system with an in-dash six-disc CD changer.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level, boost pressure, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. Caroll Shelby-signature carbon-fiber AutoMeter Ultra-Lite instruments for boost pressure, fuel pressure, and oil pressure are mounted atop the dash. The digital odometer indicates 2,200 miles.

The 5.4-liter V8 is equipped with a polished Kenne Bell supercharger and cold air intake as well as black-finished aluminum fluid reservoirs with billet caps. An oil change was most recently performed in 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec six-speed manual transmission and a 3.73:1 limited-slip differential. A Borla cat-back exhaust system has been fitted.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage and lists open recalls.

attributes.value: Mustang Shelby GT500 Super Snake Coupe

description: This 2006 Ferrari F430 Spider has 13k miles following registration history in South Carolina, Pennsylvania, Arizona, and Florida. It is powered by a 4.3-liter DOHC V8 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Rosso Corsa over Nero leather. The car is equipped with a black convertible soft top, 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels, an electronically controlled limited-slip differential, cross-drilled and ventilated brake rotors, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, power-adjustable bucket seats, and automatic climate control. This F430 Spider is now offered in New York by the selling dealer with a Ferrari Vehicle Identification Passport, the owner’s manual, a car cover, service records, and a clean Florida title.

The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Rosso Corsa and features a power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, and quad exhaust tips exiting on either side of the rear diffuser.
The 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli tires. Braking is handled by red-finished brake calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors.

The cockpit features power-adjustable bucket seats upholstered in Nero leather along with a matching center console, doors, and carpeting. Equipment includes automatic climate control, drilled aluminum pedals, a wind deflector, and power windows and locks.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with an engine-start button as well as a manettino dial for control of dynamic settings. Instrumentation includes a central tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline as well as a 220-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles.
The mid-mounted 4.3-liter F136 V8 features Bosch Motronic engine management and a dry-sump lubrication system. Factory-rated output was 483 horsepower and 343 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and an electronically controlled limited-slip differential.
The Ferrari Vehicle Identification Passport contains photos of the car during various phases of its construction.
The Carfax report shows at least one open recall.

This 2012 Audi A8L W12 was initially delivered to Audi of Dallas, Texas, and acquired out of Pennsylvania by the seller on BaT in February 2023. Gray-finished 20″ BBS wheels were subsequently installed and it now has 21k miles. Finished in Phantom Black Pearl over Nougat Brown leather, the car is powered by a 6.3-liter W12 mated to an eight-speed automatic transaxle and Quattro all-wheel drive with a sport differential. Factory options consisted of the Full Leather and Driver Assistance Packages as well as a Bang & Olufsen sound system and the Night Vision Assistant, and additional equipment includes a dual-pane sunroof, LED headlights, parking sensors, a rear-seat entertainment system, four-zone automatic climate control, and four heated, ventilated, and massaging seats. This D4 A8L is now offered with a window sticker, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Phantom Black Pearl and features bright trim on the windows, bumper covers, and side skirts. Additional exterior details include LED headlights, headlight washers, fog lights, parking sensors, a dual-pane sunroof, tinted windows, power-assisted soft-close doors, and dual exhaust outlets.

Gray-finished 20″ BBS wheels were added under current ownership, and they are mounted with 265/40 Michelin Pilot Sport All-Season tires that have production-date codes from 2023. The car rides on an adaptive air suspension, while braking is handled by four-corner ventilated discs with Electronic Brake-pressure Distribution (EBD).

The cabin features four heated, ventilated, and massaging seats upholstered in Nougat Brown leather, while burl wood trim accents the dashboard, center console, door panels, and front seat backs. Interior appointments include the Full Leather Package, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, four-zone automatic climate control, a rear seat entertainment system, powered sunshades for the rear windows, and Audi MMI infotainment with a touchpad and handwriting recognition. Driver assistance functions include Audi side assist, active lane assist, adaptive stop-and-go cruise control, and the Audi Night Vision Assistant, which is said to have been repaired under current ownership. An area of discoloration is visible on the inner bolster of the right-front seat.

The heated and leather-wrapped steering wheel is mounted on a power-adjustable column and frames a central digital information display flanked by a 180-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and bar-style gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 21k miles, approximately 7k of which were added by the seller.
The 6.3-liter W12 features Audi FSI direct injection and was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 463 lb-ft of torque. The fluids were changed and the spark plugs were replaced in March 2023.
Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transaxle and Quattro all-wheel-drive with a sport self-locking differential.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Audi of Dallas, Texas, as well as factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $153,475.00. Partial service records will also accompany the car.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1964 Pontiac Catalina 2+2 is a tw0-door sports coupe that was first delivered to Blumer Motors of Kelso, Washington. The car is refinished in white over black vinyl upholstery and is powered by a 421ci V8 mated to a three-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes eight-lug 14″ wheels, a dual exhaust system, a center console, a heater, and a push-button AM radio. An engine rebuild was completed in 2017, and the seller acquired the car in 2023. This Catalina 2+2 is now offered with a build sheet, Pontiac Historical Services documents, a Protect-O-Plate, vehicle literature, and a clean Oregon title in the seller’s name.
The Sports Coupe was the pillarless version of the Catalina. This example left the factory finished in Cameo Ivory and was refinished approximately 12 years ago under previous ownership.
Eight-lug 14″ wheels wear 225/70 BFGoodrich Radial T/A white-letter tires. Braking is provided by four-wheel drums.

The cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench upholstered in black vinyl. Appointments include a center console, a heater, a push-button AM radio, and front lap belts. The driver’s seat bottom, the trunk mat, and the door and trunk seals are said to have been replaced, and a rust repair in the trunk is noted.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a bright horn ring and sits ahead of a tachometer, a horizontal-sweep 120-mph speedometer, and gauges for battery status and fuel level. A manifold vacuum gauge sits ahead of the center console. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 4,900 miles, approximately 700 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.

The car is powered by a 421ci V8 equipped with a four-barrel carburetor, and an engine rebuild completed in 2017 that involved boring the block .020″ over and replacing the pistons, camshaft, cam bearings, and timing set.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a three-speed Hydra-Matic automatic transmission. Aftermarket mufflers are fitted.
Build paperwork shows equipment and options. Pontiac Historical Society documentation, a Protect-O-Plate, and vehicle literature are also included in the sale.

This 2022 Lamborghini Aventador LP780-4 is one of approximately 250 Ultimae roadster examples built to commemorate the final year of Aventador production. It was ordered new by the seller through Lamborghini’s Ad Personam program and was specified in Blu Emera matte over Blu Delphinus upholstery. Power is delivered by a 6.5-liter V12 linked to a seven-speed ISR automated manual transmission and a Haldex all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes carbon-fiber removable roof panels, carbon-ceramic brakes, 20” and 21” forged wheels, a suspension lift system, heated power-adjustable seats, a Sensonum sound system, and carbon-fiber interior and exterior trim. This LP780-4 Ultimae roadster has 710 miles and is now offered with a digital window sticker, the owner’s manual, a battery tender, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The Ultimae edition was announced in July 2021 as the final version of the Aventador. Production was limited to 350 coupes and 250 roadsters, although an additional 15 cars were produced by Lamborghini in response to the sinking of a cargo vessel in March 2022. This example is finished in Blu Emera, a $23,700 matte color selection.

Exterior features include optional carbon-fiber removable roof panels, bi-xenon headlights with washers, rear fog lights, heated and power-folding mirrors, and the Aerodinamica Lamborghini Attiva 2.0 active front air intake and aero-channel system.

Forged 20″ and 21″ Leirion wheels are mounted with 255/30 front and 355/25 rear Pirelli P Zero Corsa tires. The car is equipped with magnetic push-rod suspension, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), and a front-axle suspension lift system. Stopping power is provided by yellow-painted multi-piston calipers over carbon-ceramic rotors at all four corners.

The cockpit is upholstered in Ad Personam Blu Delphinus with Giallo stitching covering the seats, dashboard, pillars, and center console. Features include heated power-adjustable seats, carbon-fiber door panels and trim, Giallo Taurus seatbelts, an Ultimae plaque near the A-pillar, a Lamborghini infotainment system, a Lamborghini Sensonum sound system, and automatic climate control.

The Alcantara-wrapped multi-function steering wheel frames a TFT LCD digital gauge cluster with a variable-redline tachometer, speed and fuel readouts, and auxiliary gauges for oil temperature and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 710 miles, all of which were added under current ownership.

The 6.5-liter V12 was fitted with titanium intake valves in Ultimae specification to achieve a factory-rated output of 769 horsepower and 531 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to all four wheels through a seven-speed single-clutch ISR automated manual transmission and a Haldex all-wheel-drive system with a limited-slip rear differential.
A digital copy of the window sticker shows initial delivery to Luxury Cars Los Gatos in California, and lists factory equipment, colors, and a total suggested retail price of $655,242.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2006 Ford GT was purchased by the seller on BaT in April 2022, and it has since spent time on display at the Jax Sports Car Museum in Jacksonville, Florida. It is finished in Mark IV Red over Ebony leather and was factory-optioned with forged aluminum BBS wheels, red-finished brake calipers, and painted white stripes. Power is provided by a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 linked with a six-speed manual gearbox and a helical limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes a Ford short-shift kit, Ford Racing mufflers, Brembo brakes, HID headlights, a front splitter, and a rear diffuser. This Ford GT has 6k miles and is now offered with service records, a spare McIntosh stereo, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the name of the seller’s LLC.

The GT took inspiration from the GT40 racing cars of the 1960s and features an extruded-aluminum space frame, roll-bonded floors, and aluminum body panels. This example is one of 348 finished in Mark IV Red for the model year and features optional over-the-top white stripes and Ford GT graphics as well as HID headlights, fog lights, side air intakes, a vented hood, a front splitter, a rear diffuser, and a dual center-exit exhaust system. White Ford GT side graphics have been installed since the previous auction, and the seller states that paint correction was performed before a ceramic coating was applied during their ownership.

Factory-optional BBS forged lightweight aluminum wheels measure 18” up front and 19” out back and are mounted with 235/45 front and 315/40 rear Goodyear Eagle F1 Supercar tires. The Brembo braking system features optional red-painted four-piston monoblock calipers with cross-drilled and ventilated rotors that measure 14” up front and 13.2” out back. A brake fluid flush was performed in preparation for the sale.

The cockpit is trimmed in Ebony leather, and rubber mats cover bare aluminum floors. Manually adjusted seats were designed by Sparco and feature carbon-fiber shells with GT40-style ventilation grommets and harness slots. The console on the center tunnel houses rotary climate controls, and amenities include air conditioning, remote keyless entry, and push-button ignition. The seller states that a Ford short-shift kit is installed, and a McIntosh stereo is also included in the sale. Airbag recalls were performed in June 2022.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is affixed to a tilting and telescoping column ahead of the GT40-inspired instrument array consisting of a central tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline and an offset 220-mph speedometer. The seller notes imperfections in the steering wheel center emblem. Toggle-switch controls are positioned under additional gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, boost, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 6k miles, approximately 400 of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted 5.4-liter DOHC V8 features an aluminum block, cylinder heads, and pistons in addition to a Lysholm screw-type supercharger, a dry-sump lubrication system, and a water-to-air intercooler. Factory-rated output was 550 horsepower and 500 lb-ft of torque. Work in May 2024 included an oil change and a coolant flush.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Ricardo six-speed manual transaxle and a helical limited-slip differential. The seller notes that Ford Racing mufflers are installed, and a transaxle fluid flush was performed in May 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1970 Ferrari Dino 246 GT was built for the European market and is one of approximately 355 L-Series examples produced between June 1969 and October 1970. Completed on January 15th, 1970, this example was reportedly delivered new in Italy and was later imported to the US from South Africa by the selling dealer in 2023. It has been repainted in Rosso Chiaro over Nero vinyl and is powered by a 2.4-liter V6 equipped with triple Weber carburetors and mated to a five-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes four-wheel ventilated disc brakes, 14” Cromodora alloy wheels with knock-off hubs, and a heater. This L-Series 246 is now offered in Mount Kisco, New York with a Dino Compendium report, service records, and a clean Montana title.

The L-Series 246 GT debuted at the Geneva Motor Show in 1969 as the successor to the 206 GT of 1967 to 1969. Like its predecessor, it featured an aluminum hood, decklid, and doors as well as a push-button trunk latch and thinner chrome bumpers compared to later 246 GTs.

The Scaglietti-built bodywork on this example was delivered from the factory in Giallo Fly, and it was repainted in its current color of Rosso Chiaro in the 1980s and again in the 2000s. European-market lighting includes flush front turn signal lenses, small round signal repeaters on the front fenders, amber rear turn signals, and the absence of rectangular side and rear reflectors. The lower nose was repaired and refinished and the front bumper brackets replaced in 2018, at which time the rear bumpers were repaired and rechromed.

The 14” Cromodora alloy wheels feature three-eared knock-off covers over a center-locking hub and are mounted with Michelin XWX tires measuring 205/70. A matching spare wheel is mounted in the front trunk. The suspension incorporates unequal-length A-arms, coilover shock absorbers, and anti-roll bars at front and rear. Stopping power is provided by power-assisted ventilated disc brakes all around.

The cabin houses fixed-back bucket seats that tilt on their bases and are trimmed in Nero vinyl with color-matched upholstery over the door panels and console. Black carpets line the floors, and additional features include “mouse-fur” dash trim, a heater, a gated shifter, a passenger-side footrest, a sill-mounted passenger grab handle, and headrests mounted to the rear bulkhead.

The leather-trimmed steering wheel features a Dino horn button and frames Dino-branded Veglia Borletti instrumentation including a 270-km/h speedometer, a tachometer with a 7,750-rpm redline, an analog clock, and auxiliary gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and amperage. The five-digit odometer shows 55k kilometers (~34k miles), less than 100 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The mid-mounted 2.4-liter Tipo 135CS V6 features a 65° angle between cylinder banks, dual overhead camshafts on each bank, Magneti Marelli ignition, and a trio of two-barrel Weber carburetors. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transaxle. Work in 2017 included tightening the cylinder heads, resetting the valve tappets, overhauling the carburetors and alternator, and cleaning the fuel system. The thermostat and housing were replaced in 2018.
The Matthias Bartz Dino Compendium report lists the factory colors and options as well as a production date of January 15, 1970 and the known ownership history.
Chassis number *00572* is shown above, and the car is titled using VIN DINO246GT00572.

This 1981 GMC Jimmy Sierra Classic 4×4 is a South American example that was imported to the US in 2023 and subsequently acquired by the seller. Power is provided by a 305ci V8 linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case and the truck is finished in blue over tan vinyl upholstery.  Equipment includes a white removable hardtop, a suspension lift kit, five-spoke 15″ wheels, Warn manually locking front hubs, power steering, power front disc brakes, a Delco AM/FM stereo, and air conditioning. This Jimmy shows 75k kilometers (~47k miles) and is now offered at no reserve with a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The truck is finished in blue and features a white removable fiberglass hardtop as well as a fender-mounted antenna, side moldings, dual side mirrors, Sierra Classic badging, and chrome bumpers. There is a dent in the tailgate trim, a scratch on the bumper, and paint chips.

The five-spoke 15″ wheels are mounted with 33×12.5″ Kumho Roadventure MT15 tires. The truck is equipped with power steering and a suspension lift kit, and braking is provided by power-assisted front discs and rear drums. The front wheels feature Warn manually locking hubs.

The front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in tan vinyl upholstery joined by a color-coordinated dashboard pad, door panels, and carpets. Interior appointments include a center console, an AM/FM stereo, and air conditioning.

The two-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-km/h speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and voltage. The five-digit odometer shows 75k kilometers (~47k miles), approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.
The 305ci V8 was factory equipped with a double-barrel carburetor. An oil change was performed in 2024.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
The Carfax report shows a single entry in 2024 and is free from accidents or other damage.
The truck passed a California smog test in April 2024, however it has not been inspected by the Calfornia Bureau of Automotive Repair and cannot be sold to an in-state private party buyer.

This 1958 Cadillac Fleetwood Series 75 was purchased by the seller’s father in 1980, and it was refurbished between 2002 and 2006 with work that included a repaint in black as well as overhauls of the 364ci V8 and the four-speed automatic transmission. The interior is trimmed in gray cloth and vinyl and features front and rear bench seating as well as fold-away middle seats and rear controls for the radio and air conditioning. An Edelbrock carburetor has been installed along with a replacement dual exhaust system and an electric windshield wiper motor. This Fleetwood limousine was inherited by the seller in 2019 and is now offered with refurbishment records and photos as well as a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The car was refinished in black following rust repairs performed during the refurbishment. The seller notes that there is a chip on driver side window, the fuel-filler spring is missing, and the Cadillac badge on the fender is missing.
The 15″ wheels wear chrome covers and are wrapped in whitewall tires. The car is equipped with power steering and power-assisted drum brakes.

The front bench seat has been reupholstered in gray cloth and is accented by dark gray trim on the dash and door panels. The car is equipped with air conditioning, an AM radio, and power windows. The seller notes the emergency brake pedal is missing, and the air conditioning and heater control levers are tight.

The rear passenger compartment has pop-up middle-row jump seats and a rear bench trimmed in gray cloth upholstery and complemented by woodgrain trim and a color-coordinated bulkhead, pillows, and carpeting. Rear occupants are provided with overhead lighting, an electric clock, air vents, footrests, and ashtrays as well as controls for the radio, windows, and climate control system.

The 120-mph speedometer is accompanied by an analog clock and a fuel gauge, and the seller notes a crack on the fuel-gauge lens. The seller notes that the five-digit odometer does not work, and shows 39k miles, although total mileage is unknown.
The 364 V8 was rebuilt in 2002 and is topped with an Edelbrock carburetor. The radiator was overhauled during the refurbishment.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission that was rebuilt in 2002. A replacement dual exhaust system was installed in 2006.
The Fleetwood body tag decodes as follows:
The car is titled by its Colorado assigned VIN.
Photos of the refurbishment process are included in the gallery.

This 1929 Ford Model A cabriolet was built into a street rod in the mid-1990s and is powered by a fuel-injected 5.7-liter LT1 V8. The engine is backed by a 700R4 automatic transmission, and other highlights of the build include full fenders, four-wheel independent suspension, four-wheel disc brakes, and 15″ wheels. The cabin is upholstered in maroon and cream cloth and features a tilt steering column, floor shifter, Alpine cassette stereo, and VDO gauges. The car remained with its previous owner for approximately 30 years and was driven little during that time before being selling dealer in 2024. This Model A is now offered with a clean Ohio title.

The cabriolet body is steel and is equipped with steel fenders, running boards, and a hood top. Additional features include front and rear bumpers, cowl-mounted turn signals, dual sideview mirrors, and a black soft top. The seller notes that the doors close but are not flush with the body.

Steel 15” wheels wear beauty rings and hubcaps along with staggered-width Cooper tires. Fully independent suspension is Mustang II style up front and Jaguar style out back, and braking is provided by vented discs and inboard solid discs, respectively. Adjustable coilovers are fitted all around.

Bench seating is upholstered in cream cloth and was installed in 2002. The door and side panels are trimmed in maroon cloth, and interior appointments include a floor shifter and an Alpine cassette stereo. The cabin is also equipped with power windows, though the seller notes that they are not functional.

A three-spoke steering wheel is mounted on the tilting column, and an 8k-rpm Auto Gage tachometer is also mounted to the column. VDO instrumentation in the dash includes a 120-mph speedometer along with gauges for voltage, fuel level, water temperature, and oil pressure. The odometer shows 11k miles, just a handful of which were added by the selling dealer. The previous owner reportedly drove the car little, adding just 500 miles while attending local shows over a 30-year period.
The injected LT1 V8 was reportedly sourced from a Corvette and was installed circa 1995 as part of the build. The alternator was replaced in November 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 700R4 four-speed automatic transmission. The car is equipped with a dual exhaust system, and the fuel tank and battery are located in the truck as pictured in the gallery.

This 1999 Jeep Cherokee Sport is a two-door example finished in black over Agate cloth and is powered by a 4.0-liter inline-six mated to a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes front disc brakes, 15″ five-spoke steel wheels, a roof rack, fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo, air conditioning, cruise control, and front bucket seats. The seller purchased the truck in 2021 and has since added approximately 750 of the 140k miles. This XJ Cherokee is now offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name.

The truck is finished in black with a black grille, bumper covers, and wheel arch flares. Additional equipment includes a rear wiper, a roof rack, fog lights, and power-adjustable side mirrors. The bumpers and side trim pieces are faded.

The 15″ five-spoke steel wheels are mounted with 225/75 Cooper Discoverer H/T tires. Stopping power is provided by front discs and rear drums. The truck came equipped from the factory with power steering.
The cabin features reclining front bucket seats and a rear bench trimmed in Agate cloth. Amenities include a rear window defroster, air conditioning, cruise control, and an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo.

The steering wheel is mounted on an adjustable column and frames a 100-mph speedometer, a 6k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, voltage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 140k miles, approximately 750 of which were added under current ownership.
The PowerTech 4.0-liter inline-six was factory rated at 190 horsepower and 225 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck features a Selec-Trac four-wheel drive system.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1990 Mazda MX-5 Miata is finished in Classic Red over black cloth and is powered by a 1.6-liter DOHC inline-four linked with a five-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a black convertible soft top, 14″ Daisy wheels, cruise control, and air conditioning. The car has spent time registered in Michigan and Montana and now shows under 65k miles. The selling dealer recently acquired the car, and the tires were replaced and the oil was changed in preparation for the sale. This NA Miata is now offered by the selling dealer in New York at no reserve with a service record, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.
The car is finished in Classic Red and features a black soft top as well as pop-up headlights, chrome door handles, painted mirror caps, a convertible top boot, and a single exhaust outlet.

The 14″ Daisy alloy wheels are mounted with 185/60 Kumho Solus TA51a tires installed in June 2024. The car is equipped with an independent double wishbone suspension, front and rear stabilizer bars, and four-wheel disc brakes.

The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black cloth along with color-coordinated door panels. Interior amenities include air conditioning, an AM/FM/cassette stereo, cruise control, and power windows.
The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows under 65k miles.
The 1.6-liter DOHC inline-four was factory rated at 116 horsepower and 100 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in June 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1980 Chevrolet K5 Blazer Silverado was fitted with a replacement 350ci V8 under previous ownership and refinished in orange metallic following the seller’s 2023 acquisition. Equipment includes a three-speed automatic transmission, an NP205 dual-range transfer case, a 12-bolt limited-slip rear axle, power steering, front disc brakes, 15″ Rally wheels, a removable black hardtop, tan cloth upholstery, air conditioning, power windows and locks, and a Kenwood Bluetooth stereo. This K5 Blazer is offered with service records, an owner’s manual, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The seller states truck was refinished in orange metallic under current ownership, and rust repairs were performed on the floorboards before the truck was refinished. Additional work involved installing round headlights and a windshield with an antenna as well as replacing the chrome bumpers, badges, folding side mirrors, door handles, and door and tailgate locks that have been keyed alike. Exterior details include a removable fiberglass hardtop with sliding side windows that has been coated in a textured black material as well as an electric rear window and a 2″ receiver hitch.

The 15″ Rally wheels have been refinished and are mounted with 32×11.5″ BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2 tires. A covered spare is housed in the rear cargo area. Monroe shock absorbers were installed under current ownership and the truck is further equipped with power steering and Warn manually locking front hubs. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums.

The front bucket seats and folding rear bench are trimmed in tan cloth with vinyl sides and backing. The carpeting was replaced under current ownership and appointments include air conditioning, power windows and locks, and a Kenwood Bluetooth stereo. The cruise control module has been removed though the switch is retained.

The two-spoke steering wheel is mounted to a tilting column and frames an 85-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel level, voltage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 98k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

A replacement 350ci V8 was installed in 2005 and the battery was replaced under current ownership. The carburetor was adjusted and the truck passed a Colorado emissions test in March 2023. The seller notes that the smog equipment and catalytic converter are retained.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a TH350 three-speed automatic transmission, an NP205 dual-range transfer case, and a 12-bolt limited-slip rear axle with 3.73:1 gearing. The transmission and torque converter were rebuilt in 2021. The truck is equipped with a transmission oil cooler and the muffler was replaced under current ownership.

This 1962 MG MGA Mk II roadster was acquired by the seller in 2010 following refurbishment work carried out under previous ownership. Finished in white over red vinyl, the car is powered by a 1,622cc inline-four linked with a four-speed manual transmission. It is equipped with a black soft top, removable sliding windows, 15″ knock-off wire wheels, front disc brakes, and a rear luggage rack with a wicker basket. Service performed within the last five years is said to have included overhauling the dual SU carburetors and replacing the radiator, water pump, and rear wheel bearings as well as changing the brake master cylinder, front brake pads, rear brake shoes, and shock absorbers. This MGA roadster is offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, recent service records, car show trophies, a car cover, a red tonneau cover and top boot, and Maine registration in the seller’s name.

The body was repainted white in approximately 2000. Equipment includes a black soft top, a left-side mirror, removable sliding windows, and a rear luggage rack with a wicker basket. The seller notes wear on the soft top, and photos showing cracked paint and other blemishes can be viewed in the gallery below. The photos and videos were taken in September 2023.

Bright 15″ knock-off wire wheels were mounted with 165-series Michelin XZX tires in 2020. Additional work at that time is said to have included changing the shock absorbers and rear wheel bearings as well as replacing the brake master cylinder, front pads, and rear shoes.

The bucket seats are trimmed in red vinyl and complemented by a color-coordinated dashboard, center armrest, and door panels. Black carpeting lines the floors, and a fire extinguisher is mounted beneath the dash along with an inoperative Kenwood stereo and aftermarket speakers.

The banjo-style steering wheel fronts Jaeger instrumentation consisting of a 120-mph speedometer, a tachometer, an analog clock, and supplementary gauges. The seller notes that the fuel level gauge is inaccurate. The five-digit odometer shows 99k miles, approximately 2,500 of which were added under current ownership.

The 1,622cc inline-four sends power to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual gearbox. The radiator, water pump, and coolant hoses were replaced in October 2018, while the dual SU carburetors were reportedly rebuilt in July 2020.
Photos showing corrosion and fluid seepage on various underbody components can be viewed in the gallery below.
Manufacturer’s literature, recent service records, car show trophies, wing windows, tinted visors, and a car cover will accompany the car along with a red top boot and tonneau cover.
The car does not have a title, as it is registered in a state that does not issue titles for vehicles of its age. It is being sold on its Maine registration.

This 1962 Volvo P1800 is finished in red over black vinyl with plaid cloth inserts and powered by a 2.0-liter inline-four paired with a five-speed manual transmission. The seller purchased the car in 2016 and a subsequent refresh has included repainting the bodywork, reupholstering the interior, rebuilding the engine, carburetors, and gauge cluster, overhauling the brakes and suspension, installing a stainless steel exhaust system and Dayton wire wheels, and replacing the clutch assembly. This P1800 is now offered with service records and a clean Nevada title in the seller’s name.
The car was repainted in red in 2020 and the door and window seals were replaced. The windshield was replaced in 2015, and the seller notes that some of the brightwork has been re-plated.

The seller added 15″ Dayton wire wheels and they are mounted with Firestone Precision Touring whitewall tires manufactured in 2015. The seller notes that the suspension and brakes have been overhauled during their ownership.
The seller reupholstered the cabin in black vinyl with plaid seat inserts. The carpets have also been replaced.

Instrumentation includes a 120-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and a suite of auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 6k miles, approximately 3k of which were added during current ownership. The speedometer, tachometer, and temperature gauge have been rebuilt, and the speedometer reads approximately 10% low. Total mileage is unknown.
A 2.0-liter B20 inline-four has been installed and it was rebuilt in March 2020. The twin SU carburetors were also rebuilt, and a stainless steel exhaust system is installed.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a Ford T9 five-speed manual transmission. The clutch assembly was replaced in 2017.
listing_details: Black Leather Upholstery w/ Plaid Cloth Inserts

description: This 2009 Audi R8 coupe is powered by a 4.2-liter FSI V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Daytona Gray Pearl under orange 3M vinyl wrap. Modifications include KW V3 coilovers, 19″ Variant wheels, a Rev9 Autosport stainless-steel exhaust, and aftermarket engine management software. Retained factory equipment includes black leather upholstery, a speed-activated rear spoiler, carbon-fiber Sigma side blades, a rearview camera, parking sensors, a Bang and Olufsen sound system, and heated power-adjustable seats. The seller acquired the car in 2022 and has since added approximately 10k of the 63k indicated miles. This R8 is now offered with a car cover, a battery tender, the removed factory wheels, accessories, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington state title.

The car is finished in Daytona Gray Pearl under orange 3M vinyl wrap that extends to the door jambs and side marker lenses. Exterior features include carbon-fiber Sigma side blades, LED headlights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, front and rear parking sensors, and integrated dual exhaust outlets. Clear paint protection film covers the nose and Scrape Armor bumper protection has been added to the underside of the front bumper cover.

Matte black 19″ Variant Xenon wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 Evo2 tires measuring 235/35 up front and 305/30 out back. KW Suspensions V3 coilover suspension is installed, and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated and cross-drilled discs. The front brake pads, rotors, and sensors were replaced in February 2023 along with the parking brake pads. Other work in February 2023 included installing V10-specification rear suspension components comprising control arms, track rods, hardware, and wheel bearings and housings.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable seats trimmed in black leather along with matching door panel inserts. Appointments include a rearview camera, a Bang and Olufsen sound system, automatic climate control, and an infotainment system with Audi Navigation Plus. Audi-logo under-door light projectors have been added.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 63k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The 4.2-liter FSI V8 features dry-sump lubrication and is modified with a Rev9 Autosport stainless-steel exhaust system and aftermarket engine management software. Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and Quattro all-wheel drive. The seller states that the clutch components were replaced at 50k miles. Records indicate that carbon cleaning was performed on the intake in February 2023 at which point the intake manifold gaskets and engine air filters were also replaced. The Carfax report notes valve cover gasket replacement in February 2024.
The removed factory 19″ split five-spoke wheels are included in the sale along with a battery tender, a car cover, and service records.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
There is currently a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.

This 1971 Honda CB350 was purchased by the seller in 2008, and refurbishment work carried out in 2015 included refinishing and resealing its 325cc parallel twin, rebuilding the twin Keihin carburetors, and repainting the frame. The fuel tank was internally coated, and the piston rings, cam-chain tensioner, petcock, and control cables were replaced. Finished in Candy Gold, the bike also received replacement tires in 2018 and a battery, spark-plug caps, and muffler baffles in 2023. It is further equipped with a five-speed transmission, both kick and electric starters, and 18″ wire-spoke wheels along with drum brakes, preload-adjustable shocks, both center and side stands, and a black bench seat. This CB350 is now offered at no reserve with a tool kit and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The Candy Gold bodywork was removed in 2015 so that the single-downtube steel frame could refinished in black along with the battery box, fork yokes, and air-cleaner case. The 3.2-gallon fuel tank was lined with POR-15, and much of the hardware was replated. Additional bike features include street lighting with turn signals as well as a black vinyl-upholstered two-up seat, folding passenger foot pegs, and both center and side stands. The seller notes some pitting in the brightwork, and photos showing a dent in the headlight bezel, chipped paint and graphics, and a drilled hole in the top of the rear fender are provided in the gallery below.

Wire-spoke wheels with 18″ chromed-steel rims and drum-brake hubs were mounted with IRC GS-11 tires and replacement tubes in 2018. Suspension consists of a telescopic fork that was resealed in 2015 as well as dual shrouded and preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm.

The chrome handlebar carries dual mirrors and levers with replacement cables, and instrumentation just ahead consists of a green-dial Nippon Seiki 110-mph speedometer and a matching tachometer with a 9,500-rpm redline. The five-digit odometer shows 8k miles, approximately 700 of which were ridden under current ownership.

The 325cc parallel twin was factory rated at 34 horsepower and is equipped with both kick and electric starters, dual Keihin carburetors, and a chrome dual exhaust system with “HM317” stampings. The 2015 refurbishment included bead-blasting and repainting the crankcase and side covers, removing carbon deposits, and honing the cylinders along with rebuilding the carburetors and reassembling the engine using a replacement camshaft-chain tensioner, piston rings, and seals and gaskets. The petcock and fuel lines were also replaced, and the header-mounting rings were re-chromed. In 2023, the battery, muffler baffles, and spark-plug caps were replaced.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and a drive chain.
A tool kit is included in the sale.
Additional photos taken during the refurbishment can be viewed in the gallery.

This 1988 BMW M6 remained with its previous owner for 21 years, during which time it was fitted with a 3.8-liter S38B38 inline-six and six-speed manual transmission sourced from a European-market E34 M5. The seller acquired the car out of Ohio on BaT in April 2023 and proceeded to overhaul the air conditioning system and replace the valve cover gasket, tires, and mounts for the engine and transmission. Finished in black, the car is equipped with a UUC stainless-steel exhaust, Schrick camshafts, Turner Motorsport ECU tuning software, 17″ OZ Racing wheels, lowering springs, Dinan sway bars, HID projector-beam headlights, and a sunroof. The interior is appointed with power-adjustable front seats upholstered in gray leather as well as an M Tech II steering wheel, an onboard computer, and a cooled compartment in the rear. This S38B38-powered E24 M6 shows 176k chassis miles and is now offered in California with a car cover, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington title in the seller’s name.

The two-door body is finished in black and features a front spoiler with integrated fog lights as well as a sunroof, HID projector-beam headlights, bright trim, a power antenna, a decklid spoiler, and twin center-exit exhaust outlets. Chipped paint and dents on various body panels are shown in the gallery, and the red and blue bodyside pinstripes are faded. Corrosion at the base of the windshield is noted by the seller. Scuffs on the right front fender were touched up, the side mirror caps were repainted, and faded paint on the spoiler was repaired under current ownership.

The 17″ silver-finished OZ Racing Mito multi-piece wheels were mounted with 245/45 Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 tires in March 2024. Lowering springs and Dinan sway bars have been installed and braking is handled by four-wheel discs, the rear components of which are said to have been sourced from an E34 540i. A brake fluid flush was performed in preparation for the sale.

The power-adjustable front seats are believed to have been reupholstered in gray leather, which extends to the rear bench and portions of the door panels. Amenities include cruise control, on onboard computer, a cooled compartment in the rear, and power-operated windows, mirrors, and locks. The air conditioning system was overhauled with a replacement compressor, lines, blower motor, and heater fan as well as a recharge with R134a refrigerant following the seller’s acquisition. The rear sunshade is inoperative and the seller notes that the right-front seat tilt cover is missing a retaining screw. A JVC head unit and an aftermarket amplifier have been installed, however, their functionality has not been verified by the seller.

The M Tech II steering wheel frames a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The six-digit mechanical odometer shows 176k chassis miles, approximately 100 miles were added by the seller. Areas of wear are noted on the steering wheel.

A 3.8-liter S38B38 inline-six sourced from a European-market E34 M5 was installed in August 2003 by Koala Motorsport of Novelty, Ohio. The replacement engine features an aluminum radiator, 280-degree Schrick camshafts, and Bosch Motronic 3.3 engine management software, which is said to have been modified with ECU tuning software from Turner Motorsport. Work following the seller’s acquisition included changing the oil and replacing the valve cover gasket, engine mounts, spark plug tube seals, and the drive belts for the alternator and power steering pump. The results of an April 2024 compression test are provided in the gallery.

Power is delivered to the rear wheels through an E34 M5-sourced six-speed manual transmission, an aftermarket driveshaft, and a differential with 3.77:1 gearing. The transmission and differential received fluid changes in April 2024, and work since has included performing a dry ice cleaning process on the engine bay and underside as well as replacing the transmission mounts and a differential bushing. A UUC stainless-steel exhaust system is installed.
A car cover is included in the sale. Service records will also accompany the car and can be viewed in the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The car has not been inspected by the California Bureau of Automotive Repair and has not passed a California emissions test.

This 1963 Rupp Grand Prix go-kart is powered by twin McCulloch 7.08ci two-stroke singles with Rev-Grip dry clutches. It was purchased by the seller in 2019 and subsequently refurbished with a metallic blue repaint of the chromoly tubular frame. Hardware was show-chromed, and both engines were reportedly rebuilt. Features include turbine wheels with bright trim rings, a single drum brake, a black vinyl seat, and a chain-driven, fixed-gear rear axle with dual sprockets. This Rupp Grand Prix is now offered at no reserve in Chicago, Illinois, on a bill of sale.

The chromoly tubular frame is said to have been stripped and powder coated in medium blue metallic under current ownership.
