White pinstripes and a shadowed number 7 have been added to the Nassau panel, which also features a manufacturer’s plate labeled “Grand Prix”. Additional features include a chrome Hoffco front bumper and a polished aluminum floorplan with an under-pedal grip pad.

The 5″ Rupp turbine wheels were stripped and re-chromed, together with the trim rings, and wear replacement Vintage Speed slick tires. The wheel bearings have been replaced, and the steering shaft, tie rod end, and spindles have also been chromed. Stopping power is provided by a rear-mounted 6″ Bendix drum brake.
The three-spoke steering wheel with a black grip fronts a single seat that has been reupholstered in black with white piping and Dart Kart branding. A chrome Chilton fuel tank is mounted behind.

The twin McCulloch MC70 singles were reportedly rebuilt by Bill McCornack during the refurbishment and fitted with replacement pistons, rods, bearings, rings, gaskets, and seals. The engines are equipped with chromed shrouds, Tillotson carburetors, Azusa velocity stacks, and exhaust trumpets with pea shooter-style top plates. Power is sent to the rear axles via rebuilt Rev-Grip dry clutches, drive chains, and a detachable rear axle.
The manufacturer’s plaque affixed to the Nassau panel shows wear and is stamped with serial number 257. The pictured kart stand is not included in the sale.

This 1973 Honda XR75 is said to have remained in storage for 39 years before it was refurbished in 2022 with work that included refinishing the bodywork in metallic gray, powder-coating the frame and upswept exhaust, and rebuilding the 72cc SOHC four-stroke single along with the fork, drum brakes, and wheel hubs. Power is delivered to the rear wheel via a four-speed transmission, and the bike is equipped with a black vinyl solo seat, a chrome cross-braced handlebar, a skid plate, a Keihin carburetor, a kick starter, preload-adjustable shocks, and wire-spoke wheels with chrome steel rims. Acquired by the seller in 2023, this XR75 is now offered at no reserve in California for off-road use only with a 2023 inspection report and a bill of sale.

The fuel tank, fenders, and side number plates were refinished in metallic gray with red and white decals as part of the aforementioned refurbishment. The frame was powder-coated black at that time, and the bike is equipped with a black vinyl solo seat, a front number plate, a rear grab bar, a skid plate, spring-loaded serrated foot pegs, and a side stand.

Wire-spoke wheels with chrome steel rims measuring 16″ up front and 14″ out back are mounted with IRC Motocross GS-45Z1 tires. Braking is handled by chrome-finished drum brake hubs, while suspension consists of a consists of a conventional telescopic fork with chrome-finished lowers as well as a pair of preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm. As part of the refurbishment, the fork, brakes, and wheel hubs were rebuilt.

The chrome-finished cross-braced handlebar is equipped with black-tipped clutch and brake levers as well as a twist-grip throttle and ignition switchgear. The motorcycle is not equipped with an odometer or other instrumentation, therefore true mileage is unknown.

The 72cc SOHC four-stroke single is said to have been rebuilt in 2022. It features a 16mm Keihin carburetor connected to a chrome-finished intake manifold as well as a kick starter and an upswept exhaust system that has been refinished with black powder-coating.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a four-speed transmission and a drive chain.
The motorcycle does not have a title or registration. It is being sold on a bill of sale for off-road use only.

This 1994 Toyota Land Cruiser is a left-hand-drive example that spent time in the Middle East before it was imported into the US following the current owner’s purchase in 2022. Showing 134k kilometers (~83k miles), the truck is powered by a 4.5L 1FZ-F inline-six linked with a five-speed manual transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and locking front, center, and rear differentials. Finished in Dark Emerald Pearl over gray cloth upholstery, it is equipped with 16″ alloy wheels, manually locking front hubs, barn doors, a winch, a center console refrigerator, folding third-row seats, a CD/cassette stereo, and air conditioning. This FZJ80 VX-R is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner at no reserve with a clean Michigan title in the name of the owner’s LLC

The truck is finished in Dark Emerald Pearl with side graphics, and it was optioned without a sunroof. Exterior details include barn doors, a swing-out spare tire carrier, a winch, sliding rear windows, running boards, and mud flaps. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.
The 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Dunlop Grandtrek tires. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs, and braking is handled by front discs and rear drums.

The cabin features front bucket seats, a second-row bench, and third-row folding seats upholstered in gray cloth with striped inserts. Interior amenities include a CD/cassette stereo, a center console refrigerator, air conditioning, and a digital clock.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 200-km/h speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 134k kilometers (~83k miles), approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.
The 4.5L 1FZ-F inline-six is equipped with a carburetor as well as four valves per cylinder. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is equipped with locking front, center, and rear differentials.

This 1978 Ducati 900SS is powered by an 864cc L-twin that features a desmodromic valvetrain, bevel-gear-driven overhead camshafts, and a pair of Dell’Orto PHF carburetors. The bike is finished in silver with blue accents, and additional equipment includes a five-speed transmission, triple disc brakes, Borrani alloy rims, Marzocchi suspension, a Bosch ignition, a Tommaselli throttle, and Conti megaphone mufflers in addition to a half-fairing, a racing-style seat, clip-on handlebars, rear-set foot controls, and a center stand. This 900SS was acquired by the seller circa 2019 and is now offered with a New Hampshire title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in silver with blue stripes and 900 Super Sport graphics, and the half-fairing was repainted blue under previous ownership. The black-finished open-cradle steel frame utilizes the engine as a stressed member, and additional features include a 4.75-gallon fuel tank, a clear windscreen, vented side covers, rear-set foot controls, and a racing-style solo seat with a zippered storage compartment and a rear cowl. The rear fender has been removed and the taillight relocated to the rear cowl. Close-up photos in the gallery show chips and cracks along with yellowed decals and rust adjacent to the rear brake master cylinder.

Wire-spoke wheels with Borrani 18″ alloy rims are mounted with older Michelin M45 tires. Marzocchi suspension consists of a 38mm telescopic fork with black sliders as well as a pair of preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm. Braking is provided by dual 280mm discs up front and a single 229mm disc at the rear. The seller recommends bleeding the front brake and replacing the tires before riding.

Clip-on handlebars carrying cracked Verlicchi grips and a Tommaselli Daytona 2C throttle are secured beneath the top triple clamp. The dash houses a 150-mph Smiths speedometer, a matching tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, a bank of warning lamps, and a keyed ignition switch. The five-digit odometer shows 10k miles, approximately 500 of which were ridden by the seller.

The 864cc square-case L-twin features a desmodromic valvetrain, bevel-driven overhead camshafts, and a pair of 32mm Dell’Orto PHF carburetors with screened velocity stacks as well as a Bosch electronic ignition, a kick starter, and a chrome dual exhaust system with upswept Conti megaphone mufflers. The carburetors were cleaned and the oil was changed subsequent to the seller’s acquisition of the bike out of long-term storage. A temporary dry-cell battery was installed for the purpose of filming a cold-start video, though the bike is being sold without a battery.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a wet clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a drive chain.

The bike is accompanied by spare parts including an Imola fiberglass fuel tank, Imola racing camshafts, a set of chrome Lafranconi mufflers, a pair of 40mm Dell’Orto PHM carburetors, intake manifolds, air cleaners, a black-finished race exhaust system, factory specialized workshop tools, and various other parts, many of which were collected as part of an unrealized plan by the previous owner to convert the bike into a racer.
The New Hampshire title carries an “Antique Vehicle” brand.

This 2008 Mercedes-Benz ML550 remained under the car of a single owner in California prior to the selling dealer’s acquisition, and it has 39k miles. It is finished in Black (040) over black MB-Tex and is powered by a 5.5-liter V8 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes a sunroof, 19″ AMG five-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, a backup camera, and three-zone automatic climate control. This W164 ML550 is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The truck is finished in Black (040) and features roof rails, fog lights, a sunroof, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, running boards, a power liftgate, and polished exhaust outlets. Photos depicting paint-meter readings are provided in the gallery.

The 19″ AMG five-spoke wheels are mounted with Pirelli Scorpion Verde tires that show date codes from 2020. The truck is equipped with an Electronic Stability Program (ESP) and a four-wheel Electronic Traction System (4-ETS). Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs with Emergency Brake Assist. The power steering pump was said to have been replaced in preparation for the sale.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in black MB-Tex along with a matching center console and door panels. Additional appointments include heated power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, a backup camera, three-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, an analog clock, a fuel-level gauge, and a digital information display. The digital odometer indicates 39k miles.

The 5.5-liter M273 V8 was factory rated at 382 horsepower and 391 lb-ft of torque. Power is delivered to all four wheels through a 7G-Tronic seven-speed automatic transmission and a 4MATIC all-wheel-drive system. An oil change was performed and the timing cover gasket was said to have been replaced in preparation for the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 2006 Mercedes-Benz CLS55 AMG is one of 55 examples produced for the US market in collaboration with the Swiss watchmaker IWC Schaffhausen. All examples were finished in Titanium Gray Metallic over Titanium Exclusive Nappa leather, and power comes from a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. The car has been fitted with Lorinser bumpers, fenders, side skirts, a rear spoiler, and a sport exhaust system. Additional features include a sunroof, bi-xenon headlamps with Active Curve Illumination, Parktronic, aftermarket 20″ wheels, heated and ventilated Dynamic front seats, heated rear seats, an Alcantara headliner, four-zone climate control, a Harman Kardon audio system, COMAND with navigation, Keyless Go, and a powered rear-window sunshade. The car was initially sold in California and remained registered in the state prior to the seller’s February 2022 purchase, and it has 26k miles. This C219 CLS55 AMG is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a damage-free Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

All IWC Ingenieur examples were finished in exclusive Titanium Gray Metallic with a matching matte-titanium grille, side window bezels, and handle inserts. The car features Lorinser bumpers, fenders, side skirts, and a rear spoiler, and additional exterior details include a sunroof, bi-xenon headlamps with Active Curve Illumination, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, Parktronic, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and quad exhaust outlets.

Staggered-width 20″ aftermarket wheels are mounted with 255/30 and 305/25 Hankook Ventus V12 Evo 2 tires that were reportedly installed in March 2022. The car is equipped with an Electronic Stability Program (ESP), speed-sensitive power steering, and Airmatic Dual Control air suspension. Stopping power is provided by perforated and ventilated discs measuring 14.2″ and 13″ front and rear, respectively.

The four-passenger cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in Titanium Exclusive Nappa leather, while Piano black trim accents the dashboard and center console. Woven floor mats line the footwells, and additional amenities include heated and ventilated Dynamic front seats, heated rear seats, an Alcantara headliner, four-zone climate control, a power-operated rear-window sunshade, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 surround-sound system, COMAND with navigation, and Keyless Go. The front-seat massage function does not work.

The Alcantara- and leather-trimmed steering wheel frames IWC Schaffhausen-styled instrumentation that includes a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer, an analog clock, and digital gauges for fuel level and water temperature. The digital odometer indicates 26k miles, approximately 8k of which were added under current ownership.
The supercharged 5.4-liter M113 V8 was factory rated at 469 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque.

Power is delivered to the rear wheels through an AMG Speedshift five-speed automatic transmission. The car has been fitted with a Lorinser Sport exhaust system. The transmission shift plate, pan gasket, and fluid were reportedly replaced in December 2022.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Autobahn Motors in Belmont, California, along with factory colors, standard equipment, options, and a total retail price of $122,475.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage. One open recall is noted.
There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

This 2017 Ford F-150 Raptor SuperCrew pickup remained with the original owner until the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024. The truck is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter V6 linked with a 10-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and an electronic locking rear differential. It is finished in Lightning Blue Metallic over black leather upholstery, and options include the Raptor Technology Package, a twin-panel sunroof, a Retrax tonneau cover, Baja Design LED auxiliary lights, a receiver hitch, 17″ wheels, an Alcon big brake kit, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, a Sony sound system, and SYNC 3 with navigation. This F-150 Raptor has 69k miles and is now offered with the owner’s manual, two keys, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The Raptor features widened front and rear fenders compared to the standard F-150, and this example is finished in Lightning Blue Metallic. Exterior equipment includes LED headlights, Baja Design LED auxiliary lights, a heavy-duty front bumper, exposed tow hooks, a twin-panel sunroof, Raptor-branded side steps, a power-sliding rear window, a Retrax tonneau cover, a receiver hitch, remote tailgate release, a spray-in bedliner, and heavy-duty skid plates. Scratches around the body are noted by the seller.

The 17″ wheels are mounted with 315/70 Nitto Ridge Grappler tires. The truck was factory equipped with Fox Racing internal-bypass shocks. An Alcon big brake kit was installed under previous ownership.

The SuperCrew cabin features heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in black leather with Dark Earth Gray accents. Interior amenities include a Sony sound system, cruise control, dual-zone automatic climate control, and SYNC 3 with navigation. The optional Raptor Technology Package added a lane-keeping system, rain-sensing wipers, and Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 140-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,200-rpm redline as well as a central configurable LCD screen with auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, fuel level, and transmission temperature. The digital odometer indicates 69k miles.
The twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 510 lb-ft of torque. A coolant flush was performed in June 2022 and an oil change was carried out in March 2024.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a 10-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and an electronic locking rear differential. The differential fluid and transfer case fluid were changed in June 2022 and the transmission fluid was changed in November 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage and lists at least one open recall.

This 1977 Chevrolet K10 Silverado 4×4 pickup has been refinished in yellow over black cloth and fitted with a 350ci V8 linked with a three-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Equipment includes a 4″ lifted suspension, Bilstein shock absorbers, power steering, an Edelbrock intake manifold, Holley Sniper electronic fuel injection, dual fuel tanks, a dual exhaust system, 15″ Eagle Alloys wheels, and an AutoMeter digital instrument display. Acquired by the seller’s father in 2024, this K10 is offered by the seller on behalf of their father with an Arizona title.

The truck has been refinished in yellow and features a Fleetside bed, a sliding rear window, chrome bumpers and bed side rails, a spray-in bedliner, and a tow ball. Areas of corrosion and other blemishes in the finish can be viewed in the gallery below.

The 15″ Eagle Alloys wheels are mounted with 33×12.5″ Mirage MR-MT172 tires. The truck is equipped with a 4″ lifted suspension, Bilstein shock absorbers, manually locking front hubs, power steering, and power-assisted front disc and rear drum brakes.

The interior was refreshed under prior ownership and features a black cloth bench seat with vinyl sides and yellow stitching. Additional appointments include power-adjustable side mirrors and USB power outlets as well as aftermarket speakers and a BOSS Audio Systems touchscreen head unit with a backup camera that are currently inoperative. The air conditioning system is not functional and the seller notes that the left window is difficult to operate.

The two-spoke tilting steering wheel frames an AutoMeter digital instrument display, on which the odometer shows 1,100 miles, approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.

The factory 400ci V8 was replaced with a 350ci V8 under previous ownership that is fitted with an Edelbrock intake manifold, a Holley Sniper electronic fuel injection system, and an aluminum radiator with dual electric fans.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The transmission is said to be fitted with a shift kit and the truck is equipped with dual fuel tanks and a dual exhaust system.
The Arizona-assigned identification number CKR147Z188337 corresponds with the VIN listed on the current Arizona title, which carries an “Exceeds Mechanical Limits” odometer brand.

This 1966 Chevrolet Chevelle SS396 is a triple-black convertible that is powered by a replacement 396ci V8 mated to a four-speed manual transmission and a Moser 9″ rear end with a limited-slip differential. The car rides on a lowered suspension with Ridetech coilovers, and the staggered-diameter Billet Specialties wheels are mounted over four-wheel disc brakes. Additional equipment includes power steering, front bucket seats, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, a Hurst shifter, ancillary instrumentation, and a push-button radio along with a Holley carburetor, an MSD distributor, long-tube headers, and aftermarket headlights. Acquired by the seller in August 2022, this Chevelle SS396 convertible is offered with a Virginia title.

The car is finished in Tuxedo Black with a black soft top, and equipment includes faux hood vents, quad headlights, chrome bumpers, Super Sport badging, quarter vent windows, and aftermarket headlights. An issue with the right-rear window is reported along with chips in the finish.

Billet Specialties 18″ front and 20″ rear wheels are mounted with a mixed set of Sentury and Lexani tires. The car rides on a lowered suspension with Ridetech coilovers, and braking is provided by power-assisted four-wheel discs with Wilwood rear calipers.
The front bucket seats and rear bench are upholstered in black vinyl, and equipment consists of a push-button stereo, a center console, and a Hurst shifter. Corrosion is noted on the trunk floor.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel fronts a horizontal 120-mph speedometer and a fuel level gauge. An AEM air/fuel ratio readout is mounted to the A-pillar, and a trio of ancillary gauges are fitted beneath the dashboard. The five-digit odometer shows 68k miles, approximately 12k of which were added under current ownership.
The replacement 396ci V8 breathes through a Holley 750-cfm carburetor and is equipped with an MSD distributor.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a Moser 9″ rear end with a limited-slip differential. Exhaust gases flow from long-tube headers to a stainless-steel dual-outlet system.
Decoding the data plate reveals the following production information:
There is a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

This 1988 Ford Mustang Saleen is #210 of approximately 700 examples modified by Saleen Autosport for the model year, and it shows 68k miles. The car is finished in black with gold stripes over beige cloth upholstery, and it is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 mated to a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Saleen additions included a rear wing, revised body panels, upgraded suspension and braking components, 16″ basketweave wheels, Flo-Fit front seats, a MOMO steering wheel, and a Hurst shifter. The car was previously sold on BaT in December 2023, and it was acquired six months ago by the selling dealer, who installed a factory-specification Pioneer cassette stereo and serviced the suspension, exhaust, paint, and glass. This Saleen Mustang is offered with Saleen correspondence and literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title.

The hatchback body is said to have been refinished circa 2018. Paint correction work was completed in preparation for the sale, and the rear quarter windows were replaced. A Saleen Mustang banner spans the windshield, and a decal showing the car’s Saleen build number “210” is located on the left side of the front bumper.

Five-lug 16″ American Racing/Saleen basketweave wheels were mounted with 225/50 Michelin Pilot Exalto tires under current ownership, and replacement dampers were installed for the Saleen Racecraft suspension, which also has performance-tuned springs, unique strut top bearings, urethane sway bar bushings, and a three-point strut tower brace. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel SVO-type disc brakes.

The Flo-Fit front bucket seats are trimmed in beige cloth, and red Saleen Mustang embroidery accents the color-keyed door panels. Appointments include air conditioning, power windows, locks, and mirrors, and a Pioneer cassette stereo installed by the selling dealer. Steve Saleen’s signature is noted on the center console, retractable cargo cover, and dashboard, which has an area of discoloration on its right side.

The leather-wrapped MOMO steering wheel frames Saleen Mustang-branded instrumentation including a 170-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 68k miles.
A plaque located ahead of the Hurst shifter indicates that this car was #210 modified by Saleen Autosport for the 1988 model year.
The 5.0-liter High-Output V8 produced 225 horsepower and 300 lb-ft of torque when new.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a Traction-Loc limited-slip differential. The selling dealer installed a dual exhaust system with catalytic converters and an H-pipe.
The included correspondence from Saleen identifies this car as one of 15 with these exact colors and options.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1968 Mercedes-Benz 280SL delivered new in Europe and was imported into the US before making its way to Canada in the mid 1980s. It is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (180) over blue MB-Tex and is powered by a 2.8-liter inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a blue convertible top, a removable hardtop, power steering, 14″ Bundt alloy wheels, and a heater. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2024 and has since added approximately 100 miles. This W113 SL is now offered at no reserve with British Columbia registration.

The W113 SL was designed by Friedrich Geiger, Béla Barényi, and Paul Bracq and was introduced to the public at the 1963 Geneva Motor Show. This example is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (180) and features a blue soft top, a removable hardtop, and European-specification headlights.
The 14″ Bundt alloy wheels are mounted with 195/70 Toyo tires. The car is equipped with power steering, and braking is provided by power-assisted four-wheel discs.
The cabin houses bucket seats upholstered in blue MB-Tex that extends to the door panels. Interior appointments include an analog clock, a floor-mounted gear shifter, and a heater.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a chrome horn ring and frames a 140-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 67k kilometers (~42k miles), approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.
The 2.8-liter M130 inline-six was factory equipped with Bosch fuel injection and was rated at 195 horsepower and 195 lb-ft of torque when new.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.
The car is being sold with it’s registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia.

This 2004 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe was initially sold in Nevada and spent time in California before its purchase by the seller in 2013. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter M96 flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and it is finished in Black over black leather. It was optioned with xenon headlights and heated power-adjustable seats, and additional equipment includes a sunroof, a deployable rear spoiler, a Becker-Porsche radio, cruise control, automatic climate control, and 18″ Turbo Look II wheels that have been refinished in chrome. This 996.2 coupe is now offered in Texas with the owner’s manual, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Black (L041) and features an electric sunroof, xenon headlights, integrated fog lights, a deployable rear spoiler, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. Matte protective film has been applied to the front end. The seller notes that the front and rear hood struts are in need of replacement.

18″ Turbo Look II wheels have been refinished in chrome, and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. Braking is handled by four-piston Porsche-branded calipers fitted over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats trimmed in Black leather. Interior equipment includes driver-seat memory settings, a Becker-Porsche CDR23 radio with a remote CD changer, cruise control, and automatic climate control. The radio knobs are sticky and the left vanity light does not work and the cover fell off but is included in the sale.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 200-mph speedometer, a central tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 21k miles, approximately 13k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.6-liter M96 flat-six was factory rated at 320 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. The seller notes that the drain plug requires replacement and a spare is included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The California title is listed as a duplicate.

This 2010 Land Rover Range Rover HSE has remained in California through the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024 and now has 73k miles. It is finished in Nara Bronze over Arabica and Ivory leather and is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck features 20″ alloy wheels, an electronic center differential, a sunroof, a rearview camera, heated and ventilated front seats, a heated rear bench, a rear-seat entertainment system, navigation, and Harman Kardon audio. This Range Rover HSE is offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a California title.

The truck is finished in Nara Bronze and features xenon headlights with washers as well as fog lights, a sunroof, a rear window wiper, and parking sensors. Close-up photos of the paintwork and trim are presented in the gallery.

The 20″ multi-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/50 Michelin Defender LTX M/S tires with 2019 and 2020 date codes. The truck is equipped with an adjustable air suspension, a Terrain Response system, and Hill Descent Control. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The front seats are upholstered in Arabica leather and feature heating, ventilation, power adjustment, and lumbar support, while Ivory leather accents the cabin. The rear cargo area has a cover, a barrier, and a spare wheel and tire. Amenities include heated outboard rear seats, keyless entry, push-button start, a rear-seat entertainment system, a rearview camera, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and multi-zone climate control.

The heated steering wheel frames a 12.3″ digital instrument cluster displaying an 8k-rpm tachometer, a 155-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 73k miles.
The 5.0-liter AJ133 V8 was factory rated at 375 horsepower and 375 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in June 2024.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed ZF automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and an electronic center differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2014 Chevrolet Camaro 2SS coupe was purchased new by its current owner, and a Magnuson supercharger kit was subsequently added to its 6.2-liter V8. The drivetrain was further modified with a Livernois camshaft and cylinder heads, a Roto-Fab intake system, a displacement-on-demand eliminator kit, ID850 injectors, and exhaust components from Corsa, Stainless Works, and NOWEEDS as well as a Precision Industries torque converter and an external cooler for the six-speed automatic transmission. Finished in black over matching leather upholstery, the car was optioned with the RS package and is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 20″ alloy wheels, Brembo brakes, BMR trailing arms and toe rods, a rear spoiler, and xenon headlights along with heated power-adjustable front seats, a head-up display, Boston Acoustics audio, air conditioning, and MyLink infotainment. With 13k miles, this fifth-generation Camaro is now offered by the seller on behalf of its owner with a window sticker, owner’s manuals, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in black with a matching vented hood and rear spoiler. Exterior details include xenon headlights with LED halo rings as well as LED running lights, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, LED taillights, and dual exhaust outlets. Scrapes under the front lip are noted by the seller, along with a right-side door ding and chipped paint on the front bumper cover.

Silver-finished 20″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 245/45 front and 275/40 rear Pirelli P Zero tires that have 2013 production-date codes. Braking is provided by Brembo calipers fitted over ventilated discs, and the suspension has been modified with BMR trailing arms and toe rods.

The heated and power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in black leather with SS headrest embroidery, and the dashboard, door panels, and rear bench are trimmed to match. Additional appointments include MyLink infotainment, a Boston Acoustics sound system, air conditioning, and an auto-dimming rearview mirror.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 180-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,250-rpm redline as well as auxiliary gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature, all supplemented by a head-up display. Additional gauges for oil pressure, voltage, oil temperature, and transmission temperature are housed in the center console. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles, all of which were added under current ownership. The warning for low tire pressure remains on after startup.

The 6.2-liter V8 has been modified with a Magnuson TVS2300 Heartbeat supercharger kit, a Livernois LS Stage 2 Hi-Lift camshaft, and ported and milled Livernois Stage 2 cylinder heads. The throttle body was ported, and a kit to eliminate the displacement-on-demand system has been added along with a Roto-Fab cold-air intake system, a Livernois dual-fuel-pump kit, and Injector Dynamics ID850 injectors.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Precision Industries torque converter with a 3k-rpm stall speed has been fitted along with an external transmission cooler and axles rated for 1,000 horsepower. Aftermarket exhaust components include a Corsa cat-back stainless-steel system, Stainless Works long-tube headers, and a NOWEEDS electronic exhaust diverter system.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Hank Graff Chevrolet in Davison, Michigan, factory colors and equipment, and a total vehicle price of $41,185.
The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries and it notes an open manufacturer safety recall from June 2014.

This 1974 Ford Bronco is powered by a 302ci V8 that has been fitted with a FiTech fuel-injection system and a dual exhaust system with four-into-one headers, and it rides on a lifted suspension with Bilstein shocks and 15″ steel wheels mounted over hydroboosted front discs and rear drums. The truck is finished in black over black leather upholstery, and additional equipment includes a three-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, a BeCool aluminum radiator, a silver removable hardtop, a domed hood with pins, retractable side steps, trimmed fenders, a microsuede headliner, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, a lockable center console, and aftermarket audio equipment. Acquired by the current owner in 2019, the truck now shows 30k miles. This Bronco is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean California title in the name of the owner and their trust.

The truck was repainted black under prior ownership and is equipped with a silver removable hardtop, retractable side steps, trimmed fenders, chrome bumpers, dual side mirrors, front bumper-mounted auxiliary lights, and a domed hood with pins. The tailgate handle does not work and the windshield wipers need to be replaced. Close-up images of exterior blemishes are provided in the gallery.

The 15″ steel wheels are mounted with 33×12.5″ BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A tires, and an older spare is mounted to the swing-away rear carrier. The truck rides on a lifted suspension with Bilstein shocks. Stopping power is provided by front discs and rear drums with a Hydratech Hydroboost system. The seller states the vehicle needs an alignment.

The front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in black leather upholstery. Appointments include a microsuede headliner, a lockable center console, a heater, and aftermarket audio equipment. The detached rearview mirror is included in the sale. A rip is visible on the side of the driver’s seat.

The wood-rimmed three-spoke steering wheel features a Ford Mustang center logo and fronts a 100-mph speedometer, a column-mounted Sun tachometer, and supplementary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 30k miles, approximately 7k of which were added under current ownership. The aftermarket oil pressure, voltage, and coolant temperature gauges mounted within the dashboard are said to have been installed under current ownership.

The 302ci V8 is said to have received a top-end overhaul under prior ownership and is equipped with a FiTech EFI system, a BeCool aluminum radiator, Cobra-branded valve covers, a purple-finished aftermarket heat exchanger, and a dual-exhaust system with four-into-one headers. The battery, alternator, and voltage regulator were reportedly replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels via a three-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
The California title is a duplicate.

This 1986 Chevrolet C10 Scottsdale pickup is powered by a 5.3-liter Vortec V8 linked with a 4L60E four-speed automatic transmission and the truck is finished in white and blue over blue vinyl upholstery. Equipment includes a Belltech lowered suspension, 20″ American Racing wheels, power steering, power front disc brakes, an aluminum radiator, and Speed Engineering long-tube headers. The cabin is outfitted with a sliding rear window, a push-button AM/FM stereo, and air conditioning. The selling dealer acquired the truck in 2022 and has since added approximately 1,500 miles. This C10 is now offered in Alabama with an owner’s manual and a North Carolina title.

The truck was repainted in white and blue under prior ownership and features a Fleetside bed as well as dual rectangular headlights, dual side mirrors, bright trim, and chrome bumpers. There is a dent in the passenger door.

The 20″ American Racing Torq Thrust Wheels are mounted with Pirelli tires measuring 245/40 up front and 295/40 out back. The truck is equipped with a Belltech lowered suspension and power steering. Power-assisted front discs and rear drums provide braking.

The bench seat is trimmed in blue vinyl upholstery joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, door panels, and carpets. Interior appointments include a sliding rear window, a push-button AM/FM stereo, air conditioning, and Chevrolet-branded rubber floormats.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames an 85-mph speedometer and gauges for voltage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The fuel gauge does not work. The five-digit odometer shows 30k miles, although the speedometer and odometer do not work. Total mileage is unknown.

The 5.3-liter Vortec V8 was installed in 2022 and is said to have been sourced from a 2002 Chevrolet Tahoe. An Edelbrock air cleaner, an aluminum radiator, electric cooling fans, and Speed Engineering long-tube exhaust headers have been fitted.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a 4L60E four-speed automatic transmission and a 10-bolt rear axle. The transmission is said to have been rebuilt under prior ownership. An aftermarket dual exhaust system has been fitted and terminates before the rear axle.
The SPID label shows factory equipment and colors.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists a Not Actual Mileage Title issued in July 2018.

This 2012 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe is a Premium Package Plus-equipped example that has been fitted with a Fabspeed exhaust system and was initially delivered to Porsche of Hawaii in Honolulu. Finished in Agate Gray Metallic over black leather upholstery, it is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK automatic transaxle. The car has the Sport Chrono Package, PASM sport suspension, 20″ Carrera S alloy wheels, a sunroof, Power Steering Plus, bi-xenon headlights with PDLS, ParkAssist, heated and ventilated adaptive front Sport Plus seats, Rennline floor liners, and PCM with navigation. Purchased by the seller in 2023, this 991.1 has 51k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Agate Gray Metallic and has bi-xenon headlights with Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS) as well as fog lights, a sunroof, front and rear parking sensors, LED taillights, clear side markers, and a speed-activated rear spoiler. The front spoiler and lip were repaired in preparation for the sale.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in May 2024 and the sale was not completed due to some complexities surrounding emissions and title information, which have since been resolved. Neither the seller nor winning bidder were at fault.

The 20″ Carrera S alloy wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 305/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4s tires showing 2022 date codes. Braking is handled by red-painted Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated discs. The car is equipped with Power Steering Plus and PASM sport suspension.

The heated and ventilated power-adjustable adaptive Sport Plus front seats are upholstered in black leather with Guards Red seatbelts, and the footwells have been fitted with Rennline floor liners. Interior appointments include Porsche Entry & Drive, PCM with navigation, the Light Design Package, and cruise control. The heater wiring harness was replaced in June 2024.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central tachometer with a 7,600-rpm redline as well as a 200-mph speedometer and gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 51k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.8-liter flat-six was factory rated at 400 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque. The car is equipped with a Fabspeed exhaust system. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale, and the car passed a California smog test in June 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK automatic transaxle and an electronically locking rear axle with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV).
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Porsche of Hawaii in Honolulu, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $127,335.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Heated and Ventilated Adaptive Front Sport Plus Seats

description: This 2013 Lamborghini Gallardo LP570-4 Spyder Performante has 10k miles and is powered by a 5.2-liter V10 which drives all four wheels through a six-speed automated transaxle and limited-slip differentials. Finished in Bianco Monocerus over Nero Alcantara upholstery, the car was optioned with xenon headlights with washers, a black soft top, a fixed rear wing, a back-up camera, ceramic-composite brakes, 19″ Scorpius wheels, a front-axle lift system, bucket seats, carbon-fiber interior and exterior accents, and navigation. Purchased by the seller in 2020, this Gallardo Spyder Performante is now offered in Florida with a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alaska title in the name of the seller’s LLC.

The carbon-fiber bodywork and aluminum components employed in the construction of the Spyder Performante resulted in weight savings of approximately 143 pounds as compared to the contemporary Gallardo LP560-4 Spyder. This example is finished in Bianco Monocerus with color-contrasting graphics and a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, side skirts, fixed rear wing, and mirror casings. Additional details include a black convertible soft top, xenon headlights with washers, LED taillights, and exhaust outlets that exit through the rear valance. Paint protection film has been applied to the front bumper cover, front fenders, hood, and mirror caps, and the exterior has received a ceramic coating.

The 19″ Scorpius alloy wheels are mounted with 235/35 front and 295/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. The car is equipped with an optional front-axle lift system, and stopping power is provided by cross-drilled and ventilated ceramic-composite discs with black-finished calipers at each corner. The brake fluid was flushed in December 2020, and replacement TPMS sensors were fitted in January 2022.

The cabin is upholstered in Nero Alcantara that extends from the manually adjustable dual bucket seats to the dashboard and rear bulkhead. Carbon-fiber trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include a back-up camera, navigation, Performante-branded sill plates, cruise control, Lamborghini logos on the headrests, and dual-zone automatic climate control. A ceramic coating has been applied to various interior components, per the seller.

The Alcantara- and carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel fronts a pair of paddle shifters as well as a 210-mph speedometer and a tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. Gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, and battery voltage are located on the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 10k miles, approximately 800 of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.2-liter V10 was factory rated at 562 horsepower and 398 lb-ft of torque. Work in December 2020 included flushing the coolant, replacing the front and rear differential fluids, and installing a replacement drive belt, air filters, and spark plugs. A replacement battery was installed in November 2023, and an oil change was performed in January 2024.

Power is delivered to all four wheels through a six-speed E-gear automated transaxle, limited-slip front and rear differentials, and a Viscous Traction permanent all-wheel drive system. The seller states the clutch was examined in May 2024 and showed approximately 32% of wear.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2001 Chevrolet Camaro SS convertible is powered by a 5.7-liter LS1 V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and has 45k miles. The car is finished in Light Pewter Metallic over Ebony leather and features a limited-slip differential, a black convertible soft top, 17″ split-spoke alloy wheels, Acceleration Slip Regulation, a rear spoiler, a hood scoop, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, a CD stereo, a Monsoon sound system, cruise control, and air conditioning. The selling dealer purchased the car in 2024. This fourth-generation Camaro SS is now offered in South Carolina at no reserve with the owner’s manual, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in Light Pewter Metallic and is equipped with a black convertible soft top, SS badges, fog lights, a rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets. A blemish on the front end is noted by the selling dealer.

The 17″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V4 ES tires. Additional SS equipment included a performance suspension with a larger front stabilizer bar, revised shock valving, and stiffer springs and bushings than the standard Camaro, and the car is equipped with Acceleration Slip Regulation. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel anti-lock ventilated disc brakes.

The seats are upholstered in Ebony leather and interior features include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, a CD stereo, a Monsoon sound system, cruise control, Camaro SS-branded floormats, and air conditioning. Wear is visible on the driver’s seat bolster.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 45k miles.
The 5.7-liter LS1 V8 was factory rated at 325 horsepower and 350 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1971 Toyota Land Cruiser FJ40 is finished in green over black vinyl upholstery, and it is powered by a 3.9-liter F inline-six linked with a three-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Additional equipment includes 15″ steel wheels, manually locking front hubs, power steering, a removable hardtop with a white roof, a winch, a tow ball, a heater, and inward-facing rear seating. Acquired by the current owner in 2016, this FJ40 is offered by the seller with a Washington title in the owner’s name.

The truck is finished in green and features a removable hardtop with a white roof along with a Warn winch, a left side mirror, a tow ball, and a rear-mounted spare tire. Rust is noted in the left-front wheel well.
The gray-finished 15″ steel wheels feature polished hubcaps and are mounted with General Grabber AT2 tires. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs and power steering.
The seating surfaces have been reupholstered in black vinyl. Appointments include inward-facing rear bench seats, black rubber floor mats, and manual wind-up windows.
The three-spoke steering sits ahead of gauges for oil pressure, temperature, fuel level, and amperage. The speedometer and odometer are missing. Total mileage is unknown.
The 3.9-liter F inline-six features a single carburetor.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a three-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The seller states the clutch, flywheel, pressure plate, pilot bearing, and release bearing were recently replaced.
The Washington title is a duplicate and carries a Classic brand.

This 1966 Sunbeam is said to have been purchased by the prior owner in 1990 as a non-running project before being acquired from their estate by the seller in 2023. Based upon the features, components, and serial numbers and plates, the seller believes the car to be a Mk 1A Tiger. The car is finished in red and features a removable black hardtop, a banjo-style steering wheel, seats trimmed in black vinyl, aftermarket shocks, and 13″ steel wheels. It has been partially stripped and the engine and four-speed manual gearbox have been removed, though the latter is included in the sale along with a collection of additional spare and removed parts. This Sunbeam project is now offered at no reserve with transferable New York State registration in the seller’s name.

Previously finished in black, the car underwent bodywork and was repainted in its current shade of red in the early 2000s under previous ownership. It is accompanied by a removable black hardtop. The convertible top has been removed along with the headlights, bumpers, and various exterior trim pieces.
The car wears a mismatched set of 13″ steel wheels mounted with older tires. Aftermarket shocks have been added, and the front disc and rear drum brakes are retained.
The interior has been partially stripped and houses bucket seats trimmed in black vinyl. Rust is visible on various metal surfaces.
The banjo-style steering wheel sits ahead of a burl wood veneer dashboard. The factory Jaeger instrumentation has been taken out and will accompany the car.
The engine and transmission have been removed, and the latter is included in the sale.
Rust is visible on the underbody, and additional underside photos are presented in the gallery.
The chassis plate is shown above and the car’s serial number aligns with Mk 1A production. Additional identifying markings are presented in the gallery.
A collection of spare and removed parts will accompany the car.

This 1998 Rover Mini Cooper BSCC Limited is finished in black with a white roof and powered by a fuel-injected 1.3-liter inline-four linked to a four-speed manual transaxle. The car wears Sport Pack–style 13″ alloy wheels and wheel arch extensions along with dual driving lights and a center-exit HKS muffler. Inside, the seats are trimmed in green leather and accompanied by wood veneer trim along with an airbag steering wheel, air conditioning, and a Clarion stereo. The car underwent a repaint in Japan before being brought to Canada and was acquired by the current owner in 2019. This Mk VII Cooper is now offered at no reserve on dealer consignment in Ontario, Canada, with a clean Carfax report and Ontario registration.

A Japanese-market version of the Sport LE model offered in the UK, the BSCC Limited was built to commemorate the 30th anniversary of the Mini Cooper’s race victories in the 1968 British Saloon Car Championship. This example was disassembled and repainted black with a white roof prior to importation from Japan. The car wears white mirror caps and hood stripes along with replacement decals, and further details include dual driving lights, Sport Pack–style wheel arch extensions, side window deflectors, a leather fuel filler bib, and a center-exit HKS muffler.
Sport Pack–style 13″ alloy wheels are mounted with 175/60 Yokohama AS39 tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums.

The front bucket seats and rear bench are trimmed in green leather, and color-coordinated upholstery extends to the door and side panels. Wood veneer trim accents the cabin, and further details include air conditioning, a gearshift lever extension, and three-point seatbelts. A Bluetooth-capable Clarion stereo has been added, though the seller notes that it does not pick up North American stations.

The airbag steering wheel wears a Mini Cooper badge and is wrapped in green and perforated black leather. Instrumentation consists of a 180-km/h speedometer, a tachometer, and a combination gauge. The five-digit odometer shows 26k kilometers (~15k miles) and has rolled over. Approximately 7k kilometers (~4k miles) have been added under current ownership.

The 1.3L A-series inline-four features single-point injection (SPi) and was factory-rated at 62 horsepower and 70 lb-ft of torque. A replacement battery and engine mount were installed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the front wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle, which is said to have been rebuilt in 2019.
Decoding the VIN tag provides the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
The vehicle is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 1976 Honda MT125 Elsinore is powered by a 123cc two-stroke single paired with a five-speed transmission. It is finished in silver and blue and features street lighting, 21″ and 18″ wire-spoke wheels, a black vinyl solo seat, an upswept expansion-chamber exhaust, a kick starter, a chrome cross-braced handlebar, oil injection, high-mounted fenders, drum brakes, and a side stand. This MT125 Elsinore was purchased by the seller in 2008 and is now offered at no reserve in New York with an owner’s manual and a Vermont registration in the seller’s name.

The fuel tank is finished in silver and blue and is complemented by black side panels, white plastic high-mounted fenders, and yellow, white, and black graphics. Features include street lighting, a black vinyl solo seat, a skid plate, and a side stand.

The 21″ and 18″ wire-spoke wheels wear older Nitto knobby tires. Suspension consists of a conventional fork as well as dual preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm. Braking is provided by drums at both ends.
The chrome tubular handlebar wears black rubber grips and fronts a Nippon Seiki 80-mph speedometer and a matching tachometer with inset indicator lights. The five-digit odometer shows 93 miles.

The 123cc two-stroke single is equipped with a Keihin carburetor, oil injection, a kick starter, and a black-finished upswept expansion-chamber exhaust system. The seller states the battery was replaced in May 2024.
Power is routed to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and a drive chain with upper and lower guards.
The bike does not have a title, as it is registered in a state that does not issue titles for a vehicle of its age. It is being sold on its registration.

This 1966 Shelby Mustang GT350 was invoiced to Marv Tonkin Ford in Portland, Oregon, on February 25, 1966, finished in Candy Apple Red with cast alloy wheels and a Sport Deck rear seat. The car remained with four owners in Oregon before being purchased by the current owner in Washington in 2005. An ensuing refurbishment was completed in 2006 and saw the car repainted in its factory color with white stripes, and it is powered by a 289ci HiPo V8 linked with a T-10 four-speed manual transmission. Other equipment includes black vinyl upholstery, front disc brakes, Koni shocks, dual exhaust, Flowmaster mufflers, a Holley 715-cfm carburetor, PerTronix ignition, a steel-reinforced fiberglass hood, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and an AM radio. This GT350 is now offered in Portland, Oregon, on dealer consignment with a copy of the original invoice, service records, and a clean Washington title.

The car was delivered new in Candy Apple Red (J) and was repainted in 2006. White over-the-top and rocker stripes have been added, while the car is also equipped with a steel-reinforced fiberglass hood with variable-diameter hood springs and hood pins as well as a driver-side mirror, functional side scoops, double-curved plexiglass quarter panels, and re-chromed bumpers and bumperettes.

Sand-cast 10-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 225/60 front and 245/60 rear BFGoodrich Radial T/A tires that are said to have been recently installed. GT350s were factory-equipped with Kelsey-Hayes front disc brakes as well as larger rear drums than standard Mustangs. Suspension components include Shelby lowered front A-arms, overrider traction bars, axle-limiting cables, and Koni shocks. The car is equipped with a quick-ratio steering box.

The cabin features low-back bucket seats and a Sport Deck rear seat trimmed in black vinyl. Lap belts are in place for four occupants, while an AM radio is situated in the dash. The glovebox door contains a Carroll Shelby signature.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer flanked by fuel-level, oil-pressure, amperage, and coolant-temperature gauges, and a Cobra-branded 9k-rpm tachometer is center-mounted atop the dash. The five-digit odometer shows 33k miles.

The 289ci HiPo V8 was reportedly rebuilt by Gray’s Automotive Machine Shop in McMinnville, Oregon, during the refurbishment and is topped by a Holley 715-cfm central-pivot four-barrel carburetor that is said to have been rebuilt in preparation for the sale. Equipment includes a 7.5-quart aluminum oil pan, Cobra “open-letter” valve covers, a dual-point distributor with PerTronix ignition, and a cast-aluminum high-rise intake manifold. The fuel-sending unit was replaced in October 2023, and the alternator and voltage regulator were reportedly recently replaced.
Dynamometer test results from 2007 show peak outputs of 257 rear-wheel horsepower and 284 lb-ft of torque.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through an aluminum-case T-10 four-speed manual transmission that is said to have been recently rebuilt. The rear axle seals were replaced in July 2021. The dual exhaust system features ceramic-coated tri-Y headers, a crossover pipe, and Flowmaster mufflers. The rear end is equipped with 3.89:1 gearing.

This 2022 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring is a Canadian-market example that was specified in Agate Gray Metallic over Exclusive Manufaktur Guards Red and black leather. Power is supplied by a 4.0-liter flat-six that drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a mechanical limited-slip differential. Features include the Chrono package, a front-axle lift system, LED Matrix-Design headlights, a speed-activated rear spoiler, rear-axle steering, center-locking wheels, heated adaptive sport seats, Porsche Communication Management, automatic climate control, and cruise control. This 992 GT3 Touring has 1,300 kilometers (~800 miles) and is now offered in Canada with the owner’s manual, service records, and a clean Alberta registration.

The car is finished in Agate Gray Metallic (M7S) and was optioned with the Touring Package in Black, which added black window trim and rear Porsche lettering as well as a revised decklid with a mesh grille and a retractable rear spoiler in place of the raised wing found on the standard GT3. Additional features include LED Matrix-Design headlights, a rear fog light, rear parking sensors, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. Clear paint-protection film has reportedly been applied to the body.

The 20″ front and 21″ rear GT3 center-lock wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero Corsa tires. Stopping power is provided by dimpled and ventilated discs at each corner. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system and rear-axle steering.

The heated and adaptive front sport seats feature debossed Porsche crests on the headrests and are trimmed in Exclusive Manufaktur Guards Red leather. The center console and upper dash are upholstered in black leather with red deviated stitching. Amenities include Porsche Communication Management infotainment with navigation as well as traffic sign recognition, a Bose sound system, automatic climate control, auto-dimming mirrors, cruise control, and black brushed aluminum sill guards.

The GT3 sports steering wheel features a vehicle configuration dial and frames a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline as well as a digital speed readout and dual adjustable TFT screens. A dash-mounted chronograph is included as part of the Chrono package. The digital odometer indicates 1,300 kilometers (~800 miles).

The 4.0-liter flat-six features direct fuel injection, VarioCam variable valve timing, dry-sump lubrication, and individual throttle bodies. It was rated at 502 horsepower and 346 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in May 2023, and an inspection report from that time is included in the gallery.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a mechanical limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage. A Canadian Carfax report is viewable in the gallery.
The vehicle is being sold on its Alberta registration, which serves as the ownership document in Alberta, Canada. The sale does not include a title.
listing_details: Exclusive Manufaktur Guards Red & Black Leather

description: This 1989 Ferrari Mondial T cabriolet shows 16k miles following registration history in New Jersey, Massachusetts, Florida, Ohio, and Pennsylvania. Service since June 2019 has included fluid exchanges and replacing the timing belt, water pump, camshaft seals, belts, fuel filters, control arm bushings, and spark plugs and wires. Finished in Bianco over Blu leather, the car is powered by a 3.4-liter F119D/G V8 paired with a five-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, a black soft top, a gated shifter, a Pyle CD stereo, power windows, and air conditioning. This Mondial T cabriolet was listed on BaT in February 2024 and is now offered again by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, service records, tool kits, a clean Carfax report, and a Pennsylvania title.

The Mondial was designed by Pininfarina, and the T model features body-color bumper covers as well as restyled side air intakes, door handles, and fenders when compared with earlier examples. The car is finished in Bianco and features a black soft top, pop-up headlights, integrated front fog lights, black lower bodywork, and quadruple exhaust outlets. Paintless dent repair was performed on a left quarter panel and the doors in June 2019. Additional work at that time included adjusting the driver’s door and replacing the corresponding weatherstripping. Touch-up paint was applied in August 2019. The photos in the listing and the gallery below were taken in February 2024.

The 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Premier A/S tires. The car is equipped with power steering and an adjustable suspension, while braking is handled by four-wheel vented discs with an anti-lock system. The control arm bushings were replaced in June 2019, and the brake fluid was flushed in May 2023.

The four-place cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Blu leather along with a color-coordinated lower dashboard and door trim. Interior features include a gated shifter and power windows. A Pyle CD stereo has been added. The front passenger seat upholstery was repaired in May 2021, and the air conditioning system was recharged in May 2023.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 180-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The steering column surround was refinished in June 2019. The six-digit odometer shows 16k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

The longitudinally mounted 3.4-liter F119D/G V8 features two overhead camshafts per cylinder bank, dry-sump lubrication, and Bosch Motronic digital engine management. It was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 229 lb-ft of torque. A belt service was conducted in June 2019 by Exoticars of Milford, New Jersey, at which time the water pump, camshaft seals, fuel filters, tensioners, idler bearings, and spark plug wires were replaced. The battery was replaced in May 2021, and the oil was changed and the spark plugs were replaced in May 2022.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The clutch fluid was flushed in May 2023.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in New Jersey, Massachusetts, Florida, Ohio, and Pennsylvania.
The Pennsylvania title carries a “Classic” brand.

This 2000 Ford F-150 SVT Lightning is one of 4,966 produced for the model year and now has 40k miles. The truck is finished in Bright Red over Medium Graphite cloth and Ebony leather and is powered by a supercharged 5.4-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes a MagnaFlow exhaust system, 18″ SVT five-spoke alloy wheels, fog lights, an aftermarket grille, aftermarket rear traction bars, a receiver hitch, a sliding rear window, AutoMeter A-pillar gauges, a Pioneer touchscreen head unit, an aftermarket subwoofer, and cruise control. The current owner purchased the truck in 2021. This SVT Lightning is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with the owner’s manual, an SCT performance control module, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title in the current owner’s name.

The truck is finished in Bright Red, and Lightning-specific features include revised bumper covers, side skirts, and a side-exit exhaust. Additional equipment includes a Flareside bed with side steps as well as an aftermarket front grille, a receiver hitch, a sliding rear window, a tonneau cover, and fog lights. The underside of the front bumper cover is scraped.

Silver-finished 18″ SVT five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 295/45 Nitto NT555 tires. The truck is equipped with SVT-tuned dampers and springs as well as front and rear stabilizer bars. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel anti-lock disc brakes. Aftermarket rear traction bars are installed.

The cab features a 60/40 split bench seat upholstered in Medium Graphite cloth and Ebony leather. SVT embroidery adorns the headrests, and amenities include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, air conditioning, a Pioneer touchscreen head unit, an aftermarket subwoofer, and cruise control. The key fob battery is due for replacement.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5,250-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil pressure, boost pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. AutoMeter vacuum pressure and air/fuel ratio gauges are mounted to the A-pillar. The digital odometer indicates 40k miles, approximately 1,200 of which were added under current ownership.
The supercharged and intercooled 5.4-liter Triton V8 was factory rated at 360 horsepower and 440 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential with 3.55:1 gearing. The catalytic converter has been removed and a MagnaFlow exhaust system is fitted.
Factory literature and an SCT performance control module are included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage and lists at least one open recall.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their April 2001 Road Test for the SVT Lightning.

This 1987 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe was the subject of a backdate build that was completed by Backyard Legends and Sonderwerks Porsche, both located in North Carolina. Highlighting the alterations is a twin-spark 3.4L flat-six that was built with Mahle pistons, 296° camshafts, a Rasant Products intake with individual throttle bodies, and an M&K stainless-steel exhaust system, while the body was backdated, flared, and repainted Stone Grey. Braid 17″ wheels were also installed along with Elephant Racing coilover suspension and upgraded brakes, while the interior was overhauled with Recaro seats, Rennline pedals, and a MOMO Prototipo steering wheel. The current owner purchased the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 2k of the 128k miles now shown. This Carrera coupe is now offered on dealer consignment with build records and a clean Illinois title.

The car was modified with a 1972-style front bumper, a 1973-style rear bumper, 930-specification flares, a 964-specification engine cover and spoiler, and a long hood before it was repainted Stone Grey. Paint protection film was applied along with a ceramic coating in 2020.
H4 headlights modified with projector beams were installed along with early-style grilles and lenses, and the weather seals were replaced along with the emblems.

Braid Fuchs-style wheels measure 17×9″ up front and 17×11″ out back, and they wear Nitto tires measuring 255/40 and 315/35, respectively. Elephant Racing coilover suspension has been installed along with upgraded braking components.

An RS-style carpet set, RS American door panels, and a roll bar were installed inside, and the rear seats were removed. The Recaro seats are trimmed in black leather with plaid accents, and matching upholstery covers the lower dashboard.

A MOMO Prototipo steering wheel was installed along with Rennline pedals. The instrument cluster was rebuilt in June 2020 by Nichols Speedometer and now shows 128k miles, approximately 2k of which were added by the owner.

The flat-six was rebuilt to displace 3.4 liters with Mahle pistons, Carillo connecting rods, ARP hardware, Web Cams 296° camshafts, rebuilt rockers, upgraded valve springs, titanium retainers, twin-spark heads, a Rasant Products GT3-style plenum with individual throttle bodies, and Megasquirt engine management.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a G50 five-speed manual transaxle. And M&K stainless-steel exhaust system was installed during the build.
Records from the build are included in the sale and displayed in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of reported damage or accidents.

This 1987 Mercedes-Benz 190E 2.3-16 is a Canadian-market example that remained with its original owner in Ontario before the seller acquired it in 2023. Power is provided by a 2.3-liter inline-four mated to a dogleg five-speed manual transmission, and the car is finished in Smoke Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, a self-leveling suspension, 15″ Gullideckel alloy wheels, a power sunroof, and a trunk lid spoiler with an integrated brake light as well as power-adjustable bolstered front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and power windows. Work in February 2024 involved replacing the valve cover gasket, alternator, radiator, and tires. This W201 is now offered in Canada with manufacturer’s literature, a tool kit, spare parts, a Carfax report, and Ontario registration in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Smoke Silver Metallic (702) and features a body-color front air dam, side skirts, wheel-arch flares, and trunk spoiler with an integrated third brake light. Additional exterior details include a hood ornament, integrated fog lights, headlight wipers, a power sunroof, and asymmetrical side mirrors. The grommet for the power antenna was replaced in February 2024. The Carfax report contains an August 2003 entry describing a damage claim. The seller states this was a curb collision incident that resulted in damage to the left side skirt, which was subsequently repaired along with the exhaust system. Photos provided in the gallery show scrapes on the front-right area of the car and corrosion is noted on the left edge of the trunk lid.

The 15″ Gullideckel alloy wheels were mounted with 205/55 Yokohama Advan Fleva tires in February 2024. The brake fluid was flushed and the power steering filter was replaced at that time. An adjustable self-leveling suspension was equipped from the factory, and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. A power steering fluid leak is noted by the seller.

The power-adjustable bolstered front sport seats are upholstered in black leather that extends to the rear bench and portions of the door panels. Wood trim accents the center stack, and amenities include driver seat-position memory, cruise control, and power-operated windows. The Becker Grand Prix cassette stereo is in anti-theft mode and the fan speed selector switch is stuck in the second-lowest position.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline and an inset analog clock as well as a 240-km/h speedometer and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and instant fuel economy. Gauges for voltage and oil temperature reside in the center stack. The six-digit mechanical odometer shows 133k kilometers (~83k miles), less than 1k kilometers were added by the seller. The Carfax report contains a January 2012 entry describing a potential odometer rollback and notes a mileage inconsistency in the most recent entry from February 2024. True mileage is unknown.

The 2.3-liter M102 inline-four was designed in collaboration with Cosworth and was factory rated at 167 horsepower and 162 lb-ft of torque. The fluids and filters were changed in February 2024, and further work at that time included replacing the valve cover gasket, alternator, battery, spark plugs, coolant temperature sensor, and radiator. The fuel pump relay, over-voltage relay, and climate control relay are said to have been replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a Getrag five-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential, both of which received fluid changes in February 2024.

The Carfax report contains the aforementioned 2003 damage report as well as the aforementioned entries from 2012 and 2024 describing mileage inconsistencies. There is a gap in entries between August 1987 and February 1999.
The vehicle is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada. The sale does not include a title.
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the 190E 2.3-16 when it was new? Click here to check out their March 1986 Road Test.

This 1985 Chevrolet K5 Blazer Silverado has been registered in Idaho since new and was refurbished following the late owner’s acquisition in April 2021. Work included fitting the 383ci V8, repainting the exterior dark red, and refreshing the interior with Corbeau front bucket seats, Dakota Digital gauges, and an aftermarket sound system. Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a Hughes torque converter, and additional equipment includes aftermarket wheels, LED headlights, a receiver hitch, power windows, and air conditioning. This K5 Blazer is offered by the seller on behalf of the owner’s estate at no reserve with service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Idaho title.
The truck was repainted dark red in 2021 and is equipped with a removable hardtop, LED headlights and auxiliary lights, chrome bumpers, and a receiver hitch.

The aftermarket wheels feature blue accents and are mounted with Mazama tires. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs and power steering. The front brake pads, calipers, rotors, and hoses as well as the rear brake drums were replaced in September 2021.

The Corbeau front bucket seats and the rear bench are trimmed in black upholstery. Appointments include air conditioning, power windows, an Alpine CD stereo, dual Audiomobile subwoofers, and a Focal amplifier and speakers. SoundSkins sound-dampening material has been applied to the cabin.

The steering wheel frames Dakota Digital instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and supplementary gauges. The digital odometer shows 331 miles. A potential odometer rollover is shown on the Carfax report in February 2012. Total mileage is unknown.
The 383ci V8 was installed in 2021 and is equipped with a Weiand intake manifold, a Spectre air cleaner, and Flowtech exhaust headers.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a Hughes torque converter. The axles feature 4.10:1 gearing.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned potential odometer rollover.

This 2004 Chevrolet SSR was purchased new by the current owner and now has 3,300 miles following history in New Jersey. It is finished in Smokin’ Asphalt over Ebony leather and is powered by a 5.3-liter V8 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the 1SB Preferred Equipment Group, a power-folding hardtop, satin chrome running boards, wood cargo floor rub strips, integrated side-saddle cargo area storage, a sport suspension, heated power-adjustable twin bucket seats, remote keyless entry, cruise control, and air conditioning. This SSR is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a recent service record, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The SSR was built on a modified version of the GMT360 platform shared with the contemporary TrailBlazer SUV, and its styling was inspired by the Chevrolet Advance Design family of trucks. This example is finished in Smokin’ Asphalt with a color-matched hardshell tonneau cover and a power-retractable convertible hardtop.
