Additional equipment includes flush-mounted halogen headlights bisected by a satin-finished chevron bar as well as flush-mounted taillights, power-operated heated side mirrors, integrated satin chrome running boards, and dual polished exhaust tips. The carpeted cargo bed is accented with wood strips and features integrated side-saddle cargo area storage. Photos of paint meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 19″ front and 20″ rear five-spoke cast-aluminum wheels are mounted with 255/45 front and 295/40 rear Goodyear Eagle RS-A tires. The SSR was equipped from the factory with a ZQ8 sport suspension featuring an independent front and five-link solid-axle rear setup with front and rear stabilizer bars. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated disc brakes.

The twin heated and power-adjustable high-back bucket seats are upholstered in Ebony leather complemented by satin chrome trim. Amenities include a color-keyed waterfall console as well as a CD stereo, air conditioning, and cruise control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames SSR-branded instrumentation including a 140-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. Auxiliary gauges for voltage, fuel consumption, and transmission temperature are mounted below the center console and feature satin silver-finished bezels. The digital odometer indicates 3,300 miles.
The 5.3-liter Vortec 5300 V8 wears an SSR-branded engine cover and was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 335 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed and the battery was replaced in March 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to Bergey’s Chevrolet in Colmar, Pennsylvania, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total vehicle price of $46,150. Manufacturer’s literature and a recent service record are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2001 Mercedes-Benz G500 is a short-wheelbase cabriolet that was imported to the US by Europa International of Santa Fe, New Mexico, and has since been registered in New York. The truck is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 linked with a five-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and locking front, center, and rear differentials. It is finished in Tectite Gray Metallic over gray leather, and equipment includes a black convertible top, fog lights, running boards, 18″ five-spoke AMG wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, heated rear seats, cruise control, an AM/FM stereo, and air conditioning. This W463 G500 shows 46k miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, and a clean New York title in the current owner’s name.

The truck is finished in Tectite Gray Metallic and features fog lights, running boards, and a retractable black convertible top. One of the securing knobs at the bottom of the rear window is missing, and stone chips are noted on the leading edges. There are three chips in the windshield.

G55-sourced 18″ five-spoke AMG wheels are mounted with older 285/55 Yokohama tires that show cracking, and a covered spare is housed on the tailgate. Stopping power is provided by ventilated front and solid rear discs.

The cabin houses heated power-adjustable front seats and a rear bench upholstered in gray leather that extends to the door panels. Other interior details include heated rear seats, cruise control, an AM/FM stereo, and air conditioning. Wear is noted on the driver’s seat outer bolsters, and there is a dent in the roll bar.

The four-spoke leather- and wood-rimmed steering wheel fronts a 150-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and a fuel-level gauge The digital odometer indicates 46k miles. There are dead pixels in the dash display.
The 5.0-liter M113 V8 was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to all four wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and locking front, center, and rear differentials.
The window sticker lists factory equipment and a total suggested retail price of $135,000.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage.

This 1982 Toyota Land Cruiser FJ40 has spent time in California and New York and was refurbished by TLC 4×4 in Los Angeles, California, circa 2000. Acquired by the current owner in 2020, the truck is powered by a 4.2-liter 2F inline-six linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. It is finished in Khaki with a removable hardtop and a white roof over black upholstery and features 15″ steel wheels with polished hubcaps, manually locking front hubs, power steering, Old Man Emu suspension, air conditioning, and rear jump seats. This FJ40 shows 147k miles and is now offered with an owner’s manual and a clean New York title.

The truck was reportedly repainted Khaki during the aforementioned refurbishment in 2000. Driving lights have been added up front, and additional features include a removable hardtop with a white roof along with side mirrors, rear ambulance-style doors, and a rear-mounted spare tire.

The 15″ steel wheels feature polished hubcaps and are mounted with 31×10.5″ BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A K02 tires. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs and power steering. Braking is from front discs and rear drums. Old Man Emu suspension components have been added.

The interior features front bucket seats and inward-facing rear jump seats retrimmed in black upholstery. Textured black paint has been applied to the floors, and a Tuffy locking center console houses an Alpine CD stereo linked with replacement speakers. Additional equipment includes air conditioning, a dash pad, and manual wind-up windows.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer as well as gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, amperage, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 147k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.
The 4.2-liter 2F inline-six is equipped with a single carburetor.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Additional underside photos are viewable in the image gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in California and New York from the first entry in 1993.

This 2005 Chevrolet Silverado 2500HD LT 4×4 pickup is powered by a 6.6-liter Duramax turbodiesel V8 linked with a five-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck remained registered with the original owner until 2024 and now has 58k miles. It is finished in Sport Red Metallic over Graphite leather, and features include fog lights, a receiver hitch, 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, heated power-adjustable front bucket seats, a rear bench, a Bose sound system, a rear-seat entertainment system, cruise control, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This GMT800 Silverado is now offered in Wisconsin by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The truck is finished in Sport Red Metallic and features a Leer bed topper, fog lights, side steps, a receiver hitch, cab lights, 4×4 bedside graphics, and chrome-finished bumpers. The tailgate is scratched and additional blemishes and scratches around the body are shown in the gallery below.

The 16″ five-spoke eight-lug alloy wheels are mounted with 245/75 Michelin LTX tires. Stopping power is provided by front and rear disc brakes. A wheel speed sensor was replaced by the selling dealer.

The Crew Cab features heated power-adjustable front bucket seats upholstered in Graphite leather. Interior appointments include a Bose sound system, a rear-seat entertainment system, cruise control, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 120-mph speedometer, a 5k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, voltage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 58k miles.
The 6.6-liter Duramax turbodiesel V8 was factory rated at 310 horsepower and 605 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through an Allison five-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1991 BMW 850i is powered by a 5.0-liter V12 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Alpine White over Light Silver Gray leather upholstery. The car is equipped with 18″ Style 37 M Parallel wheels, a power-operated sunroof, fog lights, a CD stereo, dual-zone automatic climate control, heated power-adjustable front seats, and cruise control. The car was initially registered in Hawaii and spent time in Nevada and California prior to the seller’s acquisition in 2023. This E31 has 68k miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the current owner’s name.

The pillarless coupe’s exterior is finished in Alpine White and features pop-up headlights, fog lights, a power-operated sunroof, and black bodyside trim. The hood was refinished under previous ownership. The left side mirror cap and rocker panel have paint chips.

Staggered-width 18″ Style 37 M Parallel wheels are mounted with Fortune Viento Fsr702 tires that show 2024 date codes and measure 225/40 up front and 255/40 at the rear. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. The car is equipped with Electronic Damping Control. In 2024 the brake fluid and power steering fluid were changed and the shocks, struts, front sway bar end links, front lower control arms, rear lower ball joints, rear trailing arm bushings, rear upper control arms, and rear ball joints were replaced. The wheels show curb rash and the power steering box leaks.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats trimmed in Light Silver Gray leather along with matching door panels and carpets. Equipment includes an onboard computer, dual-zone automatic climate control, a CD stereo, a trunk-mounted CD changer, a mobile phone, driver position memory, and a power-adjustable steering column.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 190-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 68k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.0-liter M70B50 V12 was factory rated at 296 horsepower and 332 lb-ft of torque. The intake manifold gaskets and oxygen sensors were replaced in April 2018 and in 2024 the spark plugs, water pump, battery, and valve stem oil seals were replaced and an oil change and coolant flush were performed.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission. In 2018 the transmission fluid, transmission output shaft seal, and transmission pan gasket were replaced.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2001 Aston Martin DB7 V12 Vantage coupe is finished in Pentland Green over Saddle Tan leather and is powered by a 5.9-liter V12 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Features include 18″ 10-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, dual-zone climate control, and an Alpine stereo hooked to an Alpine amplifier. The car has spent time in Pennsylvania, Virginia, and South Carolina where the seller purchased it in late 2023, and they have since added approximately 300 of the under 53k indicated miles. This DB7 is now offered with a maintenance summary, a car cover, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean South Carolina title in the seller’s name.
The car is finished in Pentland Green and features fender vents, a power antenna, and integrated dual exhaust outlets. The door handle assemblies were replaced in January 2020.

Silver-finished 18″ 10-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DWS Tuned tires measuring 245/40 up front and 265/35 out back. The right-rear wheel has curb marks. Stopping power is provided by black Aston Martin-branded calipers over cross-drilled discs at each corner.

The heated power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Saddle Tan leather with green piping complemented by green carpets. Wood veneers accent the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and interior amenities include dual-zone climate control and an Alpine stereo hooked to an Alpine amplifier mounted in the trunk. The left window motor and regulator were repaired in January 2020 and the air-conditioning system was recharged in January 2024.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features shift buttons and frames a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates under 53k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.9-liter V12 was factory rated at 420 horsepower and 400 lb-ft of torque.  The throttle bodies were cleaned in January 2020, the battery was replaced in July 2023, and the oil was changed in January 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2005 Porsche Cayenne Turbo is finished in Crystal Silver Metallic over black leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.5-liter V8 paired with a six-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission. The vehicle remained registered in California until 2024 and now has 52k miles. Equipment includes all-wheel drive, bi-xenon headlights, ParkAssist, 22″ TechArt wheels, Porsche Entry and Drive, heated power-adjustable front seats, heated rear seats, a Bose sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and PCM with navigation. This Cayenne Turbo is now offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual and a clean California title.

The vehicle is finished in Crystal Silver Metallic with black trim and features a sunroof, bi-xenon headlights, a receiver hitch, front and rear parking sensors, roof cross bars, a rear window wiper, and quadruple exhaust finishers. The Carfax report notes that the rear of the vehicle sustained “minor damage” in October 2019 with no additional information provided.

Gray 22″ TechArt Formula wheels are mounted with 285/35 Toyo Proxes ST III tires. The left-front wheel has blemishes. Equipment includes an air suspension and Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), and stopping power is from red Porsche-branded calipers over ventilated rotors at each corner. The Carfax report notes front brake pad and sensor replacement in February 2024.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats and a heated rear bench upholstered in black leather along with a color-coordinated dashboard, door panels, and carpets. Amenities include Porsche Entry and Drive, a Bose sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, rubber floor mats, front seat-position memory settings, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation. The driver’s door is missing the Bose speaker grille emblem.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features shifter switches and frames a 180-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,400-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, fuel level, and boost pressure. The digital odometer indicates 52k miles.
The twin-turbocharged 4.5-liter V8 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 457 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to all four wheels through a six-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a variable center differential.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned damage entry and at least one recall.

This 2002 BMW 330Ci convertible has been registered in Florida from new, and it was specified in Gray Green Metallic over Sand Montana leather. Power is supplied by a 3.0-liter M54 inline-six paired with a five-speed automatic transmission, and equipment includes the Sport Package, 18″ Style 71 wheels, a black convertible soft top, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 convertible has 101k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a Florida title.

The car is finished in Gray Green Metallic and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets. The Carfax report shows that an accident occurred in February 2006. The seller states that the right front fender was repainted in preparation for the sale.

The 18″ Style 71 wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich tires. The car is equipped with the sport suspension as well as Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) and All Season Traction (AST). Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in Sand Montana leather. Amenities include seat-position memory for the driver as well as woodgrain trim, a Harman Kardon sound system, an alarm system, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The center console is damaged, the storage bin lid is missing, and the driver’s master window switch does not work.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer, a tachometer with an inset fuel economy gauge, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 101k miles, approximately 600 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.0-liter M54B30 inline-six was factory rated at 225 horsepower and 214 lb-ft of torque. The PCV valve and the coolant reservoir were replaced in April 2018, and the oil was changed in January 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident.
The Florida title is listed as a duplicate.

This 2002 BMW M5 is powered by a 4.9-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Caramel Nappa leather upholstery. Indicating 64k miles, the car is equipped with 18″ Style 65 wheels, a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, heated power-adjustable front seats, an M Audio system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and navigation. It was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023, and work performed in preparation for the sale included replacing the clutch, flywheel, spark plugs, fuel filter, air filter, valve cover gaskets, and upper and lower control arms. This E39 M5 is now offered in Wisconsin with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic with Shadowline trim and features xenon headlights with washers, fog lamps, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, rain-sensing wipers, and quad exhaust outlets.

Chrome Shadow 18″ Style 65 wheels are fitted with Firestone Firehawk tires that were reportedly mounted in preparation for the sale. The car features Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) with All Season Traction, and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs measuring 13.6″ and 12.9″ front and rear, respectively. Work in 2024 has included replacing the upper and lower control arms.

The cabin features Caramel Nappa leather covering the heated power-adjustable front sport seats, door panel inserts, center console, and lower dashboard, while burl walnut wood accents the upper dashboard, center console, and upper doors. Amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, an M Audio system, and navigation.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts an M-branded 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 64k miles, approximately 600 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 4.9-liter S62 V8 is equipped with individual throttle bodies and double-VANOS continuously variable valve timing. It was factory rated at 394 horsepower at 6,600 rpm and 369 lb-ft of torque at 3,800 rpm. The oil was changed and the spark plugs, valve cover gaskets, fuel filter, and air filter were replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Getrag six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The clutch and flywheel were replaced in June 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1969 BMW R69US was purchased new by the seller’s father, who took delivery of the bike in Germany and toured Europe on it for three weeks before shipping it to the US. The bike was reportedly stored from 1992 until 2018, at which time ownership transferred to the seller. Finished in Avus Black, the motorcycle is powered by a 594cc opposed twin paired with a four-speed gearbox. Equipment includes 18″ alloy rims, drum brakes, a conventional telescopic fork, preload-adjustable shocks, dual Bing carburetors, and a driveshaft along with a Schorsch Meier two-up seat, a chrome cross-braced handlebar, bar-end turn signals, and both center and side stands. This R69US is now offered with a pair of panniers, a shop manual, parts receipts, and a clean Wyoming title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in Avus Black with double white pinstripes on the fenders and the fuel tank, which is equipped with black rubber knee grips, enameled roundels, and a topside storage compartment. Features include a Denfeld Schorsch Meier two-up seat upholstered in white-piped black vinyl in addition to bar-end turn signals, a left-side bar-mounted mirror, a frame-mounted air pump, and both center and side stands. Rust on the left side of the rear fender is noted by the seller.

Wire-spoke 18″ wheels with shouldered alloy rims and drum-brake hubs wear older Metzler tires, and the rear inner tube was replaced in 2024. Suspension is provided by a conventional telescopic fork as well as preload-adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm on the left and the final-drive housing on the right.

Instrumentation ahead of the chrome cross-braced handlebar consists of a VDO 120-mph speedometer and a pair of indicator lights. The five-digit odometer shows 3k miles, approximately 250 of which were ridden under current ownership. The horn button’s movement is restricted, the left turn signal works intermittently, and the lights do not work properly until the bike has been running for a while.

The 594cc opposed twin features dual Bing carburetors and was factory rated at 42 horsepower. The carburetors were overhauled in 2019, and the throttle cable and fuel line were replaced at that time. The carburetor seals are said to drip temporarily following longer periods of non-use. Scrapes on the right-side valve cover are depicted in the gallery.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a four-speed transmission as well as a driveshaft enclosed within the right leg of the swingarm.
The headstock plate indicates that this bike is an R69US with serial number 665622, and the matching numbers stamped on the frame and the engine case can be viewed in the gallery.
A pair of removable leather panniers is included in the sale.

This 1968 Mazda Cosmo is a Japanese-market example, and one of 833 Series II examples produced between July 1968 and September 1972. It remained in Japan until 2006, and it was purchased by the current owner in 2013 and subsequently featured in a collection. The car is finished in white over black vinyl upholstery with houndstooth cloth seat inserts, and power comes from a 982cc 10A twin-rotor engine paired with a five-speed manual transmission. Features include a Hitachi four-barrel carburetor, power-assisted front disc brakes, 15″ steel wheels, fender-mounted mirrors, air conditioning, a Clarion push-button AM radio, and a wood-rimmed steering wheel. This L10B Cosmo is now offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a Texas title in the owner’s name.

The Cosmo was developed as a halo vehicle for Mazda and was introduced at the Tokyo Motor Show ahead of the 1964 Tokyo Summer Olympics. It entered production in May 1967, with all units being built by hand at Mazda’s Hiroshima factory. The Series II Cosmo debuted in 1968, and featured a wheelbase increased by 15cm as well as 15″ wheels, a revised front end, a more powerful engine, and a five-speed manual transmission. This example is finished in white and features chrome bumpers and trim, covered headlights, fender-mounted mirrors, and a dual-exit exhaust that exits through the rear valance.

Painted steel 15″ wheels wear chrome center caps with blue Mazda rotary badges, and they are mounted with 165/80 Bridgestone Sneaker tires. A spare wheel is stowed beneath the trunk floor. The front suspension features a conventional control-arm configuration with coil springs and an anti-roll bar, while a leaf-sprung de Dion axle is equipped out back. Braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The right-hand-drive cabin features bucket seats trimmed in black vinyl with houndstooth cloth inserts. Red carpets line the floors, and amenities include air conditioning, a Clarion push-button AM radio, a wooden gearshift knob, three-point seat belts, and storage pockets on the seatbacks.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel is mounted on an adjustable column ahead of a 250-km/h speedometer, a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline, and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 20k kilometers (~13k miles), approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.

The 982cc 10A twin-rotor engine was revised for the Series II Cosmo and features two spark plugs per chamber as well as dual distributors and a single Hitachi four-barrel carburetor. Output was factory rated at 128 horsepower, an 18-horsepower increase over Series I cars.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transmission.

This 1975 Honda CB360T is said to have spent time as part of indoor collections in both Pennsylvania and North Carolina before it was acquired by the seller in 2020, and it now shows 9k miles. Finished in Light Ruby Red with black and white stripes, the bike is powered by a 356cc SOHC parallel twin paired with a six-speed transmission. It is also equipped with a kick starter, an electric starter, a chrome-finished two-into-two exhaust system, a front disc brake, 18″ wire-spoke wheels, chrome fenders, a two-up seat, and both center and side stands. The dual Keihin carburetors were reportedly rebuilt in 2015, while work in 2023 is said to have included servicing the oiling and ignition systems. This CB360T is offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, a tool kit, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in Light Ruby Red, and black and white stripes accent the 2.9-gallon fuel tank. Additional details include dual mirrors, chrome-finished fenders, a black vinyl-upholstered two-up seat with a passenger grab strap, and both center and side stands.

Wire-spoke 18″ wheels are mounted with IRC Grand High Speed tires. Suspension consists of a telescopic fork in addition to dual shocks connected to the swingarm. Braking is handled by a front disc and a rear drum.

The chrome handlebar is mounted aft of Nippon Seiki instrumentation consisting of a 110-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 9,200-rpm redline, while a bank of indicator lights is located between the gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 9k miles.

The 356cc SOHC parallel twin features a kick starter, an electric starter, replacement air cleaners, and a chrome-finished two-into-two exhaust system. Factory-rated output was 34 horsepower. The seller states that the dual Keihin carburetors were rebuilt in 2015 and that replacement engine case cover fasteners were sourced from David Silver Spares. Work in 2023 is said to have included changing the battery and fluids, cleaning the oiling system and fitting replacement gaskets and O-rings, adjusting the ignition timing and timing chain tension, and changing the battery, ignition points, spark plugs, and fluids.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a six-speed transmission and a drive chain.
An owner’s manual and a tool kit will accompany the motorcycle.

This 1974 Ford Bronco Explorer has been cosmetically and mechanically refurbished, which included repainting the exterior Brook Blue and refreshing the interior with blue vinyl and houndstooth cloth upholstery, replacement carpets and door panels, a RetroSound stereo, and an aftermarket air conditioning system. The 302ci V8 was fitted with an Edelbrock carburetor and intake manifold, and the three-speed automatic transmission was overhauled. Additional work included replacing braking, suspension, and exhaust components as well as the valve lifters, pushrods, timing chain, oil pump, fuel sending unit, fuel pump, water pump, and starter. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2022, the truck now shows 58k miles, and it is offered in New York with a Deluxe Marti report and a clean California title.

During the refurbishment, the body was removed from the frame, the trim, window felts, window seals, and exterior lights were replaced, and the truck was repainted Brook Blue. Equipment includes a white removable hardtop, a rear-mounted spare tire, and chrome bumpers.

The 15″ wheels were powder-coated and mounted with 33×10.5″ BFGoodrich tires during the build, which also reportedly included replacing the brake drums and shoes as well as the shocks, springs, and steering stabilizer.

The front bucket seats were reupholstered in blue vinyl with houndstooth inserts during the refurbishment, which also included replacing the carpets, door panels, and headliner. Amenities include a RetroSound stereo, an aftermarket air conditioning system, and an Explorer badge on the glove box.

The steering wheel wears an aftermarket cover and fonts a 100-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges for amperage, fuel level, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer shows 58k miles.

The 302ci V8 is equipped with an Edelbrock intake manifold and carburetor. The valve lifters, pushrods, timing chain, oil pump, fuel sending unit, fuel pump, water pump, and starter are said to have been replaced and an aftermarket exhaust system was reportedly installed during the build.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels via a three-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The selling dealer states the transmission was overhauled and the frame was sand-blasted and repainted during the refurbishment.
The Deluxe Marti report lists factory equipment and production information as well as a build date of March 6, 1974.
Photos taken during the refurbishment are provided in the gallery.

This 1976 Chevrolet K10 4×4 pickup was acquired by its late owner in 1986 and subsequently modified to resemble a GMC and fitted with a 502ci V8 that is backed by a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is finished in black over red cloth and vinyl, and features include a receiver hitch, a sliding rear window, manually locking front hubs, power steering, 15″ wheels, and 33″ tires. This K1500 is now offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of an estate with a clean Maryland title in the name of the late owner.
The truck was refinished in black in the 1990s and is equipped with a receiver hitch, a sliding rear window, chrome bumpers, and GMC badging.

The 15″ wheels are mounted with 33×12.5″ BFGoodrich Radial All-Terrain T/A tires. The truck is equipped with power steering and manually locking front hubs. Braking is provided by front discs and rear drums.
The cabin houses a bench seat upholstered in red cloth and vinyl. Woodgrain trim accents the dashboard. The headliner is loose. The radio and components for the air conditioning have been removed.
The two-spoke GMC-branded steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 11k miles, and total mileage is unknown.
The seller notes that the 502ci V8 was installed in the 1990s. It is equipped with an Edelbrock intake manifold and tube-style headers feeding a dual exhaust system.
Power is routed to all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. A 12-bolt rear end with a welded-on brace is fitted.
The truck is being offered on behalf of an estate.

This 1966 Ford Mustang coupe was refurbished under previous ownership and is finished in Emberglo over Emberglo and Parchment vinyl. The car is powered by an A-code 289ci V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission, and features include a Pony-style interior, 14″ styled steel wheels, front disc brakes, a vinyl roof, chrome bumpers, GT badging, fog lights, front bucket seats, a Custom AutoSound stereo, Magnaflow mufflers, and a cabin heater. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2023, and subsequent work included balancing the driveshaft, replacing the U-joints, and changing fluids. This Mustang is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual and a clean Washington title.

The car was factory-finished in Emberglo and refinished under previous ownership. Additional work included rechroming the bumpers and adding a white vinyl roof. Features include lower-body stripes, a vinyl roof, fog lights, GT badging, chrome bumpers, and dual exhaust outlets that exit through the rear fascia. Close-up photos of the exterior are shown in the gallery.

The 14″ styled steel wheels are mounted with 215/70 Goodyear Regatta 2 tires. The car is equipped with power steering and KYB shocks and braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench reupholstered in Emberglo and Parchment vinyl along with pony backrest embossing. The door panels and carpeting were also replaced. Woodgrain trim accents the dashboard and center console, and amenities include a cabin heater, lap belts, and a Custom AutoSound stereo. Wear is noted on the seat belts and center console.

Instrumentation consists of a 140-mph speedometer, a column-mounted tachometer and clock, and gauges for fuel level, oil pressure, amperage, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 43k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The 289ci V8 was factory rated at 225 horsepower. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a C4 three-speed automatic transmission. The driveshaft was balanced and the U-joints were replaced under current ownership, and the transmission and rear differential fluids were changed. A dual exhaust system with Magnaflow mufflers is fitted, and the underside is coated.
The warranty number is consistent with a 1966 Mustang coupe that was built in San Jose, California and equipped with a 289ci V8. Decoding the trim tag reveals the following information:

This 2015 McLaren 650S Spider is finished in Mantis Green over black Alcantara upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Equipment includes a power-retractable hardtop, 19″ and 20″ forged wheels, LED headlights, carbon-ceramic brakes, a vehicle lift system, an active rear spoiler, parking sensors, heated power-adjustable seats, a Meridian sound system, touchscreen infotainment, and automatic climate control. The current owner purchased the car in 2020 and has since added approximately 14k of the 47k miles. This 650S is now offered in Arizona on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean Washington title.

The 650S utilizes a carbon-fiber chassis and an aluminum rear subframe. This example is finished in Mantis Green with a carbon-fiber front splitter, rocker accents, side intakes, and rear bumper insert. Additional exterior details include LED lighting, a power-retractable hardtop, dihedral doors, front and rear parking sensors, and an active rear wing that doubles as an air brake. Blemishes in the front splitter are shown up close in photos below.

Stealth-finished 19″ and 20″ five-spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. The vehicle is equipped with an optional vehicle lift system as well as McLaren’s ProActive chassis control, which features Normal, Sport, and Track driving modes. Stopping power is provided by green-finished McLaren-branded calipers over cross-drilled carbon-ceramic discs.

The heated power-adjustable bucket seats have McLaren logos embroidered on the headrests and are upholstered in black Alcantara that extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior amenities include seat-position memory, push-button start, a Meridian sound system, a rear-view camera, a vertically oriented touchscreen with navigation, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features carbon-fiber trim and fronts a central 9k-rpm tachometer with an inset digital speedometer flanked by two digital displays. The digital odometer indicates 47k miles, approximately 14k of which were added under current ownership.
The twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 was factory rated at 641 horsepower and 500 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera 4 cabriolet remained under the care of its previous owner for approximately twenty-three years, and it now shows 35k miles. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Black over black leather. Features include a replacement black soft top, 17″ Cup II wheels, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front seats, supple seat inserts, a remote six-disc CD changer, a Hi-Fi sound system, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 993 C4 cabriolet is offered by the selling dealer with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, an air compressor, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

The car is finished in Black (L741) and features a replacement power-retractable black soft top as well as xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, heated power-adjustable mirrors, black rear bumperettes, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler with an integrated third brake light, and dual polished exhaust outlets. Paint imperfections are shown in detail in the gallery.

Silver-finished 17″ Cup II wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The car features an Automatic Brake Differential (ABD), and the 993 was the first 911 to feature multi-link rear suspension. Braking is handled by silver-finished Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in black leather with supple inserts, and additional amenities include eight-way power-adjustable front seats, a Hi-Fi sound system, a Becker Porsche CR-1 cassette stereo, a remote six-disc CD changer, cruise control, and air conditioning. Damage to the center console trim is shown up close in the gallery.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, a Quarz analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 35k miles.
The air-cooled 3.6L flat-six was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 243 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Cherry Hill Imports in New Jersey, along with standard equipment, options, and a total price of $81,251.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1983 Toyota Land Cruiser FJ45 pickup was acquired out of Venezuela by the current owner in 2023 before it was relocated to Colombia and later imported to the US in December 2023. Power is provided by a 4.2-liter 2F inline-six linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Work since 2023 has involved refinishing the truck in blue and replacing the bed, fuel tank, 15″ wheels, and tires. It is also equipped with power steering, four-wheel disc brakes, a front winch, air conditioning, and a CD stereo. This FJ45 pickup was listed on BaT in March 2023 and is now offered again by the seller on behalf of the owner with a clean Florida title in the name of the owner’s business.

The seller reports that the truck was refinished in its current shade of blue in 2023 and that the bed was replaced at that time. A Rough Country front winch is fitted along with a drop-down tailgate and a revised front bumper.
Steel 15″ wheels wear hubcaps and are mounted with 31×10.5″ Teraclaw tires. The truck is equipped with power steering and four-wheel disc brakes.
The cab houses split front seats trimmed in gray upholstery. Equipment includes air conditioning, a dash pad, and a CD stereo.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-km/h speedometer as well as gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, amperage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 105k kilometers (~65k miles), approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.

The 4.2-liter 2F inline-six was factory rated at 125 horsepower and is equipped with an aluminum radiator. The engine is said to have been refreshed in 2020 under prior ownership, and the fuel tank was replaced following the seller’s acquisition.
Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
Photos of the refurbishment in progress are shown in the gallery below.

This 1993 Mercedes-Benz 500E has remained registered in New York since new and now shows 95k miles. It is powered by a 5.0-liter M119 V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Black Pearl Metallic over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ eight-hole alloy wheels, a power sunroof, fog lights, Automatic Slip Control, automatic climate control, a Continental head unit with Bluetooth connectivity, heated power-adjustable front seats, and cruise control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this W124 500E is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean New York title.

The 500E was assembled by Porsche and featured wheel arch flares, revised bodywork, and a lower ride height when compared to other W124 models. This example is finished in Black Pearl Metallic (199) and features gray lower cladding. Additional exterior features include headlights with washers and wipers, integrated fog lights, a retractable antenna, an aftermarket rear wing, and a power sunroof. Photographs of paint-meter readings are presented in the gallery.
Silver 16″ eight-hole alloy wheels are mounted with Yokohama Avid Ascend GT tires. The car is equipped with Automatic Slip Control (ASR). Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in black leather along with a color-coordinated lower dashboard, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include automatic climate control, driver’s seat position memory, a Continental head unit with Bluetooth connectivity, a power-adjustable steering column, dual front airbags, and cruise control.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 95k miles.
The 5.0-liter M119 DOHC V8 was factory-rated at 322 horsepower and 354 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage from its first entry in January 1998.

This 2000 Ducati Monster 750 Dark was purchased by the seller on BaT in February 2023 and now shows 689 miles. The bike is finished in black over a black trellis frame and is powered by an air-cooled 748cc L-twin mated to a five-speed transmission. Equipment includes a desmodromic valvetrain, a two-into-two exhaust system, and Brembo wheels and brake calipers as well as an inverted Showa fork, a Sachs-Boge monoshock, an electric starter, a stepped two-up seat, and a side stand. Service since 2023 is said to have included replacing the tires, battery, clutch discs, brake pads, chain, and sprockets in addition to revalving the rear shock, rebuilding the suspension, and installing LED lighting, Motogadget mo.View mirrors, and transparent belt covers. This Monster Dark is now offered at no reserve with a tool kit, removed parts, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in satin black over a gloss black steel trellis frame. Features include a 4.4-gallon fuel tank, Motogadget mo.Blaze LED turn signals, a Revival Secret LED headlight, Motogadget mo.View Classic mirrors, and a stepped two-up sport seat complemented by dual grab rails and folding passenger foot pegs. The side stand has been repainted, and there a touched-up scratch on the left front section of the fuel tank. Other scratches are noted.

Black-finished 17″ Brembo three-spoke wheels were mounted with Michelin Road 6 tires under current ownership. Suspension is handled by an inverted 43mm Showa front fork as well as a box-section swingarm connected to a a revalved adjustable Sachs-Boge monoshock via a progressive linkage. The suspension has reportedly been rebuilt and sprung for a 220-lb rider. Braking is from gold-finished Brembo calipers mounted over drilled rotors at both ends. The seller states that the brake pads and fluid were changed since their purchase.

The chrome low-rise handlebar bearing dual mirrors fronts instrumentation consisting of a 140-mph speedometer, a bank of warning lamps, and a five-digit odometer showing 689 miles. Discoloration is visible on the upper handlebar clamp. The seller has removed the turn signal indicator bulb from the gauge cluster, and, when using the left turn signal, the four-way flashers illuminate.

The two-valve 748cc L-twin is equipped with a desmodromic valvetrain, an electric starter, and a pair of low-mounted upswept mufflers bearing Ducati ZDM-A13/-B13 stamps. The dual Mikuni carburetors were reportedly cleaned and performance jetted in 2017. Equipment is said to include an Antigravity lithium battery, an Oberon clutch slave cylinder, a fuel filter with quick-release fittings, and a manual-valve fuel petcock. Work since 2023 reportedly includes replacing the belts, pulleys, spark plugs, oil and filter, clutch discs, clutch master cylinder, both sprockets, and the air filter. The belt covers have been replaced with transparent units, and stainless-steel engine fasteners have been installed. The charcoal canister has been removed.
Power is sent to the rear wheel through a multi-plate wet clutch, a five-speed transmission, and a replacement drive chain.
The motorcycle will be accompanied by a tool kit, removed parts, and a service manual.

This 2019 Porsche 911 GT3 RS is a Canadian-market example that was purchased by the seller in 2020 after being registered in Ontario, Canada, and now has 7k miles. Finished in Guards Red with black graphics over black leather and Alcantara upholstery, it is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle. The car has a front tow hook, Schroth racing harnesses, Rennline aluminum track mats, 20″ and 21″ center-lock alloy wheels, a front-axle lift system, LED headlights with PDLS, a rear spoiler, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, PCM with navigation, a GMG Racing roll cage, and Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus. This 991.2 GT3 RS is now offered in Georgia with the owner’s manual, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.

Developed as a track-focused variant of the GT3, the RS is equipped with a magnesium roof panel, aluminum doors, a rear wing, and a carbon-fiber trunk lid, engine cover, and front fenders. This example is finished in Guards Red with black graphics, and additional details include LED headlights, lightweight glass, a front tow hook, center exhaust outlets, and LED taillights with PDLS. Blemishes are located near the right air intake, left rocker panel, passenger door, and both rear quarter panels. The front splitter was replaced following initial photos, photos of the replacement splitter can be seen in the gallery below.

The 20″ front and 21″ rear center-lock alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 265/35 up front and 325/30 at the rear. Braking is handled by red Porsche-branded calipers over dimpled and ventilated rotors, and the car is equipped with a front-axle lift system. Standard GT3 RS equipment included rear-axle steering, Porsche Active Suspension Management, and Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus. Curb damage is present on the left-front wheel.

The cabin houses carbon-fiber full bucket seats trimmed in black leather with Alcantara inserts, GT3 RS-embroidered headrests, and color-contrasting stitching, which extends to the center console and door panels. Rennline aluminum track mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include Schroth racing harnesses, a GMG Racing roll cage, aluminum pedals, red trim, Porsche Communication Management (PCM), navigation, and cruise control. Scuffs and blemishes are noted on the door jambs.

The three-spoke Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel frames a central GT3 RS-branded tachometer as well as a 350-km/h speedometer, an LCD screen, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles, approximately 800 of which were added under current ownership.
The 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 520 horsepower and 346 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other damage.
listing_details: Carbon-Fiber Full Bucket Seats w/Schroth Racing Harnesses

description: This 2000 BMW R1200C is finished in black and is powered by a 1,170cc opposed twin that routes power through a five-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft. Features include 19″ front and 17″ rear wire-spoke wheels, a black solo seat, a windscreen, a rear luggage rack, a Telelever front end, triple anti-lock disc brakes, Bosch electronic fuel injection, and a dual exhaust system as well as a side stand. This R1200C was purchased by the seller in 2023 and is now offered at no reserve with a tool kit, a Clymer manual, a battery tender, and a Vermont title in the seller’s name.

The bike is finished in black, and features include a black solo seat with a passenger pillion that folds into a backrest as well as a clear Aeroflow windscreen wth leg splash guards, chrome engine guards, folding passenger foot pegs, side mirrors, a 4.5-gallon fuel tank, a rear luggage rack, a pair of DrySpec saddlebags, and a side stand.

The 19″ front and 17″ rear wire-spoke wheels are mounted with older tires. Suspension consists of a Telelever front end as well as a single-sided Paralever swingarm with a monoshock. Anti-lock braking is provided by multi-piston calipers fitted over a pair of rotors up front and a single disc out back. Corrosion is noted on the wheels and the fork.

The chrome pullback handlebar is secured aft of instrumentation consisting of a 130-mph speedometer with inset warning indicators as well as a bank of additional indicator lights. An analog clock is attached to the bike near the top triple clamp. The six-digit odometer shows 12k miles, approximately two of which have been ridden under current ownership. The seller states the speedometer was replaced under prior ownership at around 6k miles, and total mileage is unknown.

The 1,170cc opposed twin features Bosch Motronic electronic fuel injection, a dual exhaust system, twin external oil coolers, four valves per cylinder, oil-cooled cylinder heads, and an electric starter. The seller states the oil was changed in preparation for sale.
Power is routed to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and an enclosed driveshaft.
A Clymer service manual, a tool kit, a battery tender, a spare air filter, and a pair of DrySpec saddlebags are included in the sale.
The Vermont title carries classic and replaced brands.

This 1993 Chevrolet Corvette convertible was previously listed on BaT in July 2023, and it was imported to Canada in August 2023. It is powered by a 5.7-liter LT1 V8 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Competition Yellow over white leather. Equipment includes 17″ Sawblade alloy wheels, a limited-slip differential, a white convertible soft top, fog lights, a Delco-Bose sound system, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This C4 convertible has 25k miles, and it is now offered in Canada with the owner’s manual, service manuals, a clean Carfax report, and British Columbia registration.

The car is finished in Competition Yellow and features a white convertible soft top, pop-up headlights, integrated fog lights, a Corvette-branded front plate cover, quad tail lights, and dual polished exhaust outlets. A repair to the fiberglass behind the front-left wheel was performed prior to the area being refinished.

The 17″ Sawblade alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport+ tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. The directional wheels are mounted backwards.

The cabin features power-adjustable sport bucket seats trimmed in white leather with 40th Anniversary logos embroidered on the headrests, and they are joined by a black dashboard, center console, and carpets. Amenities include a Delco-Bose sound system, a CD/cassette stereo, automatic climate control, a digital clock, and cruise control.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central digital speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and battery voltage. The digital odometer indicates 25k miles.
The 5.7-liter LT1 V8 features multi-port fuel injection and was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 340 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a ZF six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The vehicle is being sold on its registration, which serves as the ownership document in British Columbia, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 2016 Audi Allroad Quattro Premium Plus was ordered with the Technology and Sport packages, and it has been registered in California from new through the selling dealer’s recent acquisition. Finished in black over black leather, the car is powered by a turbocharged 2.0-liter inline-four that drives all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. It also features a dual-pane sunroof, a rear window wiper, a power-operated liftgate, roof rails, power-folding heated mirrors, xenon headlights, fog lights, 18″ five-arm-Allroad alloy wheels, a black cloth headliner, Audi Drive Select, three-zone automatic climate control, an Audi MMI infotainment system with navigation, and a Bang & Olufsen sound system as well as heated and power-adjustable front sport seats. This B8 Allroad Quattro indicates 86k miles and is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a California title.

The car is finished in black with silver roof rails and lower-body accents. Additional exterior details include a dual-pane sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, heated and power-folding side mirrors, and rear parking sensors.

Silver-finished 18″ five-arm-Allroad alloy wheels are mounted with 245/45 Kumho Solus Majesty 9 TA91 tires that are said to have been mounted in preparation for the sale. The car rides on a sport-tuned five-link front suspension and trapezoidal-link rear suspension. Anti-lock braking is handled by four-wheel discs with ventilated rotors up front.

The seating surfaces are trimmed in black leather, while woodgrain trim accents the color-coordinated center console. Appointments include three-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, a rearview camera, a black cloth headliner, Audi Drive Select, Audi Advanced Key, Audi MMI Navigation Plus infotainment with a rearview camera, and a Bang & Olufsen sound system along with heated and power-adjustable front sport seats with driver-side position memory settings.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level along with a central driver information display. The digital odometer indicates 86k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.

The turbocharged 2.0-liter TFSI inline-four produced 220 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque when new. Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed Tiptronic automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. An oil change has been carried out in preparation for the sale.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in California.

This 1976 Ford F-250 4×4 pickup has been with one family since new and is finished in purple over tan upholstery. The truck is powered by a 360ci V8 linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case, and additional equipment includes a CVF Racing serpentine belt system, an aluminum radiator, 17″ Vision wheels, a receiver hitch, a spray-on bedliner, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, JVC stereo, and a heater. This F-250 is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a California title in the seller’s name.
The truck has been repainted purple and features a Styleside bed, a chrome front bumper, a receiver hitch, a spray-on bedliner, and side steps. Rust is noted in the bed.
The 17″ Vision wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich Mud-Terrain T/A KM3 tires. Braking is provided by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.
The bench seat is trimmed in tan upholstery. Features include a glovebox-mounted JVC stereo, a heater, and black carpeting.
The wood-rimmed steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and supplementary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 1,300 miles. Total mileage is unknown.
The 360ci V8 features a CVF Racing serpentine belt system and an aluminum radiator.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case.
A stamp of F26YRA81156 is shown on the frame above. The VIN on the California title has a B in place of the 8 in the seventh position.

This 1965 Buick Riviera is powered by a 401ci V8 equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and mated to a three-speed automatic transmission, and it is finished in Regal Black over Saddle vinyl. Equipment includes 15″ Rally wheels, concealed stacked headlights, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, rear bucket seats, power windows, an AM/FM radio, cruise control, and air conditioning. The seller purchased the car in 2021 and the exhaust system and battery were replaced in 2024. This Riviera is now offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, service manuals, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The pillarless hardtop coupe came finished from the factory in Regal Black (A), and exterior equipment includes concealed stacked headlights, a stylized “R” hood ornament, Gran Sport badging, a power antenna, chrome bumpers, and dual exhaust outlets. The seller notes paint shrinkage and states that the left front fender has been repainted. The headlight doors do not open and close properly.

The 15″ Rally wheels are mounted with 225/75 Goodyear tires. A full-size spare is located in the trunk. The car is equipped with power-assisted steering, and braking is handled by power-assisted front and rear drums.

The cabin features front and rear bucket seats upholstered in Saddle vinyl along with matching door panels. Interior appointments include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, power windows, an AM/FM radio, cruise control, and air conditioning.

The two-spoke steering wheel is mounted to a tilting column and frames a 140-mph speedometer, an analog clock, a fuel-level gauge, and warning lights for oil pressure, coolant temperature, and amperage. The five-digit odometer shows 68k miles, approximately 250 of which were added under current ownership.
The 401ci V8 was originally specified with a four-barrel carburetor and was factory rated at 325 horsepower. A replacement battery was installed in 2024.
The engine stamping is viewable above.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission.
Decoding the trim tag reveals the following information:

This 2022 Ford Mustang Shelby GT500 is a Heritage Edition example that was also ordered with the Carbon Fiber Track and Technology packages. It is finished in Brittany Blue Metallic with Wimbledon White painted stripes over Ebony leather and suede and is powered by a supercharged 5.2-liter V8 linked with a Tremec seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential. Features include HID headlights, carbon-fiber 20″ seven-spoke wheels, Brembo brakes, Recaro front seats, a Bang & Olufsen 12-speaker audio system, and SYNC 3 infotainment with navigation.  Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this GT500 Heritage Edition has 8 miles and is now offered in Missouri with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a car cover, and a clean Massachusetts title.

All GT500 Heritage Edition examples were finished in Brittany Blue Metallic with optional Wimbledon White side and painted over-the-top stripes. Exterior features include a louvered hood, HID headlights, heated mirrors, Cobra puddle lamps, a rear wing, and LED taillights with sequential turn signals. The Carbon Fiber Track Pack added front splitter wickers and a manually adjustable carbon-fiber rear wing.

Exposed carbon-fiber 20″ seven-spoke wheels are mounted with 305/30 front and 315/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. The car is equipped with four-wheel independent suspension and a MagneRide damping system. Stopping power is provided by six-piston front and four-piston rear Brembo brake calipers fitted over two-piece ventilated rotors. The Carbon Fiber Track Pack added adjustable strut top mounts.

The Recaro front seats are trimmed in Ebony leather and suede with Dove accents and are complemented by a carbon-fiber instrument panel. The rear seats were deleted as part of the Carbon Fiber Track Pack, and amenities include a SYNC 3 infotainment system with an 8″ touchscreen, dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, and Ford Track Apps. The Technology Package included a 12-speaker Bang & Olufsen sound system, voice-activated navigation, and BLIS blind-spot monitoring. Factory-installed plastic floor protectors line the foot wells.
The passenger-side dashboard plaque identifies this GT500 as chassis N0165.

The Alcantara- and leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features a gray centering stripe and paddle shifters and frames a configurable 12″ LCD instrument panel. Analog oil pressure and oil temperature gauges are mounted in the center stack. The steering wheel center is covered by factory-installed protective plastic. The digital odometer indicates 8 miles.

The hand-assembled 5.2-liter Predator V8 was factory rated at 760 horsepower and 625 lb-ft of torque and features an inverted roots-type supercharger, an air-to-liquid intercooler, and an engine oil cooler as well as a plaque bearing the engraved signature of the engine builder.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission and a Torsen limited-slip differential with 3.73:1 gearing. The car features an active dual exhaust system with quad polished outlets.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to Friendly Ford of Enfield, Connecticut, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total retail price of $114,585. Manufacturer’s literature, a car cover, and a packaged front splitter will accompany the vehicle.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and notes an open recall.

attributes.value: Mustang Shelby GT500 Heritage Edition Carbon Fiber Track Pack

description: This 1999 Porsche 911 Carrera cabriolet was specified in Zenith Blue Metallic over Savannah Beige all-leather, and it was specified with a body-color removable hardtop, power-adjustable front seats, and a remote six-disc CD changer. It is powered by a 3.4-liter M96 flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and further equipment includes a dark blue soft top, a deployable rear spoiler, 18″ Sport Design wheels, a Kenwood infotainment screen with navigation, cruise control, and automatic climate control. The seller purchased the car in June 2022, and it has 61k miles. This 996.1 cabriolet is now offered at no reserve with a service invoice, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Zenith Blue Metallic and is equipped with a color-matched removable hardtop and a dark blue convertible soft top as well as integrated fog lights, a deployable rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers. A cable line on the convertible top was repaired in October 2022. Paint imperfections are noted along with cracked front-end protective film. Photos depicting paint imperfections as well as paint-meter readings are provided in the gallery.

The 18″ Sport Design wheels show signs of curb rash and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires showing date codes from 2021. Braking is handled by four-piston Porsche-branded calipers fitted over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners which are said to have been serviced in October 2023. The front lower control arms and sway bar links were reportedly replaced in May 2024. There is an infrequent rattle originating from the front-left wheel.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in Savannah Beige leather, which are accented by a color-coordinated dashboard and door panels. Amenities include eight-way power-adjustable front seats, driver-seat memory settings, stainless-steel door sill plates, a Kenwood Excelon infotainment screen with navigation, a Hi-Fi sound system, a remote six-disc CD changer, cruise control, and automatic climate control. The right-rear window regulator was replaced in October 2022.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 180-mph speedometer, a central tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 61k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.4-liter M96 flat-six was factory rated at 296 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. The spark plugs were replaced in May 2022.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. The clutch was reportedly replaced in October 2023.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 2003 Mercedes-Benz SL500 shows registration history in Florida since August 2003, and it has 38k miles. It is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic over Charcoal leather. Features include a power-folding hardtop, bi-xenon headlights, 18″ Avior wheels, heated power-adjustable seats, a Bose sound system, and COMAND with navigation. This R230 is now offered by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Brilliant Silver Metallic (744) and features a power-folding convertible hardtop, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, and fender air vents. The front bumper cover was repainted under prior ownership.

The 18″ Avior wheels are mounted with Continental ContiProContact tires. The car features Active Body Control (ABC) suspension as well as an Electronic Stability Program (ESP) and Automatic Slip Control (ASR).

The heated and power-adjustable seats are upholstered in Charcoal leather and feature memory settings. Burl Walnut trim accents the center console and door panels, and additional interior equipment includes dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, and COMAND with navigation.
The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 38k miles.
The 5.0-liter M113 V8 was factory rated at 302 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the R230 SL500 when it was new? Click here to check out their April 2002 Road Test.

This 1991 Nissan 300ZX Twin Turbo is said to have been purchased new by the current owner from Sutherlin Nissan of Atlanta, Georgia, and it now shows 49k miles. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.0-liter V6 that is modified with an HKS boost controller, revised intake piping, high-capacity fuel injectors, and a stage 1 turbo kit, and it rides on Tein suspension components and 18″ Rovos wheels mounted over AP Racing front brakes. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission, and the revised body panels are finished in Aztec Red. Additional details include removable roof panels, JDM-style taillights, charcoal leather cabin upholstery, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, automatic climate control, a Pioneer head unit, and an aftermarket amplifier and subwoofer. This Z32 is now offered on dealer consignment at no reserve a clean Georgia title.

The car is finished in Aztec Red and features removable glass T-top roof panels, a rear spoiler, JDM-style taillights, revised bumper covers, and extended rocker panels. The Carfax report lists an accident in 1998 with “severe” damage noted to the front of the vehicle, and the selling dealer states the incident involved the car hitting a mailbox. The report also indicates an accident in August 2022, which resulted in “minor” damage to multiple areas of the vehicle. Paint-protection film is said to have been applied to the front of the vehicle. Close-up photos of the paint, trim, and imperfections are provided in the gallery.

Silver 18″ Rovos wheels are mounted with staggered-width Michelin Pilot Sport tires with 2020 and 2022 production date codes. The car is equipped with Super HICAS four-wheel steering and Tein suspension components. Stopping power is provided by yellow AP Racing front and factory rear calipers over Stillen rotors.

The two-place cabin features bolstered seats trimmed in charcoal leather along with a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, and door panels. Appointments include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, a Pioneer head unit, a Rockford Fosgate amplifier, a custom subwoofer enclosure, automatic climate control, and cruise control.

The MOMO steering wheel features carbon-fiber trim and frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, turbo boost pressure, oil pressure, and fuel level. An auxiliary boost gauge is mounted to the A-pillar. The six-digit odometer shows 49k miles, nearly all of which were added under current ownership. The windshield washer warning light is illuminated.

The twin-turbocharged 3.0-liter VG30DETT V6 features air-to-air intercoolers and is equipped with a stage 1 turbo kit, revised intake piping, and an aluminum radiator along with an HKS boost controller, high-capacity fuel injectors, and a Stillen stainless-steel exhaust, according to the selling dealer. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. An engine-out service is said to have been performed in 2015, and work in 2022 reportedly included cleaning the throttle bodies, changing the engine oil, and performing coolant and clutch fluid flushes.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accidents in 1998 and 2022.

This 1985 Toyota Pickup XtraCab SR5 was refurbished in preparation for the sale, which included fitting the replacement 2.4-liter 22R-E inline-four and overhauling the five-speed manual transmission as well as replacing clutch, exhaust, suspension, and braking components. The truck was repainted black, and the interior was refreshed with R134a-converted air conditioning, a Bose touchscreen head unit, and replacement carpets. Additional equipment includes a dual-range transfer case, 15″ steel wheels, Bilstein shocks, a tow ball, a spray-on bedliner, a sunroof, and power windows. Acquired by the seller in November 2022, the truck now shows 367k miles. This Toyota pickup is offered with the owner’s manual, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.
The windshield, headlights, and taillight lenses were replaced and the truck was repainted black with contrasting decals. Equipment includes a tow ball, a sunroof, a spray-on bedliner, and mud flaps.

The 15″ steel wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich Mud-Terrain T/A KM3 tires. Braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums. The seller states the steering knuckles were rebuilt, Bilstein shocks were installed, and the master brake cylinder and brake booster, calipers, drums, shoes, and lines along with the steering damper, U-bolts, and wheel cylinders were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The bucket seats are trimmed in gray cloth. Features include a Bose touchscreen head unit, power windows, and Toyota-branded rubber floor mats. Work in preparation for the sale is said to have included converting the air conditioning system to utilize R134a refrigerant, installing sound-dampening material, replacing the carpets, and reupholstering the armrests.

The steering wheel frames a 110-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 367k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The replacement 2.4-liter 22R-E inline-four was installed in preparation for the sale and is equipped with LCE Performance headers and a Magnaflow exhaust system. The following components are also said to have been replaced during the build:
The truck was designated a gross polluter in May 2024, and it subsequently passed a California emissions test in June 2024.

The seller states the five-speed manual transmission was overhauled, the differentials were serviced, the clutch, flywheel, master clutch cylinder, and transmission mounts were replaced, and bedliner material was applied to underbody components during the refurbishment. Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels via a dual-range transfer case.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned gross polluter designation.

This 1996 Ford Thunderbird LX has been registered in California from new through the selling dealer’s recent acquisition, and it now shows 80k miles. Powered by a 4.6-liter SOHC V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission, the car is finished in White Opalescent Clearcoat over Saddle cloth. It also features a sunroof, a power antenna, independent suspension, anti-lock disc brakes, 15″ cast aluminum wheels, semi-automatic climate control, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, and a factory cassette stereo in addition to power windows, door locks, and mirrors. This MN12 Thunderbird is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a California title.
The car is finished in White Opalescent Clearcoat (WR) with a power sunroof and a power-deployable antenna. Blemishes are identified by the selling dealer in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 15″ cast aluminum wheels are mounted with 215/70 BF Goodrich Advantage Control tires. The MN12 Thunderbird rides on a four-wheel independent suspension, and this example is equipped with optional four-wheel anti-lock disc brakes. The selling dealer states that the shock absorbers, anti-roll bar end links, and front brake pads and rotors were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The front bucket seats and the rear bench seat are upholstered in Saddle cloth. Appointments include semi-automatic climate control, cruise control, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, and a factory AM/FM/cassette stereo along with power windows, door locks, and mirrors.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel wears a Thunderbird LX-branded airbag cover, and it sits ahead of a 120-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges. The six-digit odometer shows 80k miles, approximately 100 of which were added by the selling dealer.
The 4.6-liter V8 features a single overhead camshaft per cylinder bank, and it produced 205 horsepower when new. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission.
Additional underside photos are presented in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in California.

This 2004 Ford Thunderbird is finished in black over beige leather and is powered by a 3.9-liter DOHC V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. The car spent time in Ohio and Florida before it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, and it now has 33k miles. The tires and alternator were replaced in preparation for the sale. Equipment includes a body-color removable hardtop, a power-operated tan soft top, integrated fog lights, power-adjustable heated seats, an in-dash six-CD changer, and dual-zone automatic climate control. This Thunderbird is now offered by the selling dealer with manufacturer’s literature and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Evening Black and features a matching removable hardtop with porthole windows as well as a power-operated tan soft top. Additional equipment includes an egg-crate grille, integrated fog lights, a hood scoop, a polished windshield surround, Thunderbird-script badges, and a dual-outlet exhaust system.

Chrome 17″ seven-spoke wheels feature Thunderbird-branded center caps and are mounted with 235/50 Avanta HPZ-02 tires, which the selling dealer notes were installed in preparation for the sale. The car is equipped with traction control, four-wheel independent suspension, and ventilated disc brakes.

The interior features heated and power-adjustable seats trimmed in Light Sand (BQ) leather, while silver trim accents the black door panels and dashboard. Amenities include dual-zone automatic climate control, cruise control, and an AM/FM stereo with an in-dash CD changer.

The leather-wrapped multi-function steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 33k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.9-liter V8 features dual overhead camshafts per cylinder bank and variable valve timing. Output was rated at 280 horsepower and 286 lb-ft of torque when new.
