The selling dealer notes that the alternator was replaced in preparation for the sale. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

This 2021 Toyota Land Cruiser is a Heritage Edition example powered by a 5.7-liter V8 linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a Torsen locking center differential. It is finished in Classic Silver Metallic over black leather and is equipped with 18″ BBS forged wheels, Crawl Control, a Multi-Terrain Monitor system, a sunroof, LED headlights, and skid plates. Other features include heated and ventilated front seats, heated second-row seating, and fold-away third-row seats along with Dynamic Radar cruise control, four-zone automatic climate control, and a voice-activated touchscreen navigation system connected to a JBL audio system. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this URJ200 has 7k miles and is offered in Idaho with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

Heritage Edition trucks received a revised grille, darkened LED headlight housings, side badging, and black mirror caps with chrome accents. This example is finished in Classic Silver Metallic and features a Yakima roof rack with a wind deflector as well as a Multi-Terrain Monitor camera system, mud flaps, fog lights, a sunroof, a rear spoiler, and parking sensors. Front paint protection film was optioned from the factory.

Bronze-finished 18″ BBS forged aluminum alloy wheels are mounted with 285/60 Dunlop Grandtrek AT23 tires. Skid plates cover the front suspension, radiator, fuel tank, and transfer case, and the truck came factory equipped with a Kinetic Dynamic Suspension System (KDSS), Crawl Control with off-road turn assist, Brake Assist, and Active Traction Control. Stopping power is provided by ventilated discs at each corner.

The heated, ventilated, and power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in black leather with bronze stitching. Amenities include driver-seat position memory, heated second-row seating, third-row seating, Dynamic Radar cruise control, a voice-activated touchscreen navigation system, a Bird’s Eye View 360 camera with Multi-Terrain Monitor, a JBL audio system, an AM/FM/CD stereo, and four-zone automatic climate control. The selling dealer notes scuffs on the door sills.

The heated multifunction steering wheel frames a central digital display, a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, fuel level, and voltage. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles.
The 5.7-liter DOHC V8 features dual independent VVT-i variable valve timing for a factory rating of 381 horsepower and 401 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a Torsen locking center differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Toyota of Santa Fe, New Mexico, along with factory equipment, colors, options, and a total of $91,175.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2001 BMW 530i sedan spent time with two owners in Virginia prior to the selling dealer’s 2024 acquisition and now has 79k miles. Power comes from a 3.0-liter M54 inline-six mated to a five-speed manual transmission, and the car is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over gray Montana leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ Style 82 alloy wheels, a power sunroof, and xenon headlights with washers as well as heated and power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD stereo. This E39 530i is now offered at no reserve in New York with service records dating to 2001, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title.

The sedan left the factory finished in Topaz Blue Metallic and features xenon headlights with washers as well as fog lights, a power sunroof, bright window trim, and power-adjustable side mirrors with color-keyed housings. The front bumper cover has been repainted to correct blemishes, per the selling dealer. Chipped paint on various body panels is shown up close in photos provided in the gallery.

The 16″ Style 82 alloy wheels are mounted with 225/55 Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 tires. A full-size spare and a tool kit reside in the trunk. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control as well as four-wheel ventilated disc brakes.

The heated and power-adjustable front bucket seats are trimmed in gray Montana leather that extends to the fold-down rear bench and door panels. Wood trim accents the cabin and amenities include driver seat-position memory, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a BMW Business CD stereo. The blower motor and register were replaced in March 2021. The head unit has dead pixels and the wood trim just above is cracked. Tears on the rear edge of the driver’s door panel upholstery can be seen in the gallery.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel is mounted on a power-adjustable column and is joined by a wood-trimmed shift knob surrounded by a black leather boot. Instrumentation consists of a tachometer with a 6,100-rpm redline as well as a 155-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature, instant fuel economy, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 79k miles, approximately 400 miles were added by the selling dealer.
The 3.0-liter M54B30 inline-six was factory rated at 225 horsepower. An oil change was most recently carried out in May 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission, which received a fluid change in May 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage and lists history with two owners in Virginia.

This 2000 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe has remained registered in California from new and now has 45k miles. The car is powered by a 3.4-liter M96 flat-six paired with a five-speed automatic transaxle and is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes a deployable rear spoiler, stainless-steel tailpipes, 18” wheels, cruise control, heated front seats, stainless-steel door sills, a Porsche CDR-220 stereo, and automatic climate control. This 996.1 coupe is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic and is equipped with integrated fog lights, a sunroof, a deployable rear spoiler, a black decklid badge, and dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers.

The 18” wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot tires that measure 225/40 up front and 265/35 at the rear. Braking is handled by four-piston Porsche-branded calipers fitted over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. A brake fluid flush was performed in June 2024.
The heated front seats are upholstered in black leather, and interior equipment includes cruise control, a Porsche CDR-220 stereo, stainless-steel door sills, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 180-mph speedometer, a central tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 45k miles.
The 3.4-liter M96 flat-six was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. In June 2024 the coolant was flushed, oil changed, and the air filter replaced.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed automatic transaxle.
Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2018 Mercedes-AMG C63 S coupe is a Brilliant Blue Metallic-finished example that has been modified with an aftermarket air intake system, front grille, engine-management software, front splitter, and downpipes. Powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission, the car has the Premium, Parking Assist, Night, and Multimedia packages as well as black and white Nappa leather upholstery, black-finished 19″ twin five-spoke AMG wheels, a panoramic sunroof, air suspension, LED headlights, heated and ventilated AMG Performance front seats, a surround-view camera system, a Burmester sound system, and dual-zone automatic climate control. The current owner purchased the car in 2021 and has since added approximately 15k of the 45k miles. This C205 is now offered with the owner’s manual, two keys, spare parts, a Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The car is finished in Brilliant Blue Metallic and features the AMG Night Package, which adds black exterior accents and black chrome-plated quad exhaust outlets. Additional details include a panoramic sunroof, an aftermarket front splitter, a later-model-style front grille, Parktronic parking sensors, and LED headlights. Damage to the left and left-rear portions of the body is listed in an August 2018 entry of the Carfax report, and the seller notes the car received bodywork as a result of the damage.

The black-finished 19″ twin five-spoke AMG wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 285/30 rear Hankook Ventus V12 tires. The C63 S was factory equipped with an AMG High-Performance Composite Braking System and an AMG Ride Control sport suspension with three-stage adaptive damping. Curb damage is visible on the right-front and right-rear wheels, and the brake calipers have been refinished in yellow under current ownership. A brake fluid flush was performed in December 2023.

The heated and ventilated AMG Performance front seats feature position memory settings and are trimmed in black and white Nappa leather with AMG logos on the backrests. AMG-branded floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include a surround-view camera system, a Burmester sound system, Keyless-Go, Active Parking Assist, Blind Spot Assist, COMAND infotainment with navigation, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The flat-bottom AMG Performance steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a central multifunction display flanked by a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 45k miles, approximately 15k of which were added under current ownership.

The twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter M177 V8 has been modified with an aftermarket intake system, engine-management software, and downpipes. Replacement fuel injectors were installed in April 2024, and an oil change was performed in May 2024, at which time the spark plugs were also replaced, per the seller.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through an AMG Speedshift seven-speed automatic transmission. The car is equipped with an electronic limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.
There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.
listing_details: Black and White Nappa Leather Upholstery
Premium, Parking Assist, Night, and Multimedia Packages

description: This 1976 BMW R90S was acquired by the seller in 2013 and subsequently fitted with replacement Daytona Orange bodywork. It is powered by a 898cc opposed twin paired with a five-speed transmission and has been modified with an aftermarket exhaust system, stainless-steel braided brake hoses, and an R100S seat. Additional equipment includes an S fairing, dual front disc brakes, a two-up seat, alloy rims, and Dell’Orto carburetors. This R90S is now offered at no reserve with a spare bodywork set, BMW panniers, frame mounting brackets, a black rear grab rail, service records, period magazine articles and brochures, owner’s literature, and a clean Pennsylvania title in the seller’s name.

The bike has been fitted with replacement Daytona Orange bodywork in place of the TT Silver Smoke bodywork it came with, the latter of which is included in the sale. The two-up seat is from a R100S and the hand grips are from a 1978 model, and additional equipment includes an S fairing, a clear windscreen, a 6.3-gallon fuel tank, folding passenger foot pegs, and both center and side stands. A Hans Muth signature can be found on the rear fender. The seller notes that part of a key blank is broken off in the frame lock.

Wire-spoke wheels with polished aluminum rims measuring 19″ up front and 18″ out back wear Metzeler tires that the seller notes should be replaced. Suspension consists of a leading-axle telescopic fork as well as a pair of adjustable shocks mounted to the swingarm on the left and the final drive enclosure on the right. Braking is provided by dual front discs with stainless-steel braided hoses and a rear drum.

The adjustment knob for a hydraulic steering damper that spans the lower triple clamp and the frame sits aft of a chrome handlebar equipped with dual mirrors. Instrumentation consists of a MotoMeter 140-mph speedometer, a matching tachometer with a 7,100-rpm redline, and a column of indicator lights. The five-digit odometer shows 36k miles, approximately 2k of which were ridden under current ownership. The seller notes that the clock is from a later model BMW.

The 898cc opposed twin was factory rated at 67 horsepower and 55 lb-ft of torque and features Dell’Orto PHM 38mm carburetors, an electric starter, and an aftermarket chrome dual exhaust system with a crossover pipe.
The number 4991098 stamped on the engine case matches the numbers stamped on the steering head plate and the frame, photos of which can be viewed in the gallery.
Power is delivered to the rear wheel through a five-speed transmission and a driveshaft enclosed within the right leg of the swingarm.

This 2005 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited Rubicon is #285 of 1,000 Sahara examples and was sold new at Jasper Jeep of Jasper, Georgia. Now with 15k miles, the truck is powered by a 4.0-liter inline-six linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range Rock-Trac transfer case. It is finished in Light Khaki with a Dark Khaki removable hardtop as well as front and rear Dana 44 axles, Tru-Lok front and rear remote locking differentials, full metal doors, fog lights, air conditioning, cruise control, power steering, Light Khaki high-back front bucket seats, a fold-and-tumble rear seat, a factory CD stereo, and a roll bar. This LJ Wrangler is now offered by the selling dealer with a soft top, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Georgia title.

This long-wheelbase Rubicon is finished in Light Khaki, and the Dark Khaki removable hardtop has a rear wiper. Bumper-mounted fog lights are fitted along with rear light guards and Sahara badging. An uninstalled Dark Khaki soft top is included in the sale.

Machine-finished 16″ Rubicon wheels are fitted with 245/75 Goodyear Wrangler MT/R tires, and a full-size spare is mounted to a swing-out rear carrier. Stopping power is provided by ABS disc brakes at all four corners. The truck came factory equipped with a Quadra-Coil multi-link suspension with solid axles.

The high-back front bucket seats are upholstered in Khaki cloth with color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Interior equipment includes a fold-and-tumble rear seat, a roll bar, a mini-floor console with a cup holder, air conditioning, cruise control, an AM/FM/CD stereo, and a locking glovebox. A Sahara decal indicating that this is #285 of 1,000 is located on the center stack.
The steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, voltage, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 15k miles.
The 4.0-liter Power Tech inline-six was rated at 190 horsepower and 235 lb-ft when new.

Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range Rock-Trac transfer case, and Tru-Lok front and rear remote locking differentials. Rubicon equipment included skid plates and front and rear Dana 44 axles with 4.11:1 axle ratios.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
listing_details: Tru-Lok Front And Rear Remote Locking Differentials

description: This 2023 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Widebody Jailbreak is a Last Call edition example that is finished in Plum Crazy over black Houndstooth cloth upholstery and was optioned with a six-speed manual transmission, which is paired with a supercharged 6.2-liter V8. Purchased new by the seller at Central Florida Dodge of Orlando, Florida, the car has a limited-slip differential, Brembo brake calipers, a competition suspension, 20″ Devil’s Rim forged aluminum wheels, HID Air-Catcher headlamps, widebody fenders, heated front seats, a heated steering wheel, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a Uconnect infotainment system. This Hellcat Widebody Jailbreak Last Call has 1,400 miles and is now offered with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Plum Crazy with satin black front and rear spoilers and Midnight Metallic exterior badging. Additional details include HID Air-Catcher headlamps, widebody fenders, an aluminum hood with dual air scoops, Hellcat fender badges, a rearview camera, rear parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets.

Black 20″ Devil’s Rim forged aluminum wheels are mounted with 305/35 Pirelli P Zero tires. The car is equipped with a Widebody competition suspension system with adaptive Bilstein dampers. Braking is handled by red-finished six-piston front and four-piston rear Brembo calipers.

The heated front seats are upholstered in black Houndstooth cloth with embossed SRT logos on the backrests. SRT-branded floor mats line the footwells, and interior appointments include driver-seat power adjustability, a folding rear seat, keyless entry, push-button start, Jailbreak badging, a Uconnect infotainment system, a Harman Kardon high-performance sound system, cruise control, blind-spot- and rear cross-path detection, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The heated leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a red 200-mph speedometer and 7k-rpm tachometer along with a configurable digital display. The digital odometer indicates 1,400 miles, all of which were added under current ownership.
The supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 produced 717 horsepower and 656 lb-ft of torque when new and is equipped with aluminum cylinder heads and a forged-steel crankshaft, connecting rods, and pistons.
A “Last Call” plaque is affixed under the hood near the driver-side headlight.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker shows initial delivery to Central Florida Dodge of Orlando, Florida, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $82,474.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

This 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa was initially sold in California and has remained registered in the state through the seller’s February 2018 purchase, and it shows 76k miles. The cylinder heads were machined and the 3.6-liter flat-six resealed in June 2019, and additional work at that time included repairing the Targa roof panel as well as replacing the steering rack and clutch components for the six-speed manual transaxle. It is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over black leather, and features include 17″ two-piece Targa wheels, a power-operated glass roof panel, power-adjustable front seats, supple leather seat inserts, a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR-46 stereo, a Hi-Fi sound system, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 993 Targa is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, a car cover, and a clean California title.

The 993 Targa was based on the convertible bodyshell and featured a revised roof with a lifting and sliding glass center section as opposed to the removable top found on earlier 911 Targa models. This example is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and stainless-steel dual exhaust outlets. The Targa roof panel was repaired in June 2019, and the windshield was replaced in June 2024. The Carfax report lists accident damage in an undated entry, and the selling dealer notes that the rear bumper cover has been refinished. Paint blemishes are noted.

Targa-specific two-piece 17″ Speedline wheels show signs of curb rash and are mounted with Yokohama Advan Fleva tires that were installed in December 2020. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. The steering rack, tie rods, and the left-front wheel bearing were replaced in June 2019, and the struts were replaced in June 2024.

The seating surfaces are trimmed in black leather with supple inserts, and they are complemented by an aluminum shifter and handbrake lever. Amenities include power-adjustable front seats, driver-seat lumbar support, a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR-46 stereo, a Hi-Fi sound system, cruise control, air conditioning, and stainless-steel sill plates.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 76k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The air-cooled 3.6L M64 flat-six features a VarioRam intake system and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 250 lb-ft of torque. The cylinder heads were machined and the engine resealed in June 2019, and additional work at that time included replacing the spark plugs, ignition wires, the ignition rotor, the distributor cap, the secondary air check valve, and the cut-off valve. An oil change was performed in January 2024, and the battery was replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. The clutch disc, pressure plate, and the clutch release bearing were replaced in June 2019.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Beverly Hills Porsche in Los Angeles, California, along with standard equipment, options, and a total price of $79,866.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned unreported accident.

This 1997 Land Rover Defender 90 is a left-hand-drive station wagon that was imported to the US in April 2024 from Spain, where it was registered since new according to the selling dealer. Powered by a 2.5-liter 300Tdi turbodiesel inline-four linked with a five-speed manual transmission, it has a locking center differential, LED lighting, 16″ alloy wheels, 33″ BFGoodrich tires, aftermarket front seats, inward-facing rear jump seats, and a rooftop tent. The truck’s cooling system, drivetrain, and brakes were serviced in the fall of 2023. This Defender 90 shows 236k kilometers (~147k miles) and is offered with clean Florida title that lists it as a 1998 model.

The truck’s white finish is contrasted by a black grille, headlight bezels, wheel arch extensions, bumpers, and checker-plate trim. Equipment includes LED headlights, an air intake snorkel, a roof-mounted light bar, and a Cruz roof rack with a Front Runner tent.

Five-spoke 16″ wheels are mounted with 285/75 BFGoodrich Mud-Terrain T/A KM3 tires, and a matching spare is stored out back. Four-wheel disc brakes are noted, and the brake fluid and pads were replaced in 2023.
The high-back sport seats are trimmed in black upholstery over dark floor covers, and a locking center console is fitted.
A two-spoke steering wheel frames the instrument cluster, which has a 150-km/h speedometer. The six-digit mechanical odometer shows 236k kilometers (~147k miles).
The cargo area has four inward-facing jump seats as well as a dividing barrier and an all-weather floor mat.

The 2.5-liter 300Tdi turbodiesel inline-four sends power to all four wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case with a manually locking center differential. The selling dealer reports that the water pump, coolant expansion tank, coolant, engine oil, accessory drive belts, and drivetrain fluids were replaced in October 2023 along with the air and fuel filters.
Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.
The Carfax report lists history beginning in May 2024.

This 1968 Triumph Bonneville T120R was acquired out of Canada by the seller’s late husband in 2004 when it was subsequently imported to the US. It is finished in red with black side covers and is powered by a 649cc parallel twin mated to a right-side-shifted four-speed transmission. Features include a two-up seat, a twin leading-shoe front drum brake, wire-spoke wheels, chrome fenders, center and side stands, a dual exhaust system, and a steel fuel tank. This T120R is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, service records, spare parts, a tool kit, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The fuel tank was internally sealed and repainted in enamel Candy Red with a silver center stripe and gold pinstripes in May 2011. Features include a black vinyl-upholstered two-up seat, chrome fenders, folding passenger foot pegs, black rubber knee grips, and both center and side stands.

The 19″ front and 18″ rear wire-spoke wheels feature chrome-finished rims and are wrapped with 3.50″ front and 4.00″ rear Dunlop Gold Seal K70 tires. Suspension consists of a conventional telescopic fork with black rubber gaiters as well as dual shocks mounted to the swingarm. Braking is from drums at both ends, the front of which features a twin leading-shoe design.

A chrome handlebar fronts Smiths instrumentation consisting of a 150-mph speedometer and a 10k-rpm tachometer. The five-digit odometer shows 25k miles, approximately 20k of which have been ridden under current ownership.
The 649cc OHV parallel twin was factory rated at 52 horsepower and is equipped with twin Amal carburetors, a kick starter, and a dual exhaust system with chrome-finished pipes.
The number DU78756 stamped on the engine case matches the last six number stamped on the frame, a photo of which can be viewed in the gallery.
Power is transferred to the rear wheel through a right-side-shifted four-speed transmission as well as a drive chain.
Owner’s literature, restoration guides, and the owner’s handwritten notes are included in the sale.

This 1963 Chevrolet Corvette split-window coupe is powered by a 327ci L75 V8 paired with a Powerglide two-speed automatic transmission and is refinished in dark blue over dark blue upholstery. Equipment includes 15″ reproduction turbine-style wheels with three-eared knock-off spinners as well as power-assisted brakes, power steering, power windows, an AM/FM radio, and concealed headlights. The car was refurbished under previous ownership and acquired by the selling dealer in 2024. This C2 split-window coupe is now offered with an NCRS Shipping Data Report and a clean Ohio title.

The fiberglass body was finished at the factory in Daytona Blue (916A) and was refinished under previous ownership. Features flip-up headlamps, fender vents, quad tail lamps, chrome bumperettes, and dual exhaust tips that exit through the rear valance. Paint chips on the edge of the driver’s door are shown in the gallery.

The 15″ reproduction turbine-style wheels wear three-eared knock-off spinners and are mounted with Goodyear Speedway Blue Streak tires measuring 7.75-15. The C2 was the first Corvette to offer fully independent suspension, with upper and lower control arms at the front and a three-link setup with a transverse leaf spring at the rear. The car is equipped with power steering, and braking is handled by four-wheel power-assisted drums.

The cabin features two bucket seats upholstered in dark blue vinyl as well as color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include a heater, an AM/FM radio, an analog clock, power windows, and lap belts. A tear in the driver’s seat is shown up close in the gallery.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5,300-rpm redline as well as gauges for amperage, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 45k miles.
The 327ci L75 V8 was equipped from the factory with a single four-barrel carburetor for a factory rating of 300 horsepower. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.

The engine stamping includes sequence 3109192 which matches the last six digits of the vehicle’s serial number. The SD suffix corresponds with a 300-horsepower, 327ci V8 for use with an automatic transmission.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Powerglide two-speed automatic transmission.
Decoding the trim tag reveals:

This 1990 Porsche 911 Carrera 2 coupe is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a five-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Guards Red over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes 16″ Design 90 wheels, a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, power-adjustable front seats, a JVC stereo, cruise control, and R134a-based air conditioning. The engine was rebuilt in 2019, including rebuilding the cylinder head and replacing the intake and exhaust valves, rod bearings, distributor, fuel pump, oil return tube, oil hoses, drive belt, and spark plugs. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 964 C2 coupe is offered in West Virginia with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title.

The car is finished in Guards Red and features a speed-activated rear spoiler, an electric sunroof, integrated fog lights, and heated and power-adjustable side mirrors. The rear tail lights and center reflector were replaced in 2019. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Silver-finished 16″ Design 90 wheels are wrapped in Goodyear Eagle Sport tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. Work in 2019 included rebuilding the CV axles and replacing the front and rear brake pads, control arm bushings, brake hoses, and power steering hose.

The power-adjustable front bucket seats are upholstered in black leather and are complemented by a color-coordinated dash, center console, and door panels. Amenities include a JVC stereo, power windows, cruise control, and air conditioning, the latter of which has been converted to utilize R134a refrigerant. The blower motors and window switch were replaced in 2019.

The leather-wrapped four-spoke steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as a 180-mph speedometer, a Quarz analog clock, and gauges for oil level, oil pressure, oil temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 100k miles, approximately 200 of which were added by the selling dealer. The speedometer was repaired in 2019 at Palo Alto’s Speedometer. Total mileage is unknown.

The air-cooled 3.6L M64 flat-six was factory-rated at 247 horsepower and 228 lb-ft of torque. The engine was rebuilt in 2019, including rebuilding the cylinder head and replacing the intake and exhaust valves, rod bearings, fuel pump, oil return tube, oil hoses, drive belt, spark plugs, distributor, and engine sound pad.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle with a limited-slip differential. The clutch cylinders were replaced in 2019.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage from its first entry in April 1996.

This 1986.5 Porsche 928S was acquired by the current owner in 2020 and is said to have subsequently spent time in long-term storage. Now showing 68k miles, it is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transaxle and is finished in Guards Red over Champagne leather. Equipment includes anti-lock disc brakes, 16″ seven-hole alloy wheels, a steel sunroof, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable front seats, air conditioning, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. This 928S is offered on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a corrected Illinois title.

The car is finished in Guards Red (80K) and features pop-up headlights with washers as well as fog lights, front and rear spoilers, a steel sunroof, power-adjustable side mirrors, and a rear window wiper.

Silver-finished 16″ seven-hole alloy wheels with full-color Porsche crest center caps are mounted with 225/50 Kelly tires. Compared to earlier models, the 1986.5 928S features uprated brakes that are handled by anti-lock discs at each corner. Damage is visible on the wheels.

The power-adjustable front bucket seats and folding individual rear seats are trimmed in Champagne leather. Appointments include air conditioning, cruise control, power windows, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo. The dashboard and glovebox leather is warped and delaminated.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 170-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature, fuel level, oil pressure, and voltage. The six-digit odometer shows 68k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.0-liter V8 was factory rated at 288 horsepower and 302 lb-ft of torque. The car was last serviced in 2020, and the selling dealer recommends a comprehensive inspection of all critical systems before it is deemed roadworthy.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a rear-mounted four-speed automatic transaxle. Fluid residue is visible on underside components and additional underside photos are presented in the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage and lists history in Illinois. There is a gap in reporting from August 2000 to the final entry in December 2020.
The current Illinois title is a “corrected” title.

This 1989 Maserati Biturbo Spyder i was acquired by the seller in 2002 and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.8-liter V6 mated to a five-speed manual transmission. It is finished in Swan White over beige leather upholstery and is equipped with a convertible soft top, fog lights with amber lenses, 15” alloy wheels, power windows, and air conditioning. This Biturbo Spyder shows 7k miles and is offered with manufacturer’s literature, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Swan White and equipped with a convertible soft top, a beige top boot, a front spoiler, fog lights, Zagato badging, and quad exhaust outlets. The front bumper cover is said to have been repainted.

Slotted 15” alloy wheels are mounted with 205/50 front and 225/50 rear Hankook Ventus HR II tires. The car rides on a fully independent suspension, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes. The brakes are said to have been serviced in the past year.

The front bucket seats are upholstered in tan leather that extends to the dashboard, center console, sun visors, and door panels. Burl woodgrain trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include air conditioning, an analog clock, and power windows.

The brown four-spoke steering wheel is leather-wrapped and frames blue instrument dials including a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for boost pressure, oil pressure, water temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 7k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.
The twin-turbocharged 2.8-liter V6 was factory rated at 225 horsepower and 246 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The seller notes that the clutch assembly was replaced in the past year.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1996 Chevrolet Tahoe LS has remained registered with the original owners and now shows 109k miles. The truck is finished in Emerald Green Metallic over Neutral cloth upholstery and is powered by a 5.7-liter V8 mated to a four-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. Features include 16″ twist five-spoke aluminum wheels, rear barn doors, roof rails, chrome lower-body cladding, a receiver hitch, bench seating, power windows and locks, an AM/FM/cassette/CD stereo, and air conditioning. This GMT400 Tahoe is now offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of the current owners with factory literature, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Dakota title in the current owner’s name.

This four-door example is finished in Emerald Green Metallic (43U), and features include front tow hooks, chrome bumpers and lower-body cladding, roof rails, running boards, pinstripes, a receiver hitch, and rear barn doors. There is a scrape on the left rear door and wheel arch, and the right rear wheel arch is dented.
The 16″ twist five-spoke aluminum wheels are mounted with 245/75 Toyo Open Country tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in Neutral cloth along with color-coordinated door panels and carpeting. Amenities include front bench seating, a folding three-passenger rear bench, power windows and locks, an AM/FM/cassette/CD stereo, and air conditioning.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for fuel level, voltage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 109k miles, all of which were added under current ownership.
The 5.7-liter Vortec V8 was factory rated at 255 horsepower and 330 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission with overdrive and a dual-range transfer case. Corrosion is visible on the underside.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1985 GMC Caballero is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and was optioned with the Diablo trim package, which added a front air dam, 14″ Rally wheels, sport mirrors, and two-tone paint. Finished in Dark Red Metallic and Silver Metallic over maroon cloth upholstery, it is further equipped with bed rails, air conditioning, and a tilt-adjustable steering wheel as well as power windows and locks, cruise control, and a Delco cassette stereo. Following registration history in Oklahoma and Florida, the truck was acquired by the selling dealer in May 2024. Showing 79k miles, this Caballero is now offered at no reserve in New York with the SPID label, spare keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The truck is finished in Dark Red Metallic with Silver Metallic lower body panels, accented with black and red pinstripes where the two shades meet as well as red and silver beltline pinstriping. Additional exterior details include chrome bumpers, a GMC-logo hood ornament, a front spoiler, dual sport mirrors, bed rails, and bodyside moldings. Photos showing paint-meter readings and dings in the body are provided in the gallery below.

Rally 14″ wheels with dark-finished recesses and bright trim rings are mounted with 205/75 Hercules MR IV Touring Radial thin-whitewall tires. The truck was factory-equipped with power-assisted steering and brakes, with discs up front and drums out back.

The split-bench seat is upholstered in maroon velour, and woodgrain trim accents the dashboard. Maroon mats cover matching carpeting, and additional appointments include air conditioning, power windows and locks, cruise control, a Diablo dash tag, and a Delco AM/FM/cassette push-button radio.

The ComforTilt two-spoke steering wheel frames an 85-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5k-rpm redline and an inset clock as well as gauges for fuel level, voltage, coolant temperature, and oil pressure. The five-digit odometer shows 79k miles, approximately 25 of which were added under current ownership.
The 5.0-liter V8 features a four-barrel carburetor and was factory rated at 150 horsepower and 240 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a column-shifted four-speed automatic transmission.
Decoding the Service Parts Identification label reveals the following information:
The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries.

This 2014 Porsche Cayenne S is finished in Carmine Red over Umber and Light Tartufo leather and is powered by a 4.8-liter V8 linked with an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential. It is equipped with the Sport Chrono, Convenience, Walnut Interior, and Bose Audio packages as well as 21″ Cayenne SportEdition wheels, a panoramic sunroof, ParkAssist, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, and PCM with navigation. The vehicle has spent time in Florida, California, and Arizona where the selling dealer recently acquired it, and it now has 69k miles. This Cayenne S is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Arizona title.
The vehicle is finished in Carmine Red with black trim and features fog lights, front and rear ParkAssist, a panoramic sunroof, and LED taillights.

Black 21″ Cayenne SportEdition alloy wheels are mounted with 295/35 Pirelli tires. Stopping power is provided by six-piston front and four-piston rear brake calipers over ventilated rotors at each corner.

The cabin features heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in Light Tartufo leather, while Umber leather covers the front center console armrest and upper dashboard. Walnut wood trim adorns the interior, and amenities include a back-up camera, a Bose sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation.

The wood- and leather-rimmed steering wheel features shifter switches and frames Luxor Beige instrument dials consisting of a 175-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 69k miles.
The 4.8-liter V8 features VarioCam Plus and was factory rated at 400 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to all four wheels through an eight-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and a locking center differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2019 Aston Martin DB11 coupe is a black-on-black example that is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 paired with an eight-speed automatic transaxle and now has 7k miles. Features include a limited-slip differential, the Satin Silver Jewelry Pack, 20” wheels, an Adaptive Damping System, a deployable rear spoiler, LED lighting, parking sensors, heated front seats, a 360-degree camera, an Aston Martin Audio System, dual-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. Acquired by the seller in 2021, this DB11 Coupe is now offered with a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (P1328AAA) with a color-coordinated front grille, exhaust tips, and side strakes. Additional features include Aeroblade with a deployable rear spoiler, body-color roof strakes, parking sensors, and LED headlights and taillights. The third brake light was replaced in 2022.

The 20” wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza tires. Braking is handled by red calipers over ventilated discs at each corner, and a brake fluid flush was performed in 2022. The car came equipped from the factory with an Adaptive Damping System.

The heated front seats and rear bucket seats are trimmed in black leather with red stitching, and Aston Martin logos are embossed on the front headrests. Amenities include a 360-degree camera, an Alcantara headliner, front-seat position memory settings, keyless entry, dual-zone automatic climate control, an Aston Martin Audio System, black leather trim inlays, red seat belts, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. The Satin Silver Jewelry Pack added a satin silver horn ring, paddle shifters, steering wheel trim, center stack surrounds, air vent bezels, seatbelt bezels, and speaker grilles as well as satin silver door releases, bezels, and sills.

The multifunction steering wheel is mounted on a power-adjustable column and sits ahead of a 12″ configurable digital gauge cluster. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.
The twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter quad-cam V8 was factory rated at 503 horsepower and 513 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale, and the battery was replaced in 2022.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a rear-mounted ZF eight-speed automatic transaxle that features a limited-slip differential and utilizes active torque vectoring. The rear differential was serviced in 2022.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1993 Land Rover Defender 90 is a left-hand-drive example powered by a 2.5-liter 200Tdi turbodiesel inline-four linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. It is finished in metallic green and equipped with a removable black soft top, a Puma-style hood, body-color wheel arch flares, rock sliders, and 16″ wheels. The cabin is trimmed in brown leather and has front bucket and rear jump seats in addition to an Alpine stereo and air conditioning. The truck was imported to the US under previous ownership and was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024. This Defender 90 is offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean New York title.

The truck is finished in metallic green and has body-color wheel arch flares and a removable black soft top with roll-up sides. Other exterior features include a Puma-style hood, rock sliders, and a fold-down rear step.

The 16″ wheels are mounted with 265/70 BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2 tires showing 2020 and 2021 date codes. A matching spare is secured to a swing-out carrier at the rear of the truck. Stopping power is provided by front discs and rear drums.

The cabin is trimmed in brown leather upholstery and houses front bucket and rear jump seats with diamond stitching and green piping. Features include air conditioning, a center console, an Alpine head unit, and aftermarket speakers.

Instrumentation includes a 150-km/h speedometer and gauges for battery charge, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 4k kilometers (~2k miles). A mileage inconsistency is noted on the Carfax report in an October 2023 entry, and total mileage is unknown.
The 2.5-liter 200Tdi turbodiesel inline-four sends power to all four wheels through a five-speed manual transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a locking center differential.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned mileage inconsistency.

This 2005 BMW 330Ci convertible was initially sold in the US and was imported to Canada in November 2009 where it was purchased by the seller in April 2024. The car is powered by a 3.0-liter inline-six paired with a five-speed automatic transmission and is fitted with the ZHP Performance Package, which added revised aerodynamic bodywork, a sport suspension, and a revised final drive ratio. The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic over gray Montana leather, and features include heated front sport seats, 18″ M Double Spoke wheels, a black convertible top, adaptive xenon headlights, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This ZHP convertible has 98k miles, and it is now offered in Canada with the owner’s manual, a removable wind deflector, a clean Carfax report, and Ontario registration.

The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic (A07) and features a power-retractable black soft top as well as an aerodynamic package that includes revised bumper covers and side skirts. Additional features include adaptive xenon headlights, fog lamps, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and twin exhaust outlets. There is an indentation in the rear bumper cover. Additional paint blemishes are shown in detail in the gallery.

Silver 18″ M Double Spoke wheels are mounted with General G-Max AS-05 tires. The ZHP Performance Package added a stiffer sport suspension, revised control arms, and larger anti-roll bars when compared to the standard E46. The car is also equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC). The brake pads and rotors were replaced under current ownership, per the seller.

The cabin features heated front sport seats trimmed in gray Montana leather, while black cube aluminum trim accents the dash, center console, and door panels. Amenities include front seat power lumbar support, driver-seat memory settings, automatic climate control, cruise control, navigation, a BMW Business CD stereo, a remote CD changer, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The seller notes that the automatic dimming feature of the rearview mirror is not functional.

The multi-function M sport steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, instant fuel economy, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 98k miles, approximately 3k of which were added during current ownership.

The 3.0-liter M54 inline-six features upgraded engine management software along with revised camshafts for a factory rating of 235 horsepower and 222 lb-ft of torque in ZHP specification. The fuel filter and spark plugs are said to have been replaced under current ownership.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The vehicle does not have a title and is being sold on its Ontario registration, which serves as the ownership document in Ontario, Canada.

This 2008 Lamborghini Gallardo Superleggera was initially delivered in Japan and was acquired by the selling dealer and imported to Canada in 2023. The car was subsequently modified by converting the six-speed gearbox to a manual setup and removing the front differential so that power from the 5.0-liter V10 is directed exclusively to the rear wheels. The car is finished in Grigio Telesto over black Alcantara and is equipped with a rear wing, 19″ Scorpius wheels, fixed-back bucket seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a replacement head unit with Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay. This Gallardo Superleggera now has 30k kilometers (~19k miles) and is offered by the selling dealer with Ontario registration.

The Gallardo was initially styled by Italdesign Giugiaro, while the final production version was designed in-house by Luc Donckerwolke. The Superleggera is equipped with a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, rear decklid, mirror housings, and side skirts in addition to a thinner windshield and polycarbonate in place of various standard glass panels. This example is finished in Grigio Telesto and features xenon headlights, power-folding side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets that exit through the rear valance.

Scorpius 19″ wheels are mounted with 235/35 front and 295/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4s tires that were installed in June 2023, per the seller. Braking is provided by black-finished calipers with Lamborghini script over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors at all four corners. The optional front-axle lift system does not work.

The interior houses fixed-back seats upholstered in black Alcantara that extends to the dashboard and headliner. Carbon-fiber trim accents the center console and door panels. A gated shifter was fitted as part of the manual gearbox conversion. A replacement head unit with Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay was installed in 2023.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel frames a 340-km/h speedometer, a 10k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. A three-gauge panel mounted atop the dashboard includes readouts for oil pressure, oil temperature, and voltage. The seller notes that the check engine light intermittently illuminates. The digital odometer indicates 30k kilometers (~19k miles), approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.

The 5.0-liter V10 was factory rated at 523 horsepower and 376 lb-ft of torque. The seller reports that the spark plugs, ignition coils, and water pump were replaced in 2022 prior to the car’s importation.

The car left the factory equipped with a six-speed automated transaxle and an all-wheel-drive system. A conversion to rear-wheel drive that involved removing the front differential was completed in 2023, and the gearbox actuator, shifter, and pedals were replaced at that time to convert the system to a manual setup.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage since an initial entry in June 2023.

This 2001 Mercedes-Benz SL500 was initially delivered to David R. McGeorge Car Company in Richmond, Virginia, and it has 46k miles following registration history in Maryland and Delaware. The car is powered by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission and is finished in Desert Silver Metallic over Java Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes a removable hardtop, a brown soft top, 18″ five-spoke AMG wheels, fog lights, heated power-adjustable seats, a Bose sound system, a remote six-disc CD changer, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this R129 is now offered in Pennsylvania with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Delaware title.

The car is finished in Desert Silver Metallic (693) and features a matching removable hardtop as well as a brown soft top. Additional exterior equipment includes fog lights, fender air vents, and the AMG Styling Package, which added revised bumper covers and aerodynamic side skirts. The convertible soft top is said to have been replaced in 2024, and Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.
The 18″ five-spoke AMG wheels are mounted with a mixed set of Continental and Michelin tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable seats upholstered in Java Nappa leather along with burl wood accents on the doors and center stack. Amenities include a deployable roll bar, seat position memory, a Bose sound system, a remote six-disc CD changer, a heated rear hardtop window, cruise control, and automatic climate control.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, a clock, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, fuel economy, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 46k miles.
The 5.0-liter M113 V8 was factory-rated at 302 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque, which is routed to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to David R. McGeorge Car Company in Richmond, Virginia, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total retail price of $86,065.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2007 Porsche 911 GT3 remained registered in Hawaii through 2023 and was sold on BaT in February 2024 before the selling dealer’s acquisition later in the year. It now has 6k miles and is powered by a 3.6-liter Mezger flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Carrara White over black leather and Alcantara, the car is equipped with the Sport Chrono and Sound Plus packages, silver 19″ alloy wheels, bi-xenon headlights, a sunroof, an adjustable rear wing, heated adaptive sport seats, automatic climate control, and PCM 3.0 with extended navigation. This 997.1 GT3 is offered by the selling dealer in Texas with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.

The 997.1 GT3 is distinguished from contemporary 911 Carrera models by its aluminum front trunk lid and doors, more aggressive front and rear fascias, an adjustable rear wing, and center-exit exhaust outlets. This example is finished in Carrara White and features a sunroof, auto-dimming mirrors, rain-sensing wipers, and bi-xenon headlights with washers. The front license plate bracket was removed and factory-style fog lights and taillights were installed in April 2024.

Silver 19″ alloy wheels were mounted with 235/35 front and 305/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires in 2022. Braking is handled by red Porsche-branded six-piston front and four-piston rear calipers over 13.8″ rotors. The GT3 was factory equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) featuring adjustable coilovers. The brake fluid was flushed in July 2023.

The heated and adaptive hard-back sport seats are trimmed in black leather and Alcantara with debossed Porsche crests in the headrests. Interior amenities include the Sound Package Plus, automatic climate control, cruise control, red seatbelts, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) 3.0 with extended navigation. The air conditioning system was recharged in April 2024.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel frames a central GT3-branded tachometer with an 8,400-rpm redline as well as a 225-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 6k miles. The Carfax report shows that the steering column was replaced in October 2023.

The 3.6-liter Mezger flat-six features VarioCam variable valve timing as well as titanium connecting rods and dry-sump lubrication. It was factory rated at 415 horsepower and 300 lb-ft of torque. The battery was replaced in July 2023 and service in April 2024 involved changing the drive belt and coolant pipe and hoses as well as flushing the coolant.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The shift cable was replaced in April 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

This 1969 Jaguar XKE Series II roadster was restored circa 2008 and purchased by the owner in 2024. It is finished in Willow Green over tan leather and is powered by a 4.2-liter inline-six linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes triple SU carburetors, exhaust headers, a black soft top, a louvered clamshell hood, four-wheel disc brakes, 15″ wire wheels, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and a retro-style radio. This XKE roadster is now offered on dealer consignment with a Jaguar Heritage Trust Certificate, service records, Jaguar club literature, and a clean Arizona title.

The car has been refinished in the factory Willow Green, and exterior equipment includes a replacement black soft top, sealed-beam open headlights, a driver-side mirror, wraparound chrome bumpers, bright trim, a louvered clamshell hood, and dual exhaust outlets.
Chrome 15″ wire wheels are secured by two-eared knockoffs and are mounted with 185-series Michelin tires. Braking is provided by four-wheel discs with inboard-mounted rear rotors.

The cabin is upholstered in tan leather and was refreshed in 2013. The seats were rebuilt and retrimmed and the dashboard was re-covered. Interior appointments include a retro-style radio with an auxiliary input, a locking glovebox, and a heater.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel frames Smiths instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5k-rpm redline as well as an analog clock and gauges for voltage, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 85k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership. The speedometer was repaired in 2014, and the total mileage is unknown.
The 4.2-liter inline-six was rebuilt in 2013 and is fitted with triple SU carburetors and tubular headers. The thermostat and drive belts were replaced in January 2023.
The engine stamping 7R1142-9 matches the number listed on the Heritage certificate.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Jaguar Daimler Heritage Trust certificate lists the original colors and powertrain numbers.

This 1995 Acura NSX-T is a Formula Red-finished example that shows 16k miles and was optioned with a five-speed manual transaxle, which is paired with a 3.0-liter VTEC V6. The car has black leather upholstery, staggered-diameter 16” and 17” aluminum wheels, a limited-slip differential, a removable body-color roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a CD changer, and a Bose sound system. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2024 following registration history in California and Oregon. This NSX-T is now offered with the owner’s manual, spare keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The NSX featured aluminum bodywork, and this example is finished in Formula Red with a body-color removable roof panel. Exterior details include pop-up headlights, an integrated rear wing, side air intakes, power-adjustable side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets.

Staggered-diameter 16” and 17” seven-spoke aluminum wheels are mounted with 215/45 front and 245/40 rear Bridgestone Potenza tires showing 2022 and 2023 date codes. The car features a four-wheel double-wishbone suspension with front and rear stabilizer bars, and braking is handled by NSX-branded calipers over vented rotors at each corner.

The power-adjustable sport seats are upholstered in black leather and are joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, door panels, and carpets. NSX-branded floor mats line the footwells, and interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, and a cassette stereo linked to a six-disc CD changer. The stainless-steel door sill plates are stamped with the car’s serial number. Aftermarket controls have been integrated into the center console.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, a 188-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 16k miles.
The mid-mounted 3.0-liter V6 features VTEC variable valve timing and was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 210 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1974 Porsche 914 was acquired out of Texas by the seller’s spouse in 2001 and repainted Alaska Blue Metallic in 2007. The bucket seats were reupholstered in beige vinyl with patterned cloth inserts at that time, and power comes from a 2.0-liter flat-four mated to a five-speed manual transaxle. The car rides on 15″ Fuchs alloy wheels and is further equipped with a black removable Targa top, pop-up headlights, fog lights, and a chrome rear luggage rack and bumper bar as well as a cabin heater and a push-button AM/FM stereo. The fuel injectors were replaced in May 2024. This 914 shows 69k miles and is now offered at no reserve with spare parts, a service handbook, a record of the 2024 service, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The body received rust and dent repairs before it was repainted Alaska Blue Metallic in 2007. The black removable Targa top was refurbished at that time, and additional exterior details include pop-up headlights, fog lights, black sail panels, a driver-side mirror, a chrome rear luggage rack and bumper bar, and polished bumper trim. The trim piece surrounding the windshield has delaminated in the center.
The 15″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with 165-width Semperit Hi-Life M501 tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel discs.

The fixed-back bucket seats were reupholstered in beige vinyl with patterned cloth inserts in 2007. Color-coordinated carpeting lines the footwells, and amenities include an Astro Line push-button AM/FM stereo, a heater, a center console, and crank-operated windows. Cracks are visible on the top of the dashboard.

The leather-wrapped four-spoke steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central 7k-rpm tachometer, a 120-mph speedometer, and a fuel-level gauge. An analog clock and gauges for engine temperature and voltage reside in the center stack ahead of the shifter. The five-digit odometer shows 69k miles, approximately 150 miles were added by the seller.

The mid-mounted 2.0L flat-four features Bosch D-Jetronic fuel injection and was factory rated at 91 horsepower. The fuel injectors were replaced in May 2024 and the seller recommends replacing wiring in the engine area.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle. Corrosion is noted on the underside.
Spare parts and a service handbook are included in the sale along with a record of the recent service, which can be viewed in the gallery.
The Colorado title is a duplicate.

This 1985 Mazda RX-7 GSL remained registered in Pennsylvania until it was acquired by the seller on BaT in January 2023, and it now shows 82k miles. Powered by a 1.1-liter 12A rotary paired with a five-speed manual transmission, the car is finished in Desert Brown Metallic over brown leather upholstery. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, 13″ alloy wheels, four-wheel disc brakes, power windows, cruise control, and an AM/FM cassette stereo with a graphic equalizer. Work performed in 2022 consisted of replacing the front brake pads and rotors, and the seller states that the starter and clutch hydraulic cylinders were replaced under current ownership. This RX-7 is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean West Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Desert Brown Metallic (T9) and features a removable sunroof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable side mirrors, a rear window wiper, and a power antenna. The left door was reportedly repainted under prior ownership and an area of rust is noted in the rear window channel.
Four-spoke 13″ alloy wheels are mounted with 185/70 Kenda Kenetica tires. Braking is handled by power-assisted four-wheel discs, and the pads and rotors were replaced in October 2022.

The cabin features seats upholstered in brown leather with a color-coordinated dashboard and carpeting. Additional appointments include cruise control, power windows, a heated rear window, and an AM/FM cassette stereo with a graphic equalizer. The air conditioning and Quartz clock are inoperative.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil pressure, voltage, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 83k miles, under 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The 1.1-liter 12A Wankel rotary was factory equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and was rated at 101 horsepower and 107 lb-ft of torque, which is is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The engine oil and air filter were changed in October 2022, and the radiator was reportedly replaced under previous ownership. The seller states that a replacement starter and clutch hydraulic cylinders were installed following their acquisition.
Additional underside photos are viewable in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1996 Chevrolet K1500 Silverado was purchased new at Pierson Chevrolet in Gadsen, Alabama, was acquired by the selling dealer from the original owner in April 2024, and now shows 59k miles. The truck is powered by a 5.7-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a limited-slip rear differential, and it is finished in Victory Red over tan leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels, a sliding rear window, a spray-on bedliner, a receiver hitch, air conditioning, power windows, and a CD stereo. This GMT400 pickup is offered by the selling dealer in Indiana at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title.
The truck is finished in Victory Red and features a Sportside bed as well as a receiver hitch, a sliding rear window, and a spray-on bedliner.

The 16″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2 tires. The truck is equipped with a 2″ rear body lift and front disc brakes. The lower ball joints, outer tie rod ends, and right-front axle shaft were reportedly replaced in preparation for the sale.
The bench seat is trimmed in tan leather, and amenities include air conditioning, power windows, and a CD stereo. The driver’s seat is said to have been reupholstered.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for voltage, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 59k miles. The selling dealer states the coolant temperature gauge was repaired in preparation for the sale.

The 5.7-liter V8 was factory rated at 250 horsepower and 335 lb-ft of torque. Service in preparation for the sale is said to have included replacing the serpentine belt, rear main seal, intake manifold gaskets, and distributor cap and rotor, recharging the air conditioning system, and performing an oil change.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a limited-slip rear differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2005 Audi S4 Avant was acquired by the seller in 2019 and subsequently fitted with a remanufactured 4.2-liter V8 and was serviced with metal-reinforced timing chain guides. It is finished in Arctic White over black leather and beige Alcantara upholstery, and power is sent to all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. The car is equipped with 18″ Avus wheels, a sunroof, roof rails, heated power-adjustable Recaro front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Pioneer head unit, and a Bose sound system. This S4 Avant has 140k miles and is offered with service records, a clean Carfax report, and transferable Vermont registration in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Arctic White with aluminum roof rails as well as body-color side moldings. Additional details include a sunroof, fog lights, headlight washers, tinted windows, a rear spoiler, and dual exhaust outlets. The seller states a rearview camera has been added and the factory adaptive headlights have been replaced with non-adaptive units. Repaired paint chips are noted, and close-up photos of blemishes along the body can be seen in the gallery.

Replacement 18″ Avus wheels were refinished in 2020 and are mounted with Yokohama Advan Sport A/S tires. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel vented disc brakes, and various components of the sport-tuned suspension have been replaced under current ownership according to the seller.

The heated and power-adjustable Recaro front seats are upholstered in black leather and beige Alcantara, while carbon-fiber trim accents the center console. Equipment includes driver’s seat memory settings, cruise control, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Pioneer head unit, and a Bose sound system.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a 170-mph speedometer and an S4-branded tachometer flanked by auxiliary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 140k miles, approximately 40k of which were added during current ownership. The Carfax report notes the instrument panel was repaired in 2005, and the seller reports a warning light related to the headlamps is illuminated.

The 40-valve 4.2L V8 was replaced at approximately 106k miles with a remanufactured unit by Pacific German of Laguna Hills, California, in February 2020. Additional work at that time included installing metal-reinforced chain guides as well as replacing the rear timing chain guide rail, valve cover gaskets, intake manifold gaskets, rear main seal, fuel injectors, engine mounts, ignition coils, and oxygen sensors. The engine was modified with a Revotechnik Stage 2 ECU tune at that time. An oil change was performed in March 2024.

An invoice from February 2020 lists the installation of an “OEM remanufactured long block” and subsequent part number. Additional records for services performed under current ownership total over $30k and are shown in the gallery.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. The clutch disc, flywheel, and slave cylinder were replaced in 2020. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
The car does not have a title, as it is registered in a state that does not issue titles for a vehicle of its age. It is being sold on its registration.

This 1973 Pontiac Firebird Formula was refurbished in 2023 and is finished in white with blue stripes over black and blue upholstery. It is powered by a rebuilt 350ci V8 linked to a Turbo Hydra-Matic three-speed automatic transmission and rides on a coilover suspension and 15″ snowflake-style wheels. Equipment includes twin hood scoops, front and rear spoilers, aftermarket headlights, power-assisted front disc brakes, Flowmaster mufflers, and an Edelbrock intake manifold along with front bucket seats, air conditioning, and an aftermarket head unit and speakers. Acquired by the seller in 2024, this Firebird Formula is offered with a clean Nevada title in the name of the seller’s trust.

The exterior was disassembled before being repainted in white with blue stripes, and photos taken during the process are provided in the gallery. The weather seals and glass is said to have been replaced. Details include front and rear spoilers, dual hood scoops, an Endura front bumper, aftermarket headlights, and quad exhaust outlets. Close-up photos of the paint, trim, and panel fitment are provided in the gallery.

The 15″ honeycomb-style wheels are mounted with Mastercraft Avenger G/T tires. The car rides on a coilover suspension and tubular control arms, and it is equipped with power steering. Braking is provided by front discs and rear drums.

Sound-deadening material was applied during the refurbishment, after which the headliner, sun visors, door panels, carpets, and dashboard were replaced and the front buckets and split rear seats were reupholstered in black vinyl with blue cloth inserts. Appointments include a center console, air conditioning, and a retro-look stereo linked to aftermarket speakers. The dome light does not work.

The Formula steering wheel fronts a machine-turned dashboard fascia housing a 160-mph speedometer. The five-digit odometer shows 71k miles, and the seller states that less than 500 miles have been added since completion of the refurbishment.
The 350ci V8 was rebuilt under prior ownership, and it is equipped with an Edelbrock intake manifold and valve covers along with an MSD ignition coil.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a Turbo Hydra-Matic three-speed automatic transmission. The dual exhaust system features an H-pipe midsection and Flowmaster mufflers, and the frame was refinished during the build.
The current Nevada title notes an exempt odometer brand.

This 2001 Jaguar XKR convertible has 49k miles following registration history in California, and it remained in the care of its original owner until May 2024. Finished in Titanium over Oatmeal leather, the car is powered by a supercharged 4.0-liter V8 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Features include a power-retractable black soft top, 18″ Double Five alloy wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, navigation, an Alpine sound system, a remote CD changer, and automatic climate control. This XKR convertible is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.
The car is finished in Titanium (LGL) and features a power-retractable black convertible soft top, fog lights, hood vents, a power antenna, and polished exhaust outlets.

The 18″ Double Five alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car is equipped with four-piston brake calipers over ventilated rotors as well as a computer-controlled adaptive suspension system. The brake fluid was replaced in June 2024.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in Oatmeal leather, and interior features include woodgrain veneers, navigation, an Alpine sound system, a cassette stereo, a remote CD changer, and automatic climate control.

The wood- and leather-rimmed steering wheel frames a 170-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 49k miles, approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership.
The supercharged 4.0-liter AJ V8 was factory rated at 370 horsepower and 387 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in June 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Alpine Sound System w/Remote CD Changer

description: This 2016 BMW M235iR is one of a limited number of factory-built race cars sent to the US, and it was purchased new by the seller and used in World Racing League and SCCA events. The car is finished in white with Motorsport stripes and white #6 roundels, and power comes from a replacement 3.0-liter N55 inline-six mated with a paddle-shifted eight-speed Steptronic automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. It was modified with the installation of the M240iR conversion package, the Hot Climate package, GT4 wing endplates, an M4 auxiliary radiator, an off-road exhaust system, and a Motorsport EVO suspension with solid heim joint control arms. Additional equipment includes an air jack system, motorsport-tuned Dynamic Stability Control, and antilock disc brakes with PFC front calipers as well as 18″ BBS wheels, an adjustable carbon-fiber rear wing, a rearview camera, a roll cage, air conditioning, a Cool Shirt system, an OMP racing seat, a Motorola radio, an AiM data logger. This M235iR is now offered on a bill of sale in Stilwell, Kansas, with service records and a clean Carfax report.

The M235i Racing featured flared fenders along with revised bumpers and side skirts compared to a standard M235i. This example is finished in white with blue, purple, and red Motorsport stripes and white #6 roundels. A replacement front bumper, grille, hood, and underbody panel were installed in March 2019, and additional equipment includes carbon-fiber mirror caps, a rearview camera, and an adjustable carbon-fiber rear wing with GT4 endplates as well as a rear tow strap and dual exhaust outlets.

Black-finished 18″ split-spoke BBS wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport slicks. The car is equipped with an air jack system as well as motorsport-specific versions of ABS, Dynamic Stability Control, and Automatic Stability Control. The suspension was modified with Motorsport EVO solid heim joint control arms, and replacement rear air jacks were installed in April 2021. Braking is handled by PFC four-piston fixed calipers up front and two-piston calipers at the rear.

The cockpit features a carbon-fiber transmission tunnel, footwells, and door panels with pull straps in addition to a factory 2-series dashboard.
