It features an Alexander Automotive Engineering OHV cylinder head, a counterweighted crankshaft, full-pressure oiling, dual Stromberg 97 carburetors, a Datsun-sourced dual-coil distributor, and a finned valve cover. The radiator is equipped with an electric cooling fan. An invoice for the engine build can be seen in the gallery.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a three-speed manual transmission that consists of a 1932 case and 1939 Ford gears.
The car is titled in Washington as a 1932 Ford Tudor, and the title carries a 2008 “Classic” brand from the state.

This 1962 Ford Falcon Ranchero was refurbished in 2012 and was purchased by the seller in 2015. It is powered by a 170ci inline-six paired with a three-speed manual transmission and is finished in red with a white roof. Equipment includes a simulated hood scoop, 14″ steel wheels, chrome hubcaps and trim rings, drum brakes, a heater, an AM radio, and chrome bumpers, while the cabin is trimmed in red and white vinyl upholstery. This Ranchero is now offered in Maryland at no reserve with a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The pickup was repainted in red with a white roof during the refurbishment in 2012, and details include a cargo bed with a drop-down tailgate as well as a simulated hood scoop, a polished grille, and chrome-finished front and rear bumpers.

The 14″ steel wheels feature bright hubcaps and trim rings and are mounted with Decathlon white-stripe tires, and a spare is mounted behind the driver’s seat. The pickup is equipped with front coil and rear leaf springs. Stopping power is provided by front and rear drums.

The cabin features a bench seat upholstered in red and white vinyl, and matching trim adorns the door panels. Interior appointments include a heater, vent windows, an AM radio, seatbelts, and a dashboard storage compartment.

The three-spoke steering wheel fronts a horizontal 100-mph speedometer and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 32k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.
The 170ci inline-six was factory rated at 101 horsepower and 156 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a column-shifted three-speed manual transmission.
Photos taken during the refurbishment are provided in the gallery.
Decoding the data plate reveals the following production information:

This 1986 Mercury Capri ASC McLaren convertible is one of 245 examples modified by the American Sunroof Company for the model year and was acquired new by the owner’s father at Hines Park Lincoln-Mercury on June 15, 1987. ASC additions include a tan convertible top that stows in place of the rear seat as well as a revised trunk lid, top cover, body panels, fog lights, and clear aero headlight and taillight covers. Power is provided by a 5.0-liter V8 paired with a five-speed manual transmission and the car is finished in black over tan leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes a Kenwood cassette stereo, a leather shift knob, a 140-mph speedometer, a Whistler radar detector, basketweave 15″ wheels, and Recaro bucket seats with headrest speakers. This Capri ASC Mclaren has 81k miles and is now offered with service records, repair manuals, historical documents and pictures, an owner’s manual, and a Michigan title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in black with a tan soft top and ASC additions include a revised front fascia, trunk lid, body-color top cover, side skirts, ASC McLaren badging, and clear aero headlight and taillight covers. The car was damaged while being serviced at a dealership in 1988 and subsequent repairs included replacing the bumper cover, header panel, grille, and fender. There is a crack in the front air dam and paint and body blemishes are displayed in the gallery. The seller notes that the roof latch on the convertible cover is missing a spring and that the foglights do not work.
Basketweave 15″ wheels wear 5.0 SC center caps and are mounted with BFGoodrich Comp T/A tires. Power steering and front disc brakes were factory equipped.

The Recaro front bucket seats have headrest-mounted speakers and are trimmed in tan leather upholstery. Wood veneer lines the dashboard and center console and equipment includes air conditioning, a Kenwood cassette stereo, a leather shift knob, a Whistler radar detector, and power windows and door locks. The radio does not have reception and the aftermarket alarm key fobs are missing. The seller notes that the clutch pedal requires adjustment.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for amperage, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The “O’Boost EGO” and “Low Fuel” warning lights remain illuminated at all times. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 81k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.
The 5.0-liter V8 features multiport fuel injection and was rated at 200 horsepower and 285 lb-ft of torque when new. The seller notes that the electrical system has a slow drain.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission.

The dealer sales addendum lists the total price of $24,714 and the Manufacturer’s literature, Bloomfield Collision repair invoice, McLaren parts catalog, repair manuals, historical documents and pictures, and service records accompany the vehicle.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage report and a duplicate title issued.
The Michigan title lists a “Duplicate” brand.

This 2024 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 RS was ordered with over $50k in options, including the Weissach Package, 20″ forged magnesium wheels, Porsche Ceramic-Composite Brakes, a front-axle lift system, and more as detailed below. It is finished in white over black leather and Arctic Grey Race-Tex and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle. Equipment includes a Bose surround-sound system, CFRP full bucket seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, and PCM with navigation. The current owner purchased the car new and it now has 19 miles. This 718 Cayman GT4 RS is now offered in California on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean Georgia title.

The 718 GT4 RS features lightweight rear glass, vented front fenders, additional upper intakes, and a larger swan-neck rear wing when compared with the contemporary 718 GT4. This example is finished in white (C9A) and features a partially painted carbon-fiber front trunk lid as well as bi-xenon headlights, power-folding side mirrors, ParkAssist rear parking sensors, and integrated dual exhaust outlets exiting through the rear diffuser.

The 20″ forged magnesium wheels were a $15,640 option and are finished in Satin White Gold Metallic and mounted with 245/35 front and 295/30 rear Dunlop Sport Maxx Race 2 tires. This example was ordered with Porsche Ceramic-Composite Brakes (PCCB) with yellow-finished calipers as well as a front-axle lift system. The car is also equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM).

The carbon-fiber reinforced-plastic (CFRP) full bucket seats are upholstered in black leather with Arctic Grey Race-Tex inserts, stitching, and “Weissach RS” headrest embroidery. Appointments include carbon-fiber trim, a Bose surround-sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and PCM infotainment with navigation. A fire extinguisher is mounted in the passenger footwell.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features shift paddles and fronts a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline flanked by a 200-mph speedometer and a configurable digital display. The Chrono Package specified a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 19 miles.

The mid-mounted 4.0L flat-six resides beneath a carbon-fiber cover in the rear cargo area and was factory rated at 493 horsepower and 331 lb-ft of torque. Power is routed to the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch transaxle, and the car is equipped with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV) and a mechanically locking differential.
The window sticker notes initial delivery to the Porsche Experience Center in Atlanta, Georgia, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total price of $217,880.
No Carfax report is available for this vehicle as no entries have been generated yet.
listing_details: Satin White Gold Metallic 20" Forged Magnesium Wheels

description: This 1997 Ford F-250 HD XLT is a regular-cab 4×4 pickup that remained with one owner in Illinois until the selling dealer’s 2024 acquisition. Power comes from a 5.8-liter V8 linked to a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a limited-slip rear differential. The truck is finished in Raven Black over Opal Gray cloth, and equipment includes 16″ eight-lug wheels, manually locking front hubs, a sliding rear window, a bed mat, a tonneau cover, air conditioning, cruise control, and a factory AM/FM cassette stereo. This F-250 is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Illinois title.
The truck is finished in Raven Black and equipped with a sliding rear window, a rear step bumper, a bed mat, and a snap-down tonneau cover.

Eight-lug 16″ wheels are mounted with 235/85 Kelly Edge AT tires. Braking is handled by power-assisted front discs and rear drums, with the latter featuring ABS. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs.

The bench seat is trimmed in Opal Gray cloth and is accompanied by a color-coordinated dashboard and door panels. Amenities include air conditioning, cruise control, power windows and locks, and a factory AM/FM cassette stereo.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames an 85-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, voltage, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 43k miles. The Carfax report shows a mileage reading of 71k recorded in 2009 along with a mileage inconsistency in 2024.
The 5.8-liter Windsor V8 was factory rated at 205 horsepower and 328 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission, a dual-range transfer case, and a limited-slip rear differential.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned mileage inconsistency.

This 2012 Land Rover Range Rover Sport HSE was optioned with the GT Limited Edition trim package, and it has 76k miles. Finished in Orkney Grey over Ebony leather and Lunar Alcantara upholstery, it has electronic air suspension, a locking center differential, 20″ wheels, xenon headlights, roof rails, power-folding mirrors, a power-operated tailgate, touchscreen infotainment, an 825-watt Harman Kardon sound system, and heated front and rear seats. Power comes from a 5.0-liter AJ133 V8 linked with a six-speed automatic transmission. The vehicle was acquired in November 2023 by the selling dealer, who reports the suspension was subsequently serviced, and the timing chains, guides, and cam sprockets were replaced. This L320 is offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, 2023 service records, and a clean Massachusetts title.

GT Limited Edition elements include flush-fitting bumper covers, a body-colored extended hatch spoiler and side skirts, and dual quadrangle exhaust finishers. Damage to the rear is listed in a November 2017 entry on the Carfax report.

Diamond-turned 20″ wheels are mounted with 275/40 Kumho Solus Majesty 9 TA91 tires. Height-adjustable air suspension and selectable Terrain Response driving modes are additional elements. The brake hoses, rotors, pads, and fluid were replaced in July 2023, and the selling dealer reports the front lower control arms were replaced in December 2023.

The heated and power-adjustable front seats are trimmed in Ebony leather with Lunar Alcantara inserts, and Grand Black wood trim accents the cabin, which has a glass sunroof, a 17-speaker Harman Kardon sound system, touchscreen infotainment, and heated rear seats.

Mounted on a power-adjustable column, the heated steering wheel has shift paddles, and the driver is aided by a heated windshield, a rearview camera, a voice-recognition system, keyless start, parking sensors, automatic headlights, and rain-sensing wipers. The digital odometer indicates 76k miles.

The 5.0-liter V8 was factory rated at 375 horsepower and 375 lb-ft of torque. The spark plugs were replaced in July 2023, and the timing chains, guides, and cam sprockets were replaced in December 2023 according to the selling dealer, who adds that the cooling system was also serviced in preparation for the sale.

Power is routed to all four wheels through a ZF six-speed automatic transmission, and a dual-range transfer case with an electronic center differential. The fuel tank shield and transfer case fluid were replaced in July 2023.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage entry.

attributes.value: Rover Range Rover Sport HSE GT Limited Edition

description: This 1961 Porsche 356B coupe was originally delivered to Competition Motors of Hollywood, California and reportedly remained registered to the same family for the last five decades. The car is powered by a replacement 1.6-liter flat-four paired with a four-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Signal Red over black leatherette. Features include 15″ steel wheels, a louvered decklid, a sunroof, dual bullet-style side mirrors, vent windows, an AM/FM radio, and front bucket seats. This 356B coupe is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a copy of the Kardex, the owner’s manual, service records beginning in 1968, spare parts, and a clean Colorado title.

The T5 body was introduced for the 1960 model year with revised front-end styling, including raised bumpers and headlights along with a redesigned front trunk lid handle. This Reutter-built example came finished from the factory in Signal Red (6011) and was repainted in 1981, at which time the left rocker panel was repaired. The rear bumper was replaced and the rear end repaired following an accident in 2005. Equipment includes a louvered decklid, a sliding steel sunroof, bullet-style side mirrors, a windshield washer system, body-color bumpers, and “Super 90” badges. The passenger vent window has been replaced. There are blemishes on the bumpers.

The 15″ vented steel wheels wear Deluxe hubcaps and are mounted with Continental ContiProContact tires measuring 175/65. The car was factory equipped with drum brakes at each corner. The brakes are soft.
The front bucket seats and rear jump seats have been reupholstered in black leatherette, and interior appointments include a Blaupunkt AM/FM radio, lap belts, and a body-color painted dashboard.

The three-spoke steering wheel features frames green-letter VDO instrumentation including a 120-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 5,500-rpm redline as well as a combination gauge for oil temperature and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 47k miles, and total mileage is unknown.

The replacement 1.6-liter flat-four was installed in the late 1960s and is equipped with dual two-barrel carburetors missing the air cleaners. A leakdown test from October 2023 is viewable in the gallery. The seller notes a strong fuel smell while driving and states that the carburetors need adjustment.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle. The seller states that the shifter is worn and requires new bushings. A hole has been cut in the front battery box area as shown in the gallery.
The copy of the Kardex lists the factory colors, serial numbers, and a build date of January 26, 1961.

This 1974 MGB Roadster spent time in Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, and Texas before the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2024. Finished in British Racing Green over tan vinyl, the car is powered by a 1.8-liter inline-four paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a Weber carburetor, a performance muffler, front disc brakes, 14″ Minator wheels, a luggage rack, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, a Kenwood Bluetooth stereo, and a cabin heater. Work in 2021 consisted of replacing the throttle cable and rebuilding the cylinder head. This MGB is offered by the selling dealer with tools, service records, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The car is refinished in British Racing Green and features a black soft top and boot, door-mounted mirrors, a chrome luggage rack, and chrome bumpers with overriders. Previous bodywork is noted on the passenger door.

Eight-spoke 14″ Minator alloy wheels are mounted with 185/70 Douglas Xtra-Trac II tires. A spare wheel and tire are located in the trunk. Braking is provided by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The bucket seats and door cards were retrimmed under previous ownership in tan vinyl. Woodgrain trim accents the dashboard, center console, and shift knob, and appointments include a cabin heater, black sun visors, a locking glove box, a passenger-side map pocket, MG-branded black carpeted floor mats, and a Kenwood Bluetooth stereo.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel fronts Smiths instrumentation including a 120-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges displaying oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 27k miles.
The 1.8-liter inline-four features a Weber carburetor. Work in 2021 consisted of replacing the throttle cable and rebuilding the cylinder head with replacement valves, seats, and guides.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission. The exhaust is equipped with a performance muffler.

This 1967 Chevrolet Corvette convertible was delivered new to Lyle Chevrolet in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio, and was refurbished under prior ownership, reportedly in 2016, with work that included refinishing the body in red as well as re-trimming the interior in black vinyl. Power is provided by a 427ci L71 V8 linked to a four-speed manual transmission and a Positraction differential. The car is equipped with a removable hardtop, a black soft top, an aftermarket air conditioning system, an aftermarket digital stereo, 15″ Rally wheels, four-wheel disc brakes, power steering, and side-exit exhaust pipes. This C2 Corvette convertible was purchased by the seller in 2022 and is now offered with an NCRS Shipping Data Report, parts records, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The fiberglass body was delivered from the factory in Ermine White and has been refinished in red, reportedly in 2016. Exterior features include a removable hardtop, a black soft top, a black-striped stinger hood, retractable headlights, chrome split bumpers, fender vents, a driver-side mirror, and a side-exit exhaust system with heat shields.

The 15″ Rally wheels wear chrome trim rings and center caps and are mounted with P225/70r15 BFGoodrich redline tires. The C2 Corvette featured fully independent suspension, with upper and lower control arms at the front and a three-link setup with a transverse leaf spring at the rear. This example is equipped with power steering, and braking is handled by power-assisted four-wheel discs.

The cabin features two bucket seats upholstered in replacement black vinyl as well as color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include aftermarket air conditioning, a heater, a vertical push-button AM/FM radio, an analog clock, and lap belts.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level, amperage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 54k miles, fewer than 500 of which were added under current ownership. Total mileage is unknown.
The 427ci L71 V8 is equipped with three two-barrel carburetors and was factory rated at 435 horsepower and 460 lb-ft of torque.
The engine stamping is pictured. The JE suffix corresponds with a 435-horsepower, 427ci L71 V8 for use with a manual transmission.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.
Decoding the trim tag reveals:

This 1977 Ford F-250 Custom 4×4 pickup was delivered new to Wilson Motors of Corvallis Oregon, and it was registered in Tennessee before it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024. Powered by a 400ci V8 linked with a three-speed automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case, the truck is finished in two-tone metallic green over green vinyl and cloth upholstery. Equipment consists of 16″ alloy wheels, manually locking front hubs, a headache rack, a bed-mounted storage box, a four-barrel Edelbrock carburetor, and a fabricated dual exhaust system. This F-250 Custom is now offered in Oregon with a Deluxe Marti report and a clean Tennessee title.

This long-bed Styleside example was finished in Light Jade Green (R) from the factory, and it was repainted in the same shade with a Dark Jade Metallic roof and accents circa 2019, according to the selling dealer. Exterior details include a headache rack, a bed-mounted storage box, dual towing mirrors, a sliding rear window, a chrome front bumper, an aftermarket locking fuel door, black spray-on bedliner, a steel rear bumper with a lowered tow ball, and aluminum bodyside moldings with vinyl inserts. Paint bubbles are visible around the roof drip rails, and additional photos of exterior imperfections are viewable in the gallery below.

The 16″ alloy wheels are mounted with 315/75 Mudstar Radial M/T tires. The truck is equipped with manually locking front hubs and power steering, and braking is provided by power-assisted front discs and rear drums. There are areas of corrosion on the wheels.

The cab features a bench seat upholstered in green vinyl with cloth inserts as well as a color-coordinated upper dashboard pad and door panels. Additional details include a heater, a gun rack, a glove box, and camouflage-pattern floor coverings. There are cracks in the top of the dashboard, the stereo has been removed from the dashboard, the fabric on the right side of the bench is torn, and a section of the trim on the left side of the bench is missing.

The two-spoke steering wheel frames an 85-mph speedometer as well as gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, battery charge status, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 58k miles, a handful of which were added under current ownership.

The 400ci V8 has been fitted with an Edelbrock four-barrel carburetor and a chrome-plated Edelbrock air cleaner housing. The selling dealer reports that the engine runs roughly until it has warmed up.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a three-speed Cruise-O-Matic automatic transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck has been fitted with a fabricated dual exhaust system that terminates in front of the rear axle.
The Deluxe Marti Report lists colors, equipment, and production statistics.

This 1991 BMW M5 has remained registered in California since new and is finished in Sterling Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather upholstery. Powered by a 3.5-liter S38 inline-six paired with a five-speed manual transmission, the car has been fitted with Bilstein dampers, H&R springs, and a Dinan ECU chip. Additional equipment includes 17″ M System I wheels with “turbine” covers, a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, and dual-zone air conditioning. It was acquired by the selling dealer in 2023, and work performed in preparation for the sale included adjusting the valves and replacing the valve cover gasket, distributor cap and rotor, spark plugs, tires, front control arms, thrust arms, shock mounts, rear trailing arm links, and tie rods. This E34 M5 has 168k miles and is offered at no reserve with spare parts, a window sticker, service records, manufacturer’s literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Sterling Silver Metallic (244) and features fog lights, a sunroof, dual exhaust outlets, and a revised front air dam, rear valance, and rocker panels when compared to the standard E34. There are dings on the front doors and paint chips around the body. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Factory 17″ M-System I wheels feature directional turbine-style covers and are fitted with Toyo Proxes Sport tires that were mounted in 2024. Bilstein dampers and H&R springs have been added, and the self-leveling rear suspension has been removed. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. Work completed since 2023 included changing the brake fluid and power steering fluid and replacing the front control arms, thrust arms, shock mounts, rear trailing arm links, and tie rods. There are curb marks on the wheels. The factory self-leveling suspension components are included in the sale.

The cabin features black Nappa leather covering the heated power-adjustable front sport seats as well as the door panels and center console. An obsolete mobile phone remains housed in the center console, and amenities include cruise control, a Sony head unit, an onboard computer, and dual-zone air conditioning, the latter of which was recharged in preparation for the sale. The selling dealer states that the rear door panels are delaminating.

The steering wheel frames a 180-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 168k miles, approximately 900 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.5-liter S38B36 inline-six features dual-overhead camshafts along with individual throttle bodies and was factory rated at 310 horsepower and 266 lb-ft of torque. Work performed since 2023 included changing the oil, adjusting the valves, and replacing the valve cover gasket, distributor cap and rotor, spark plugs, and exhaust hangers. A Dinan ECU chip has been added.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Getrag 280/5 five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The transmission is said to have been replaced in 2019, and work completed during the selling dealer’s ownership included changing the transmission fluid and replacing the transmission mounts. The seller states that the vehicle passed a California emissions test in June of this year.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.
listing_details: 17" M System I Wheels w/ "Turbine" Covers

description: This 2000 Toyota 4Runner SR5 is powered by a 3.4-liter 5VZ-FE V6 linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The truck is finished in Millennium Silver Metallic over gray cloth and features 16″ alloy wheels, a sunroof, a roof rack, running boards, air conditioning, cruise control, a Pioneer touchscreen head unit, and a power rear window. The selling dealer purchased the truck in May 2024 and it now has 131k miles. This 4Runner is offered with a clean Maryland title.

The truck is finished in Millennium Silver Metallic and features a sunroof, running boards, a roof rack, mud flaps, skid plates, a rear wind deflector, and a rear window wiper. A November 2003 entry on the Carfax report notes that the truck was inspected after damage due to vandalism, though no further details are available.

The 16″ alloy wheels are mounted with 265/70 Goodyear Wrangler Duratrac tires that show 2023 date codes. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums that were replaced in July 2024 along with the front shocks, front coil springs, and the power steering line.

The cabin features gray cloth upholstery on the seats along with a color-matching dash, center console, door panel inserts, and carpets. Amenities include air conditioning, a Pioneer touchscreen head unit, cruise control, a digital clock, and a power rear window.
The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 110-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 5,500-rpm redline, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 131k miles.

The 3.4-liter 5VZ-FE V6 was factory rated at 183 horsepower and 217 lb-ft of torque. In March 2023 the battery, air filter, and spark plugs were replaced. An oil change was carried out in April 2024 and the valve cover gasket was replaced in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The clutch assembly was replaced in August 2021 and the transfer case fluid and differential fluids were changed in March 2023. Areas of rust are visible on the underside.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage report.

This 1967 Jaguar XKE Series I roadster was purchased by the owner in 1974 and was the subject of a refurbishment that was completed in 2014. It is powered by a 4.2-liter inline-six linked to a four-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Opalescent Maroon over tan leather, the car is equipped with a black soft top, open sealed-beam headlights, 15″ wire wheels, power-assisted disc brakes, triple windshield wipers, and a heater. This XKE Series I roadster is now offered on dealer consignment with a Jaguar Heritage Trust Certificate, service records, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The car was refinished in its factory Opalescent Maroon in 2016. Equipment includes a black soft top, sealed-beam open headlights, a louvered clamshell hood, wraparound chrome bumpers, bright trim, a driver-side mirror, triple windshield wipers, and dual exhaust outlets.
The 15″ wire wheels are secured by two-eared knock-offs and are mounted with 205/70X15 Dunlap Signature Ii tires. Braking is provided by four-wheel discs with inboard-mounted rear rotors.
Originally trimmed in black, the cabin was reupholstered in tan leather in the 2010s. Interior appointments include black vinyl dash trim, a sliding rearview mirror, a Blaupunkt radio, and a heater.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel frames a Smiths 160-mph speedometer and 6k-rpm tachometer, while auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and amperage are located in the center of the dashboard. The five-digit odometer shows 64k miles, approximately 6k of which were added since 1974.
The 4.2-liter inline-six features triple SU carburetors and was factory rated at 265 horsepower and 283 lb-ft of torque. It was rebuilt in 1987 and refreshed again during the 2010s build.
The cylinder head stamp matches the number listed on the Heritage Trust certificate.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a full-synchromesh four-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Jaguar Heritage Trust Production Record Trace certificate shows the original colors and drivetrain numbers as well as the build and dispatch dates.

This 1982 Fiat Spider 2000 is finished in Safari Ivory over tan vinyl upholstery and is powered by a 2.0-liter inline-four paired with a five-speed manual transmission. It is equipped with a tan soft top, a top boot, 14″ Cromodora alloy wheels, and four-wheel disc brakes along with an Alpine cassette stereo and a heater. The car was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024 and was previously listed on BaT in March 2024. This Spider 2000 shows 109k miles and is offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean South Dakota title.

The car is finished in Safari Ivory (285) and features a folding tan convertible soft top, a convertible top boot, a “2000” badge, dual side mirrors, and vent windows. A chip in the trailing edge of the left door and a blemish in the right-rear quarter panel are highlighted in the gallery below. The windshield wipers do not work.

The 14″ Cromodora alloy wheels are mounted with 185/60 Toyo Extensa A/S tires showing date codes from 2016. The car was factory equipped with an independent front suspension with a sway bar and coil springs as well as worm-and-roller gear steering. Stopping power is handled by discs at all four corners.

The cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench upholstered in tan vinyl joined by matching door panel inserts, a color-coordinated center console, and wood veneer accents. Interior appointments include a wood shift knob, a locking glove box, an Alpine cassette stereo, and a heater. Cracks in the upper dashboard, missing front seat belt guides, and a tear in the side of the front passenger seat are shown in photos below.

The three-spoke steering wheel fronts Veglia Borletti instrumentation consisting of an 85-mph speedometer, a tachometer, a clock, and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 109k miles.

The 2.0-liter inline-four is equipped with fuel injection and was factory rated at 102 horsepower and 110 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission. An underhood label notes that a timing belt service was performed in November 2020.
Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 2008 Mercedes-Benz CL600 is finished in black over black leather upholstery and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V12 paired with a five-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes 18″ staggered-width five-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, bi-xenon headlights, Distronic adaptive cruise control, Parktronic, Night View Assist, Keyless Go, heated and ventilated dynamic multi-contour front seats, Poplar wood trim, a rearview camera, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2024 and it now has 95k miles. This C216 is now offered in Florida at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in Black (040) and features a pillarless roof design with fully retracting side windows. Additional exterior equipment includes active bi-xenon headlights with washers and cornering lights as well as fog lights, a glass power sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and heated side mirrors.

The 18″ staggered-width five-spoke wheels are mounted with 255/45 front and 275/45 rear Continental ContiProContact tires that were installed in September 2023. Stopping power is provided by disc brakes with ventilated rotors at each corner. The car is equipped with an Electronic Stability Program and an Active Body Control suspension.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in black leather that extends to the dashboard and door panels. Ash wood trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Amenities include a rearview camera, a Harman Kardon LOGIC7 sound system, heated and ventilated dynamic multi-contour front seats, a power rear sunshade, Distronic adaptive cruise control, Parktronic, Night View Assist, Keyless Go, dual-zone automatic climate control, and COMAND infotainment with navigation.
The four-spoke heated steering wheel frames a digital 160-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 95k miles.
The twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V12 was factory rated at 510 horsepower and 612 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was carried out in June 2023.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a 5G-Tronic five-speed automatic transmission.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

This 1980 Suzuki LJ80 4×4 was first sold in Colombia, and it was reportedly refurbished in 2019 before being acquired by the seller in 2021 and imported to the US in 2023. Refinished in yellow over black vinyl, the truck is powered by a 797cc inline-four linked with a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. It also features a Mikuni carburetor, a beige soft top, a white-finished front bumper with yellow-lens auxiliary lights, and black-finished 15″ steel wheels as well as a Suzuki-branded AM radio. Work in August 2023 is said to have included changing the valve cover gasket, oil pan gasket, air filter, oil, and battery. This LJ80 is offered with a 2019 Club Colombiano de Automóviles Antiguos y Clásicos judging sheet, refurbishment photos, and a clean Florida title that lists the truck as a 1981 model.
The body has been refinished in yellow. Features include a beige soft top, a white-finished front bumper with yellow-lens auxiliary lights, and Suzuki-branded rear mud flaps.
Black-finished 15″ steel wheels are mounted with Lima Caucho tires. The truck rides on leaf springs at all four corners.

The front bucket seats and the rear jump seats are trimmed in black vinyl. The body-color steel dashboard houses an AM radio, a passenger-side grab handle, and a glove compartment with a black-finished lockable door.

The two-spoke steering wheel frames a 120-km/h speedometer, gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level, and warning lamps. The five-digit odometer shows 65k kilometers (~41k miles), approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.

The 797cc inline-four is equipped with a Mikuni carburetor, and it drives the rear or all four wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a dual-range transfer case. The seller states that the valve cover gasket, oil pan gasket, air filter, and battery were replaced in August 2023, at which time an oil change was performed.
Photos illustrating various stages of the refurbishment can be viewed in the gallery below along with a 2019 Club Colombiano de Automóviles Antiguos y Clásicos judging sheet.
The current Florida title describes the truck as a 1981 model.

This 2014 Audi Q7 Prestige S Line is powered by a turbodiesel 3.0-liter TDI V6 linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission and Quattro all-wheel drive, and it is finished in Graphite Gray Metallic over black leather. Equipment includes the S Line Plus Package, Audi Adaptive Xenon headlights, a panoramic sunroof, 19″ multi-spoke wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, Audi MMI Navigation infotainment, cruise control, a Bose sound system, roof rails, and four-zone automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the truck in 2024, and it has 91k miles. This Q7 is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual and a clean California title.

The truck is finished in Graphite Gray Metallic (LM7W), and exterior equipment includes Audi Adaptive Xenon headlights, a panoramic sunroof, roof rails, a rear spoiler, black window trim, and a rear window wiper. The Carfax report notes “minor damage” to the rear and right rear in March 2014 along with an accident resulting in “moderate damage” in October 2014. The selling dealer notes evidence of a front bumper repaint, and rock chips are present on the hood.

The 19″ multi-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with a mix of Yokohama and Continental tires. Braking is provided by gray-finished calipers over ventilated discs at each corner. The brake pads were replaced in May 2024.

The cabin houses heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in black leather that extends to the rear bench and door panels. Other interior details include Audi MMI Navigation infotainment, a CD stereo, a Bose sound system, cruise control, and four-zone automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel fronts a 180-mph speedometer, a 6k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 91k miles, approximately 800 of which were added under current ownership.

The turbodiesel 3.0-liter TDI V6 was factory rated at 240 horsepower and 406 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale, and the battery was replaced in 2023. Power is routed to all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission and Quattro all-wheel drive.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage and accidents and lists an open recall.

This 1966 Austin-Healey 3000 BJ8 Mk III is finished in British Racing Green Dark over black leather and is powered by a 2.9-liter inline-six paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Features include a black soft top, 15″ knock-off wire wheels, front disc brakes, a top boot, a tonneau cover, a hood scoop, a cabin heater, and front bucket seats. The car was acquired by the seller in 2023, and work has since involved rebuilding the generator, adjusting the valves, and replacing the sway bar bushings, carburetor gaskets, and oil pan gasket. This 3000 Mk III is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a shop manual, an initial purchase order, a car cover, and a clean Washington title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in British Racing Green Dark (GN29) and features a top boot, a tonneau cover, a hood scoop, bright trim, and chrome bumpers with overriders. A replacement black soft top was installed in 2017. The seller notes paint blemishes, a ding and bubbling on the deck lid, and rust-through in the trunk well. The driver’s door latch occasionally sticks.
The 15″ knock-off wire wheels are mounted with 180HR15 Michelin XAS tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums. The sway bar bushings were replaced in 2023.

The 2+2 cabin features bucket seats that were reupholstered under prior ownership in black leather with red piping, and interior appointments include a cabin heater, a center console, a locking glovebox, and wood trim. There are cracks in the finish of the wood trim.

The banjo-style steering wheel frames Smiths black-dial instrumentation consisting of a 140-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, a fuel-level gauge, and a combination gauge displaying oil pressure and water temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 51k miles, approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership.

The 2.9-liter inline-six featured dual SU HD8 carburetors from the factory for a rating of 150 horsepower and 173 lb-ft of torque. Work in 2023 included rebuilding the generator and replacing the oil pan gasket and carburetor gaskets. A valve adjustment was performed in 2024.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission with Laycock-de Normanville electric overdrive. Leaks are noted from the steering box and differential and the undercoating is flaking.

This 2011 Bentley Continental Supersports convertible remained registered in New Jersey through the current owner’s acquisition in 2019, and it now has 27k miles. Power is supplied by a twin-turbocharged 6.0-liter W12 linked with a six-speed automatic transaxle, an all-wheel-drive system, and a Torsen center differential. The car is finished in Ice over Beluga leather with diamond-stitch Alcantara inserts, and it features 20″ Supersports alloy wheels, an adaptive air suspension, a replacement power-retractable black soft top, xenon headlights, parking sensors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a backup camera, heated massaging front comfort seats, carbon-fiber interior trim, navigation, a 12-speaker audio system, multi-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control. This Continental Supersports convertible is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The Supersports model is approximately 250lbs lighter than the contemporary Continental GT, and it features Smoked Steel-finished grille meshes, headlight bezels, and trim as well as a revised front fascia, smoked taillight lenses, and flared quarter panels to accommodate a wider rear track. This example is finished in Ice and features a power-operated black soft top that was replaced in 2021 by Bentley of Paramus, New Jersey. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, front and rear parking sensors, polished trim, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and integrated dual exhaust outlets with polished finishers. There are scrapes on the front bumper cover, and additional photos of the exterior condition are provided in the gallery below.

Black-finished 20″ Supersports 10-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 275/35 Pirelli P Zero tires that show 2022 production codes. The car is equipped with an adaptive air suspension that includes driver controls for ride height and damper settings. Stopping power is provided by Bentley-branded calipers fitted over ceramic-composite rotors at each corner. The brake fluid was flushed in February 2024. Paint chips are noted on the right-front and left-rear wheels.

Optional heated, massaging, and power-adjustable front comfort seats are trimmed in Beluga leather with diamond-stitch Alcantara seat inserts and Supersports backrest embroidery. Appointments include a dash-mounted Breitling analog clock, carbon-fiber interior trim, a rearview camera, a navigation system, a CD stereo, a 12-speaker audio system, multi-zone automatic climate control, and cruise control.

The multifunction steering wheel sits ahead of column-mounted paddle shifters and frames a 210-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 27k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The twin-turbocharged 6.0-liter W12 was factory rated at 621 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in February 2024, and the selling dealer reports that the spark plugs and coil packs were replaced within the last 100 miles.
Power is sent to all four wheels through a ZF 6HP six-speed automatic transaxle and a Torsen center differential.
The window sticker lists factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $292,260.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
listing_details: Beluga Leather w/Diamond Stitch Alcantara Inserts

description: This 1964 Porsche 356SC coupe was built on March 9, 1964 and spent time in New Mexico and California before being brought to Colorado, where it was purchased by the seller’s father in 1985 before ownership was transferred to the seller in 1991. The car is finished in Light Ivory over a black interior and is powered by a replacement 1.6-liter flat-four paired with a four-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes 15″ steel wheels, disc brakes, body-color bumpers, twin engine grilles, cloth front bucket seats, a cabin heater, a Blaupunkt cassette radio, and an analog clock. Work in 2024 consisted of adjusting the valves and replacing the glovebox, headlights, spare tire strap, and passenger vent window seal. This 356SC coupe is now offered with a copy of the Kardex, the owner’s manual, service records, a removed set of wheels, and other parts, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The Karmann-built body came finished from the factory in Light Ivory (6404) and was repainted in 1997. Features include an underside front tow ring, twin engine grilles, and body-color bumpers with bright guards. Replacement headlights and lenses were installed in 2024. The windshield washer system is inoperative and the seller notes paint imperfections, scratches on the driver’s window, various areas of touch up, and aged window seals. Bubbling and peeling around the body is pointed out in the gallery.

Chrome 15″ steel wheels wear Porsche crest hubcaps and are mounted with Falken ZE912 tires that show date codes from 2010 and measure 195/60. The car was factory equipped with disc brakes at each corner. The seller states that the tires should be replaced. The removed set of wheels and tires is included in the sale.

The front bucket seats were reupholstered in cloth in 1997, while the rear jump seats are trimmed in black leatherette. Interior appointments include a body-color painted dashboard, a cabin heater, lap belts, a Blaupunkt cassette radio, and an analog clock. A reproduction glovebox was installed in 2024 along with a replacement passenger vent window sea. The clock is inoperative, the carpeting on the center tunnel should be replaced, and there are tears on the vinyl behind the rear seats. An aftermarket gas heater is included in the sale.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation consisting of a central tachometer with a 5,500-rpm redline as well as a 120-mph speedometer and a combination gauge for oil temperature and fuel level. Auxiliary gauges for oil pressure and voltage have been added below the dash. The speedometer intermittently works and the five-digit odometer shows 29k miles. Total mileage is unknown.
The replacement 1.6-liter 616/16 flat-four was was rebuilt in the late 1980s. A Crane Cams electronic ignition system has been installed. The valves were adjusted in 2024.
Engine stamping KD*P*804237* is shown above, and a corresponding number is listed on the Kardex below the original engine number.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transaxle. There are various leaks from the engine and axle boots.
A copy of the Kardex is shown above and lists the factory colors and serial numbers.
The Colorado title is listed as a duplicate.

This 1969 Oldsmobile Ninety-Eight town sedan was delivered new to Story Oldsmobile in Lansing, Michigan, finished in Nassau Blue over blue cloth. It is powered by a 455ci Rocket V8 paired with a three-speed automatic transmission, and equipment includes power-assisted brakes, a limited-slip differential, power steering, rear fender skirts, a power-adjustable front seat, an AM/FM radio, air conditioning, a power trunk lid latch, and power windows. This Ninety-Eight was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024 and is now offered in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, and an Illinois title.
The car was finished from the factory in Nassau Blue and has been repainted. Exterior details include a driver-side mirror, quad headlights, and rear fender skirts.

Stock 15″ wheels are mounted with 225/75 Michelin whitewall tires showing pre-2000 date codes. The car came equipped from the factory with power steering, and braking is provided by power-assisted drums at each corner.

The seating surfaces are upholstered in blue cloth, and interior equipment includes a six-way power-adjustable front seat, an AM/FM radio, air conditioning, and power windows. Splits in the front bench upholstery can be viewed in the gallery.

The three-spoke steering wheel has a cracked rim and fronts a 120-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and a fuel-level gauge. The five-digit odometer shows 24k miles, approximately five of which were added under current ownership.
The 455ci Rocket V8 featured a four-barrel carburetor from the factory for a rating of 365 horsepower and 510 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a Turbo Hydra-Matic three-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. The muffler is said to have been recently replaced.
Decoding the trim tag reveals the following information:
The Illinois title is listed as a duplicate.

This 1971 Jaguar E-Type Series III 2+2 is finished in green over black leather upholstery and is powered by a 5.3-liter V12 mated to a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes knock-off wire wheels, an AM/FM stereo, air conditioning, and a heated rear window. The car reportedly remained with its prior owner for 43 years before being acquired by the current owner in 2017. This E-Type is now offered on dealer consignment with an owner’s manual, service records, and a clean Wisconsin title.
The car is finished in green and was repainted around 1997. Features include dual side mirrors, an antenna, a forward-hinged louvered hood, and quad exhaust outlets.

Wire-spoke 15″ wheels are mounted with 205/70 Pirelli P4000 Super Touring tires. The Series III E-Type was factory equipped with power steering and four-wheel disc brakes with inboard-mounted rear rotors.

The 2+2 cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in black leather as well as color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include a push-button AM/FM radio, air conditioning, and a heated rear window.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames Smiths instrumentation including a 160-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline. An analog clock along with auxiliary gauges for voltage, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level are mounted in the center stack. The five-digit odometer shows 47k miles.
The 5.3-liter V12 is equipped with quadruple Zenith-Stromberg carburetors and was rated at 314 horsepower and 349 lb-ft of torque when new.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission.

This 2006 Honda Z50J is a chrome-finished Monkey Limited model produced in limited numbers for the Japanese market. This example has been modified with a Yoshimura exhaust system, an extended swingarm, a front disc brake with a multi-piston caliper, and 8″ wheels along with Special Parts Takegawa components including a big-bore cylinder kit, oil cooler, air filter, intake pipe, ignition coil, and 140-km/h speedometer. It also features a four-speed transmission, folding handlebars, street lighting, a right-side mirror, a black and gray vinyl-upholstered solo seat, and a side stand. This Z50J6-YB is offered at no reserve in California for off-road use only with a bill of sale.

The bodywork and the steel backbone frame wear a chrome-plated finish, while Honda wing graphics accent the 1.3-gallon fuel tank. Additional details include a right-side mirror, a headlight, a taillight, turn signals, a black and gray vinyl-upholstered solo seat, and a side stand.

Aftermarket 8″ wheels are mounted with Bridgestone tires, the rear of which has a visible crack in the left sidewall. Suspension consists of an inverted fork as well as dual shocks mounted to the extended swingarm. The bike features an aftermarket front disc brake with a gold-finished twin-disc caliper, while a rear drum provides stopping power at the rear.

A pair of twist–lock knobs permit the handlebars to drop and stow for transport or storage. The bike has been fitted with a Special Parts Takegawa-branded 140-km/h speedometer, and the inset odometer shows 1,200 kilometers (~734 miles). Total mileage is unknown.

The horizontal four-stroke single has been fitted with a Special Parts Takegawa big-bore kit that displaces 88cc according to the seller, and the engine also features a larger-than-stock Keihin carburetor, a Yoshimura exhaust system, and Special Parts Takegawa components including the air filter, intake pipe, ignition coil, and oil cooler. The spark plug was replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is routed to the rear wheel through a four-speed transmission and a drive chain.

This 1993 Ford Mustang SVT Cobra was initially delivered to Prestige Ford-Lincoln-Mercury, Inc. of Richlands, Virginia, and spent time in several additional states before it was acquired by the current owner on BaT in August 2023. Now showing just under 228 miles, the car is finished in black over Opal Grey leather. Power is provided by a 302ci V8 linked with a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and equipment includes a rear spoiler, fog lights, 17″ turbine-style alloy wheels, and a cassette stereo as well as the 250A Preferred Equipment Package, which added air conditioning, front floor mats, and the Power Equipment Group. This Fox-body Cobra is offered with a window sticker, a Deluxe Marti report, an SVT Certificate of Authenticity, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The body is finished in black (UA), and the . Features include a decklid spoiler, Cobra badging, fog lights, and polished dual exhaust tips in addition to revised taillights shared with the Mustang SVO.

Turbine-style 17″ aluminum wheels were reportedly mounted with 245/45 Michelin Pilot Sport 3+ tires under previous ownership. Stopping power is provided by power-assisted four-wheel disc brakes, and SVT-specific suspension components included custom-valved Tokico shocks and struts along with revised springs and anti-roll bars. Work in October 2022 is said to have included flushing the brake fluid and power steering fluid as well as resurfacing the rear brake rotors.

The front bucket seats and the rear bench seat are upholstered in Opal Grey leather. Appointments include a factory cassette stereo, door-panel map pockets, and the optional Preferred Equipment Package, which added air conditioning along with power windows, mirrors, and door locks. The driver-seat power-adjustment motor was reportedly replaced in 2020.

The leather-wrapped airbag steering wheel frames a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 5,900-rpm redline, and gauges for voltage, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows just under 228 miles, approximately seven of which were added under current ownership.

The 302ci OHV V8 features a Cobra-specific upper intake manifold and camshaft as well as a 65mm throttle body, GT40 cast-iron cylinder heads, and aluminum roller rockers. Factory-rated output was 235 horsepower and 280 lb-ft of torque. Maintenance under previous ownership is said to have included replacing the fuel filter, changing the oil, and flushing the coolant.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a BorgWarner T5 five-speed manual transmission paired with a Traction-Lok rear axle, the latter of which was reportedly serviced in October 2022.

The included window sticker displays initial delivery to Prestige Ford-Lincoln-Mercury, Inc. of Richlands, Virginia, and it lists factory colors and equipment along with a total price of $21,257. An SVT Certificate of Authenticity, a Deluxe Marti report, and factory literature will also accompany the car.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Kentucky, West Virginia, Illinois, North Carolina, and California from its initial entry in February 2007. According to the seller, mileage discrepancies on the report that were noted in the previous listing were corrected by Carfax in October 2023.

This 1983 Cadillac Eldorado Biarritz coupe is finished in black over button-tufted red leather and powered by a 4.1-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transaxle. Now showing 55k miles, it features a brushed stainless-steel and black vinyl roof, Electronic Level Control suspension, power steering, four-wheel disc brakes, and 15″ steel wheels with wire-style covers in addition to six-way power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a Symphony Sound cassette radio, and power windows, locks, and mirrors. Acquired by the selling dealer in May 2024, this Biarritz coupe is offered at no reserve in Florida with a clean Carfax report and a clean Illinois title.

The car is finished in black with red pinstriping and features a brushed stainless-steel and black vinyl roof, chrome bumpers and trim, cornering lamps, a power-closing decklid, a power antenna, and Twilight Sentinel headlamp control.

The 15″ steel wheels wear wire-style covers and are mounted with 205/75 Ironman RB-12 NWS narrow-whitewall tires. Power steering, Electronic Level Control suspension, and four-wheel disc brakes were standard equipment on the Eldorado.

Button-tufted red leather covering the six-way power-adjustable front seats and rear bench is complemented by woodgrain trim on the dashboard and door panel inserts. The cabin is appointed with automatic climate control, cruise control, a Symphony Sound cassette radio, and power windows, locks, and mirrors.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a horizontal-sweep 85-mph speedometer and a fuel level gauge while a fuel economy data display is located centrally on the dash. The five-digit odometer shows 55k miles.
The 4.1-liter LT8 V8 features digital fuel injection and was factory rated at 135 horsepower and 200 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in 2024.
Power is sent to the front wheels through a four-speed automatic transaxle.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage and shows a gap in entries from June 1983 to May 2015.

This 2007 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe has 7k miles, and it was first delivered to Tom Williams Porsche in Irondale, Alabama. It is finished in Basalt Black Metallic over Terracotta and black leather, and it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six that drives all four wheels via a six-speed manual gearbox. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono Package, 19” Turbo wheels, bi-xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, and PCM with navigation. This 997.1 Turbo coupe is now offered in New York by the selling dealer with a window sticker, owner’s manuals, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in Basalt Black Metallic and features bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, side air intakes, and flared quarter panels. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery.

The 19” Turbo wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza RE050A tires, which show date codes from 2007. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded six- and four-piston front and rear calipers over 13.8″ rotors. The car is equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) as well as Porsche Stability Management (PSM) with an automatic brake differential (ABD). The brake fluid was changed in May 2024.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in Terracotta supple leather, while black leather adorns the upper portions of the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include driver-seat memory settings, a Bose sound system, automatic climate control, cruise control, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central tachometer and a 225-mph speedometer as well as gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles.

The twin-turbocharged and intercooled 3.6-liter Mezger flat-six was factory rated at 480 horsepower and 460 lb-ft of torque. The Sport Chrono Package allows the 997.1 Turbo to overboost for up to 10 seconds, increasing peak rated torque to 505 lb-ft. Power is sent to all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. The clutch pressure accumulator was replaced in August 2019, and the oil was changed and spark plugs were replaced in May 2024.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Tom Williams Porsche in Irondale, Alabama, along with factory equipment, colors, and a total price of $130,115.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

This 2013 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 was purchased new by the seller from Jorns Chevrolet of Kewaunee in Wisconsin, and it now has 1,500 miles. Finished in Night Race Blue Metallic over Ebony leather upholstery, the car is powered by a supercharged 6.2-liter V8 mated to a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the 3ZR Premium Equipment Group, chrome 19″ and 20″ wheels, Brembo ceramic-composite brakes, xenon headlights, a clear engine cover, a Bose sound system, navigation, power-adjustable heated seats, and a head-up display. This C6 ZR1 is now offered with the window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Wisconsin title in the seller’s name.

The C6 ZR1 featured a hydro-formed aluminum chassis paired with composite and carbon-fiber bodywork. The car is finished in Night Race Blue Metallic and features xenon headlights, an exposed carbon-fiber roof, a clear engine cover, and polished quad exhaust outlets.

Chrome 19″ and 20″ aluminum wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires measuring 285/30 up front and 335/25 out back. The car is equipped with Magnetic Ride Control, and braking is handled by red Corvette-branded calipers over Brembo ceramic-composite discs at each corner.

The power-adjustable bucket seats are upholstered in Ebony leather with blue stitching and ZR1 logos embroidered on the headrests. The car was optioned with the 3ZR Premium Equipment Group, which added heated seats with position memory settings for the driver along with a power-adjustable steering column, a Bose sound system, navigation, and a CD stereo. Additional amenities include 60th Anniversary door sill accents, Keyless Access, push-button start, a head-up display, cruise control, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped three-spoke steering wheel houses controls for the voice and audio system, and it frames a 220-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, boost pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 1,500 miles.

The supercharged and intercooled 6.2-liter LS9 V8 features a dry-sump lubrication system and was factory rated at 638 horsepower and 604 lb-ft of torque. Engine oil, transmission fluid, and rear axle coolers were specified from the factory.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox and a limited-slip differential.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Jorns Chevrolet of Kewaunee, Wisconsin, along with factory colors, equipment, and a total vehicle price of $127,305. The owner’s manual and a build sheet are also included.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

This 2007 Saturn Sky is powered by a 2.4-liter Ecotec inline-four linked to a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Chili Pepper Red over black and tan leather. Equipment includes the Premium Trim Package, a manually retractable tan soft top, a decklid-mounted luggage rack, a removable Continental spare wheel carrier, Bilstein shocks, four-wheel disc brakes, 18″ polished alloy wheels, air conditioning, cruise control, and a CD stereo linked to a Monsoon sound system. The seller purchased the car in 2023 and subsequent work included changing the oil and replacing the tires, battery, and serpentine belt. This Sky is offered at no reserve with a copy of the window sticker, an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The Sky was built as a twin to the Pontiac Solstice, with both vehicles riding on the General Motors Kappa platform. This car is finished in Chili Pepper Red and features a manually retractable tan soft top in addition to fog lights, a front-hinged hood, bright hood vent trim, vented front fenders, a decklid-mounted luggage rack, and a polished aluminum exhaust outlet.

Polished 18″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 245/45 Ironman Imove Gen2 AS tires with 2023 date codes. Saturn Skys were not equipped with spare wheels from the factory and a custom Continental spare wheel and tire are affixed to the receiver hitch. The car is equipped with an independent suspension with Bilstein monotube shocks. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel anti-lock disc brakes.

The bucket seats are upholstered in black and tan leather. Appointments include air conditioning, cruise control, power windows, and a CD stereo linked to a Monsoon sound system. The driver seat is currently raised 1.5″ from the factory position.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel fronts a 140-mph speedometer, an 8k-rpm tachometer, and a fuel-level gauge. The digital odometer indicates 60k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership.

The 2.4-liter Ecotec inline-four was factory rated at 177 horsepower and 166 lb-ft of torque and features variable valve timing, a GM Performance cold air intake, red-finished engine and fuse box covers, and red wire looms. Work in 2023 included changing the oil and replacing the battery and serpentine belt.
Power is routed to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
A copy of the window sticker shows initial delivery to Saturn of Columbia in South Carolina along with factory colors, standard and optional equipment, and a total vehicle price of $27,275.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in South Carolina, Mississippi, Louisiana, Tennessee, and Florida.

This 1970 Mercedes-Benz 280SL is finished in red over beige upholstery, and it is powered by a 2.8-liter inline-six mated to a four-speed automatic transmission. Equipment includes a matching hardtop, a black soft top, 14″ steel wheels with painted covers, power steering, four-wheel disc brakes, and a Becker Europa AM/FM radio, The car was brought to Canada from the US approximately 10 years ago, and reportedly underwent a multi-year refurbishment that concluded in 2022. This W113SL was acquired by the seller in 2023 and is now offered with the owner’s manual, records, a hardtop stand, a car cover, and Nova Scotia registration.

The W113 SL was designed by Friedrich Geiger, Béla Barényi, and Paul Bracq and was introduced to the public at the 1963 Geneva Motor Show. This example came finished from the factory in Dark Red (542) and was repainted its current shade of red during the aforementioned refurbishment. Exterior details include a black soft top, split chrome bumpers with overriders, twin exhaust outlets, and US-specification headlights. There are holes in the soft top, though a replacement is included in the sale. Photos of the included red hardtop and replacement Robbins soft top are shown at the end of the gallery.
The 14″ steel wheels are mounted with 185/75 Hankook Optimo H724 tires. The car is equipped with power steering, and braking is provided by power-assisted four-wheel discs.

The bucket seats are trimmed in beige upholstery, and color-coordinated upholstery extends to the door panels and upper and lower dash pads. Interior appointments include an analog clock, hand-crank windows, seatbelts, Coco floor mats, a floor-mounted gear shifter, and a Becker Europa AM/FM radio.

The two-spoke steering wheel features a chrome horn ring and frames a 140-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,500-rpm redline as well as gauges for fuel level, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The five-digit odometer shows 43k miles, approximately 400 of which were added under current ownership.

The 2.8-liter inline-six is said to be a replacement item, and power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission. Fluid changes were performed and replacement filters installed under current ownership.
The data plate decodes as follows:
The vehicle is being sold on its Nova Scotia registration, which serves as the ownership document in Nova Scotia, Canada. The sale does not include a title.

This 2001 BMW Z3 2.5i is powered by a 2.5-liter inline-six paired with a five-speed manual transmission and is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over red and black Oregon leather. Equipment includes a black convertible soft top, 16″ Style 42 alloy wheels, a front shock tower brace, a wind deflector, a BMW Business CD stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. This Z3 has 74k miles and is now offered in Nevada by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Montana title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and features a power-operated black convertible soft top, fog lights, flared wheel arches, front fender vents, aftermarket headlight assemblies, and dual exhaust outlets. BMW Performance decals are affixed to the rocker panels.

The 16″ Style 42 alloy wheels are mounted with Falken Ziex tires, which were reportedly fitted in June 2024. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with ventilated front rotors, and a front shock tower brace has been added.

The cabin features two bucket seats trimmed in red and black Oregon leather, and matching leather extends to the door panel inserts. Amenities include a wind deflector, a BMW Business CD stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning.

The suede-wrapped steering wheel frames a 155-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,200-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 74k miles.
The 2.5-liter M54B25 inline-six was factory rated at 184 horsepower and 175 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed and the air filter was replaced in June 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

This 2012 Ferrari 458 Spider has remained registered in Indiana from new and was acquired by the current owner in 2018. It wears a red vinyl wrap over a Cuoio leather-trimmed interior and is powered by a 4.5-liter DOHC V8 linked with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and an electronic differential. The car has a power-retractable hardtop, 20″ five-spoke alloy wheels, adaptive xenon headlights, Daytona-style seats, and navigation. Carbon-fiber trim and replacement black upholstery and carpeting were added in 2022, and other features include carbon-fiber side skirts, a custom sound system, and a steering wheel with LED shift indicator lights. This 458 Spider has 18k miles and is offered on dealer consignment with service records, accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Indiana title.

The body is finished in Grigio Silverstone and was fitted with a Blood Red Inozetek vinyl wrap in 2022. Exterior features include a power-retractable hardtop, adaptive xenon headlights, fog lights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, tinted windows, LED taillights, and triple exhaust outlets. Carbon-fiber side skirts have been added. The engine cover struts were replaced in 2021. Rock chips are noted on the car.

The 20″ five-spoke alloy wheels are wrapped in 235/35 front and 295/35 rear Michelin Pilot 4S tires that were mounted in 2020. The car is equipped with magnetorheological dampers, and braking is handled by gray-finished calipers over cross-drilled carbon-ceramic rotors. The steering rack was rebuilt in 2021.

The power-adjustable Daytona-style seats are upholstered in Cuoio leather with Cavallino-embroidered headrests, and the cabin features navigation, a CD stereo, and dual-zone automatic climate control. In 2022, the dash, door panels, and upper windshield pillars were reupholstered in black leather and black carpeting and carbon-fiber trim were fitted. A custom sound system was installed at that time and includes Hertz speakers and a subwoofer enclosure behind the passenger seat. The passenger-side airbag was replaced in 2018.

A carbon-fiber and black leather-trimmed steering wheel with LED shift indicator lights was added in 2022. It features paddle shifters, a red engine-start button, and an adjustable manettino that toggles among several traction control and vehicle settings. Instrumentation includes a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline flanked by two configurable displays. The digital odometer indicates 18k miles, approximately 17k of which were added under current ownership. The LED lights on the steering wheel show higher revs than actual.

The mid-mounted 4.5-liter F136F V8 features a flat-plane crankshaft as well as dry-sump lubrication, and was factory rated at 562 horsepower and 398 lb-ft of torque. The spark plugs were replaced in 2021. An oil change was performed and the air conditioning system was recharged in April 2024.
Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and an electronic differential.
The Carfax report notes no accidents or other reported damage.
There is currently a lien on the car, and the current owner’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.

This 2001 Dodge Ram 3500 was modified when new with a Lexor-TS conversion package by Pleasure-Way Industries of Saskatchewan, Canada, and it was registered with one family until 2024 according to the selling dealer. Finished in white over blue cloth, it features a generator, roof-mounted air conditioning, a flat-folding rear sofa, a toilet, an aisle shower, and a kitchenette with a refrigerator, microwave, sink, and stovetop. Power comes from a 5.9-liter V8 paired with a four-speed automatic transmission. This Ram 3500 camper van has 33k miles and is offered at no reserve in New York with 2001 sales documents, owner’s manuals, service records, and a clean Pennsylvania title.

The high-roof van is finished in white with multicolor stripes and graphics, and it has an 11′ retractable awning in addition to a fiberglass lower body kit with side steps. Damage to the front is listed in a November 2003 entry on the Carfax report. The right-rear quarter panel has been refinished.
Chrome-finished 16″ steel wheels are mounted with 245/75 Arroyo Eco Pro H/T tires. The van rides on a 127″ wheelbase, and stopping power is provided by anti-lock front disc and rear drum brakes.

The front captain’s chairs are trimmed in blue velour with patterned inserts over color-keyed carpets. Front cabin appointments include air conditioning, a cassette stereo, a tilt steering column, cruise control, and power windows, mirrors, and locks. The digital odometer indicates 33k miles.

The rear cabin has a flat-folding electric sofa, two ottomans, a table, a TV with a VHS player, and overhead air conditioning. A bathroom with a toilet, sink, and aisle shower faces the central kitchenette, which has a faucet, refrigerator, microwave, and two-burner stovetop.
The 5.9-liter Magnum V8 was factory rated at 245 horsepower and 335 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a 46RE four-speed automatic transmission and a Dana 60 rear axle with 4.10:1 gearing.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage entry.

This 2024 Chevrolet Corvette Z06 3LZ convertible was optioned with the Z07 Performance Package, which added a performance suspension system with Magnetic Selective Ride Control and carbon-ceramic Brembo brakes with Edge Red calipers. It is finished in black over Adrenaline Red and black leather and is powered by a 5.5-liter LT6 V8 paired with an eight-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Equipment includes the Carbon Aero Package, a front-axle lift system, an electronic limited-slip differential, a power-retractable hardtop, 20″ and 21″ spider-design forged wheels, heated and ventilated GT2 bucket seats, and a Performance Data and Video Recorder. The car was delivered new to the selling dealer and has not been sold to a private party owner. Indicating 2 miles, this C8 Z06 is now offered by the selling dealer with a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a Manufacturer’s Certificate of Origin.

The car is finished in black with a power-retractable hardtop. The Carbon Aero package added a front splitter and rockers, a high-wing spoiler, and dive planes finished in Carbon Flash. Features include LED headlights, front and rear cameras, side air intakes, a front splitter, rear parking sensors, and black exhaust finishers.

The black-finished 20″ front and 21″ rear spider-design forged aluminum wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2R tires measuring 275/30 and 345/25, respectively. Stopping power is provided by Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes with Edge Red-finished multi-piston calipers. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system with memory settings as well as Magnetic Selective Ride Control.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in two-tone Adrenaline Red and black leather complemented by Torch Red seatbelts. Amenities include heated and ventilated GT2 bucket seats, leather upper interior trim, a Performance Data and Video Recorder, dual-zone automatic climate control, a 14-speaker Bose sound system, and an 8″ touchscreen with Chevrolet Infotainment 3 and navigation.

The heated carbon-fiber- and leather-trimmed steering wheel is fitted with carbon-fiber shift paddles and frames a configurable 12″ digital display that includes a central tachometer and auxiliary readouts for coolant temperature and fuel level.
